3.description: sandwiches are awesome...asian guy who works there dont know how to count money

1.description: I go to a Jimmy Johns once or twice a week for lunch.  You walk in and you're greeted by the team with a welcome hello. I like the sandwiches because they are consistent, fresh, & just the right amount of the right ingredients.  I like to eat healthy and just have tap water with the sandwich. The soda, cookies, and chips take away from that plus just add calories.  The interior is clean and the music playing helps enjoy my time while I eat my lunch.  Also, the service is always freaky fast!

2.description: This the jimmy johns at the brick yard Jimmy John's #739Ok it would have bin five stars not only because the sandwich was awesome after weeks of trying to get jimmy johns but because Sebastian the guy that took my order at 8: 50 pm even doe it so close to closing he made an exception I'm so happy to say that his customer service is the five star along with this phenomenal sandwich  but when my hub got there to pick it up he over herd the staff complaining on how they had to make our sandwiches and that it sucks  blahhhhh blahhhhh  well you close at 9 I live right around the corner  so why complain .other then that thank you Sebastian  for helping me get my jimmy johns fix an your awesome customer service .

9.description: Sorry Robert, but this one is the location at Harlem Avenue and just north of North Avenue, not the one in the Brickyard Mall.Although I am a huge fan of JJ's - I eat the Slim One at least once a week, the "so fast you'll freak" only applies to dine in.  We live extremely close and decided to test this claim the other night.  Well, 30 minutes later they show up with the clim one, chips and a cookie.  Did you bake the cookie before coming?  Our chinese delivery full of items comes faster than that, and they are a few blocks further.  I literally could have walked there and back faster than that, so no, I will not  "freak" and next time I will just get in my car and get my fix.

10.description: All these commercials for delivery, so I finally decided to try it.  I am exactly 1.5 miles away from this Jimmy Johns, but apparently that is too far for the 'subs so fast you'll freak' people.  Their food might be good, but their delivery policy sucks.  Maybe they should stop with the commercials if they can't deliver...ha ha, get it?

4.description: DELIVER SOOO FAST!! Love it I order a few times a week! Would of received 5 but delivery and get sloppy with forgetting things like chips and drinks or even straws often.

6.description: Always satisfied I love jimmy johns only downfall some of employees aren't as friendly as they should be.

12.description: Best Jimmy Johns i have ever been to. Great staff and delicious food, not to mention this place is always spotless. I would highly recommend this location.

5.description: Testing the limits of my CTA sanity, I decided to trek out to the ONE Target store that had a particular item.  Yes, folks, I ventured out to what used to be the Brickyard Mall.  The mall is gone, but a developer did a great job of putting in a decent mix of stores which includes a Jimmy Johns.This has to be one of the nicest locations I've visited: clean, super friendly, fast and really pleasant in that they don't blast the Kid Rock at 160 decibels from the moment you walk in.Seriously, it's my biggest pet peeve why I don't eat at other JJ's--the loud music is a total turn off for those of us with our hearing still intact and wishing to remain that way.  Oh, and this location is a dollar cheaper than the downtown locations I frequent.Kudos to this store; thanks for being such great peeps!

11.description: Not sure what the big commotion is about Jimmy John's?  I thought their sandwhich was dry?? My mom ordered a #3 and I had a # 15... and there was no "big" difference except almost $2 more... boooo won't be coming back... Snarfs or Potbelly's for my family... p.s. no soup

8.description: Five stars? For jimmy John's? Yup and yup...Ordinarily i'm not a huge JJ fan but after a chinese takeout debacle that resulted in an almost two hour wait with nothing to show for it these guys really came through. Ordered online so as not to allow my hunger pains and after work anger to cause me to be less than delightful on the phone. 10 minutes later my bell was ringing! Freaky fast for real! Ps.This is the one in the brickyard "mall" aka shopping center-like-plaza-majig

0.description: I love this place! Come here at least twice a week before work. Always get treated great and they remember my order every single time... Maybe because I'm handsome. Always got to remember the handsome guys order. Nice clean place, bathrooms are clean, and the Coca cola tastes delicious. Freaky fast and I enjoy the music. It's basically music that I listen to everyday. P.s. Play some Daft Punk sometimes.

7.description: Goodbye Subway!

3.description: Probably one of the better and only sporting goods stores in the area. Reasonable prices and employees that actually know a thing or 2 helps greatly while searching in store. They cover almost everything sports(excluding Nascar), but you'll usuall find something along the lines of what you came in for.

1.description: What a dump!  The below-average rating for this place is right on the money.I went to SoxFest on Saturday, but to prepare for a day's worth of player signatures and meet-and-greets, I came here to purchase two regulation wooden bats and two balls with plastic cube cases.  Upon walking in, I immediately noticed crap all over the place.  The store entryway was disorganized, cluttered, and generally unkempt, the employees sparse and lackadaisical.I meandered over to the Rawlings (baseball) section where a customer service guy showed me his balls.  Sorry, their balls.  Sports Authority's balls.  I indicated I was going to SoxFest the following day to which he responded "oh yeah, alright, that's my team, man".  And our conversation went a little like this:Me: that's awesome, I always like to meet other fans.  Who's your favorite player?Clueless dude: ehhhh, I dunno, I kinda like them all, really (---this, by the way, is the universal answer for "I have absolutely no freaking idea what I'm talking about")Me (calling his bluff): oh, okay.....Him (pointing to a picture of former Sox pitcher Jake Peavy): I like this guy a lot, I got his autograph once at a game last year.Me (now fully aware that this guy is completely full of sh*t): Jake Peavy's autograph?  Number 44 on the White Sox?  Hmm, see that's interesting because he got TRADED in 2013.  So I'm pretty sure that didn't happen.Him: .........Me: yyyyuuuupp.I grabbed my balls and got the heck out of there, but not before paying $30 per bat.  The checkout girl asked for my email and phone number--to send a $5 rebate to or whatever--and being a good sport, I complied.  I did speech and theater for 5 years, so I KNOW I don't usually mumble or suffer from marble-mouth, but when I had to repeat my digits twice and email thrice, I couldn't help but get moderately agitated:Her: sorry, could you repeat that?Me (exasperated): .....three nine eight one sevenHer (blank look): nine eight seven?Me: nine eight ONE sevenHer: haha, okay and email?Me: [proceed to slowly spell it out using the NATO-phonetic alphabet, which works 99.9% of the time]Her: ummmmm could you do that again?Me: I'd really rather not.So to recap--messy store, utterly useless workers.  I'd avoid this place.

2.description: The so called sales people are busy talking to one another by the cash registers are are too lazy or to stupid to come over to see if you need help. I talked on the phone to a salesman about an exercise bike that was advertised for $249. Of course, they did not have it in stock. He suggested that I come in and look at his display model that was in perfect condition.  It could not be made to sit level as one of the wheels was broken. It was missing the straps that hold your fit in while you pedal.  The unit had several scuffs on it and the pedals themselves may have been bent.I can't stand it when any company has an advertised special and don't have the item in stock. I was the only customer in the store. I will look forward to them going out of business.

0.description: Sometimes the workers can be too pushy with add on sales here. I know what I want and will ask otherwise

4.description: This place is fine if you know what you need and do not need any assistance. They tend to carry equipment for so many different sports that they don't really specialize in anything - making it hard to find some things you may need. They have a nice selection of North Face and for running there is a good selection of apparel. For ice hockey? Forget it.

1.description: Purchased a screen protector for an iPhone 6, but had an iPhone plus screen protector in the box. Had to deal with attitude from Trinnie, then Chris and to top it all off, they had the gall to send security over with Chris (after making me wait 10+min) when nothing in my manner with Trinnie warranted such debasing treatment. Out $40+ for their packaging problem, still no screen protector and had to deal with vexatious Target employees. Save yourself the trouble (and $) from noxious employees and stick with Amazon.

9.description: Fun!!

23.description: I love TARGET!!! First, the employees are so helpful. I love that you can just press that button then boom! one appears. Not to mention that they will actually look for whatever it is you need. Second, Target Food Avenue/Pizza Hut & Starbuck in the same location. Making it easy to get some grub in or a delicious Starbucks Strawberries N Creme beverage. Third, this is the only Target that I consistently find clearance sales. I swear if you find it one day, by next week it'll be in the clearance end cap.Finally, huge parking lot! It's always good to know that no matter when you go...you will find parking!

12.description: Absolutely love target, and this one was pretty decent. Its nice that its located within a huge shopping center.

21.description: Sweeet! Who knew Target had some really cute work/date/hangin out appropriate dresses!! When in doubt, put on a dress. And I was able to snag the last of the x-small sizes.. yay. **and if I ever see one of you bitches out on the streets wearing the same shit, I'll slit your throat.** omg. Just kidding!! That's not very nice. But yes.. there are some pretty sweet finds among the masses of not that great looking pieces. This store is a fucking mess though, weekdays and weekends. Cool that they also have some food here like a frozen and dairy section. But I would not do my grocery shopping here unless I was a guy that didn't know my way around the kitchen because it's very limited.

16.description: It's Target, there really isn't much to say, except that I wish I could make one trip there every couple of weeks and actually pick up everything I need instead of making two trips per week because I forgot something *else* that I needed.Shopping lists?  Never heard of'm.

17.description: I shop at Target but some things are just to pricey.Sure. they have nice things but think of the economy.I like Target for many reasons but one especiallyis cause there is a STARBUCKS inside :D

10.description: Open more Cashiers! Target is starting to look like Walmart where there is only few cashiers open. Cashiers are lazy and rude. In the middle of a Saturday and there is only three cashiers open ??? Come on!! People have places to be. Also the isles were very messy and the scan barcodes did not work.. Very disappointed from a target!

5.description: Worst target ever! Too many bad things to list.

11.description: This is Target, so if you've been to another Target you will know exactly what to expect.The store is always busy but never seems over crowded, plenty of parking and the checkout lines aren't bad (they always seem to have plenty of registers open).The prices are pretty good and the selection is okay, they seem to focus more on variety of merchandise, rather than a big selection of certain things (tv's for example). You can get everything from groceries, clothing, medicine, toys, misc electronics, books... to video games.With that said, while this is my go to store for groceries and other household items, I would go elsewhere to buy a new TV and other electronics (it's not because of the prices, just a poor selection).

22.description: I shop at Target but some things are just to pricey.Sure. they have nice things but think of the economy.I like Target for many reasons but one especiallyis cause there is a STARBUCKS inside :D

0.description: Near by location, always find good deals if you look good enough. Friendly staff, fast checkout. Decent sized store for the area. Always clean, never been disappointed coming here. I recommend the location for the brickyard mall shoppers. Come one come all.

20.description: I love Target. Maybe too much. I should give them one star for making me spend $70 every time I try to go buy a carton of milk. *sigh

19.description: Wow... never thought a target could be bad but this one is bad.  Disorganized items, website says they have merchandise that isn't there, entrance is on one side of the parking lot... weird.  And at 5:30 all the staff disappeared into a meeting leaving a line of about 10 people waiting.  Never had these things happen at a Target.

2.description: Oh no, Target.  Why do you have to torture me incessantly?  All I want to do is to find the right deals for the store coupon that I was attempting to use.  I had the $10 off $40 coupon for the participating-brand, household items, found in their weekly ad.  I systematically browsed through the sections that were part of the deal.  I grabbed the Charmin toilet paper, Bounty paper towels, and two (2) Dawn dish detergents.  I saw the sign with my large Asian eyes and ensured that those items were qualified for the coupon.  Initially, I didn't care about using that $10 off $40 store coupon because I didn't think I would purchase that much.  However, after meticulous mathematical calculations, I realized that I needed five (5) more dollars to reach $40 and then I could get to save $10 with that coupon.  Well, why did I just grab two (2) more bottles of Dawn detergent?  Apparently, I'm one of a very few individuals who still wash all dishes, pots, and pans with my bare hands.  Hubby and I confidently proceeded to the register.  The cashier was very friendly.  She didn't mind us presenting all the manufacturer's and store coupons and even reimbursed $0.05 for bringing in our own reusable bag.  Nevertheless, the problem soon occurred after the $10 off $40 coupon was refused to be scanned.  The cashier read the condition and the participating brands, and she didn't see "Dawn" listed on the coupon.  She then explained to us why the coupon couldn't be used, even though there were multiple signs in the area, where bottles of Dawn dish detergent were merchandized,  delineating that "Dawn" appeared to be one of the participating brands.  Overall, I've never had a successful trip, using my coupons, at any Target location in the city.  Really, there hasn't been a single one, and I'm SO tired of this.  Please, please Mr. Target.  Make my life easier by posting accurate promotional marketing by the correct merchandize.  That's all I ask for.

18.description: I adore the end-caps at Target.  The back end, end-caps that is... where the clearance items are.The cosmetic/ beauty end-caps are gold mines.  Rummage through these and you can find incredible markdowns on makeup, shower and bath, and beauty tools.  You'll be lookin fine on a dime!

13.description: It's the closest target to my house and  well it's target there's not much I can say.  Always seems to have everything that I need so I can't complain.  The only thing I can complain about is the parking-lot it's big but for some reason it's always crowded  and people just suck at it!! lol Other then that I've never had any issues i've also used the pharmacy and they are very friendly and always on time when they say 15 minutes it's really only 15 minutes!

4.description: Don't ever use this pharmacy!!!!!! Not only is it always a long wait ever single time, this pharmacy gave me the wrong dosage on my medicine.  They gave me double the dose and if I wouldn't have caught it I would have been really sick! WTF do your pharmacists even have licenses?

24.description: I adore the end-caps at Target.  The back end, end-caps that is... where the clearance items are.The cosmetic/ beauty end-caps are gold mines.  Rummage through these and you can find incredible markdowns on makeup, shower and bath, and beauty tools.  You'll be lookin fine on a dime!

6.description: Garbage service. Nobody wants to do thir job. I cant get pricing on a item I am calling about, I cant even get the manager to pickup the call. I was put on hold for 10 minutes then hung up on. Never coming here again. Hope it goes out of business.

15.description: Filthy bathrooms with no tp.

7.description: I would give a MINUS 1 if I could I just thought you should know how terrible your staff is at your Brickyard location in Chgo., IL.  I walked in looking for a foot spa after looking on line to purchase at your store.  I could not find anyone for help.  I was in the cosmetics when a young blond girl came in looking ready to come into work. Unfortunately I did not get her name.   She had earphones in and was in uniform.  I meekly asked if I could impose upon her to ask a ques. to which her response was a hand up in my face and a "I'm not working right now"!, and just continued walking to the back room without a flinch as if I never existed. I am in customer service and would NEVER even try that with a guest even if I was not clocked in yet..   Because of her ignorance I just wanted you to know I bought at $70 foot spa at Bed Bath and Beyond.  It's a matter of respect which I am afraid your store completely lacks with either training staff or the staff you are hiring are kids who have none.   Rest assured I won't be shopping at Target any longer. I am 50 yrs old, a mom of 3 and will be happy to shop for my household where people actually care where we spend our hard earned money, and appreciate that we are the people who keep you in business.  So Long Target........

8.description: Yep, it's a Target.  I've been in here a few times and they seem to have a real nice variety of things that I'm looking for.  Unfortunately today I struck out and had to go to another store for what I needed, but I guess they can't carry everything that every possible customer might want someday.  What bumps my rating up to a 4 star review is the customer service.  It seems like every time I go in here I'm always having brain farts and need associates to help me locate what is right in front of me.  On every occasion they've been super friendly and never made me feel as stupid as I was acting in pestering them.  So for customer service above and beyond I say thank you and keep up the great work!

3.description: Never thought I would find a Target as horrible as this. Worst cosmetics section ever. Open bottles, used lipsticks etc. I really only go for the cartwheel discounts on cleaning supplies and frozen food. Anything else would be impossible to find since it's so disorganized.

14.description: This is a very popular target store,  very big parking lot and covered,  very good for the raining  and definitely the snow.  This is a good selection amid you don't havre to drive to the suburbs.I saw a lot of bad reviews for this place and it seems that most of them are isolated incidents.They have a really good video selection and the food selection Is getting better.  I just like the option to be able to get everything in one place.

3.description: Drinks are priced good but the service and the food were horrible. They also don't ask people who are smoking 8n front of the place while the windows are wide open  to move to a different area so the rest of us inside don't have to smell it.

1.description: I was a guest of Overtime Sport Bar more than few times, and let me tell you something. I want to go back for more. Staff is very friendly, always smiled and good looking. Place is very cozy so it doesn't matter if you are going there to enjoy your lunch, coffee or beer- you will always feel like at home. They offer huge selection of foregin beers one of which became my favorite... "Lvivske Bilyi Lev". They are also showing sport events from around the country and Europe. Their chef is doing amazing job as well... food is fresh and made with heart.I would recommend this place to everyone!

2.description: Walked in on a weeknight.  Empty bar with a free beer promo with any food order.  Ordered food and waited almost 20 minutes.  Free beer was not cold and completely flat.  Food was delivered cold.  The waitress helping us kept on stepping outside to be on her phone.  Won't be back.

5.description: Was here with a group of friends recently, service,  food and drinks were excellent, i will have to disagree with the other reviews but from our experience we had such a good time i would definitely be back!!!

6.description: They don't even deserve 1 star. Food is absolutely the worst quality I have had since grammar school frozen lunches. Server that said she was the manager had a crappy attitude and had zero knowledge of their own menu. She also added 15% gratuity to our bill for a party 3 adults. Worst bloody Mary's I have ever had. Terrible just terrible, save yourself the frustration never go here.

7.description: I've been driving past this place for some time now an was happy to see a new sports bar opened up in the neighborhood. Sadly I was very disappointed and found it funny they advertise " best sports bar in Chicago" since it was far from that. Came in with a group of people on a Sunday afternoon to find it completely empty with the waitresses sitting around on their phones. The alcohol menu was quite small and lacking any type of creativity in drinks. We finally got our food an beverages but to no surprise it was less then on par. All of our drinks seemed to taste flat or not done properly I'm assuming from inexperienced bartenders. The food reminded me of something you buy from the frozen meat isle and then microwaved to be served on a plate. We finally decided as a group it was time to leave and continue our journey elsewhere. We asked for our check and paitiantly waited for our waitress to come back to gather our totals only to find her sitting outside talking on the phone without a single concern towards us as customers. That being said the only good thing I have to say about this place is the interior is nicely done and seems somewhat cozy. Will definitely not be coming back to this establishment.

0.description: I don't know why u complaining guys but I really liked this bar! It's a really cozy atmosphere and I meet there a lot of European people ! They are very friendly and party people)) Nice waitresses and very good beers! I recommend to everybody who want to try new things!

4.description: Love this place .. Amazing service , great food , drinks and good prices ..would definitely be go back

3.description: I drive by this place everyday and always look inside. I noticed the stylist was blow drying someones hair in the technique I like my hair blow dried.  I finally decided to call and see if I could come in for trim and style.  I spoke with Tuti and she was very friendly. I was able to get in the same day I called, which was so convenient. Tuti is awesome. She did my hair just like I like it and was very personable. Definitely going back!!

1.description: I had my haircut done at another salon over a month ago and I was really unhappy with it. I decided to wait a few weeks to let it grow out. I found Tuti on Yelp and decided to let her work magic in my hair. She did wonders. I love my haircut and highlights. She made sure my haircut and highlights were to my liking, without letting me walk out looking a hot mess. Also, her salon is only a few blocks away from me. Big plus!On an honest note, she's a really nice and awesome person. I wish more hairstylists were like her :-)

2.description: Tuti is sensational and does fantastic work. She is passionate about what she does and she has it clear that if you look great, so does she! Definitely would refer her to anyone, just make sure you call for an appointment because her salon is always full.

9.description: Tuti Hair Design is the best place to get your hair done!! From cuts, color to wedding hair styles. She is great at what she does, highly knowledgable in hair products as well as the steps to take care of your hair. I have been coming here for years after a long search for the perfect stylist, Tuti takes the time to make sure you get what want, the type of hair color products she uses will last weeks after weeks at your hair after constant washes. I highly recommend coming here, you will not be disappointed!

10.description: Tuti's is really top notch and very affordable. She will cut your hair according to your needs. She is very professional and nice, and I've never had any issues. I've gone here many times and always left happy. They offer a full range of services and everything is done promptly but with great care.

4.description: Tuti did an amazing job at an amazing price on cut and color.  The color was particularly great - I got an all over color, but she used two different colors so it had texture and depth but still only cost $45 for the color.  I have gotten so many compliments and have made referrals.

6.description: I cannot say enough about how great a job Tuti does. She is truly gifted. I have naturally curly hair that has always been really dry and brittle. I wanted to go from Blue black hair ( which I dyed myself) to Golden blonde but I was worried about the damage it would cause. Tuti was really knowledgeable about which products and processes to use. Not only did she give me a perfect color, she somehow left my hair stronger and healthier. Tuti takes pride in her work and will never let you leave until you are completely happy with your hair. The Salon has a warm and friendly environment. When you're there you feel like you're among friends. I recommend Tuti to everyone I know. I no longer trust anyone else with my hair.

12.description: Tuti is amazing! I have been getting my hair done by her for 12 years. I've tried other stylists and they never listen to me and do whatever they want to my hair. I have coarse, curly, and dry hair. Tuti is the only person who can make my hair look great. Tuti listens to what I want and also knows what will work with my hair specifically. She never disappoints. She is so incredibly talented and she always consistently makes my hair look great. Not only is she the best hair stylist and colorist, she's also a fantastic person to know.

5.description: First I like to say thank you Tuti! I was looking for a new hairstylist for a while and yet I wanted some place close to home so I went on Yelp and came across Tuti's Salon. I must say she had great reviews so I decided to try her, made an appointment for cut n keratin treatment. I'm ever sooooo glad I did, had a great experience. Love love my haircut. She's an  amazing stylist and loves what she does.  Thank you Tuti!! I'll be back!! :)

13.description: Tuti (owner) is the best hair stylist out there... Actually in my book she is the best... I have not had anyone better then her... I have been going to Tuti for several years now, since (2006)... I have never been disappointed once... I always get complements on my hair, the color, cut, even style... Her up do' s are out of this world... I've referred several people to Tuti, & everyone that has gone to her loves her... They like her work, she is very friendly & personalable... She always makes you feel welcome... Even the walk ins are welcomed... She loves her clients & we love her... I walk out feeling wonderful... Not only is she my stylist, but we are now friends... It's like sitting with a old friend having coffee & chit chatting... We even drink coffee together & catch up... She makes coffee everyday & has pastries... They also do mani/pedi's & facials, which I had facials done & it felt great... I even told Tuti she can never leave me, or I would cry... I would highly recommend Tuti's Hair Design & Tuti herself... You will not be disappointed...                                                   Susie G.

11.description: I absolutely love coming here! I was bouncing back and forth hair salon to hair salon til finally I found Tuti's hair design. Just watching Tuti do her thing and how patient and I can tell she has been doing this for a long time and yet she still talks about her perfession with so much love and passion for it. She cares about the treatment of your hair her number one thing is to keep your hair healthy. Thank you Tuti for always Doing an awesome job.

8.description: I have been going to Tuti ever since she did my first up-do for my junior prom in high school. I trust Tuti with my hair because she always listens to what I want but also offers suggestions if I want to try something new. Tuti's rates are very reasonable and I feel like I get the same great haircut from Tuti that I would get at a salon that charges twice as much. The atmosphere of the salon is professional but friendly, and Tuti treats all her clients like family.

0.description: Thank you so much Tuti!!! I absolutely love my hair, Tuti is AMAZING! I had such long hair and it was time for a change. I'm so happy I listened to my gut instinct and went to Tuti hair design. She is such a friendly person with so much positivity. She cut and gave me full highlights I've never had anyone take care of me like she did today! Once again thank you... You are a very talented person!!!

7.description: How time flies! 2 years later I am still going back to Tuti for my hair needs. The keratin treatment is wonderful. I have thick, long, wavy (nice term for frizzy) hair and the keratin treatment cut my styling time in half! I would highly recommend it to anyone with hard to manage hair.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

3.description: If you want fashion eyeglasses that fit at reasonable prices, check out Windy City Eyes in the Bricktown Square Shopping Center. Optometrist Adalina Kulbak and Manager Marna are the best.

1.description: Extremely rude unconcerned optometrist this woman doesn't deserve a dime of anyone's money! Went for annual exam her manners are nonexistent! The front desk receptionist is quite the opposite! Kind caring concerned and polite! Won't return and most definitely will not purchase eyeglasses from this establishment!

2.description: The 3 stars I give are for the staff that work there, Tthe eye doctor is mean as shit. Everyone else is friendly and show they enjoy their job. The glasses are nice and reasonably priced. They also can give u a payment plan with the amount of your choice to put down But I will never come here again. The doctor is just plan rude and I don't tolerate people like her.

0.description: I was here for my relative's eye exam after his doctor changed their hours.  The front desk staff was great at explaining everything from insurance coverage to the glasses selection.  The guy in the front desk is a total sweetheart. He would have earned this review a 5 star what brought this review down was the eye doctor herself.  She is so condescending and isn't friendlier with the children either.  For someone in her field,  she could use customer service skills.  The whole time I was there she was trying to sell me the $129 glasses package aside from the glasses we were already getting and when I told her I wasn't interested she basically made us feel like we were wasting her time and continued to try to pressure us into purchasing a second pair.  That's aside from the whole time she complained about how our previous opticians sucked because the current prescription changed "dramatically".  I couldn't wait to be out of there as fast as possible.

28.description: Excellent thin crust pizza.  Real neighborhood pizza that you order for the family on Friday nights.  Always consistent through the years. This not your commercializied, big franchise type pizza, just good pizza you expect from Chicago.

1.description: Since moving to Elmwood Park, this has become my go-to pizza delivery place. Prices are reasonable and they always have specials. Pizza is always good and piping hot. Delivery can be a bit slow at times, but the staff is courteous.

9.description: This a Great pizza.. No seating primarily delivery or pickup... Super friendly and accommodating staff.   My pizza fav is thin crust. The crust is consistently good, right amount of sauce and good fresh cheese.. Toppings are fresh.. Best is they offer pizza specials everyday, just call and listen to the daily deals..

29.description: Tucked inbetween a Polamer and I Due Mondi cafe, it can be hard to spot at first.  Surprisingly, there's a small parking lot on the right side of the building.  Ordered a 12'' stuffed pizza ($12.99) to go which took about 45 minutes.  Visually, the pie looked great.  However, I definitely should of stuck with the thin crust.  Their stuffed pizza didn't have much flavor, other than the sauce, which tasted very salty.  Crust had a good chewiness to it.  I still recommend coming here.  Prices were affordable and service was personable but, don't order the stuffed pizza.

23.description: This place is literally 4 blocks from my house. Loyal family-owned pizza joint and the food is pretty damn good. We order from here almost every weekend so the food is always consistent. I usually stick with their thin crust pizzas and pasta dinners. You cannot beat the prices at this pizza joint! The staff here is incredible and they are very quick with their delivery and carry-out.

5.description: I'm so glad I found a good pizza place so close by! I ordered from here the other day and it was the first time I could not take a bite of delivered pizza bc it was too hot! That had never happened. It's was like they literally took it out of the oven before he rang the door bell! As far as taste goes, it was awesome. Good sauce, good amount of toppings (I ordered veggie) and it was baked perfectly! I normally have to ask for the cheese medium well lol to get some color on it, not here already done :) love it!

31.description: Sorento's is a neighborhood favorite around here. It's a nice little resturant with one of the best pizza pies I've ever eaten... and I've eaten a lot. Super fast delivery in the area.

25.description: This place is the place for pizza, and pasta . Geo, and is his staff know how to make a great thin and stuffed pizza... The Best in the Business..(trust me)!!!  You will NOT be disappointed.. Thanks, Geo and Sorrentos for the killer food!!

12.description: Very nice work, sauce is excellent, service was incredibly friendly. Definitely recommend.

21.description: It's been a long time since I've had such above and beyond customer service. Tony (the person who took our order over the phone and was there when we arrived) knows how to treat customers. He showed enthusiasm and extreme friendliness which made us feel like our business was truly appreciated; first time customers. Now for the pizza, we ordered a party size deluxe with extra sauce and it was perfect to our liking. Our new favorite pizza spot and only two blocks from the house. If your in the area, make sure to check out. You won't be disappointed.

16.description: Friendly fast service. Prices are reasonable. Great option if your in the area for delivery.

17.description: After hearing my best friend rave about this pizza I FINALLY got to try it one evening for her nephews birthday party. WOW. I agree with  her 100%. This pizza is delicious!!!! The price was pretty cheap too. They have specials so just ask. We called in and the pizza was ready right on time. I can't wait to order from here again. Seriously, don't even hesitate the pizza is bomb!!!!

10.description: I've been ordering from here for over a year. They're so friendly! The thin crust pizza and sauce is phenomenal. Must order at least once a month. My favorite is the old style veggie. Spinach,mushroom, onion and tomatoes.

11.description: I love love love pizza. So I'm constantly looking for new pizza joints around this area cause I'm new around here. This place was a let down. I want to give it one star but my pizza only had cheese on it. I ordered cheese fries from here and when I got home and opened the box to try and eat some all the fries were stuck together with the cheese like glue and they sucked. Will not be back.

26.description: 5 stars - need I say more? Awesome food. Extremely friendly staff. Worth trying.

27.description: I love this place!!!  It's a very small pizza place that doesn't get the shine it deserves!!.. I've ordered on numerous occasions pizza from here since it's just a walk away from home.  I must say I am always satisfied!They constantly run specials and they are good specials on the pizza I might add! 20 bucks can get you 2 14in sized pizza and feed about 10 -ppl!!  The crust is always perfect and there's something about the cheese on this pizza I absolutely love,love, love!! Any time I go pick up my order the cashier is very friendly and my pizza is always ready longest I've ever waited for my pizza was about 5 mins.  And it's always fresh and warm!!   I recommend this place to anyone who lives in Elmwood Park!!!  I am a repeat costumer and will continue to be until I move!! lol

0.description: Perfection!  This pizza has been a favorite of our family's for over 30 years. I moved back to the neighborhood several years ago and without a doubt our choice for pizza. I also love the staff and delivery drivers. Tony is also an awesome guy, always greets you with a smile. You cannot go wrong,  get the meatlovers! Thanks Sorrento's.

20.description: I've been going to Sorrento's ever since we moved into the neighborhood about 6 years ago. Their pizza is always delicious! Not only is the price just right, but their customer service is on point as well. Their pizza is always consistently good, never had a bad experience. They have great specials at all times and after 15 pizza orders you get a free pizza!

19.description: Best thin crust pizza around this area! Have not tried anything else because thin crust is so good! Service excellent! Delivery fast and courteous! Just wished they opened a little earlier. But hey everyone has to have a life!!

2.description: My fiance and I decided to order pizza here for the first time. We've ordered the large thin crust deluxe with mozzarella sticks. The mozzarella sticks were pretty good, but the pizza was delicious. After walking a few blocks home, the pizza was still hot. The only thing they didn't give us was a menu to go. Other than that, Sorrento's will be our new pizza place.

18.description: I love this place!!!  It's a very small pizza place that doesn't get the shine it deserves!!.. I've ordered on numerous occasions pizza from here since it's just a walk away from home.  I must say I am always satisfied!They constantly run specials and they are good specials on the pizza I might add! 20 bucks can get you 2 14in sized pizza and feed about 10 -ppl!!  The crust is always perfect and there's something about the cheese on this pizza I absolutely love,love, love!! Any time I go pick up my order the cashier is very friendly and my pizza is always ready longest I've ever waited for my pizza was about 5 mins.  And it's always fresh and warm!!   I recommend this place to anyone who lives in Elmwood Park!!!  I am a repeat costumer and will continue to be until I move!! lol

13.description: These guys do pizza right.  I moved into the neighborhood a couple years back and anytime i order it's always from here.  They have a two 14" pizzas for 18.99 you can't beat.  The crust is nice and crunchy with quality ingredients.  If you want a fancy pizza this isn't the place.  But a good old fashion pizza. Yes

4.description: just got our first pizza from Sorrento's and we are pleased. our yummy pizza was delivered in less than the quoted one hour delivery time, by a most pleasant older gentleman. we ordered a large 1/2 beef 1/2 SMO. it arrived hot and tasty with a crisp crust, nicely done cheese, and enough sauce at a good price.good job Sorrento's, we will be back!

24.description: My bf and I recently moved to this neighborhood so we decided to find a new pizza place close to home for our pizza nights. So we tried this place since it is only two streets from home. We LOVED it, the thin crust is not too hard nor too soft it's just perfect. They aren't stingy with the ingredients and always have the pizza on time. Once we ordered as soon as they opened and their oven wasn't working right so we waited a hole hour but they were nice enough to give us free appetizers and a pop :). We've been ordering from there ever since. BUT the last time that we orderes which was a few days ago their pizza was just a MESS. The pizza looked a lot smaller than we ordered. It looked like a 16" when we ordered an 18". There was no crust on half of the pizza, and my half of the pizza (jalapeños and olives) was thrown only to the very last row of my slices. It looked so sloppy. Idk what happened that day with the pizza maker, but we've been a regular buying the same pizza every week he even remembers us and so does the cashier. We were very good customers but now I think we'll start trying other places and see what happens because that was a horrible experience. Sigh oh wellUpdate: We kept ordering from Sorrentos and have not had any issues since. I guess that was just a bad day! LOVE this pizza!

6.description: Every time I am on leave from the Navy and come to my hometown, I have to get one of their stuffed pizza. Although my family has moved 35 minutes away, I have to go out of my way to get one. This place is the best. I have been a loyal customer since 1990. That's the last millennium, people!!! I have traveled the world and no place rivals their food. Treat your out-of-towners to what Chicago pizza is all about.

22.description: After hearing my best friend rave about this pizza I FINALLY got to try it one evening for her nephews birthday party. WOW. I agree with  her 100%. This pizza is delicious!!!! The price was pretty cheap too. They have specials so just ask. We called in and the pizza was ready right on time. I can't wait to order from here again. Seriously, don't even hesitate the pizza is bomb!!!!

15.description: My boyfriend and I live just a few blocks from this place. We have gotten their pizza countless times and have yet to have a single complaint. The crust is always perfect, very crispy without being too crispy. The prices are more than reasonable-we get two 12 inch pizzas for like 13 bucks. Overall, just a great and consistent pizza place. Extremely friendly staff, too. If I had another star I would give it to them.

7.description: We've been ordering from here for years and have never been disappointed!  Best thin crust pizza around!

8.description: Best thin crust in Chicago by far. Crust is crispy, lots of greasy cheese, and perfectly seasoned sauce.  Highly recommend eggplant parmagiana. Low prices only $, not $$.  Prefer loumalnatis crust for deep dish.

30.description: Wow, being a pizza snob i'm truly blessed to live within delivery range of so many solid options. Sorrento's has a very good thin crust, crispy and a hint of butter. Theitr sauce is good, the toppings are good quality, and the cheese is very good. My only beef with these guys is I ordered the supposed "jumbo wings", I will say they were good wings. But the "jumbo" part is false advertisement as these are fairly regular sized wings.  -1 star for that. All in all good service, good prices, and they always seem to have a special to fit the budget. A fine establishment for the area.

3.description: My friend turn me on to it that's the best pizza I've ever had that's how Pizza should taste

14.description: It's been a long time since I've had such above and beyond customer service. Tony (the person who took our order over the phone and was there when we arrived) knows how to treat customers. He showed enthusiasm and extreme friendliness which made us feel like our business was truly appreciated; first time customers. Now for the pizza, we ordered a party size deluxe with extra sauce and it was perfect to our liking. Our new favorite pizza spot and only two blocks from the house. If your in the area, make sure to check out. You won't be disappointed.

0.description: Love this place. It looks like a hurricane started at the front door and went through the entire store. But I can always find good clothing.

3.description: Very Mediocre as this Walgreens.  At most times they are out of whatever item is in the sale paper, by midweek and their checkout lines are not as fast as you'd think a Walgreens is.  This location has a pharmacy, but they are just as slow if not as bad as the store itself.

1.description: Very unhelpful associate Jason works there ... Does not go extra mile for the customer.

2.description: By far the best Walgreens I have been in - Items are always in stock - staff is friendly and helpful - Pharmacy is the best around - always a smile and quick service - we love this store

0.description: Nice sized Walgreen's with the usual standards. Filled prescriptions fast, no complaints.

3.description: I just walked passed the store yesterday, while walking around Bricktown Square. This location is closed, the store is fully empty. I noticed because the parking area in front of the store was empty. Was pretty good when the store first opened. Fell off a bit, men's clothing was slightly bigger then the listed size.

1.description: I've never been inside of the CW Price; today was my first exploration to this place.  I must say: it's a freakin' HOT MESS, ya'll!  I used to manage a Wet Seal store in downtown Chicago.  CW Price reminded me of Wet Seal, Forever 21, Rue 21, Target, Wal-Mart, and all other retailers I failed to mention that sell "reasonably-priced" apparel, accessories, and other miscellaneous gadgets.  In actuality, I believe CW Price is a place that liquidates major retailers' overstocked and un-sold items.  I saw lots of brand names that associated with the places most individuals in this country are fairly familiar with.  I saw many home decors, beddings, and just random stuff, like what you would see in a T.J. Maxx, Marshall's, and Ross Dress for Less.  I'm not a fan of such store like CW Price.  I occasionally like to look but will never go bunkers with this type of retailer.  However, if you have little children at home who need clothing and don't want spend a fortune on it because they will be soon grow out of a certain size, I think you will be quite digging this store because the kids items are pretty inexpensive.  I guess I'm still somehow "allergic" to a store that I can see a shadow of junior clothing.  I thought I've gotten over with my fear of stepping into a Forever 21 and other competitors, yet my memories of being a manager who used to spend my life In a store that was eager to "turn around" haunts me, even in the present time.  Anyways, that kind of store isn't exactly my cup of tea, but you have the right to like it, shop it, and render your repeated businesses.

2.description: I was at this location in the summer and to my surprise the clothinf was extremely cheap $$. However the number provided does not work.  I have tried to call and no ring just an operator. There are a few other cw price locations in south chicago and I know they are open as I visited multiple locations over the summer (2014). Just curious as to why they dont show up on yelp or have information for customers.

0.description: I really don't know what else to say except every time I come here, I easily walk out with about $60-$100 in merchandise! Great store! Read my other reviews...I'm hooked!

4.description: This is going to end badly. How have I not been here before??? Jennifer Q has inducted me into the CW Price cult as of today! I didn't really know what to expect and not being a huge fan of AJ Wright I didn't have particularly high expectations. I was WRONG! This store is like Marshalls or TJ Maxx only way way better prices, better merchandise and much more organized and clean. Lee the store manager has done a great job of making this a model store. Light, organized and friendly staff make the place a pleasant experience. The clothes are unbelievably well priced! I got a New York and Company coat for $7! I kid you not! I actually thought there was a mistake! I also got two really cute fall / winter sweaters and a dress. The most expensive thing was one of the long cardigans that I bought for $39 - hardly gonna break the bank. Honestly there were so many nice things and so many deals I actually thought I might go into a frenzy! LOL I'll definitely go back and peruse more of the housewares / linens and mens clothing. I could have shopped there all day and spent many many more dollars!

3.description: It's definitely as good as it gets for a Dollar Tree. Lots of wrapping paper and other fun stuff for wrapping gifts or for party favors.

1.description: Good stuff lots of variety but...... HUGE staffing issue.one one line was open. The "manager"Lexus" or "lexi" is standing at another register not open watching the now 8 people in line. Then she proceeds to walk away and wander around the store aimlessly instead of finding another cashier or opening a register herself. I watched her. The line began to become irate and still no manager or other cashiers. I felt sorry for the cashier. Come to find out there is a problem with management and not caring what happens in the store. I was also told that there was thoughts of locking the front doors 1 hour early.(Cashier is telling me all of this). I will be calling the district office to address this problem.

2.description: Everything is a dollar!!! Need I say more! I love going here because I can find just about anything that I may need. From household supplies to car supplies they have it all! The store is always neat and you don't have trouble finding what you need. If you do need to be pointed in the right direction the employees are always friendly and very helpful! I love going here because I love to save money, especially when the product has the same effect as a more expensive brand! I would recommend dollar tree to EVERYONE who is looking to get great products at a very reasonable price!

0.description: Money is no object! the only time I can say that is at this store.ah...the good life :)

3.description: Word on the street is that DOM is the place to go if you want unique Christmas decorations, especially ones from Eastern Europe.  Well, I went in the middle of Spring looking for nesting dolls. I couldn't find any, but I spent $60 anyway.I have Polish ancestry and have been searching for a store that sold all the types of Polski things you might find at Taste of Polonia (pisanki, nesting dolls, flags).  At DOM, I bought a Polish flag, mugs with names in Polish (found my name!), a book of recipes and history called "Polish Chicago," and a flag with Pope John Paul II's picture.However, I found lots of other pleasant surprises there, though I didn't buy them.  Baby clothes with phrases in Polish, wooden blocks with the Polish alphabet, a couple racks of modern dresses, a TON of vegan purses (non-leather, and were labeled non-vegan), bunches of pots and pans, aprons with phrases in Polish. Basically, DOM carries a range of straight-off-the-boat goodies from the corny to the fancy, all at reasonable prices. I definitely will be back at Christmastime. I would love to have one, just one, beautiful ornament from the Old World!

1.description: I've only been to this store a few times, mostly when shopping at the grocery store next door. I've also visited the other locations but less frequently. What can I say, I'm not really impressed. Everything sold there is imported from Poland but looks made in China. The store itself tries to look like a WorldMarket kind of place. For those of you who have visited Poland in the recent years, most products look like those found in the Polish equivalent of a Dollar Store (ex Wszystko Za 5zl), except way more overpriced. But if you're looking for a cheap ethnic gift, like mugs or shot glasses, you'll find something. I've usually only visited around holidays, like Christmas or Easter. i love colorful ornaments and of course, I stop by when I see them in the displays. Most Christmas ornaments are the typical Old World glass ornaments. However, they are super expensive. So are the Easter decorations. Honestly, very similar ornaments, also all handmade from Poland, are sold at Shon n' Save during the holidays, all for way way less, most at $5 each. Rolling pins and cake pans? I can get those at Home Goods and pay half the price. The glass vases they have? They're pretty and unique but alas, Home Goods always has a display of the same ones from Poland, for a fraction of the cost. This all pretty to look at, giving the store 3 stars. I took away the one star for my recent experience though. I stopped by the Christmas Market at the Daly Plaza during my work break, only because it wasn't very busy. I was surprised to see that Dom, itp had a booth, all filled with ornaments. They were all so ridiculously expensive (a tiny ornament for $34.99) but I guess I should've expected that, given the prices at all the other booths. There was only one more person  at the booth browsing with me. The three girls working the booth, all Polish ladies in their 20s, were basically ignoring us. That's fine with me though, I don't like to be bothered by sales people while browsing anyways. However, they were having a rather loud conversation, in Polish, in which every other word was profanity. They probably assumed their customers didn't speak the language or just plain didn't care. I honestly didn't know so much vulgarity can be put in one sentence, by women so young, as they didn't look much younger than myself. That alone made me walk away, and to my surprise, two booths down was another ethnic Polish booth, where I bought some beautiful porcelain to give as a gift. So thanks Dom, itp but really, no thanks.

2.description: "Dzein dobry!" I was greeted when I walked in the door.  Huh?  It threw me off, so I replied, "Hello!"In Polish, it means "good morning."  I only know a few words in Polish because I don't have family who speaks the language, so what I know has faded.  That explains my few seconds of delay.Dom itp has a gorgeous selection of Christmas decorations and ornaments, all made in Poland.  Some of it does get expensive, like the centerpieces with giant globe ornaments and garland, but I bought myself a large globe ornament with handpainted leaves for $12, and a smaller ornament of an owl wearing a Santa hat for $8. There is a big wall of coffee mugs - can you find your name in Polish?  I found mine pretty fast, Aniela.  The designs on the mugs are limited with either delicate flowers or white and red flags bearing the giant eagle.  I went with the flowers.  I was so excited to find my name, as my mom recently told me that a long ago member of our family was named "Aniela," so I thought it was cool that I have the same name.  The mugs are only $5!I didn't browse the pots and pans or other kitchenware - those are the same in any language.  There are some pretty accessories, but they're a little more expensive than I was willing to spend.  Same goes for the clothes - I was kind of feeling a black tunic with leather pockets, but for $125 I wasn't even going to waste my time looking for my size.The girls behind the counter speak Polish on auto-pilot because most of their clientele speaks Polish.  I often forget that, outside of the suburbs, European cultures still live in tiny enclaves in Chicago.  The girl finally realized that I don't speak Polish when she handed me my change and I replied, "Thank you."  She was unnecessarily apologetic for speaking to me in Polish, because I expected that she would.The parking situation is nice, there's a small parking lot, although mostly occupied by people shopping at the grocery store next door.  We were able to find a spot right on Belmont though.

5.description: As a cook, my favorite stores are the small, out of the way places that stock esoteric and strange kitchen objects. Forget Williams-Sonoma and Sur La Table and their shiny Francis!Francis! espresso makers. I'm talking lidded jars for pickling and fermenting, strange grinders for sausages, and special and usual bottles. The specialty wares at Dom ITP are lovely, but it is the kitchen goods that set it apart. I went to their Hardware/Garden outlet (about a mile down the street from the fancy housewares shop) and picked up a lidded ceramic crock that will work wonders for my home fermentation. I grabbed 6 perfectly proportioned shot glasses while I was there - the shape and size were unique and quite pleasing, and it was cheap (about a dollar a glass). Technically the Hardware/Kitchenware is another store (though part of their dynasty), some of the things carried here can be found in this particular outlet. The hardware store, however, is a hardware store - along with interesting kitchen implements, you'll find light bulbs and wire.

6.description: This store is a gem.  It carries most of the same pieces that chains like Saks, Neiman's and Crate and Barrel due at a quarter of the price.  Furthermore, the owners hand pick all of the glass and home decor when traveling to Europe themselves, so there are hundreds of unique pieces to choose from.  In the winter, they carry exclusively designed Chicago themed ornaments with handpainted images of the Chicago flad, Chicago scenes, Chicago neighborhoods, Wrigley Field, U.S. Cellular Field, etc....They make the perfect gifts, as they are also half the cost of ornaments at department stores.  I believe they also sell their gorgeous collection of ornaments downtown every winter at the Christkind Christmas Market in Daley Plaza.

0.description: I called for a kitchen item I was looking for, of which I couldn't find at Carson's.  And they had it, told me the size and the price.  I could have gone to Wal-Mart or Target, but I've been on a "local shop" trend, and found this shop on Yelp for kitchen supplies.A young lady greeted me in Polish, which I really liked because, it really makes me feel like I'm in a Polish community of Chicago.  The lady I talked to was there, and walked me straight to the item.  GREAT PRICE!Had to return it, and was able to without any trouble!Parking is the only thing that is tricky, but if you keep calm, you should be fine.

4.description: I can't stay away from the DOM stores at Christmas, though I usually go to the one on Harlem.  Today, though, Jim wanted to try one of the other ones and I was happy about that because the Harlem store didn't have nearly the selection it did last year, which was disappointing.This particular store more than made up for it.  It's probably three times larger than the store on Harlem, and there were lots more Christmas things there. It was jammed with Polish shoppers who all seemed to know one another, and the sales ladies, but that didn't stop the sales staff from being incredibly helpful and kind. No fewer than four of the gals on the floor helped me with my stuff, but not in an overbearing or suspicious way.  They were just genuinely nice, and very pleasant.I bought a new ornament -- seriously they have some of the most beautiful ones I've ever seen, some at staggeringly low prices (some rather high, too.  There's an ikon I want but it's just under $100.  I'm going to have to stick to the ones under $10.) I also scored four pretty, sparkly pink tealight holders for $1 each and gave two to Glinda who has as much magpie blood as I do.  And I bought up a lot of sparkly botanicals to make a bright, lush, vivid holiday arrangement. My total was a bit higher than I wanted to go, but the result is dazzling. I can hardly wait to start decorating for Xmas!I would happily review the rest of the store, but honestly I am so overwhelmed with the spirit of sparkle that I can't think about most of their other stuff. I now know which of the DOM stores I'll be taking my friend, Karen, to when she comes in to shop. Highly recommended.

3.description: I've been getting my hair cut here for over 8 years. Everyone that has ever cut my hair has done a good job, with the exception of one time when it was cut too short, but it was my fault because i wasn't paying attention. Mike is there on Saturdays, great guy, but I haven't seen him there in awhile. They officially close at "7 PM" but they sometimes lock the door at 6:40 if they are tied up with clients. I know--it happened to me tonight (March 7 2012)Get there at least an hour before closing.

1.description: I was there today at around 430 p. The Bosnian woman in charge of the place is a despot. Upon arrival she was on her cell, i asked her how many people ahead of me...she didnt know. A man came after me and a Hispanic stylist took him b4 me, so I walked out...the Bosnian woman asking me to return, but never again will I return to this cheap joint. As an elderly woman says, you get what you paid for. Replace the Bosnian woman with someone who has a passion for their job, and Sylvia & Mike's will thrive. In the mean time, if you go there, expect to be treated like dirt. By the way...what was a young child doing at the register charging clients? I dont believe in exploiting children either.  The place is also filthy (hair all over), & it seems that the place has a high turn over.  Dont go there unless u r Bosnian--you'll b treated right.

2.description: Great haircut, cheap price, free street parking...what's not to like?  At $5 for a haircut, I'm not real picky, but this place definitely exceeded my expectations.  My barber today was from Bulgaria (I forget her name) but she spoke English well when discussing my haircut options and gave me a very good haircut.  It wasn't rushed, either, and she took the time to add gel to my hair and blow dry it.  If you don't have a fancy style - or even if you do - this place is worth the drive.  Highly recommended.  Tip well if you get a nice cut, the stylists here obviously don't make much money otherwise.

0.description: $5 haircut. No gimmicks. Polite, hard-working and friendly staff. Nice big TV to watch while you wait your turn. The honest-to-goodness value of each haircut I have received here has always exceeded $5. You are free to choose how much to tip (if any) or choose to pamper yourself by adding a hair wash for only +$3, or both!  It's still less than their competition's basic haircut price!!! I have never found any valid reason to go anyplace else. Your best bet is to get there early on Saturdays, because this place fills up quickly.They are not open on Sundays.

1.description: Well to start off, the food is awful. The cups and silverware are really dirty. The service is terrible you have employees siting around the tables laughing and making jokes in front of the customers. The food was stale and flavorless. The only thing that I can say I actually liked was the icee. Which is sad.

9.description: This place is so disgusting!! I remember why I don't come here anymore. There is garbage everywhere, nobody came to pick up our plates and the food was very poor quality (even worse than before). We paid $32 for 2 adults and a 3yo which is ridiculous for the quality. I am NEVER COMING HERE AGAIN! Eeewwwww

23.description: I did like the fact that I was the skinniest girl in this place (I was like the Kate Moss of cheap buffets), but that was pretty much all I liked about my experience at OCB. Until I met my (now ex) boyfriend, I had never been to one of these establishments.  I will never return, either.It was cheap enough, but the food was not appetizing at all. I think it was meatloaf night or something, and my European genes do not allow me to consume meatloaf. All the veggies were wilted and sad, and the salad bar had iceberg lettuce (ugh). Essentially it was really cheap, but the food was really tasteless and bad for you. I also spent about an hour in the bathroom after leaving. Whatever I ate there did not agree with my insides whatsoever (and I have an iron stomach- I've eaten street food in Thailand). Never again!

12.description: I really dislike and try my damnedest not to 1* a place; butThis place is a close 1. Let's get started.1, customer service is actually 5*s, if you engage a employee here and just ask for what you want.2, cleanliness is 1.5 star, picked up forks and they had caked on food that did not wash off properly, excuse was it was the dishwasher, how about inspecting before rolling them out.3, the seating is very comfortable; the floors were filty, I mean fiiiilllty, tables were kept clean as you went from one plate to the next.4, not a rememberable experience on a positive level. 5, will not return 6, will not, do not recommend7, Wednesdays, kids eat free, I have none, so for me on a Wed it was noisy.8, selection other than meat was horrid.

21.description: This is the worst buffet I have ever been too. The food is not good. The restaurant is a mess and the customers it attracts is pitiful. There are kids everywhere and their parents do NOT supervise them. Avoid!!

16.description: I WANTED MY MONEY BACK!!  $16 I could have eaten at red lobster.  If I wanted only "chicken" I would have went to popeyes, no one to carve the meat, NO variety of meats like fish, shrimp, meat loaf,,,  cream spinach YUCK bland and dry.. getting cheap on the desserts? 2 dollars extra for a soda..all these places are jacking up the prices and service mediocre slop!! cant do it..the one on 79 & western was decent

17.description: I've been to this buffet many times and I'm pleased with what it offers - standard American food. If you're on a vegan diet plan, this is probably not the best place to go UNLESS you are fond of salads and of getting creative with making your own dish.If you are not on a strict dietary plan, the food is good. It's not bedazzling but it also not terrible (like Shooter's Buffet). The macaroni and cheese is delicious and staples such as fried chicken and pasta, you can't go wrong with. I would be wary with the made-to-order stations, though. I sat next to the Stir Fry cart once and strict sanitation did not seem to be handled well by the individual (towels used to wipe counter area were also used to wipe pans in between orders).Otherwise, the staff seems to handle the regular buffet food exceptionally well.The salad bar has a mixture of iceberg lettuce, mixed spring, and a small option of spinach leaves. There is a variety of extras for your salad available, including mushrooms, carrots, hard boiled eggs, other veggies, cranberries, protein twigs, and dressings.I visit about once a month or so and I have not witnessed any chaotic scenes with unsupervised children, as a few reviews here have mentioned. It probably depends on the time you visit I suppose.Short version: Food is average, can't go wrong here with the taste of the food, price for dinner may be a bit steep for some

10.description: No stars if I could. There was very little variety. The food was mediocre. They charge like its a grand buffet with out standing food, will not return.

5.description: The employees working around the food were courteous.  But the food was bland, the selection wasn't really varied,  and the floor was sticky everywhere.  Most of the chairs and benches are ripped.  We paid 50 dollars for three adults and a toddler.  It wasn't worth it.

11.description: I try to go at least once a month there is a wonderful waitress  or service r ( If that's what there called her name is Mary she is the best every love her thank you Mary the cashier and manager is  very helpful when i purchased the coupon book for seniors . Great deal on the coupon book 5.00 for lots and lots of coupons check them out there good until feb 2015 great for me .

22.description: Back in the day (and I'm talking YEARS ago) this OCB was pretty decent. When I was a little girl. But now? Jesus I wouldn't be caught dead in here. The food is awful, and the pans are usually more than half empty.  If you go at 'busy hours' be prepared to get a headache with your meal too. Screaming children, adults who don't care. Also expect to hear this: "A line? What newfangled word is this?!"The health conscious should not enter this establishment, as there is nothing on the menu that you would deem appropriate. Not even the salad bar (which is pretty damn gross).Tasteless all you can eat food for a cheap price. Thanks but I'ma have to pass on this one.

0.description: I'd give it 5 stars since it only costs $11.80 for the lunch buffet with a beverage.  Nothing really stands out as exceptional, but everything is fine.  The pizza is bad, the spaghetti is bad, some of the desserts and breads are dry, but this doesn't warrant a poor rating.  You can't expect grade A everything for less than $12.

20.description: What's with the horrible reviews?  I've probably been to this location 4/5 times over the last 6 months and I have had no complaints. Sure a lot of families come in with young kids but I've never once heard young kids yell or anything. The place is clean, under 11 bucks per person  and the food is always hot ( and filled ).  And what's with the " it's not a healthy place to eat" comments?  It's a buffet, what did you expect?  I rarely go out to eat, but when I do,  I actually only go out to buffets since I eat more than the average Joe ( I'm not fat at all ). Recommended if you are in a really hungry mood.  Just don't go all the time, the calories will pile on ;)

19.description: What's with the horrible reviews?  I've probably been to this location 4/5 times over the last 6 months and I have had no complaints. Sure a lot of families come in with young kids but I've never once heard young kids yell or anything. The place is clean, under 11 bucks per person  and the food is always hot ( and filled ).  And what's with the " it's not a healthy place to eat" comments?  It's a buffet, what did you expect?  I rarely go out to eat, but when I do,  I actually only go out to buffets since I eat more than the average Joe ( I'm not fat at all ). Recommended if you are in a really hungry mood.  Just don't go all the time, the calories will pile on ;)

2.description: First impression of the restaurant isn't very good as the windows are incredibly dirty.  The doors to enter and exit, especially, are filthy and haven't been washed in a long time - as I noticed the dirty windows a week ago when I visited and again upon this visit.  On this visit, I was in the restaurant having a late lunch around 3:00 pm - and in the 45 minutes I spent there, I never saw a server.  No one ever approached my table and not one plate was picked up from my table while I was there.  So I am certain - even when I was at the buffet - that no one came by.  So, why three stars?  The food.  The buffet tables were stocked well and the foods were the right temperatures and quite tasty.  I particularly enjoyed the roast chicken and cold salads.  Other concerns are that, unlike other buffets, this Old Country Buffet puts its ice cream machine out of reach - and I had to wait a long time to get an employee to come over and give me a dish of ice cream.  Also, the washroom is very dirty at this restaurant on most every visit.

18.description: So I took a group of about 25 adults here for a pre-Thankgiving meal......I called ahead to inform them that we would be coming.  The manager was EXTREMELY accomodating and polite.  I am very pleased with the customer service provided at this Old Country Buffet.  It was a positive experience and although it could use an interior decorating MAKE. OVER.....not sweatin it.  Props to the OCB on Fullerton

13.description: I've been coming here with family since I was a little girl. As an adult with food restrictions I am happy they have a fruit and salad bar. My family and I love this place yet I only wish they would maintain cleanliness a little more.

4.description: This place has completely fell off the grid of good food. After our last family outing, I told them I will not return again. The food selection is horrible. The desserts are horrible. I felt horrible after eating this food.

6.description: Well what can I say when it comes to this place u pay for what you get. The atmosphere is pretty depressing and the employees have terrible customer service. Some food looks like its been sitting out for a while and most of the items are bland. The only reason I gave 2 stars was because of the nice lady who waits tables was and always is super nice.

15.description: Just came back from breakfast here. The food was so disgusting and reheated from days prior. I'm so angry I wasted my money on this filth. I wouldn't even feed it to my dog. This place has went down hill...I wish I could give it 0 stars

7.description: Today I went to Old Country Buffet (6560 W Fullerton Ave)  with my friends for dinner at 4p.m. I was so disappointed  they didn't have the food I wanted, was empty they didn't even bother to refill, the meatloaf, taco shells, pizza. I got sick when I went for the dessert, found a plate of cheesecake bitten with the other desserts. The knives and spoons were dirty like someone put mashed potatoes on it. I used to love coming here but after today I will never, the prices went up and the food not same, dirty and they don't even refill the food for the people. I will not go there again and won't recommend this place to anyone.

8.description: Sorry I can't give any stars the place was dirty took my appetite away the Capeting was full of food stains and the cofee & pop machines were not in working order. There was no one to help at the desert table or to cut meat in the buffet secetion.

3.description: I truly love going to this Old Country Buffet. The people are very kind and will get you seated quickly.I especially enjoyed DAMIAN'S prompt service when I wanted the carved meatThanks Damian.

14.description: The only place that I have ever gone to and not found a single thing that I would eat. Not one thing looked appetizing. Even the Caesar salad was past its prime, how do you screw that up?  Would not return

29.description: I visited I Do as a seller and listed my dress there.  Kelly was very knowledgeable and had a bride trying on gowns when I went in originally to list mine and she really knew her stuff from high end designers, to necklines to sizing and alterations. There was a wide selection there and I wished I had visited there as a buyer before my wedding. As a seller she was more than accommodating, even allowing me to continue to list my gown online which was so helpful in the end. I Do is a place that any bride should stop before David's or any large retailer to get personalized attention that you just don't find elsewhere, along with an amazing selection-from the 1930's to today.

42.description: Had a wonderful experience here.  Kelly is honest, knowledgeable and helpful.  She wants her customers to leave happy and works overtime to make that happen.

23.description: LADIES DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME SETTING A APPOINTMENT BECAUSE THE STORE WILL BE CLOSED AND NO ONE HOME WHEN YOU GET THERE! After reading some of the reviews I was a little weary about going, but I am having problems finding a dress so I decided I have to try all the options I can find. Well I should have listened to the reviews the other ladies wrote. I had a appointment today at 12pm. I drove out there which is about half hour from where I am. I walked up to the brown door and rang the doorbell like I was told. I rang the doorbell 5 more times and started knocking. I went to the second door just in-case and rang that doorbell and was knocking on that door. I called the store like 10 times. No ANSWER. I stood outside ringing the doorbell and knocking for 30 minutes!! This woman set up an appointment for me then I drove all the way out there for NOTHING, because she wasn't there, and if she was she was pretending she wasn't because I pounded on the door and rang the doorbell for 30 minutes. You would think if you set up a appointment with a customer you would be there getting ready for the appointment 15 minutes before. But Nope. I can't believe after reading other reviews of this happening to other girls that I didn't listen.

47.description: I Do is fantastic - I found the dress of my dreams for less than $500 (new). Kelly is so helpful and knowledgeable, the entire experience was great.

8.description: Kelly was super helpful and nice. I got there at 7pm for a Thursday appointment and Kelly was upstairs . She came down quickly once she knew I was there.  I then proceeded to try on about 30 dresses for 2 hours. Kelly helped me pick out some dresses once she knew what I liked but basically she just told me where to look and let me get to it. I was alone so she made sure to zip me up and take pictures for me. I've been to a few shops and hers was by far my favorite. I would recommend coming here once you have an idea of what you want because there is a lot of stock. All dresses are at least half off the original value. Plus you are reusing so its green! I did not end up buying a dress from here (yet!) but I am still dreaming about one of them...

31.description: I have been meaning to sit down and write a review for I Do Bridal Consignment for weeks! This is an unbelievable business model and I can't say enough about the owner, Kelly.  She is absolutely fantastic and helped me find my dream dress.  I was not sure what to expect when I first walked in and was surprised to see the amount of dresses Kelly had in the back of her store.Kelly has an amazing eye and although I wasn't sure what shape of dress would look best on me, she pulled a few for me to try on. The first one I tried on was the most beautiful gown I had ever seen and although I did try on a few other beautiful dresses, this was "the one." Kelly has names like Vera Wang, Simone Cavalli, Watters, Amsale, Maggie Sottero, etc, and she truly only accepts dresses that are slightly worn and in near-perfect condition.  She asks the consignor for proof of their purchase and I can officially say I bought a $4,000 Simone Cavalli gown for $1200.  I never thought I could afford such an incredible gown to wear on my wedding day.I was by myself the first time I stopped in, and Kelly went out of her way to open her store up the following day so I could bring a friend in to see the dress before making a final decision.  She even has an incredible seamstress she has worked with for years she recommends. The entire process is so accommodating.Do yourself a favor and stop in I Do.  Obviously consignment shopping in general is hit or miss, but you may just find yourself in luck.

34.description: I had a great experience and highly recommend "I Do."
