I got a brand new wedding gown that is absolutely gorgeous.  It was a designer sample, which is why Kelly had it in her store.  I also purchased my veil from "I Do" which matched my gown perfectly.  Kelly will also refer you to a seamstress who works in a bridal boutique during the day, so has the experience with fitting wedding gowns but charges a fraction of the price.  She was wonderful!  I only needed one fitting; she did the bustle and everything the way I requested.  I read some of the negative reviews about Kelly, and admit that it was a little confusing how you have to ring the bell on the green door next to the bridal shop (not the door to the store).

16.description: I saw a Groupon for I Do Bridal Consultants.  I wasn't engaged yet, so I didn't buy it, but kept them on my radar knowing that we would be soon!  I called up Kelly, the owner to schedule an appointment and she was so helpful!  I don't live near there, and wanted to make my trip out west worth it, so asked her for some input on other places to check out in the area.  She listed like 8 others, and made sure not only my time there was worth it, but my whole day was going to be a good one.It was a consignment shop, and the dresses available are totally hit or miss.  I ended up finding NOTHING that worked for me.  There was another bride there, and absolutely EVERYTHING she tried on was gorgeous on her!  Even though I didn't find my dress here, I am sure many people can and will.  The only thing I would've changed about my experience was that they asked me to not zip up the dresses myself, and have them help me get in and out of them...for care of the gowns.  However, no one was ever there to help me.  I had to come out of the dressing room, holding the dress up around the girls, find someone, and ask them to finally help me.

13.description: This shop has fabulous dresses.  You WILL find a great dress.  The owner, Kelly, is a great help and a great resource for wedding advice!

11.description: I absolutely adore this little shop. I called after shopping at many "vintage-style" bridal shops around the city. The owner, Kelly was able to find an appointment for me quickly. When I came into I Do I was surprised at how many dresses were there! Kelly was so personable and very helpful in picking out exactly the type of dress I described (something the other stores were not able to do). Also the prices here are extremely reasonable! Needless to say I ended up leaving with my perfect wedding dress. Definitely check this place out if vintage (or being budget conscious) is your thing.

39.description: I bought a dress from Kelly about a year ago. My experience with buying the dress was good enough. Kelly wasn't expecting us but let us in anyway, and we tried on a dress just for fun. The dress was a used Amsale dress that she was selling for $1000. I liked the dress very much, but as the style was old-fashioned, it needed to have quite a bit of alternations done on it. We decided to buy after she assured us that the seamstress Adela she works with would do a fantastic job. That's where my poor rating comes in. I had a total of 4 fittings with Adela, and after that I just had to take the dress even though it was not done. I asked her 3 times to make me a V-neck, in the front and the back (previously a boat neck). She cut me some kind of odd shape with three corners, and each time I asked her to fix it, she said she would and then didn't. She always managed to make things too tight or not tight enough, so the dress never actually fit me around the bust and shoulders. When taking up the skirt we ended up with a crooked hem line. The worst part is that she is just a sloppy seamstress. Here I had a gorgeous designer gown that has now been totally butchered by her attempts to alter it. As a result I now have to buy a new dress for my wedding and say goodbye to all that money I spend on the dress and the poor alterations. In conclusion: I recommend Kelly's store, especially if you find something that won't need a great deal of alterations. I do not recommend using her seamstress. She is just not detail oriented - and when you're working with a wedding gown, you just need to be.

37.description: I bought my wedding dress here back in November of 2009. I got married in April 2010. This shop might not be for everyone, especially if you're a bride who wants more of the Say Yes to the Dress atmosphere, but I LOVED it. I didn't want to spend thousands of dollars on a dress and I didn't want to go somewhere like David's. For $600 I got an absolutely wonderful vintage Marshall Field's dress. I also tried on some very beautiful and reasonably priced modern dresses, but the vintage MF dress was absolutely perfect and I know that no other bride had my dress...as least not for 40 years!The owner was very helpful and nice, no pressure. She let all of us look through dresses ourselves as well as pull things she thought we'd like. And the best part for me was that I got to take the dress home that day, though she will store it for you for free if you need.

0.description: Having been to many other stores, and not to a lot of others due to budget limitations, I Do Bridal Consignment was a breath of fresh air. This is not the place to go if you're looking for the glam experience with glasses of champagne, flashy lights and people pushing you to buy a dress you cannot afford. It's a place to shop for a beautiful wedding dress, with Kelly who has a very good eye and is open to letting you try on really as many gowns as you're interested in, and will keep you on budget, too. I never felt rushed, and I got some great tips on photography and bouquet size that I might never have considered.In the end, I bought a dress in my budget that is stunning! It's made well, looks good on me and I can't wait to meet with the seamstress for the alterations. I feel comfortable with Kelly and I think others will too.

38.description: I hate to write a negative review, but I had the most frustrating experience with this shop!  I made an appointment a week in advance.  Like one of the reviews below, I was also asked over the phone for a detailed description of the dress I was looking for.  I must have passed the test because she let me schedule an appointment, but asked me to call to confirm on my way there.On the day of the appointment (with my mom in the car from out-of-state to see this place!), I called on my way to the shop and got their voicemail but decided to go anyway.  One LONG drive later, we arrived at the shop 10 minutes before my scheduled appointment time to find the lights off and the doors locked!  The hours posted on the door said it should have been open at that time.  HOW FRUSTRATING!!  It was such a waste of the limited time I had with my mom.  I would never return.

51.description: If you're looking for a typical upscale bridal experience, I Do is perhaps not the place for you. However, if you're looking to eschew the "wedding industry" as much as possible, I Do is great! Kelly, the owner and proprietor, is wonderful. I feel much better about supporting the business of this friendly, hardworking woman than the goons at David's Bridal. Kelly is nice, and extremely helpful. She's also very talented at matching a woman's body and style to a dress. In fact, I ended up buying one that she selected. She was attentive the whole two hours I was trying on dresses. Her selection is vast, and has everything from 1930s - 1970s vintage to couture. They run anywhere from $300 to $4000. I ultimately bought a fantastic couture dress for half its going price on account of a nearly unnoticeable snag in the silk. If you're looking for something unique, I recommend I Do.

27.description: I didn't want to buy an expensive designer dress so I'd started by looking at David's Bridal. I didn't like the style of any of their dresses - far too modern for me.  Plus, the material was constraining, hot, and cheap, even though the dresses were relatively expensive. So I gave I Do Designer Bridal Consignment a try. At first I was skeptical. The owner wasn't there at first, so I was just working with her relatively young daughter. And then I was sifting through dozens of dresses and it felt really overwhelming. But her daughter found the perfect dress for me. And the owner showed up very quickly after I'd arrived. They weren't pushy at all. They devoted all their time to me. And they didn't rush me - allowing me to try on as many as I wanted, for as long as I wanted. I found the perfect dress for me - a lovely, simple dress made by Lazaro designer, but for a fraction of the original price. The dress (unlike the cheap fabrics) was entirely breathable, moved effortlessly. Both the owner and her daughter were friendly, positive, and knowledgeable. I highly recommend this.(street parking only, but it's really easy to find parking)

32.description: This experience was not worth the time/drive so far west.  I did not receive any call to reschedule my appointment and when I arrived there was a note on the door that they were closed.  When I did finally get in, the experience of trying to browse the dresses was unpleasant and there was a lot of ugly dresses.  I am kind of baffled by the positive reviews.  Granted, I am not a "vintage" style bride, but I was expecting to find used relatively recent designer dresses and found a very limited selection.  If you have a limited budget and do not want to get your hopes up at a nice bridal salon, come here first.  But once you go to a nicer place, it would be really tough to settle for anything you find here.

54.description: This place is awesome!  I'd read really great reviews online and even though it's kinda far west I thought it would be worth a shot.  I Do has both consignment and new dresses in truly unique styles.  Additionally, Kelly -the owner, is brilliant she really worked with us for over two hours pulling dresses she thought would look good on me from every corner of her shop.  Even better, Kelly has a seamstress friend who can do any type of alteration inexpensively and quickly.  Seriously gals, check this gem out!

48.description: I wish I could give 4.5 stars. The only reason its lacking a star is because of the seamstress referred by the store was disappointing.The owner, Kelly, just so happened to be the mother of a student of my maid of honor, which we found out when we arrived. She is SO good at her job. I heard good things about this place, and many have commented that you walk in with one idea and leave with something completely different. Well - its true!I came in 10 months before my wedding wanting a vintage gown from the 30s or 40s. I'm 5'9" and at the time overweight, and I had no idea how much I'd be able to lose before the big day. I had to come to terms with the fact that every woman from the war era was under 5'5" and a size -1 waist. Kelly did a great job of pulling dresses that fit my size and style. She knew I wanted vintage, but also off-white satin with little to no beading. After a few dresses I put on a very simple yet elegant diamond white satin spaghetti-strap v-neck gown, with a v-neck in the back and buttons going all the way down to the train. She was clever enough to add a beaded shawl she had picked up from a department store, and I was sold. I looked and felt fabulous! The style had enough vintage flair yet added a touch of modern glam. And I ended up losing enough weight to bring me down 2 sizes, so that's when the seamstress came in. I wasn't familiar with anyone else, so I went with the lady that Kelly referred me to, but in the end I was unfortunately unsatisfied. She could have worked with me a little better to fit the bra cups in the in the correct location, and to take in the dress in the right areas. But in the end I looked and felt great.

44.description: I searched all over chicago for a unique, reasonably priced wedding dress. I Do had tons to choose from. I found the perfect vintage 1970 dress for $375. Kelly said alterations will not be more than $125. She couldn't have been any more helpful. I would recommend I Do to any bride on a budget or not.

24.description: Based on the photo here (above) I would not give this place a second look but I went to check it out based on a referral.  It was really cool.  The shop specializes in wedding gowns, but has a few bridesmaid as well.  It is packed with all sizes ranging from 2-16 or so and they range in era from the 30s to present contemporary.  Although I think they have more vintage.  They can make alterations to any gown to make it exactly the way you want it.  I found some I liked, but I wasn't ready to commit.  There are not many very simple sheath looking gowns, which are my favorite.  I loved it, it was a fun experience, and the woman who owns the store is awesome! Go and take a look, and be open minded.  Dresses range from about 300 to 3000 depending on original price.

7.description: I had a similar experience dropping off a dress to be consigned.  I thought it was a normal store that was open during their posted store hours.  I also did not see anywhere where it said by appointment.  I got there and, like another person, found a handwritten note on the door.  I called and the owner, Kelly, was a bit snippy and rude.  I was told to drop off the dress at a business next door and when her daughter comes home she would pick up the dress.  The people next door were a little odd and I was hesitant (should have just gone home) but I did as requested since I live 40 minutes away.  I left my phone number and info along with the dress.  You would think  I would get a courtesy call telling me the dress was picked up (did not).  After several days I contacted the owner to say I didn't get a call regarding the dress and wanted to know if it was picked up.  She responded with a "I never said you would get a call".   I don't understand the lack of professionalism.  I just dropped off a $5000 designer dress with total strangers and they don't have the courtesy of a 1 minute phone call?  I will take blame for that because it was stupid of me to agree to something like that.  She also wanted a picture which I sent via email.  Instead she wanted a paper copy...What?  Why don't they take a picture themselves and print it out or print out the one I sent?  I find it hard to believe a business, in this day, doesn't have a copy/fax/printer or they can't absorb the cost of a piece of paper and some ink.  Anyway we finally got around to discussing price and details of the dress.  She kept emphasizing that it was going to be difficult to sell the dress because I didn't have the receipt and there was no tag in it and "bridal season" was over (this was June 2015).  It took 2 weeks to get the contract which states the price of the dress or best offer along with some other ridiculous requirements such as: a $30 per day charge beginning the first day after the contract expires if you don't pick up an unsold dress and charges for cleaning, pressing etc.  I don't believe for one second these people send these dresses anywhere to be cleaned if they can't even take their own pictures.  I don't like the "or best offer" clause and how do I know how much the dress actually sold for and, if it doesn't sell, did they keep it in a plastic bag.  I have never seen the inside of this store since it wasn't open when I was there.  I realize I made a mistake regarding the consigning of this dress to them.  If it doesn't sell, I will be there the day after to pick it up.  I don't understand how they get such good reviews other than they suck up to the buyers but not the sellers.

49.description: Incredibly unprofessional!!!  I made my appointment 2 weeks in advance.  They told me to call the day before to confirm.  I did and the number was "temporarily disconnected."  I tried the next morning... same thing.  It seemed like they were out of business, but I drove an hour to get there for my appointment anyway just in case.  I got there and the lights were turned off and the door closed!  I was so disappointed, but I figured that they had gone out of business.  I called again today to try and figure out what was going on.  Finally got an answer and the woman told me that she was probably upstairs and keeps the lights off when she's not there!  I don't know.  You'd think if you had a scheduled appointment somewhere that they would at least turn the lights on for you before you arrived, answer the phone, or have a voice message when they tell you to call.  This was really disappointing.  I would NEVER give I DO my business.

40.description: I was super excited to contact "I Do" after reading the reviews. However, upon calling to set up an appointment, I was asked a series of very specific questions, some of which I anticipated (date of wedding, dress size) and some I didn't (what EXACTLY are you looking for). I was also asked point blank if I looked elsewhere. I said no. She told me to look elsewhere before calling her. REALLY???? I don't understand why she doesn't want my business. I have a pretty good outline of the type of dress I want, but am open to suggestions and am not obscenely picky. I did tell her the fabric and silouette I was interested and that wasn't good enough for her. I am extremely disappointed in this experience and don't know why she refused to work with me.

53.description: I finally found my wedding dress! I must admit, that was the second store I went too. I knew what I wanted and knew that I will recognize it when I will see it.Kelly the owner has a good eye for matching dresses. There are tons of designer dresses that never been worn, some are vintage- really cool ones. She has a big variety and different styles. I bought a great dress in a good price so- deff recommended!

30.description: This place was recommended by my hair stylist, so I figured I'd check it out.  The shop looks like a resale shop inside - stuffed with merchandise, could use a little remodeling, etc.  The assistant asked what I wanted to see & then let us browse while she pulled a few things.  Kelly, the owner, was very helpful while I was trying the dresses on - great suggestions for accessories, pics, etc.  She was nice and not at all pushy.  I shopped around afterwards, but ultimately bought my dress from I Do.  No need to pay extra for the boutique treatment... I got a great dress at a great price!

46.description: A friend visited Chicago for one weekend with the mission to walk away with her wedding gown.  I Do made room for an appointment for us in their off hours.  They were completely helpful and patient.  Very skilled at understanding how a dress should fit, what could and could not be well altered.  They make you feel right at home and put at ease my friend who is not in love with her body and was loathing wedding dress shopping.  I cannot recommend this place enough for any kind of wedding gown - but they had an especially great selection of vintage.

1.description: I found my dress at I Do today, after visiting several other stores. Kelly and her daughter were great. Not pushy at all and very friendly. I found a beautiful dress for about half of its retail price. The dresses in my price range were so much nicer at I Do than at the other stores. A fun experience and I love my dress.

9.description: This is a fabulous store for saving money on a great dress.  Kelly and Hannah are professionals and provided an awesome shopping experience.  There was an enormous selection which Hannah expertly guided me through.  There was never any pressure.

26.description: I saw a Groupon for I Do Bridal Consultants.  I wasn't engaged yet, so I didn't buy it, but kept them on my radar knowing that we would be soon!  I called up Kelly, the owner to schedule an appointment and she was so helpful!  I don't live near there, and wanted to make my trip out west worth it, so asked her for some input on other places to check out in the area.  She listed like 8 others, and made sure not only my time there was worth it, but my whole day was going to be a good one.It was a consignment shop, and the dresses available are totally hit or miss.  I ended up finding NOTHING that worked for me.  There was another bride there, and absolutely EVERYTHING she tried on was gorgeous on her!  Even though I didn't find my dress here, I am sure many people can and will.  The only thing I would've changed about my experience was that they asked me to not zip up the dresses myself, and have them help me get in and out of them...for care of the gowns.  However, no one was ever there to help me.  I had to come out of the dressing room, holding the dress up around the girls, find someone, and ask them to finally help me.

25.description: Choosing a wedding dress is a very special and sentimental task in preparing for one's wedding.  My husband and I accompanied our daughter to "I Do" just this past Sunday.  Not only were there quite a few beautiful, designer dresses to choose from in our daughter's tiny dress size; but also, we felt like we were long-time/close friends to the shop owner - Kelly - by the end of the afternoon, with her careful and loving service.  Kelly also gave us many valuable tips from 19 years in the business, especially on how to best pose with the dress for pictures, flower bouquets, caring for the gown's train, etc.  It was a wonderful experience!

12.description: I'm late wtih this posting. I was looking for a wedding dress that was NOT strapless. Kelly had exactly what I was looking for. The price was good and I was able to put it on layaway. She has a woman, Adella, do the alterations out of her home. She did a great job, and charged $150.00. I highly recommend I Do Bridal to anyone I know getting married.

21.description: I can't say enough about Kelly and her willingness to help at the last minute.  I called Kelly with an urgent plea as the wedding dress I ordered on Etsy was not ready int time for my wedding.  Kelly took me in on a moments notice, and helped me find the perfect dress.  I was not interested in a "big" dress, and I found a very elegant, yet simple dress.  She arranged for Adele to make alterations, which were done expertly and in time.  Kelly has a very unique selection of dresses and it turned out to be a lifesaver for me.  Kelly is a great salesperson - she was accomodating, yet experienced.  Thank heavens I came upon Kelly and all her gowns - they saved my sanilty.

17.description: the owner was super nice and they had like a gazillion dresses packed in here. from what i could tell, they were in great condition. it was a mix of vintage stuff and samples. i would have spent more time here if i didn't already have a certain dress in mind. i could see pretty quickly that they had very few long & flowy options (most places don't) so after i saw those i was itchin' to make it to my next appointment. if you've got some time and and open mind, check it out.

10.description: While i didn't get my dress here, I was so happy that I tried on some dresses at I Do Designer Bridal Consignment. Kelly was extremely helpful and always had a solution to something that I didn't like about the particular dress that I had tried on. They didn't have what I was going for, but that doesn't mean this place isn't perfect for someone else.  I would recommend this place to anyone; they have unique dresses that you would not find at other bridal stores.

5.description: I found Kelly's shop through a friend and I am so glad I did!  She is the nicest person and very very informative and helpful .  She gives you honest opinions and has such a large selection of dresses.  I loved this place.  If you can't find a dress here, then you can't find one anywhere.  She has so many different styles and price ranges .  I found the most beautiful dress for my wedding .  I highly recommend her shop .

3.description: My friend, who is getting married, needed a veil and did not want to spend $200+ on one. I found Kelly's shop through Yelp and made a noon appointment for a Saturday.There was another group waiting outside and we waited about 10 minutes before we were let in, but once inside it was pretty much wedding heaven. Kelly took everyone's coats, showed our little group where to look for veils and then took the other ladies into the gown room (which is packed with dresses from the 20s-present organized by size. Amazing).We sorted through about 20 veils and found 3 that were all "maybes". Kelly had great insight, and in the end my friend left with a veil that was exactly what she wanted for $100.It's a small shop and pretty much every inch is crammed with gowns, dresses, and accessories. Since you need an appointment I can't see over-crowding ever being a problem. There is also a great selection of cocktail dresses and cool accessories like gloves and bags. I suppose if you go with a large entourage who are used to shops like David's where all the dresses are out on display, you might not appreciate I Do. If you love to find hidden gems or are looking for a dress from a specific time/era this is the perfect place to shop.Thanks Kelly!

35.description: I had an appointment today at 1 PM with Kelly.  I had called her a couple of weeks ago to set it up, and she seemed very nice and asked me a lot of specific questions on the phone.  I explained my mom was in town, and we were dress shopping together.  Because I live in the West Loop, we left at 12:15 PM.  We got there 5 minutes early.  All the lights were off in the shop, and there was a small sign that said ring the bell or knock.  I did both.  My mom and I waited 20 minutes.  We tried calling the store number, and got an answering machine.  I left a message.  We finally decided to leave.  It took us twice as long to get back to the city, so we were back by 2:45 PM.  All, in all, it was a 2 1/2 hour trip for nothing.I was going to blow this off, but I just now received a call at 9:15 on my cell phone from Kelly.  She said she had just now gotten around to checking her messages and called right away.  She explained that she had left a sign for today's appointments saying to ring the bell on the "green door", not the bell on the clear door.  I do not recall seeing such a sign.  She said it is because she lives above the shop and she was there the whole time.  I told her I called the shop and she said, "I was on a call when you called."  Well, if so, then why did the answering machine get it?  And, if she were expecting me at 1 PM, then why not be in the shop with the lights on?  Or why not call me - she took all my contact details when I called to make the appointment weeks ago.  Or, if it was getting on to be 15, 20, 30 minutes beyond my appointment, why not call to see what happened?  I told her that it must be my fault then that I did not see this "other" sign that she had posted specifically for today's appointments.  She said oh, no, she wasn't meaning to say it was my fault, but yes, I must not have seen the sign.  She then offered me a $50 credit toward a purchase for my trouble.  I declined and told her I had no interest in a purchase, thank you and goodbye.  Why would I want to risk wasting another 2 1/2 hours of my day, when I could've spent it at a bridal shop that had more interest in spending time with my mom and me.  There have been plenty of others that have treated us wonderfully this weekend, and one of them will be getting my business!Perhaps Kelly's dresses are lovely, but if there is one thing I cannot stand it is unreliable people who then attempt to point the finger at someone else for their own faults.

19.description: It was fun to look through the sea of dresses!! I purchased a vintage bridal gown from this shop. The dress had amazing beading and lace. The color was worn out, it had shoulder pads, it needed to be pressed, among other things, but I loved & saw the potential of the dress. I fell in love with a gown that needed a lot of work! I mean a lot of work. Kelly, the owner, recommend Adele, who does dress alterations out of her house. Adele removed the shoulder pads, inserted cups, lowered the neck line, took the sleeves out, and that was all good. I would only recommend her for simple alterations though. She is not very attentive to detail of the dress, did not do a good job taking in the back, and would not remember what I wanted to be altered in the dress. I would not recommend her for the more complex alterations & I would not say that her work is quality. Additionally, she is not very professional when it comes to sticking to appointments. There were times when I waited outside her house for 15+ sometimes 30 minutes. I ended up taking it to another alterations shop, so that another lady can finish making the rest of the alterations.  I ended up paying more for alterations combined than the dress itself. Advice: Check out this place, but if you do fall in love with a retro gown, take into consideration the cost of rejuvenating the dress.. I am with my second alterations person with more than 3+ fittings and its costing me as much as I paid for the dress. Also make sure that you select a credentialed alterations lady if you are looking to do lots of alterations on your gown.

28.description: Kelly is a little hard to get a hold of, but very easy to work with. I wanted a vintage style dress, and I got one there for $375. She even took a credit card over the phone from my mother long distance. She will hold the dress for you there in case there's a risk of it being discovered by unwanted eyes. Her seamstress is very talented as well. There isn't a giant selection of newer dresses, but I think it's worth stopping in.

45.description: I just visited I Do Bridal last weekend and was very pleasantly surprised by what a great experience I had.  Don't judge the place when you first walk in, they have tons of dresses in the back.  Most of the dressses are between $500 and $800 and they have a wide array ranging from once worn to sample stock from bridal stores that have closed to vintage dresses, too.  Kelly made some great pulls for me and was very patient and fun to work with.  I haven't decided if I'm buying one her dresses but I would recommend any bride on a budget check her out.  She's worth the drive out there.

33.description: I LOVED my dress.  I was worried about stretching my budget, but I ended up with a dress that my mom, mother-in-law, and friend adored for $600 (it was new).  I can imagine things could've been a little hit-or-miss here in the selection, but I know two other women who got their dresses here and were equally happy.  The store is definitely much lower-key than some of the other boutiques I went to, and if I'd judged the place by the storefront I never would've gone in.  But the owner was really helpful even though I didn't have an appointment (I'd recommend trying to get one just in case they're busy), not pushing me toward stuff I didn't want, and she even let me try on a few "awful" dresses and take pictures for fun.I didn't use her recommended woman for alterations (called once, she never called me back, and I found someone else before I called a second time) but my friend who used her said she was amazing.  If you are looking for a dress, this place is definitely worth a look.BONUS: most wedding stores take MONTHS to get you your dress.  I was looking in November for a May wedding, and I wasn't going to get my dress until a few weeks before the wedding.  Because I got the dress at I DO, I could take it home that same day (or store it at the store), get the alterations done on my time, and compare the fabric to my shoes and husband's suit/tie.  This saved me a lot of worry and anxiety, which made this place (and the dress) even better!

43.description: I'd give 4.5 stars if that were an option.  I went here because a friend of mine found her dress at I Do.  Kelly, the owner, asked me a lot of questions about my day, my vision on a dress and my budget.  She gave some suggestions, but didn't pressure me at all.  She gave me as much time as I wanted to go through the dresses.  In the end, I found the perfect dress well under the budget that I had.  The dress was a couture dress that I got for almost 75% off the original full-price.  The dress was in near-perfect condition.  The challenge was to alter the dress from the size 16 that it was to my size 6 frame.   To do this, Kelly sent me to her seamstress who did a phenomenal job.  The seamstress, Adella, did this phenomenal job on the first try...no additional alterations were necesary.  And her alteration price was a flat fee and well below what most places charge.I will be referring as many people as possible to take their buisness to I Do.

2.description: Word of Advice: Don't waste your time and gas. Never experienced such poor customer service in my life. Drove 40 minutes from downtown Chicago to consigned a Stephen Yearick wedding gown. Never worn. Never altered. BRAND NEW. According to Yelp, the store opens at noon.I arrived at 12:21 pm, and found a handwritten note on the door (yes handwritten) saying that they were by appointment only. After calling the business phone number, the owner (I'm assuming) asked me did I have an appointment. After explaining to her, that I was not interested in trying on wedding gowns, but simply selling one-she rudely told me that her "ad" says "by appointment only". I have no idea what "ad" she is referring to, as I am a 30 year old woman who relies on modern day technology, like the Internet and an IPhone. Plus, who needs an appointment to consign ? (Shrugs). When I explained to her that I was unaware of her "by appointment only policy", and that I simply used Yelp to guide me to her store, she barked that she would be at the store in 15 minutes (despite her business hours), and how she couldn't be rushed any sooner. She then advised me to take a picture of the dress, and walk across the street to Walgreens and have it printed, to give to her when she arrived. The most ridiculous thing I've heard in my life. Not to mention- the 95 degree heatwave in Chicago. And the dress was with me. Why do I need to pay for a print at Walgreens ?!? Had she heard of email ? Furthermore, where am I supposed to take pictures of a wedding gown ---on the street ????I told her to enjoy her day. I would never give my business to someone so tacky and rude. My advice: Give your money to a business that cares about their customers-their customer service is beyond poor. Customers should NOT have to wait in the heat for 15 minutes and spend money for a (printed) photo in order to do business with them.  It's 2015. Come to work during your listed business hours and be a little nicer.  This business is clearly stuck in the Stone Ages-along with their cold attitude. They deserve ZERO stars.

18.description: OMG this place is amazing! One of my bridesmaids found it for me since she knew I didnt want to spend a fortune on a wedding dress and don't care about fancy store experience. I went there last Sunday with my girls and was in heaven from the moment I walked in. I am a thrifty shopper and get excited when I find one of a kind original piece, which you definitely will at this store! Kelly (the owner) showed me where the dresses close to my size were and let me go through them and pick what I wanted to try. I think I tried about 10 or 12. I narrowed it down to 3 and then I picked The One! I got a brand new dress for half of what I would have paid at a Bridal Store!!! I left the dress there to be stored (at no additional fee) until my alteration time comes, because otherwise I would want to put it on every day. Don't go there unless you are ready to buy your dress, because Kelly can't hold the dresses for you, and if you find something you like, it might not be there the next time you come. I love the dress I picked, I love this store and I love Kelly for providing us, budget conscious girls with beautiful wedding dresses.

41.description: Based on the reviews here, I can imagine that shopping for a wedding dress at I Do would be a positive experience, and I was hoping to check out the place.  Unfortunately, I cannot write a review of the store, since I can't seem to get anyone there to return my calls so I can make an appointment.  Maybe it's a busy season for the wedding dress industry, but after leaving unreturned messages over the course of a month, I'm giving up.

52.description: Kelly and I Do Designer Bridal Consignment is the best!  I had been to Weddings 826 and fell IN LOVE with a sample gown that was too small for me (plus it was a little dirty looking). They're overpriced. Since they don't give you the name of the dresses you're trying on, I had to Google descriptions until I found THE DRESS. Once I found it, I looked up Bridal shops in Chicago that carry the Winnie Couture line. "I DO" did, but Kelly needed to order me the dress in my size and color. When she called to tell me the dress was in (3 weeks later, which was so early I couldn't believe my luck!), she told me that whoever she purchases the dresses from wanted her to buy something like 8-10 more dresses, because of the low price she had quoted me ($1000....whereas Weddings826 was selling a SAMPLE for $1700).  She originally quoted me that price before she ordered them based off her knoweledge of Winnie Couture dresses from last season. Anyways, she came through for me, and didn't raise the price on me once she realized the dress was worth more than that. She has wonderful customer service and ethics and I really enjoyed buying my dress from her. She also referred me to a seamstress that I didn't think twice about using for alterations since Kelly had given me such good service. The shop is a little small, and not at all trendy, but I would go back and again if I had to!

50.description: Very friendly owner and large selection of dresses.  Not the prettiest store, but worth a visit.  Reasonable prices.

4.description: I do Designer Shop was my savior! Kelly was amazing and  saved my wedding day! I was not happy with my wedding dress thast I bought somewhere else and was going to give up and be a sad bride.  But Kelly woudnt hear of such things she went out of her way to keep her store open so she can make a bride happy:).  She was so much more personable and professional than the other bride shops I visited.  I felt like a princess going to my ball. Also her dynamo seamstress Adela was amazing and was able to have my dress fitted with ample amount of time for my destination wedding.  Thank you ladies for making my wedding so special, I reccomend all brides to buy their dresses here you won' be disappointed, the dresses are beautiful and the customer service rocks!

6.description: My mother in law and I visited this shop on the Tuesday after Easter and it was packed!  Although the small shop was very busy, the staff still found time to spend with all of us to recommend dresses.  Although I didn't end up getting my dress from here, the ladies at I Do figured out my style very quickly and they really helped me envision the kind of dress that I wanted for the big day.  Perhaps I'll be back when the wedding is over to add to the inventory!

22.description: It was fun to look through the sea of dresses!! I purchased a vintage bridal gown from this shop. The dress had amazing beading and lace. The color was worn out, it had shoulder pads, it needed to be pressed, among other things, but I loved & saw the potential of the dress. I fell in love with a gown that needed a lot of work! I mean a lot of work. Kelly, the owner, recommend Adele, who does dress alterations out of her house. Adele removed the shoulder pads, inserted cups, lowered the neck line, took the sleeves out, and that was all good. I would only recommend her for simple alterations though. She is not very attentive to detail of the dress, did not do a good job taking in the back, and would not remember what I wanted to be altered in the dress. I would not recommend her for the more complex alterations & I would not say that her work is quality. Additionally, she is not very professional when it comes to sticking to appointments. There were times when I waited outside her house for 15+ sometimes 30 minutes. I ended up taking it to another alterations shop, so that another lady can finish making the rest of the alterations.  I ended up paying more for alterations combined than the dress itself. Advice: Check out this place, but if you do fall in love with a retro gown, take into consideration the cost of rejuvenating the dress.. I am with my second alterations person with more than 3+ fittings and its costing me as much as I paid for the dress. Also make sure that you select a credentialed alterations lady if you are looking to do lots of alterations on your gown.

15.description: LOVED this place.  The space is a little dingy and it is quite far west but it's basically like having a giant closet of wedding dresses from all eras and styles at your fingertips. Adela is their seamstress and although you don't have to use her, you should. She does a great job and will work with you on whatever you want to alter on your dress; add or take away sleeves/trains/etc at a reasonable cost. Plus there is just absolutely no reason to buy a new wedding dress. Thousands of dollars to wear something once in your life that immediately depreciates the moment you put it on? Just silly. I found an amazing dress here that made me feel beautiful at a great price. Perfection.

20.description: I bought my dress here in February for my July wedding.  I brought my Matron of Honor/Sister with me and that's why this was all perfect for my situation.  See, I'm not great at picking out this kind of stuff on my own, and Kelly--while helpful and willing to suggest dresses--didn't know what kind of a dress I was looking for.  However, my sister waded right into the ocean of dresses of every size and shape and design and picked out the PERFECT dress for me.  If you don't have someone who has that kind of eye, this might not be the place for you--it's just too overwhelming with choices.  When Kelly saw we had it all covered, she stepped back and let us handle it all on our own, which was what I preferred.I could never have afforded such a nice dress new, but this dress was in beautiful condition.  Amazingly, it had been in the store for only 3 days.  The owner had brought it in after not being able to sell it at a different consignment store after having it there for months.  I was glad to take it off her hands!I didn't use the seamstress the store uses, so I can't comment on that.I will admit that it was a little weird to not have any real idea of the size or price of the dresses.  She tells you which area of the store you should be looking in and then tells you the price if you ask.  So after I found the perfect dress, I held my breath to see if I could afford it--and I could!!!

36.description: I want to review the OTHER side of the I DO Bridal Consignment experience, that is being the SELLER. I would highly warn anyone who would try and sell a gown or veil to the questionable owner, Kelly Hamilton. I brought my dress and veil in one year ago and had to call Kelly to get updates on the selling status. Whenever I would call, we would be disconnected. I usually could not get through for a day or so and then would be told that there were new phones with problems. I believe Kelly had my number logged because whenever I called from a different phone, she would answer. The contract agreement stated that when the garment was sold, a check would be sent in the mail. After many calls, Kelly finally admitted that the veil was sold even though I had not received a check.  After several more calls, Kelly finally sent me a check. Then six months went by and I never heard from her, so I called again only to experience the disconnections. Kelly then told me that she did not know if my dress sold and that she couldn't tell because I didn't have a picture of it. Even though I gave her the invoice number, she said it was impossible to look up and that she would call me the next day to update the sales status. She never called and one week later I called her from another phone. There was no problem with disconnection. She then told me she FORGOT to check on my dress and if I come in, she would look for it. Again, I asked her why she couldn't give me the status over the phone. She would not answer my question but said that if I come in we can look for it. I made an appointment and she had cash in an envelope for me. I asked her about my dress. She said she still didn't know if it sold, so  I asked her WHY she was giving me money. Instead of giving me an answer, Kelly asked me if I wanted the dress back. I took the cash and left NEVER wanting to deal with her again. Her actions speak volumes regarding her honesty. I plan to report this incident to the Better Business Bureau. It is possible that your bargain was someone else's loss.

14.description: I was originally thinking of selling my dress back to I Do but now that the wedding is done there is no chance. I adore this beautiful dress and the tailoring done by Adela was great. I didn't spend a fortune on a dress and felt really beautiful.This place is such a gem.

1.description: I'm a firm believer that all factories should have public tours.  Especially those that make such beloved things as the little red wagon.  Alas, no tours are offered here, but they do have a big red wagon you can stop and do a photo op by.  I appreciate that much.  I await the tour though.

2.description: It takes a long, long time to get all the way out here but when you do, it's quite a thing to see.I suggest bringing friends and taking pictures of them in and around the wagon or bringing a camera at the very least.Something touristy in Chicago located miles away from Michigan Avenue.  Who knew?

0.description: We were hesitant to pay for the private tour but are very glad we did. Enjoying the store with nobody inside was very worthwhile. The tour begins with pictures with a toy solider guide. He does a great job of educating the kids and parents with Radio Flyer.

29.description: This is another Xsport location that I frequent often. There's not really much to say. I gets packed during peak times especially on Mondays. I do recommend the muscle max class with Olivia and the step class with Ray. I just wish they had more 5lb weights in the fitness class. There aren't enough for everybody, so I always have to use the 8lb weights. If you decided to join a class that uses free weights make sure you're there atleast 5 minutes early.

42.description: It's too early to tell about this gym, but I think I'm getting what I paid for: a no-nonsense, neighborhood gym. I signed up mainly for the pool, and despite expressing that repeatedly to the asst. manager who walked me around, he pushed training packages on me relentlessly. Almost a total turn-off, but I needed to find a pool near my house. That aside, everyone there seems quite friendly. The pool is cloudy (what is in it? I'm going to have that checked out--) but nice enough, and the locker rooms are updated, but well-used. The lockers seem unreliable, and I wouldn't leave anything valuable inside-- many of the handles seem like they're been busted open before. I'll post updates on the condition of the pool as I swim there more. The vibe seems good, and I don't think anyone will look at me twice as I run in & out to swim, so what else do I really need? I hope they maintain the pool as well as they maintain their enormous free-weight area!

23.description: The first time I came to this Xsport, many of the treadmills were out of service. Since then they have been fixed and I'm happier with my gym sesh. I also enjoy the women's training area upstairs- it make's for an efficient circuit training one day a week. Downfall- no towel service.

8.description: Issues rectified for the most part. Pool still clean and clear. Clientele still partially foul and weird. Just please take great care of the pool. Both Brickyard and Skokie have gross-ass pools, and Skokie calls itself a "Super Power" gym, which is, of course, ridiculous. Ugh!

31.description: so i like this place and dont like this place. its like an ex that your just sick of but sometimes cant get around LOL. 1) i like this gym because it has all the machines you need to get a great work out in. 2)the locker room is nice and big so you shouldnt have a problem finding one to set your stuff up in(just make sure to lock up in this location) 3)they have the steam room in here, swimming pool, an upstairs for the lifters and downstairs for most of the cardio, plus they have a climbwall what! really a climb wall haha sick. 4) i havent really taken the time to see the proteins and how much they go for or the gear they have to view there so review not based on that.Now the Bad1) this gym is basicly called the CLUB. cause when you go there you will see everyone half dressed or all decked out with make up just to "work out" and work out meaning two minutes then spend the rest of the time looking for a gurl/guy to fuck around with haha.2)certain times are not the best to go because it shall be hard to find the equipment that you are looking to use to get your work out in. but this is just normal with any gym.3)just like any gym you have the Douchs filled with drugs and then the smelly guys, the half naked guys, and the old naked men in the locker room LOL. then the woman half naked that shouldnt be wearing that, then the gurls looking for a guy and then the people on their phone the entire time on their phones ASSES.really good gym if you want to work out everything else just dont pay attention too and do you.

34.description: Why hasn't management looked into this location yet??? It can't possibly be that hard to oversee a gym setup???No towel service, machines are very filthy, strange smell all over the gym, the mens restroom and locker area is filthy and the urinal area is a disaster and reeks of fowl odors. Its as if someone decided to go to town on a flatulence binge after drinking spoiled milk. I use my membership at other locations. They do have really clean locations, but this one is like a sore that doesn't go away. Either fix the place, replace management, or just closed it down.I am seriously looking into finding another gym that has better customer service.  I tried to get some help to stop my card from being charged while away from town from work and it was impossible. I had to eat my membership for several months as if I was going in. I find this unacceptable and for someone who's had a membership for a few years with them, I think its just wrong to do that. Bottom line.... this location is the worst one Xsport has.

16.description: Today was my 1st visit AS A MEMBER to XSport Fitness. I actually enjoyed my visit. My trainer (Jason) is really cool! I felt comfortable with him being my trainer - not intimidating at all. The gym was sort of crowded and the music was really pumping. However, I used that to my advantage because it actually helped me to find my motivation. Also, if you have towels, take them with you. Even if they did have towels, not sure if I would want to use them because I don't know where they've been. So to solve that problem - take your own! As a plus, I have Clorox wipes in my bag to use to wipe down any machine I use. (Yea, I'm a bit of a germaphobe). Lastly, I felt comfortable. I wasn't focus on any one else there but ME! I wasn't interested in the person next to me, behind me, across from me, etc. I became a member at this gym for me. Bottom line, this gym is pretty  cool. They're open 24/7. They have an awesome pool, steam room, classes, etc. If you're looking for a gym, I say give them a try. As long as you're not looking make friends, have a nanny or butler, or someone else to cater to you, you'll be okay. Remember, take towels, Clorox wipes and hand sanitizer. You'll be just fine.

13.description: Once again great customer service from this place. I was screamed at from across the front counter area because I was putting my bottle if juice in the wrong refrigerator. Ron was yelling on the top of his lungs, Sir that's the wrong one, Sir your putting that bottle in the wrong refrigerator. I was in absolutely shocked that a employee would be treating a customer like this and trying to embarrass me.There is seriously something wrong with this location and I think it all starts with Management.

11.description: Out of all xsports that I have bean at these one is still one of my favorite locations, big species and good selection of equipment, the bad part due to the age of the location some equipment needs to be replaced because maintenance is not keeping up to well, some times when it is really busy weights are in disarray, besides that the place feels like a gym not a social club

39.description: I guess I'm in the minority and really sort of like when it's crowded. Like, when running on the treadmill next to people, I imagine I'm in a race and it helps the 5miles go by much faster than when I'm next to empty machines. I just bought a membership to use for the 2 months I was in Chicago visiting my parents and it was very worth it. Every single penny. I'll miss this gym. I loved the classes and thought the instructors were awesome! Sure, it gets crowded, but it's cause they're so good!Spinning with Dee, Zumba with Juan, kickboxing cardio with Craig are the best classes but I loved step and kickboxing with Ray and step and zumba with Yesenia. Ab attack with Selina is awesome. Seriously fun classes.

37.description: I'm almost to the end of my trial month and I'm trying to decide whether or not to cancel my membership.  Since the Brickyard location is nearest, I'll write my review on that location.  The good: It's rarely ever crowded on the cardio machines. I've been in there during multiple times during the week and during the day and I've never had a problem finding a treadmill open. There are a bunch of other card options open as well. The pool is never in use. I don't think the crowd that uses this gym realize a pool can be used for workouts. If I start swimming, this will be a plus.The bad: Management is clearly pushing personal trainers. I had to endure a high-pressure sales pitch from a trainer and a meathead when I started. No thanks...I don't want to spend $250/month on your services. Sheesh. The music is LOUD. I don't mind the type of music, I just think it's too loud when it's drowning out my headphones. Having said this, my issue with the music is nothing compared with the TV situation. First, none of the cardiovascular machines have screens on them. You have to crane your neck looking at the circa-1992 TVs that are placed way too close to the machines to look at comfortably. And if you can find a machine close enough to a TV that's actually turned on, there's no way to listen to the TV.  No towel service.  Really? For $40 I can't get a towel?The ugly: this place is filthy! I think I've seen one person wipe down a machine after using it. That's because you have to go clear across the gym to find anything to clean the machine with.  And if you do find a sanitized dispenser, chances are it's empty. And the lockers are just awful. Dirty inside and out. I literally wonder if the outsides have been cleaned in under 6 months or so based on the buildup of fuzz and grime. Gross. The only redeeming part about this location is.....that I can go to the one in Logan Square as well without paying more.

0.description: I stopped working out here about a year ago, but have been a member for years before that.Positives: It has a pool, hot tub, sauna, steamroom, basketball court, its open 24/7 and it's a good price. That combo is rare to find.Negatives: Cleanliness is subpar. It's usually crowded (especially the basketball court). Monthly member appreciation day is all junk food. Lockers are constantly in disrepair.If you don't use the pool, hot tub, sauna, steam room or basketball court, Planet Fitness is a cleaner and cheaper option. If you do use those, this is the lowest priced gym that has all that.

38.description: I like this gym but be careful with the lockers.  Always check the inside to make sure the sides are bolted. A dozen or so lockers don't function properly?? Other than that, it's two floors of clean machines and a no nonsense crowd with a good vibe.

27.description: For people who love working out early in the morning like me. This gym is the place to workout, because early in the morning it isn't crowded. So you could get your workout in without any problem. Anytime after 2pm it starts getting crowded. Anytime from 4am to 1pm is not crowded. Is also open 24/7 !

32.description: I can't believe there are so many negative reviews about this place. I like the selections of machines and weights available, it's 24hrs, there is a steam room, pool plenty of cardio machines. I will say that they do need more stair climbers. They have better prices for protein than GNC, even during gold week.The men's locker room is clean. I have been to Ballys  by o'hare and that place is BAD, talk about a filthy locker room. At x-sport There is always a staff member in the locker room cleaning the place up or putting the weights back etc. I am happy here and in my opinion it's worth the money.I saw some other post mentioning "Towel Service"? You mean like a butler handing you a towel from a silver platter? C'mon this isn't a hotel. Just shut up and workout!

44.description: A friend tried to cancel with their 30 day cancellation policy.   They have pulled out every reasoning in the book for why he can't cancel.  He has sent letters, emails, and made half a dozen calls only to have them change their story everytime on why he can't cancel.  Once your original pre-paid period is up, they just start billing your credit card monthly, and it's darn near impossible to get them to stop when you want them to.These guys are shady.  Stay away!

24.description: COMPLETE AMENITIES. RUDE STAFF AND WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE.Worst customer service! My Fiance has been a member for more than a year. And I signed up just 2 mos ago. One night,my fiance was stopped by a receptionist coz he has a balance. My fiance showed to the receptionist that he just got charged by Xsport . The receptionist said it's not showing to their system. I got pissed and said they have a bad service. The receptionist got upset and told me she was not talking to me. Then the security came over and told my fiance that " you don't pay the balance then get out" I asked the names of those 2 employees but didn't wanna give. They didn't have the manager on duty that time and these 2 staff are shouting and talking to us so rude. So people, u can't come in if u have a balance coz they're not gonna let u in.

7.description: I would normally have given this gym a 3 star primarily because I like the equipment and the location was very convenient for me a while back when I worked near there. The kind of people you get working out there, you can't really control and it is what it is.If you were there to workout and not pick up dates, then you shouldn't be too concerned about people around you. Unfortunately the caliber of employees they have there has diminished so rapidly in the fast few years that has become a cancer to the Xsport name by effecting it's image from the inside out. The staff on a number of occasions have been extremely unprofessional and at times confrontational with members and I have witnessed it first hand while either entering or exiting the gym. It's not like a little attitude here and there, it's a full on public humiliation style attitude against it's own customers. Get it together Xsport. I've been a member with Xsport pretty much for the past 10 years and it has never been as bad as its been the past few years there.

40.description: Wow! So many negative reviews, this may not be the best gym but it gets the job done. I have hired a personal trainer in the past and I had a great experience. She kicked my @ss during the workout and I may have been sore, but she did her job (and thankfully she never ditched me). My biggest beef would be the availability of space from the machines to the aerobics class (I absolutely hate when I'm in aerobics and some sweaty person is in my space with their nasty sweat eww). But I just learned that to get to the front of the class or come on the weekends when everyone is recovering from their hangovers. The best feature that brings me back are the pool, sauna, and jacuzzi.

30.description: Great chain, but this specific location is CRAPPY.Xsport is a excellent chain.  Lots of gyms have been popping up lately, but Xsport stands out on three fronts:  1. It's a 24/7 gym2. Unlike many gyms, Xsport gyms (at least the newer locations, not the former world gym ones) are large, and have lots of specialized machines and weights.  So, if you're serious about weight training, bodybuilding, and/or serious hard-core cardio, they have lots of specialized equipment, which you won't find in places like Cardinal Fitness or Planet Fitness (which are geared more towards your average fitness) or even many Bally's locations (which are stuck in the 80s).  Xsport has pretty much EVERYTHING.3. It's relatively cheap (except for some select locations like Lakeview).  Xsport stripped most of the unnecessary crap that you'll find at places like Lifetime (racquetball, spa, seating areas, and all that yuppy crap that drive up the price of a gym membership).  Of course, Xsport, *does* have some unecessary crap (sauna, jacuzzi, etc), but it's minimal.So, Xsport is a great chain, definitely consider it.HOWEVER,The Bricktown location specifically is G-H-E-T-T-O.  I'll repeat G-H-E-T-T-O.  It's probably an inside joke within the company that this is the worst location of all their gyms.The equipment is not well-maintained at this location. About a month ago, I witnessed a guy -who was doing seated cable rows- ...the cable snapped, and he fell backwards.  He was lucky not to hit his head on anything.A very large percentage of the members at this location are lazy, rude slobs.  It starts in the parking lot, where people follow you in their cars to park as close to the entrance as possible.  Even though they're coming to the gym to WORK OUT they don't want to walk more than 30 feet.  (Of course, it gets VERY crowded and busy during that one day of the month when they hold "Membership Appreciation Day" and give out free pizza and cake....sad).  And because they're too lazy to walk, many perfectly-able people park their cars in handicapped spots (and they do NOT have a handicap sign on their car), or they make up a parking space where there isn't one.Inside the gym, rarely do people re-rack their weights.  And I don't mind if people don't remove the plates they used from the machine they used, but it DOES bother me that they just leave plates on the floor, for someone to trip over.  People also don't re-rack dumbbells, which is even more annoying.For dumbbells, there's only 2 pairs of every weight-category in the gym, and when you need to use the dumbbells in the 5-45 lb range (the most commonly used), they're often NOT to be found on the weight racks.  People (and women are just as guilty as men) take dumbbells far from the weight racks, and just dump them wherever when they're done using them.  Which means, when you need to use a dumbbell in the 5-45 lb range, there's a good chance you'll waste 10-20 minutes looking for them.Oh, sometimes you won't even find the specific dumbbell you're looking for, because people steal them.  Yes, an employee confirmed it for me.  And the same goes for D-handles, which have a high turnover rate of disappearing.  Of course, when you DO find what you need, there's a chance someone may have stuck their chewing gum onto it.Of course, people don't only steal the gym's belongings.  They can also steal yours.  I stopped using the lockers in the locker room when someone picked my lock and stole my credit cards.  I've also had a jacket stolen, and personal equipment stolen (ab hangers, bar pad)...so make sure not to forget anything behind when you move from one equipment to another, because it'll be gone in ten minutes, and don't bring your wallet with you.Which all makes sense why the company puts little investment into this gym.  Why they don't maintain the equipment, why they don't frequently fill the paper-towel dispensers, why a faucet in the bathroom may be "out of order" for weeks at a time...I mean when people steal from the gym, or when they leave the faucet ON with the water running after they're done washing their hands in the bathroom (IF they bother to wash their hands)...it's just not worth putting too much investment into this location, otherwise the company loses money on this location.So, like I said, great chain, crappy location,  I've been to other locations, and they're very nice.  Unfortunately, I have no choice, as there is no other gym near me that has all the equipment I need.  But, if you have a choice, don't go to this one,

1.description: Still waiting for clean locker rooms, disinfecting spray bottles with actual liquid in them, and civilized staff. (Personal trainers are AWESOME! XSport employees are not.)Stopped using my membership as regularly as I was once my personal trainer left. Saw no reason to go back as the staff is always unwelcoming, condescending, and arrogant. All my guests are pressured to get a membership even though I clearly specify that they're my workout buddy (which I'm able to bring) are aren't interested. As a result, my workout buddies never return as a result of the harassment followed by the eye rolling when they respectfully decline offers made. Ive only kept the membership because of the 24hour benefit, and the fact that this gym is about 10 mins from my home, not to mention the unusually low promo I got my membership at. However, I'd rather get up at 4:45 to make it to my local YMCA which opens at 5am. They're always friendly and helpful despite having to deal with gym members, building residents, and summer camp or after-school kids, sometimes simultaneously. I've filed a complaint with corporate and was offered a free week-guest pass for a friend. Which I declined, as I don't think my friends deserve to be put through the headache I pay a monthly fee for.

9.description: A true lifters gym! Huge free weight area with padded floor for deadlifts! The problem is only 1 squat rack is on it. That said things are fixed promptly and there are plenty of people really working out not there to pick some one up. But that happens to I am sure. I live near the one by Harlem & Irving and this is my gym.

26.description: This an email that I sent to their corporate and although they responded and the new club by portage park is nice, The whole experience has led me to gladly pay more and switch to Formula Fitness.  The bottom line , when you offer low dues. You get low quality members that are gettho and inconsiderate.    Email: "Just recently upgrading my new membership until the location near my house opens, My Fiancee and I decided to visit you club at Bricktown. My experience was upsetting to say the least as I found the location poorly managed. My primary concern was the equipment ( treadmills) which we found at least 5 or 6 out of service. Others factors adding to my disappointment was the lack of towel service and supplies to clean the machines. This has left such a bad taste that I have scheduled a visit with a competitor this saturday and if their facilities seem better, I will gladly cancel my membership. The reason I choose your club is because the Portage park location is 4 blocks from my house but in no way, is running clubs such as the Bricktown. Now I question the cleanliness of your pools. When confromting the manager about this, her excuse was unacceptable"LOST MY BUSINESS!!!!!

25.description: This Xsport seriously needs some improvement.  I think the machines are good, fairly new and in working order so that is a plus.  However, the group classes here are horrible.  I have been to a few at this location and at others and this location just fails.  Zumba in the basketball court is a joke, you can't hear the instructor and its just awkward in there.  I know they moved it there in order to accomodate the demand but if people would just get there early to attend or go on a different day then it wouldn't be a problem.  Some of the other classes are SOOO crowded and people sneak in there halfway through the class and the instructors don't say anythin.  Maybe they aren't allowed to but its disturbing to the rest of the class.  OHH and spin class was a TRAINWRECK.  We were the seated position the majority of the time and the music just didn't go along with the intensity that a spinning class should have.  I was also seated in between two morons who arrived late and constantly interupted the class with their antics, trying to distract the instructor and she fell for it.  She spent several minutes conversing with them and then with a co-worker.  It was so rude and inappropriate, I will never attend classes here again.

12.description: Great free weight set up... Other than that there's a whole list of cons... Filthy gym instead of wiping down railings the water fountains should be cleaned out as they have MOLD growing all over the faucet and drain. (Wonder what the city would say about this.)Free weights are usually a mess even at down times they're scattered. Out dated cardio equipment that's usually out of order or the treadmills skip bogus No Towels...! Only full service xsport I've been too that doesn't provide this No WIFI!!! Also none of the cardio equipment is equipped with TVs which I've been to express xsports that offer memberships for $5 a month that have this feature included yet I pay $39.99 a month at a full service xsport and don't have it provided for me. I don't like to break my neck to look at the tv to a show I don't even have the power of changing.

21.description: I'm giving it a three star rating because even though this facility needs repairs and buying supplements seems to be an episode  from mission impossible,  this place has one of the best trainers, if not the best! His name is Ryan, he is dedicated, professional and customer focused. He offers a holistic approach to training, which involves effective work out techniques and healthy eating habits. He helps clients achieve results and is always willing to offer advise to get to the next level. He is your best bet if you want to get fit.

17.description: COMPLETE AMENITIES. RUDE STAFF AND WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE.Worst customer service! My Fiance has been a member for more than a year. And I signed up just 2 mos ago. One night,my fiance was stopped by a receptionist coz he has a balance. My fiance showed to the receptionist that he just got charged by Xsport . The receptionist said it's not showing to their system. I got pissed and said they have a bad service. The receptionist got upset and told me she was not talking to me. Then the security came over and told my fiance that " you don't pay the balance then get out" I asked the names of those 2 employees but didn't wanna give. They didn't have the manager on duty that time and these 2 staff are shouting and talking to us so rude. So people, u can't come in if u have a balance coz they're not gonna let u in.

10.description: I've been coming to this gym since I was an overweight teenager. The fact that it's 15 minutes away from my house and it's a place I'm used to are the only reasons I keep coming back. To list the positive, it's a very large gym with so much equipment. With that being said, I'm a person that values quality over quantity. Although they have a lot of machines and weights, they are older and outdated. There's always a machine broken, crusty treadmills covered in dried up sweat, and dusty circuit training equipment. It's so sad because I want to like the place so bad. Because it's so large, they should have more free weights. They only have two sets of every dumbbell. That's the same amount at the express XSport that I go to sometimes. It's always crowded and that's not very conducive to the workout environment. The locker rooms smell like crap and are so unsanitary. I swear I'm about to get a bacterial infection every time I step foot in there. Lastly, the staff is very unfriendly and arrogant. They facilitate an environment that isn't likeable and don't make it a welcoming experience every time. They scan my card and give it right back. They don't say anything else; no greetings ever UNLESS you didn't pay the bill. In that case, they are quick to speak. And some of the staff have been there for years. You'd think they'd say hi after being a loyal customer for 8 years. Guess not. All in all, big facility with subaverage equipment and service.

5.description: Still love this place. I think the people who have really beat this place up need to see how other gyms operate and possibly even check their OWN attitudes. You should probably go join Planet Fitness or some other strip mall gym. If you're so conscious about what other people are doing, YOU are NOT working out. Complaints about Old Machines? If you need some cutting edge 21st Century equipment to get your sweat on, you're doing it wrong and will more than likely fail. My wife has been going strong with Ryan for about 1.5yrs now and she absolutely loves him. I have become acquainted with several of the people that work there from Maint to Trainers to Managers and they're all extremely nice and helpful. Sure 1 review from a guy like me isn't going to turn everyone around, but I have to try. If you don't like the "Element" there, find somewhere on YOUR side of the tracks.Really sick of hearing people call this place Ghetto, D-Block, Jail Gym, Convict Crew.Some of the nicest and most helpful guys that I have encountered here are ex-convicts. Much better than the Eastern Euro Meathead/Roid Crowd you will encounter at other gyms. :-PJust went to the New Norridge location. Nice setup, but I think they spent too much $$$ on the stonework and frills and not enough on the real estate. So for you Suburban Prim and Proper types, go to Norridge and keep your whiney asses out of Bricktown.

3.description: What can I say? The original Xsport location showing its age. Water fountain on the first floor broken and leaking for weeks. No towel service. It's close to home, otherwise I wouldn't come here.

35.description: Ever want to feel un-motivated in a physical sense all while being trained by a gelled-out D-bag?Well if you do, this particular Xsport gym is the way to go. The sellers make up lies so that you won't cancel on your membership. And I have never seen a personal trainer who wasn't physically fit, UNTIL I paid a visit to this place. Sloppy, sloppy and sloppy. This "globo-gym" straight up blows.

19.description: This an email that I sent to their corporate and although they responded and the new club by portage park is nice, The whole experience has led me to gladly pay more and switch to Formula Fitness.  The bottom line , when you offer low dues. You get low quality members that are gettho and inconsiderate.    Email: "Just recently upgrading my new membership until the location near my house opens, My Fiancee and I decided to visit you club at Bricktown. My experience was upsetting to say the least as I found the location poorly managed. My primary concern was the equipment ( treadmills) which we found at least 5 or 6 out of service. Others factors adding to my disappointment was the lack of towel service and supplies to clean the machines. This has left such a bad taste that I have scheduled a visit with a competitor this saturday and if their facilities seem better, I will gladly cancel my membership. The reason I choose your club is because the Portage park location is 4 blocks from my house but in no way, is running clubs such as the Bricktown. Now I question the cleanliness of your pools. When confromting the manager about this, her excuse was unacceptable"LOST MY BUSINESS!!!!!

28.description: WORST XSPORT IN CHICAGO!!. When I went there multiple lockers were broken into and some of my stuff was missing. So basically it is a good place if u want to get ROBBED!! Stay away from this place.

45.description: The employees here are really helpful.  I always find a machine here so it's a good thing.

33.description: I have to say: This place is a must visit... "if you want to get an infection" You pick the body part. skin, eyes, fungal, genital, EVEN a mental one" So dirty, so ghetto, so incredibly mismanaged!

43.description: Horrible customer service, the worse example i've ever seen and the corporate office isn't any better. Call and complain about anything and you will think that whole "the customer is alright" thing has never been mentioned at Xsport before. Seriously they need to step it up because no matter how late the gym is open people don't want to put up with being treated like Xsport is heaven on earth in the form of a gym. Save your money...it's summer, go for a jog or check out another gym.

2.description: I know it's a poor review, but I do have a high standard for Xsport gyms.Pros: i like that its a whole other level for all strength training versus cardio. At first I wasn't sure if I was okay with it, but I guess it makes sense. On another hand, it kind of separates men and women... (not to be gender specific!) but there is a tendency for more men using the weighted machines upstairs, and women using the cardio ellipticals, treadmills, etc down below. but the number of weights and weighted machines are pretty impressive for someone interested in strength training/lifting. It is a full size-gym, so it also offers the basketball court and pool.Cons: the ellipticals and treadmills don't even have a TV at ALL!!! i like running to the music stations, so this is a huge setback for me. They also have NO TOWELS at all. so much for planning on showering here after my workout... or even just a hand towel for sweat . boooooo. the vibe isn't the friendliest here either. it seems pretty busy here. not the cleanest. just focus on doing your biz, i guess.

18.description: I was a member 10 years ago and left.  Signed back up two weeks ago and got a trainer.  The facility is good and can get crowded at times.  But the trainer I have, Alfredo, is great!  Dude is kicking my butt and doesn't let me slack off on workouts or my diet.  I give the gym 4 stars.  I give the trainer 5 stars.

41.description: Sadly, I need to take a star away.  Still no towel service.  Still not crowded on weekday mornings but someone managed to steal from me twice (including my dress while I was in the shower).I'm also very disappointed with their personal training program.  I bought a ton of sessions prior to my wedding.Trainer #1: Double booked me for our 1st session.  Then, no showed for my second.  I ditched him.Trainer #2: On the day of our 1st session, he leaves me a v.m. that he has been transferred to another gym.  Did he offer to move me to someone else?  Did he call earlier than 4 hours before our appointment?  The answers are No.Trainer #3: We worked out for close to 5 weeks.  I'm feeling good and in shape.  Suddenly, I get a phone call the day before our next session that he is leaving the company.    Since it was less then a month to my wedding, I was NOT pleased.

4.description: I a little while ago but I quit when I went to the pool and men were pissing in it and laughing about it . This was so nasty.A place used to be clean but now it is not.
