I feel like cold, fluand other scary  viruses would crawl all over my body if I touched a machine. I wish they were cleaner but they're not.I will never go back!

6.description: They dont provide towels. My first time to the gym and stepped out. Didnt bring my towel so i cant work out because i dont have anything to wipe my sweat specially after using equipment.

22.description: Once again great customer service from this place. I was screamed at from across the front counter area because I was putting my bottle if juice in the wrong refrigerator. Ron was yelling on the top of his lungs, Sir that's the wrong one, Sir your putting that bottle in the wrong refrigerator. I was in absolutely shocked that a employee would be treating a customer like this and trying to embarrass me.There is seriously something wrong with this location and I think it all starts with Management.

15.description: I dislike the fact that I have to clean my own tanning bed before I use it. Whoever cleans it clearly doesn't know that you're supposed to wipe the top handle as well as the buttons. Most of the staff is friendly and I enjoy coming here to workout. It's crazy 5pm-9pm Monday thru Friday.

20.description: Yep...this place is still garbage.  Old machines and equipment, it's always WAY, WAY too hot, most of the patrons don't seem to actually be doing anything involving physical activity - unless texting on your phone or ogling female customers counts.  I can't stand how the staff does nothing to stop the blatant staring that happens - especially during group exercise classes.  It's disgusting! Creeps will stand outside the classroom and just watch - and don't even get me started on all the dudes who hang around the balcony of the basketball court and get a free show during Zumba.  So sick.  I did get in contact with corporate and they didn't respond to my complaints.  Shocking.  The staff seemed to get better for a little while, but now it's back to the same BS of being ignored when you walk up to the front desk.  The trainers have also gotten pretty pesky and keep coming up to me while I'm working out on my own and trying to give me a sales pitch.  For the millionth time, NO!  I hope this isn't suddenly being encouraged by XSport cuz it's real annoying!  I try to avoid this location at all costs, but sadly it's the closest location to my house until the Norridge location opens.  If that location is a bust - then I'm switching gyms.  I'd rather pay more to save myself the aggravation of this place.  Booo.

36.description: I have to admit I was nervous to join this gym after all the negative reviews but the man and I decided we needed to sign up somewhere to prevent us from sitting on the couch all weekend watching Sopranos reruns! So after reviewing what was close to us, we settled on Xsport. I have been a member before I do remember that it can get very crowded and irritating but I was never a member of this location. I have to say the whole sign up process was easy and Jonathon was very helpful. I did not have to pay an enrollment fee as I was a returning member and my boyfriend was able to get his slashed in half. The gym itself is pretty large and has all the things you could need. A large area with cardio machines, a total man cave of free weights and machines upstairs, an area just for women (yay), a climbing wall, aerobics room, pool and hot tub. I was excited to see that they still have stair climbers (yeah I am old school). I thought the locker rooms were clean and didn't have that scuzzy feel. The pool was empty and the hot tub while very chlorinated was perfect temp for post workout muscle relaxation. Overall, it's a gym and it's less than $50 a month so what do you want? The parking here was much easier than the rumored nightmare at the Logan Square location. A lady I was talking to in the locker room confirmed all the other posts about theft being a problem so make sure you have a lock or just don't bring your valuables in. Oh, and they have child care for those who need it. One negative thing, the music it really loud and you feel like you are at a Euro Rave, bring headphones!

14.description: Yep...this place is still garbage.  Old machines and equipment, it's always WAY, WAY too hot, most of the patrons don't seem to actually be doing anything involving physical activity - unless texting on your phone or ogling female customers counts.  I can't stand how the staff does nothing to stop the blatant staring that happens - especially during group exercise classes.  It's disgusting! Creeps will stand outside the classroom and just watch - and don't even get me started on all the dudes who hang around the balcony of the basketball court and get a free show during Zumba.  So sick.  I did get in contact with corporate and they didn't respond to my complaints.  Shocking.  The staff seemed to get better for a little while, but now it's back to the same BS of being ignored when you walk up to the front desk.  The trainers have also gotten pretty pesky and keep coming up to me while I'm working out on my own and trying to give me a sales pitch.  For the millionth time, NO!  I hope this isn't suddenly being encouraged by XSport cuz it's real annoying!  I try to avoid this location at all costs, but sadly it's the closest location to my house until the Norridge location opens.  If that location is a bust - then I'm switching gyms.  I'd rather pay more to save myself the aggravation of this place.  Booo.

28.description: service was ok.they dragged on my food, I dont mind waiting if the restaurant is busy but damn a whole 45 minutes for my dish...ordered the red snapper (huachinango) with garlic on top.. AWESOME!and the oyster sampler ...Dope!other than the food this spot is ok.

1.description: Went out for dinner with family and decided on Islas Marias. We got there at 630 Being Saturday they had a live band which was way to loud for the size of the place. You could not even talk to the waitress to order much less with the people your there with. Definitely not kid friendly. I left because my kid was crying that his early ears left.

39.description: I've been to this location twice before and have had an alright experience.  My father turned 60 today so we decided to take him here.  He's always wanted to check it out.Can someone please tell me why on a MONDAY night there is so much going on?  There are TVsBLARING throughout the restaurant.  We got there around 6 and there was a band tuning up.  We couldn't even hear ourselves THINK!This place is not good for families and not good if you actually care to hear what your company is saying.We asked for our bill and left.  BTW - They don't believe in coins.  If your bill is 2.37 - you're out .63not a big deal, but why don't they have COINS?  Weird.

9.description: Let me start by saying , Holy Cow 10 dollars for a small michelada? I asked for modelo especial and they added negra modelo. The waitress insisted it was not negra modelo, but it can tell the difference between dark and light. Food quality went down to a point that the prices don't do the justice. Here is my humble suggestion to the owner, hire better staff or train them with customer service skills and lower your prices. 80 dollars for two people for less than average food is ridiculous

29.description: Pescado/fish with French fries, garlic bread and rice. Seriously! Get it together who gives garlic bread in a Mexican seafood platter! You are business to make quality food. If you don't change your food/platters you will never have five stars. I will try to back for langostinos. It will be the last time I will give it a chance

23.description: I dont like giving negative reviews.Especially when the food is so good!!! I really liked their food.I had the Agua Chiles.LOVED IT!!! Complimentary Ceviche?!?!? DAMN!! HELL YEAH!!! Enjoyed their micheladas as well.Nothing bad to say about anything I ate or drank.I'll go back for that NO PROBLEM!! I want to give them 4 STARS!!! But I cant.Service totally sucked.There was one bartender and one waitress for the whole restaurant.They both took turns hostessing.NOT ONCE did my waitress come to my table to see if I needed anything.She was too busy.Literally too busy.When it came time to pay the bill I waited long enough and finally just had to get up and walk to the cash register because I didnt have all night.Im hoping this is not the norm there.They're very popular in the area among the hispanic people that live in the area.They're ALWAYS PACKED on weekends.They have their food down pretty packed.Im sorry I could'nt give them a better review.FOOD WAS GREAT!!

5.description: This is a to go spot if you're bringing a large group of friends. As soon as you enter you notice the large fish tank and the bright decor. You wait to be seated and for a busy Saturday night I was surprised that my husband and I didn't had to wait for long. The atmosphere is very alive, they have a lot of tv's, bright lights, huge wooden tables, really loud music and live mariachi. Friendly waitresses bring out a tray of fresh crisp tostadas, saltine crackers and a sample of ceviche, the ceviche was good. They also have a wide variety of exotic drinks and a good line of Mexican sodas. We order shrimp octopus cocktail, a seafood mix cocktail and a large plate of mussels in a special home made sauce and a plate of prawns in sauce.In my opinion the shrimp & seafood cocktails totally missed the flavor, it was salty and it tasted weird. I didn't liked it, to me they were awful the worst i've had. I'm shaking at the memory of it. Do not order this from the menu. But I do give two thumbs up for the delicious spicy mussels, the plate comes with caramelized onions and slices of fresh cucumbers and tomatoes. Also the praws were really tasty. These two dishes totally saved the night. Overall, I recommend this place for a party or large group night. It's not an quiet intimate place if that's your thought, and you will literally expect a fiesta. The food is a hit or miss :/ but the cocktails drinks are amazing. The crowd is loud and mostly everyone dress for a party lol It's a little over priced but bringing the right crown you will have a good time.

31.description: I went here today with my husband because we wanted some good Mexican seafood and I really thought this would do it for us! I was wrong, sad to say this! The whole time we ate we were cold. The serve was not personally at all not even one smile from her. I'm not trying to be a pain, but when a serve is nice and smiles she makes it more personally and enjoyable. The food was average, not worth 50 dollars. The shrimp cocktail was so water down and they were cheap with the avocado. Like for real shrimp cocktail isn't the same without avocado. I'm Mexican and I know that's not how shrimp cocktail is suppose to taste! The other food was not great either. We will not be going to this one again!P.s I'm sure they don't care about this review either!

25.description: I have given this place 3 chances now because I really want to like them, but it's just not happening. So it was date night for the bf and I, and I was in the mood for a good old fashioned shrimp coctail. We decided to come here because we had heard from several family members, who frequently come here, that their food was awesome. I ended up getting the shrimp coctail that night and my bf got some steak dinner. Well, my shrimp coctail was gross! While it was pretty big for their smallest size, and it contained a lot of shrimp, it was practically cold tap water with bit of ketchup and a few tiny pieces of avocado in it, ewwww. It had no taste, despite my efforts to revive it with a lot of hot sauce and ketchup, and was just overall nasty. My bf said his streak was a little dry and lacked flavor also, and this must have meant it was,really bad because he's not really picky when it comes to steak. When my bf mentioned our bad experience with his mom, who loves the place, she suggested we give it another try because she said the shrimp coctail was a relatively simple dish to make, so they probably dont put as much effort into it as they do the other dishes, and that my bf's steak wasn't as good because the place is really seafood oriented. It sounded reasonable, so we gave it another chance a few weeks later. They failed again! This time my bf and I both ordered the shrimp a la diabla dinner. Again, while there was a lot of shrimp in the dish, it lacked flavor. The sauce seemed like some generic bottled crap and only had a slight kick to it. After these 2 crappy dinners, my bf and I have vowed never to eat here again....well except for their ceviche, which leads us to our most recent visit hehe. The shrimp and fish ceviche is about the only good thing they've got going for them. I was in the mood for some today,so I decided to call in and order some for pick up...last time I do that! When person picked up it was soooo loud in the background that I think he said hello twice before I actually heard him. It took about three minutes and a lot of patience from my part to order a simple freakin ceviche because neither of us could hear eachother. So I get to the place and I was waiting for my ceviche for 20 minutes, being told it would be right out, before they noticed it was right in front of them the whole time we had been there, among other food designated for delivery!!! WTH! This place is sooo bad. But I'm hooked on their ceviche now, so I guess i'll put up with it *sigh I wish it was better.

12.description: Absolutely awful! Worst coctel de camaron ever. Will never ever buy from this place again. Would not give it any stars .

37.description: I like the free salsa they give you before your meal but i'm not a fan of the complimentary ceviche (it's extra dry which is odd).Their were some Latin band dudes practicing so I imagine that a performance was about to go down or they rent their hallway to bands (which would be odd).Some of the seafood items are pretty good but this time around I wanted something small and tried out the shrimp empanadas....they were gross.Plenty of space so take your whole clan here and stretch out.

21.description: Last time there was not as pleasant as my previous visits.  Hopefully it was a mistep in their service and not the norm now.

16.description: HORRIBLE SERVICE! I will NEVER go here again. Our waitress forgot our order had to come back and ask us again! The place looks big but they have the tables so close to each other that you have no room at all! My food was also gross, my shrimp were overcooked and dry. NEVER AGAIN!!!

17.description: Awful service, after waiting for 15 min still no waitress to take order.  My friends and I just walked out.. Please close.  Never going there again.

10.description: My first time actually dining in at the restaurant was on Saturday.  I've ordered from here before and I've had their paella.The place is very wide open not much privacy between tables but it's not too bad.  The atmosphere was very busy that night and the music was a little loud and made it hard to hear the person next to me lol.  HOWEVER my large family was accommodated with to large tables and we all sat pretty comfortably. We were given an a few order of ceviche which I enjoyed tremendously seemed like it was fresh and didn't have that taste where it had been sitting out ( YUCK).  There was soo many of us I can't account for what everyone ate but I myself have had a Chicken and shrimp fajita (minus the tortillas... I know what your thinking whats fajitas with out tortillas but hey those are carbs I DO NOT NEED LOl ) I was presently surprised that they were really good.  Some places tend to burn everything when it comes to fajitas the chicken and shrimp were well seasoned and I enjoyed every bite. The food came out in spurts so not everyone was served at the same time but the delay wasn't too bad but might be something to work on since I personally feel that everyone at the table should get their food at the same time. ( hey that's just me ).  Waitress was pretty friendly and towards the end a mariachi came out and catered a few songs to our table which was nice.  Overall a nice experience !

11.description: I really don't get how this place only has 2 stars. I went here for lunch with some co-workers, and I was unsure what to expect with the rating it has. But I was pleasantly surprised. The food was good. Everyone liked their meal. The service started out a bit slow. We arrived and there was no hostess, or any clear indication if we should seat ourselves, so we just grabbed a table. After about 10 minutes waiting somebody finally came out with waters and menus and from there it was smooth sailing. My only complaint might be that they fired up the high powered sound system to turn on the tv news. The service may be too slow if they're really busy at night, but for lunch we were all pleased, and will definitely be back.

26.description: Service is good but What I had to eat wasn't. Shrimp cocktail had to many onions and the shrimp tasted old or like it has been in the freezer to long. The empanadas de camarón, were drenched in oil and not that great.  Overall the drink I had was great! That's all.

27.description: When we get there the hostess lets us know that they stop serving at 9 (that was what our greeting consisted of). OK, it's 8 so what's the problem? No, I didn't actually say that because my temper would have gotten the best of me. I just turned to my husband and counted to 10. As my husband and I debate going somewhere else, she beckons us to a table. OK, I tell myself, let me just start over and enjoy my night out after an excruciating day at work. Loved the ceviche we received upon seating. I should have ordered that as my meal. But did I go with my gut? Nope. I just had to have a coctel de camaron. Disappointing. I was shocked. How could you make such delicious ceviche and then make such bland and watery coctel de camaron? My margarita was OK. Nothing spectacular. The place was ice cold. And I had a sweater on. Seriously? I'm surprised I didn't catch a cold. And to top it off the waitress was apparently in a hurry to get us out because she brought the check before we had finished eating and when I told her we hadn't asked for it she said that they were setting up the dance floor for the "baile". She didn't go as far as saying that we were in the way but since they were moving some of the empty tables to the left and right of us I believe that it would be safe to assume that we were, in fact, in the way. She did say we were welcome to stay but we would have to pay the fee. Yeah, no thanks. Never again will I throw my money away at this establishment. No matter how delicious that ceviche was!!

35.description: Found a fly in my piña colada, food wasn't that great , we went as a group and the bill was really high so we went piece by piece and they charged $50 extra despite the fact that we gave a $40 tip we were getting robbed and the waiter wasnt there , bad service , and scammers ..will never come back Don't recommend at allthe food and sauce was spicy but with no flavor

8.description: The food was great but the service is terrible the girls working there are always so grumpy and look so confused like they have no idea what they're doing.

0.description: This place is ok! I ordered ceviche as an appetizer but sent it back because the shrimp was dark in color and super fishy n taste. However, the fajitas mixtas look great! Server was very nice about my complaint with the ceviche and had no problem taking it away.

38.description: I've been going to da Islas for many years now.  But by far this is da biggest and fanciest location that they have or that I have ever eaten in.  If u love seafood this is da place to go...avoid Sundays because its always packed and there is usually a long line and you will wait.  They usually have a live Mariachi band playing from table to table but they're expensive...about $20 per song...Yikes!!!  Oh, and dont 4get to try a Michelada...U will thank me!!!!!!!

20.description: Dreadful service.... But they make up for it with sub-par quality on their food (insert sarcasm). To say our waitress was aloof would be generous. After she brought our drinks, we waited almost 10 minutes and then STILL had to flag her down to take our order. We ordered the shrimp ceviche appetizer, steak fajitas, grilles camerones in a sweet spicy sauce, and an extra order of rice.... Ohhh we also ordered glasses of ice since she only brought us cans of sodas for our drinks. Well after 10 minutes of waiting I finally sent my son to the counter where she seemed to be washing dishes to ask her for the glasses of ice. My son was standing literally 2 feet away from her and I could see him mouthing the words "excuse me, excuse me" at least six times and she's just ignored him.... Then from across the restaurant a more senior waitress yelled to her and finally got her attention. We are now 20+ minutes into our visit and my wife can finally take a sip from her soda. Food comes out 15-20 min later.... Ummm care to guess what shrimp tastes like when you grill it for 15+ minutes? I may as well have been chewing on a piece of plastic draped in hot sauce. Ohhh and I forgot to mention that she brought out the wrong type of ceviche. When she finally brought out the correct type of ceviche it looked like there were some spoiled ingredients. I'll confirm after my stomach stops doing turning cartwheels. We will not be back. I wouldn't be surprised to see this place on an episode of Mystery Diners.

19.description: 1 star is too generous. The service is awful.  I don't want to get on a rant but...The staff looks like they hate their job and they hate you too.  You will stand at the "Please Wait to Be Seated Sign" for 15 mins before a server, who noticed you standing there 12 mins ago, finally puts down her cell phone to seat you.  It feels like none of them want the responsibility of greeting the customers, smiling, or doing their job.If I want someone to serve me Mexican food with a frown on their face, I will save the cash and go to my aunt's house.You sit and it takes 10 mins for a drink order.  Finally they take your order and it looks like they are not even paying attention.  It takes forever to get a refill or another beer.  You want your check?  Good luck with that. Now lets talk about the environment.  Its loud.  Its loud when there are 3 guests. Its loud when there are 100 guests.  The TVs are on sports channels or the jukebox plays loud banda hits from the 1990s.   You got kids running around and up and down the aisles bumping into your table while their parents hardly notice their kids left the table.Look, I love little Mexican children, but parents, SIT YOUR DAMN KIDS DOWN.  Its a restaurant; this ain't Chuck E' Cheese.  Thank you.   The food?  Not great either.  I went with the fish tacos and it was deep fried filets hidden in dry lettuce. The tacos had no flavor.  Bland.  You could have given me a tater tot taco and I wouldn't know the difference.This restaurant has five or six locations in the city and I don't get it.  If you want seafood, authentic Mexican style seafood, go to El Barco on Ashland.  Heck, there is a Long John Silver's in the parking lot.  Go there.

33.description: When I used to live in this neighborhood I would visit this place quite a bit. It seemed to have everything going for it. Then something happened. What I don't know. Maybe because I wasn't there to let me them know they were going down hill. Wishful thinking right? Now I'm not just talking about small changes. I mean big changes. Read more for the detailsThere ceviche stayed the same. A definite big 5 stars and the best thing about the restaurant. Probably some of the best in town.Now for the troubling issues. Service went from great to decent; Margaritas went from great to horrible, all flavoring and no tequila. Definitely do not get on those "bad boys!" The food blah, from tasty to "it looks like the chef/cook just gave up." I had the Camerones a la diabla and it basically consisted of a ketchup like sauce with a bit of kick to it. I've definitely had better elsewhere. This place has no redemption in my mind. I wouldn't waste my money by given it a second chance. Stick with the ceviche and a bottle of beer, then get the heck out of there.

2.description: This has got to be the worst place for caldo de camaron.. Disgusted! This was supposed to be just a shrimp soup as I was digging in ran into a crab leg and a tiny piece of squid .. Now to some that may be harmless but to me I only eat shrimp and fish so I was instantly disgusted .. I got past that and began to eat it anyway the flavor (well) there was no flavor .. Sorry but you guys should really do better for the prices you charge.

34.description: Delicious...enough said. Live mexican music on the weekends.

32.description: Why did I come back? Did I not learn my lesson last time I was here? Guess not.Called in my order for carry out.. Hadn't been here in a while and the place looks like a dump. Problem 1. One of the cushions on the chair near the entrance had a huge tear. Also tears in the curtains. Not very neat either.Problem 2. Messed up order. I ordered a filete al ojo and got octopus instead. Didn't realize it until I got home. Problem 3. Worst coctel de ceviche I've ever had. Won't event attempt to describe how awful it was. I was so embarrassed when I shared with my in-laws. I should have thrown it away.

18.description: Last time there was not as pleasant as my previous visits.  Hopefully it was a mistep in their service and not the norm now.

13.description: Worst service ever! I wouldn't even give it a star.The food is not great, the only good thing is the Ceviche. But that doesn't make up for the bad customer service this place has, it's horrible. Do these waiters & waitresses know they work for tips? They never check if you need anything and you call them over to get a refill of your drink they take more than 10-15 minutes are you serious? For a simple coke. It's always like this, I guess the owner doesn't care to keep his cliental happy.AVOID this place if you hate bad service because it's what they are best at.

4.description: This place is going downhill, they're so cheap now, they no longer serve you fries and bread with your entree, you need to pay extra for that, ridiculous, never going back...

24.description: 1 star is too generous. The service is awful.  I don't want to get on a rant but...The staff looks like they hate their job and they hate you too.  You will stand at the "Please Wait to Be Seated Sign" for 15 mins before a server, who noticed you standing there 12 mins ago, finally puts down her cell phone to seat you.  It feels like none of them want the responsibility of greeting the customers, smiling, or doing their job.If I want someone to serve me Mexican food with a frown on their face, I will save the cash and go to my aunt's house.You sit and it takes 10 mins for a drink order.  Finally they take your order and it looks like they are not even paying attention.  It takes forever to get a refill or another beer.  You want your check?  Good luck with that. Now lets talk about the environment.  Its loud.  Its loud when there are 3 guests. Its loud when there are 100 guests.  The TVs are on sports channels or the jukebox plays loud banda hits from the 1990s.   You got kids running around and up and down the aisles bumping into your table while their parents hardly notice their kids left the table.Look, I love little Mexican children, but parents, SIT YOUR DAMN KIDS DOWN.  Its a restaurant; this ain't Chuck E' Cheese.  Thank you.   The food?  Not great either.  I went with the fish tacos and it was deep fried filets hidden in dry lettuce. The tacos had no flavor.  Bland.  You could have given me a tater tot taco and I wouldn't know the difference.This restaurant has five or six locations in the city and I don't get it.  If you want seafood, authentic Mexican style seafood, go to El Barco on Ashland.  Heck, there is a Long John Silver's in the parking lot.  Go there.

6.description: Waitress was pretty friendly They had two  mariachis at one time so it was kind of loud.It seemed like there was a shift change because all of the sudden there was no staff one moment then poof tons!Bathrooms need to be better and maybe new chairs for the tablesThe food was great and basically worth the wait.

22.description: Use to  come here all the time.. now i pass by it and wonders what happened to that yummy sea food.. MY favorite food is sea food .. I LOVE  it! but on my last recent visits the price went up and i didnt mind too much .. but it went up like 3 more $$ and the service just gets worst! They waiters will be happy to take your order but never return after you get your food, we have to turn our head IN 360  to even get a glimpse of one. and when i do find out to complain about my food, she denied to help me but instead offer to go give my complaint to my actual waitres.. woah.. the lady who sat us down.. more like 15 yr old. was on her damn cell phone texting the whole time.. never got the check. had to getc up and get it my self!!... dont come here... dont want to come here.. dont need to watse my money! El Veneno is my place now! and do they rock! Food is amazing .. always TOO pack but ALways worth the wait ..

15.description: I wouldn't recommend this restaurant, I called in an order the hostess said it would be ready in 25 minutes. When I got there the order was not ready for they did not start on it yet and said the fish needed another 30 minutes to defrost and another 30 minutes to prepare.  She said she will try and get the order done faster by pouring hot water over the red snapper, I don't think that's good for defrosting fish. This restaurant is incapable of getting the order prepared on time and calling you back to let you know of a delay.

7.description: The food very good me and my husband love getting the langostinos the waitress are friendly but they always seem to forget something ....  Other than that I love their food ..

36.description: I need to re-review Las Islas Marias after my last experience. Overall: Terrible service, quite rude, and food was below par.Las Islas Marias is a favorite place for many people for many reasons - good portions, decent price, fun atmosphere, and quick service... all with mariachi music walking around the place.  HOWEVER, I had an awful experience due to a very angry waitress.Just to order our food, we had to try to spot her and flag her down (we were sitting for at least 15 minutes). She quickly took our order.... came back with the drinks we ordered about 10 minutes later - they were not event that busy at this time of the day. The food was decent, but not as stellar as it was in the past.  The fried fish dinner was tasty... I'd say between 3-4 stars.  The mixta ceviche is wonderful because even the "small" is GI-NORMOUS! 4-stars.But the server failed to give us any attention whatsoever. When we were done eating, we had to get the hostess to literally search and find our waitress because we were looking for her for a LONG time.  By the time she came, she was quite rude and abrupt.  I can say that I most likely will not be coming back here .

30.description: Went here due to location and had a large party so we needed a large restaurant.  Surprisingly I was very dissapointed.  I had order a large combo platter which was approximately around fifty seven dollars.  I did know scallops came in such a small size and the plate was mainly tiny scallops and tiny shrimp.  I will give this place a long rest before revisiting.

3.description: Awful food awful serviceClose down please

14.description: Here Right Now, the food was good. The service isn't! It is packed and loud. It was a 25 minute wait for 2, so we sat in the bar area. We never got water refilled. Had to ask for it. We were almost done with our meals by the time she came back with water. I started to ask if we could get a box but she dropped our water off then walked away. So here we are waiting again.... Still need water and a box to go... Oh. And when we never got menus when we sat at the high top tables near the bar. Oh and they don't take your used plates, like the appetizer plates. I'm posting a pic of how things are piled up..

3.description: Sorry guys...I know yelpers don't lie, just like Shakira's hips, but I have to disagree with the fellow yelpers about this place.  As soon as I went in, I smelled cigarette smoke.  I grew up in a smoker household and never really liked it much, so it turned me off immediately.  Well, my hubby concurred.  Why didn't we just leave?  Well, outdoor seating was available and it was a gorgeous day.  I decided to patronize them and ordered the iced cappuccino, hot espresso, and a bottle of San Pellegrinno.  At least the guy who made the drinks put out down the cigarette while he was making the drinks.  Thank you for that.  The coffee, actually, tasted great.  Hubby said the espresso was authentic (he's a true Italian entrapped with an American citizenship).  To be honest, the entire experience was decent except the cigarette smoke.  I know my sensory system deviates my star rendering, but I just couldn't take it.  By the way, they don't take credit cards; it's cash only.  There's a Walgreens diagonally across the road if you need an ATM (courtesy of the Chase Bank).  The total bill came under $7, so it's much cheaper than Starbucks.  If you don't mind about people smoking, it would actually be a place for you.

1.description: Great place! Very cozy on a cold day, and Maria the barista is awesome! She really makes you feel welcome and is always in a good mood. Definitely a place I will be visiting often!

2.description: God awful. They made me a cup of INSTANT coffee..yes the powdered stuff. The place reeked of cigarette smoke and didn't appear very clean. Never again. I

5.description: One of the better cappuccinos in the neighborhood, and the people are okay too

0.description: WOW! Thanks for helping me find this place Yelp!I was picking up a friend at O'Hare airport, and looking for late-night espresso (10:30/11pm)...I'm SOOO happy I found this place. I walked in and found two lemon trees, IN CHICAGO, IN MARCH! They put them inside for the winter. Very nice lady put down her cigarette a moment to make me a great espresso. In back a group of 8-10 men argued loudly over a card game. Two little old men were prone, laying flat in lazy boy chairs and covered in blankets as they snoozed with newspapers on their laps. The front is a cafe, the back space seems like an Italian club house, felt like I was in Sicily or Italy. Great decor, very warm and welcoming.So wild that I found this place. They also have a giant cooler of fun & rare Italian sodas, including bitter ones.

4.description: The outside of this place didn't look too inviting with the closed blinds on the windows and with the group of older guys sitting together outside.  But my observations couldn't have been further from the truth.The inside looked small and ordinary, with the plain undecorated walls and with a few high-up chairs and tables.  There were around 5 European sounding patrons inside watching the world cup game.  The service was very good.  The lady, with the black hair, was so nice and was pleasantly chatty with all the customers.   I got a nice sized cappuccino ($2.50) with all the fixings and it was delicious.  In the back, there was a big backroom area for parties, which had some people watching the Spain/Portugal world cup game.  I really felt comfortable being there, as I felt at ease engaging conversations with other customers about the soccer teams and what not.  Had a family business feel to it.  I think there used to be a paint store or a karate gym here before this place.

0.description: More tavern then bar,not always the cleanest....dirty mopwater is left near customer seating but it's a place where almost everybody knows your name and regular patrons don't mind the lack of amenities.

Where do thrift store rejects go to die?A.J WrightIf you think this place might be like discount-esque Marshalls, you will be surprised and not in a good way.  Everything should be $1 but it's not and that's a shame.

12.description: This restaurant has only been opened a few weeks. Everything looked new. The menus had that new plastic smell! Many, many HD TV's! We ordered the boneless wings and they were terrible! Too small & way too much breading. You would think that a restaurant with Wings in the name would get wings done right! The nachos were OK. Might give it one more shot.

3.description: This is my second time at this BWW location. The first time I came the service was a bit slow, but HELLO they just opened and they are trying to get their shit together like any other restaurant just opening. I still tipped my server over 20% because he did his best and I seen he was busy. I wish people would stop being assholes. We also ordered appetizers that thankfully didn't come out 2 minutes after we ordered them otherwise my family would've been sick. (Idiot who left a review below me). Second time I came my daughter and I wanted a quick bite to eat. The service was absolutely amazing. Our server was very friendly, she let me sample the new goose island beer, and was super nice to my daughter. I will come back often! We love this place. Keep up the good work guys and continue on working with a positive attitude because it shows. Our server's name was Micky by the way. Go show her some love.

1.description: Why 3? So at the first the service is so slow and unfriendly. We wait for our server 15 minutes. Everything is so slow. My cherry mojito test not good,it's taste like a regular cherry juice. My first and the last time to visit this place on this location.

2.description: I went to eat with my family to this new restaurant and I couldn't believe how bad the service was....let me tell you something when you order appetizers you expect them to get there two minutes after the food we ordered. ........and when our meal got to the table two out of the five meals were wrong so me and my two daughters ate while my wife and son watched then we waited twenty more minutes to get our pops refilled. ..I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone or will ever go back. ........

9.description: came here on valentines day , and the interior is so clean and nice. It was busy for lunch, my food came last compared to my friends, but the waitress was attentive and made sure we were satisfied with our lunch. The food was great ! I have been craving mango habanero wings since that day!

10.description: Would rather drive to Skokie. Place is very unorganized . You really don't get the vibe of welcome faces, more of the ugh faces. Eh rather stay in Skokie for bdubs.

4.description: Well we 1st tried order to go and I have to say it didn't taste  like The wings I usually order at  a different location it was way too cold and a little hard as if it was cooked while ago then we gave it another try but this time lets fine in very good literally just left my boyfriend and I wanted to try the new bdubs by brickyard we waited on the table for about 20 mins without being greeted at all we watched couple ladies just sat and greeted within a min but no one had said anything to us very disappointed we felt like we were invisible we seen few servers and couple actually looked at me not good at all but hey at least we have the place a try . (Bdubs lovers)

6.description: Really!? Brand new location...waited 20 minutes, was not acknowledged once, gave up and walked out.

0.description: I knew it was good to be true. I would rather drive to Skokie BWW than to this one. I asked for my traditional wings and bring different order. She takes it back and once again bring wrong order, same order she had brought in the first place. Then waited 30 min for my order. Waitress barely came around. And had to wait 10 min for package mayo and mustard because Waitress said they had to bring it from the back.Manager came to my table and apologize. Left my order for free. I will take in consideration of coming back. Manager explain it was their opening night and mistake like this shouldn't happen. Will give it another chance.

5.description: Everything is new and looks very nice. Food is as expected from BW3. The tablets for the games are all new and work very well. They're training staff right now so they're learning but they were all very nice. Will be back!

13.description: I wanted to try this place cause it's by my house and it was new. We went on a Wednesday night and it wasn't that busy. They had a lot of staff working that night. We ordered a mango/strawberry margarita on the rocks and they look like 20 mins and they came back frozen . So we complained and one of the managers made it seem that if he made it it wound taste good so we kept the frozen. Then ordered street tacos, wings and fries. (More expensive then the Skokie location by the way) the food came back cold and the "cheese fries" didn't look appealing at all cause they just put shredded cheese on top. I never got my appetizer until after I finished my cold food. It took forever. Service is horrible. Most of their employees don't have any Resturant experience for the most part. We complained until the second manager came and took the whole bill. Cause the first one just took a few dollars off. Overall not happy with this place. I rather drive to Skokie.

11.description: Terrible service. We went to get seated and we're waiting over 30 minutes. They couldn't figure out how to sit five people at a table for six. Too slow service. Left and went to Wingstop. Better service and no wait.

8.description: I understand they are new but they really need to get their sh*t together. Sat for 20 min before someone even asked what we wanted to drink. I'll be back in a few months when they know what their doing........

14.description: Went with my fiancée earlier today to this location. I will never return. I'd rather go out to the Skokie location. First off, the person who sat us didn't have a clue about the seating areas. We were hesitant to follow her. When we did sit, we waited a good ten minutes and no one had greeted us or taken a drink order; nothing. We watched as another table got greeted and taken care of right away. So I go up to the front which by the way had three "managers" or whatever the employees in the white jerseys are, just standing there not doing anything.  I enquire as to the whereabouts of a sever and then a white-jersey chimes in to help. She says she'll help us out while she took our drink orders. The server arrives finally only to ask for our drink order again... Already did that... And we order food. When the food arrives it's not what I expected. The server didn't even ask which Bayou Poboy I wanted. Shrimp is the first option so I assumed that's what I'd be receiving. But she didn't even make sure which one I wanted. So I asked the manager about the shrimp and she said our server should have asked us. There's just a major lack of communication and professionalism at this place. I definitely would NOT recommend it.

7.description: They're brand new people give them some slack! Our server was nice and attentive, the captain or whatever they're called was attentive and even the manager was going around making sure everyone was good. Good food as usual. No complaints here.

3.description: Had A Wonderful Time Celebrating My Son's 12th Birthday Party At Tanellis.. Thank You Guys For A Wonderful Service! Food Was Very Delicious, Service Was Great! Most Definitely Will Come Again! Thanx..

1.description: Tanelli's has been a family favorite in my family for years but since they moved location, it's kind of hard to get to them now since they don't deliver by me anymore. After not having it for a year, I decided to make the trip down there and see if their taste remained the same as I remembered. The good news is that the pizza was still delicious but the only thing I was a little upset about was their fries. Their French fries were covered and drowned in a lot of oil! They were soggy and covered in grease. Pizza and service a 2 thumbs up, their fries, thumbs down. :(

2.description: I called to try this place out for the first time. Crappy experience even before I ordered. I called to see if they were taking orders to pick up 35 min before they closed and the guy that answered told me sorry but he locked everything up already. This is completely unacceptable as I called 35 min before they closed and was still willing to be there on time to pick up my order not to bother there delivery drivers. If they are "locking everything up" 35 min before there advertised closing time then they should change there false advertised closing time.

9.description: Decided to order mozzarella sticks and a pizza from Tanellis right down the street.  First they forgot the mozerella sticks. We start to eat, everything SEEMS ok! Picked a slice and what do we find??? A FLY!  The delivery guy comes back and tells us to call the owner. I call the restaurant and I'm told I'm speaking with a manager.  I tell her, hi I just ordered a pizza and found a fly between the pizza crust and the box. She right away snaps back YELLING that I can go and see how clean her kitchen is. That the fly didn't come from there. Not once did she let me speak, not once did she apologize and say I don't know how it could happen. The person I spoke to had the WORST customer service skills. I told her I couldn't believe how she handled this! I just wanted them to know what happened. Im never ordering from there again! Never ever ever!!!!

10.description: I like this place. Pizza has quality and price is reasonable.The atmosphere is nice, has sofa if you want to sit and chill with friends while waiting for pizza.

4.description: Simply put Pizza is amazing I am a pizza freak tried many pizzas nothing compares to them. The owner and family R awesome very nice people. I am a customer for life

6.description: This place has been around for a very long time in Chicago. This location has definitely had its ups and downs, but this recent trip I made out confirmed to me that this place is headed in the right direction. It is under new management and they are keeping with their tradition that has made them successful for decades. Pizza was on point and service was great. Give them a try, even if you've had a not so great experience in the past.

12.description: My favorite STUFFED pizza. For me nothing comes close. I like to be objective when it comes to food and try not to over hype anything. I'd also like to say that I gave it 5 bc I have been eating Tanelli's for close to 20 years when they were on Diversey, but the truth is, in my opinion, it's just a good pizza. What does it for me is the sauce. The sauce is has a hint of tang, perfect spice, acidity from the tomato, and the right amount of sodium. The cheese is good quality as well. Perfect combo. I'm not a huge crust enthusiast bc if the cheese and sauce are on point I can look past the crust. But in this case I can say I enjoy the crust as well. And what really did for me is the simple fact that I can't any pizza cold for whatever reason, but I can eat Tanelli's cold and still really enjoy it.

5.description: Maybe we caught them on a bad day, but the mostaccioli I ordered was soggy.  The pan-crust pizza was very salty, not sure if it was from the sauce or cheese.  The crust was very good.  My daughter liked the toasted ravioli - although the dipping sauce was cold.  Like I said, maybe just an off day, based on other reviews.  We will probably give them another chance in the future since they are in the neighborhood.

13.description: Where the short-lived Armani Cafe used to be.  Ordered a medium stuffed pizza, which is their specialty.  I sat on their leather sofa and watched Cops and King of the Hill while waiting as stuffed pizzas take 2-3 times longer than a thin crust.  The only employee there was really nice.  Now, I usually think that most pizzerias fail at attempting the stuffed pizza style as I've always put, with little or no pleasure, Giordano's as the best.  But I can say with great confidence that Tanelli's is right up there with the corporate chain.  Wasn't messy, balanced, as in not too much cheese, crust or sauce, and the sauce had a great garlic and oregano taste.

11.description: Meh...not bad.  There was nobody there when I arrived except for an old man sleeping on the leather couch near the cash register.I paid $16 for a large thin crust sausage and pepperoni.  This is a bit on the expensive side in some places, but pretty typical if you go into a place with true Chicago style pizza.Crust:  not a lot of flavor, a bit on the thicker side for a thin crust (B-)Sauce:  good flavor, not too sweet or too tart.  Could have had more sauce (B)Toppings:  good quality, again, could have a bit more and could have come closer to the edges (B-)Overall:  (B-). I would order here again only with a coupon, or on a day when they have a special.  Too many great pizza places around here to pay as much as I did for and average pizza.

8.description: Love the pizza here. I usually have it delivered, hot, on time, and usually the nicest young lady delivering. I have come in several times as well. Nice set up with the couch and tv. Like being in your family room. I ask for it Chicago style, extra thin, cheese, sausage. Keep it thin and toasted and we are good.

0.description: My Husband and I decided to stay in last night and he really wanted a deep dish. Ginos and Giodornao's both cut off their delivery area a block from my building. Well I don't need them anymore. We've found Tanellis ! After ordering, Someone called to tell me they were out of strawberry cheesecake. No big deal, it happens. Plain is also good. However, The only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 was because the plain cheesecake we received instead, tasted a lot like the freezer. That's my only negative. On to the good stuff!The driver was very nice, called to check my address and told me he was on his way, 25 minutes earlier than the time predicted. When he arrived, he had a 2 liter of soda for us as a first time customer. That was a nice touch. I got my food inside and noticed the management even wrote a cute little note on the pizza box thanking us for trying them! I've worked in the service industry for years, and I've written notes like that on boxes, but this was my first time receiving one! That is some A+ service! Our pizza was a stuffed pepperoni and sausage. It was one of the best I've had and by far the best I've had delivered. There was plenty of oregano in the sauce so it didn't just taste like warmed up crushed tomatoes like so many places. It was so hot and cheesy and was just fantastic! The beef had plenty of herbs and spices as well, and was delicious even cold. We will without a doubt be using Tinelli's from now on to satisfy that cheesy craving.

7.description: Under new owner! Tony is the best and his pizza is too! Best pizza and the best time! You will keep coming back for more! Great prices for the food.

58.description: So it was one of those nights where not long ago, I was trying to brainstorm something that was halfway inbetween where all of us were coming from, and would still be open late. Considering that in mind and that it was mid-evening, I realized this place would work, since it had later hours than a lot of places around, and that it wouldn't be too far a drive for any of us going. So Applebee's it was.Food was about what I expected for chain restaurant par, not gonna knock your socks off but just alright. I hate to say it, but the food wasn't quite as good as I was hoping it'd be. Thinking about all the things I ordered, I was hoping it'd be a slight bit better than it ended up being, and it reminded me(having only been to an Applebee's once before, believe it or not) how much I prefer similar sit down chains(i.e. Chili's, Bennigan's(too bad so, so few are left....), Ruby Tuesday) over Applebee's. OTOH though, the server we had was surprisingly good, and kept up with drink refills much better than I thought we would. Men's bathroom was surprisingly clean(too many chain restaurants have s***** bathrooms that aren't kept up, so I'll give credit where it's due here), bar patrons were pleasant and not annoying, no children I could hear were screaming anywhere in the restaurant, and the music wasn't annoying(they have a TouchTunes internet jukebox). Staff was also pleasant as well, but I can't get over the fact that while some of it was fine(i.e. strawberry tea my friend got), some of it seemed just average as well(i.e. fries, and the 3 cheese penne pasta I got). Overall the more I think about the food(edited on 1/29/14, due to the fact I was debating forever in my head if this is more 2 or 3 stars...), the more I realize to myself that it isn't quite 3 stars, but a hair short of that due to the food being not quite as good as I was hoping it'd be. Can't deny that they're other chain restaurants I just prefer, over Applebee's. The strawberry tea(think that's what it was my friend ordered?) wasn't bad, though. And of course, one of those times where I wish I could use a half star rating, since they were a strong 2.5 stars, that may as well be like 2.75.I wouldn't rush back here, but I'd be open to giving this location another shot. I like this location more than the one I went to in Hodgkins, a number of years back. After all, that Quesadilla Burger was calling my name(lol), and I know I would've gotten that if it wasn't for the fact it was not part of the 2 for $20 menu.

56.description: The food and service were fair - however, what's making me vacillate between 2 and 3 stars is the lack of tableware that appears to be clean. I don't want to see watermarks, smudges, or questionable anything on my tools for eating and drinking. Hubby said I was being a bit of a snob - because I even questioned the location of this Applebee's, (I didn't know that Applebee's even came into the city). However, the nail in the coffin as it were, was when I went to the rest room to see that the stall door lock was broken and hanging - indicating that someone wanted in to that particular stall very badly, (you'd think management would have taken care of that).The food was tasty, (I had the lemon parmesan shrimp - it was a bit greasy for being on their weight watchers listing), however, given the lack of care for the tableware, I wondered with each bite - is this ok to eat? Will I get sick?As for the service... I have never gone to a Hooters, I have seen the billboards and thus know that the waitress' dress rather provocatively; so I was surprised that our server was dressed like she worked for Hooters. She was pleasant, however, "Honey put some clothes on! Please!" But then again, perhaps this choice in attire is simply an indication of the area of this Applebee's.Doesn't sound like I'll be back - hence my rating of two stars - Call me a snob!

29.description: Our first and only visit took place on 2/12/15.  It was so bad that I still feel compelled to share it here.  The food took forever. Our server was not attentive to our table. The food finally came out cold. Then we noticed the grilled onions were not fully cooked. However the server was not around to tell.  Portion sizes on the room temp fries that came with the burgers were tiny. Then it took forever for a replacement entree to come. The amount of toppings on the new burger were inconsistent with what was on the original.  It took asking two servers to finally get a manager.The manager did admit that they were short two cooks. Had they said so at the start it would have changed our expectations and we would have been more understanding. Right when getting the food we noticed the cold fries and told the server. He did go get some baskets of fresh fries. It would have been nice, since they knew that service was suffering, if they had thrown a basket of fries on the table in the 30-45 minutes we sat there between our appetizer and entrees.  Doing so would have made me less hungry and more likely to overlook a smaller portion with the meal.  Less than a dollar worth of food would have gone a long way in improving the customer experience. Giving out a coupon or small gift card for the next visit would have been acceptable too. It has the added benefit of encouraging people to come back.As management in this industry, you rarely hear about the good experiences, but bad ones can cost you 50 customers due to poor reviews (online and word of mouth). It's well worth the effort and cost to do what is needed to keep people happy .I wish I had looked at the Yelp reviews before going.  They are poor going back for quite a while. The night of I had gone back and looked at the reviews on Facebook. This past spring & summer this location was getting mostly favorable reviews on that site. Since August they have mostly been negative. Was there a change in management or a large turnover of other staff?  Does Applebees even monitor the posts here?  Someone needs to get on top of their social media marketing tatics.

42.description: Let's just say I haven't been to Applebee's in years thought i'd give it anthor chance well boy was I wrong ! First got to love the loud odd music . Our server came  20 mins after we sat . She asked we ready to eat . I said well we would like a few drinks 15 mins later we got our drinks .  We then ordered our food which took another approximately 35 minutes the food came out I had ordered chicken and steak fajitas the pan was sizzling but when I touched my chicken it was pretty ice cold. Anyways the food was ok other then it was cold. Service was slow but what did I expect . Let's just say I'll never go back!

23.description: Worst service ever sit on a tabla waiter came give us the menu and leave 15 minutes pass and no sign  of here so I get to another waiter and ask if she can take my order she came and the take my order but previous waiter the worst Luciana the worst waiter ever and to end the drink that I order came with a dirty straw

47.description: I'll start by saying that the manager tried to help, but I realize he was unsuccessful once I got home). Here is the entire experience reviewed...My husband wanted a quick steak and we needed a kid friendly place AND we had a gift card to this restaurant, so we drove the 5 miles west. I'd never choose Applebee's unless we were stuck with the option, which we felt we were with the gift card. Anyway...1. Hostess=no personality. She'll hopefully improve with time. 2. Waitress=great for 90% of the time. 3. Ordered queso dip, quesadillas were brought out. Fixed, but took way too long. Queso yummy...chips not so much. 4. Waited far too long for our food - with two young children that is never fun. 5. My Thai Shrimp Salad came out without half of the ingredients, one of the being peanut sauce. The waitress went into the back to ask about it and she returned saying that the cooks said it only comes with a citrus line vinaigrette. And put a dressing down and I asked if it was peanut sauce. She said yes and left. I tasted if and it wasn't peanut sauce. It was more citrus line vinaigrette.6. My husband enjoyed the steak and his salad. 7. My daughter enjoyed her mac n cheese and applesauce. 8. After attempting to eat my flavorless salad, I grabbed a menu. This is what was missing from my salad: edamame, almonds, peanut sauce. Stated right there in the menu! I was annoyed with our waitress that she relied on the kitchen staff to tell her what was in the salad instead of looking it up on her own. Or just knowing the menu, like she should. 9. I showed the menu to our waitress and she grabbed her manager. I explained the issue and he had the kitchen make a salad to go and comped the salad for us. He showed us the salad before we left so I could approve it. I just wanted to leave, so I ok'd it. The edamame was now visible and he pointed at an area that he said was peanut sauce.10. When I got home and put the salad away, I tastes it and there was definitely no peanut sauce anywhere. What the manager thought was peanut sauce was a dark wonton that was draped over the corner of the lettuce, so it sort of looked like peanut sauce. There were also no almonds. Seriously - was the salad made wrong on purpose yet again?!? I knew I should have tasted it before I left. Because my husband and kids were satisfied and because the salad was comped and the manager did try to solve the problem, I'm not too mad. But I think other people should know what they're getting here. What I'm most annoyed about it that we have a little over $4 remaining on the gift card. I wish we would have gotten dessert so that we would have spent the entire amount. With that small amount left, I highly doubt we will use it anyway. If someone from the restaurant wants to reply and offer a gift card back to us, I'd consider trying one more time. But I would definitely be checking my meal over very carefully.

8.description: This has to be one of the most disgusting establishments I have ever been too! First off you walk into the restaurant and literally there is garbage everywhere the floors are filthy and covered in food the tables are dirty and sticky it's like they don't know what cleaning means, we were seated at a table that had gum all over it and dirty silverware napkins and other garbage under the table! We were disgusted and wanted to leave but we had a gift card so we figured let's just stick it out! Unfortunately that was a horrific decision! We ordered food and when we got it it looked semi-decent, however that was before the chunks of hair in my boyfriends pasta! He literally pulled the hair out of his mouth and there was additional hair in the food! So we called over the manager who was apologetic, and said he would be right out with the new one so we waited he got the new one took a bite and sure enough there was also hair in that one!!! Yes that's right two times there was hair and both meals! At this point we were so disgusted we left! If you want to eat in a garbage can and enjoy this place!

31.description: It was the night before my husbands birthday (last night) and we chose Applebee's to celebrate with a party of 7 adults, a 5 year old, and a baby. HORRIBLE. COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE. However, my husband's family are reserved people and I kept my mouth shut. First of all we waited to be seated about ten minutes (my brother in law was there before us but I'm unsure of how long). We were not greeted by the host at all as he just walked past us as we walked in. Fine. As we're waiting, a waitress is telling the manager about an altercation with a table saying how she doesn't care and it's not her fault and I quote "bye, Felicia." Ghetto. And this is in front of a group of employees AND the manager AND us. So we get seated as the manager nonchalantly goes to talk to the table. They were out of crayons which was disappointing for my daughter but she lived. We ordered our food at the same times as our drinks as we had plenty of time before we were attended to. Our waiters pen died and he got another one. So he brings out the drinks. He asked everyone what their drinks were. So he calls out Sierra Mist- nobody answers and he says Sprite and my sister in law raises her hand. My husband joked that there must be a switch on the cup to switch the two. I DEFENDED the waiter. This was until he brought out the next drink. He called out a strawberry lemonade and handed it to my brother in law's girlfriend. She told her boyfriend she ordered pomegranate so he tells the server. "Oh, that's what it is." She drank it but thought it tasted like strawberry.y motherinlaws coffee came at least 15 minutes late. She asked for 2% milk and he brought little creamers. My father in law told him they wanted milk and he said that is milk. No. It was cream. He brought out a cup to hold the cream. The kind that holds marinara sauce- awkward to pour from, no? It was so cold that most people had on coats and even a waitress mentioned how cold it was- that makes for an unpleasant experience in itself. so they bring the food. Well, most of it. The food was brought out by a good 5 different people- including the manager. My husband and brother in law both got the shrimp and steak. My brother in law's food had 2 little shrimps and my husband had 5. He asked for more shrimp as it was a SHRIMP AND STEAK. This meal comes with steamed vegetables. The carrots and broccoli were crunchy. They were just warmed up. My husband did not eat his steak. He has NEVER done that.. Even if the food is just ok, he'll still eat it. My father in law called the waiter over to tell him that he has the wrong sandwich as he had a blt and asked for a club. First he said it was a club - as expected. Then he consults the menu after asking my father in law what the difference was. He laughed and told him he was right- it wasn't what he ordered. He was laughing and joking. He went to the kitchen and said we got someone else's food- which we believe was what happened with the altercation at the beginning. We all finished eating - without any refills mind you. All of our glasses were empty. we never received our mozzarella sticks (we ordered 2 and got 1).  After we were all finished eating, they finally brought my father in laws food, at which time he asked for a box. To our surprise, we were still charged for the sandwich. As we were leaving the manager was at the hostess desk. He did not even acknowledge our presence. It was a completely horrible experience.

34.description: It was ok but the mudslide tasted more like a milkshake. Little to none alcohol and the burger was well done when I wanted it medium.

16.description: Worst service ever sit on a tabla waiter came give us the menu and leave 15 minutes pass and no sign  of here so I get to another waiter and ask if she can take my order she came and the take my order but previous waiter the worst Luciana the worst waiter ever and to end the drink that I order came with a dirty straw

13.description: Holy Ghetto Applebee's. I was a little frightened coming into this Applebee's and for good reason. First, the host/hostess station has no order or understanding whatsoever. People who came in after us put their names in before us with a little movement towards the front. After getting our names in and seated, we were greeted not by a server, but by a sticky table with so much trash at our feet that we had to brush it aside with our shoe. Being here as a tourist and not knowing much in the way of places to eat and after a long, long car ride from Dallas, we wanted to  just eat and get to our hotel. What a bad start!!Our server came over after about 15 minutes and asked if we were ready to order. As we were placing our order (both drink and food at the same time....lord knows we had enough time to decide), our server was being called Nana by some young kids in the corner, not at a table. After interrupting us several times to answer her grandchild, (also a little shocking as our waitress was somewhere in her 30's) we got our order placed and waited. Our food comes not delivered by our waitress but another server who was very attentive and polite. The food came out being held on the side of the plate by pot holders we knew our food was delivered hot and fresh for us from the MICROWAVE!!! I could have swung by Aldi or Walmart and had better food microwaved in our hotel room. The food ironically was pretty decent. The bread on my pasta plate was hard as a rock though. A poor victim of the microwave!!  After we finished our food we had to ask our waitress probably 3-4 times for the check. Our check was delivered to us 10 minutes later with only the paper, not book or anything and was soaked with god only knows what. In a strange twist of events , our credit card was taken almost immediately and promptly returned. As we were filling out the receipt, the table behind my wife was being cleared off, shocker to see all the food, napkins, straw wrappers, etc.. Being nicely flung into the floor to add to the pile. We were pretty disgusted with this place and wanted to leave ASAP. Upon our drive to the hotel, we stop at a red light only to be attacked by some guy with a bottle of windex and a window cleaner. After nicely telling him we didn't want our windows cleaned he does it anyway, rumbling on about us paying him the next time around. To our shock, this was witnessed by an undercover cop car behind us who grabs the man and put him in hand cuffs and then comes to our window asking if we wanted our windows cleaned.  When we told him we didn't, he cheerfully tells us he is arresting the man and tells us we can go. Holy shit....I will stay away from this part of town. I need a GPS that has alternate route options around the hood. Avoid this Applebee's and it's surrounding areas like the plague. You'll be thankful.

11.description: Don't come on a Sunday afternoon. Drinks were wrong twice,  over an hour to get food we ordered. Oh and burgers were tiny!!!!!!!!

39.description: I usually come here with my boyfriend when we want some good ole americana....we usually order 2 for 20 deals..we start with the mild boneless buffalo wings..I order the Chicken breast with shrimp & red potatoes &  he gets steak with mash & veggies..good as a chain could be..come for their half price apps n drink specials during the week!

37.description: I usually don't write reviews on chains,but I really hate this Applebee's. The food is horrible & it all tastes like it's from the freezer. Complete waste of money.

0.description: 3.5 stars.Dined in solo while I was waiting for my car to get some maintenance.I ordered like a beast, since I was going to work overnight (7pm-7a).  Chicken tortilla soup: A salt stick. I got the salt burn off of these flavors. It was pretty hearty and pretty filling, but I wouldn't sign myself up for a second round. It was kind of like... "I'm eating this bowl and finishing it, only because I've already halfway invested in it." But the chicken was dry. The soup was very thick. It's a filler, but not super tasty or different, by any means, in my book.Green goddess wedge salad: Pleasant surprise! Green goddess tastes like thousand island dressing wanting to go green... pretty similar flavor profile, with more of a zing. Sweeter, maybe. But what caught me off guard is the candied bacon. Sweet and salty, with a little bit of a crisp. YUM! I'm not that big on bleu cheese, but it wasn't overpowering, and definitely helped blend all components together. That was a win.Shrimp scampi liguini: Flavorless linguini, and cooked all right. The shrimp was pretty good I guess... looked nearly translucent, had a slight fishy taste, which leaves me wondering whether that was a good or a bad thing. Is it fishier because it's going bad? cuz it wasn't cooked enough? I don't think I like questioning my food as I'm eating it. I know that sounds weird, but when you're eating to try and answer questions to life, that doesn't necessarily leave me with the itch to come back for more.Service: Weird. Food came out pretty quick, which was good. But I wish the waitress pointed out that there was a Monday special, which I SO would have jumped on! 6.99 for a burger and fries on monday? whaaaaa.....All food had come out while I was still working on my soup. She asked how everything was, but it was pretty evident that nothing aside from the soup had been touched. She never gave me a refil on my soda. And I would have ordered a small dessert (3.49 dessert shooters), but she dragged on coming back after I finished my food.It's a lot better since the applebees I last remembered! Almost too many options.. bar food, entrees, burgers, specials, pastas, wow. But I think it's becoming a strong competitor against Chili's, which has a flavor profile that's become boring to me.

38.description: I give this pile a no star review for the customer service alone ... I had a party of 10... So we were told a 30 min wait ok right i get it a party of 10... 45 min later i walk in to find out what is going on ... The hostess tells me that a group came in and took our seat ... So i said so this is my fault ? No response ... I ask t o talk to a manager and try to see what he is going to to to make up for our now very long wait ... He tells me to deal with it. .... If a place doesmt care about 10 people how much less do they care about 1... Stay far away it will be better for you.

51.description: So let me start off with I love Applebee's but this one was the worst! If you are thinking of coming to this one, please do everyone including yourself a favor and don't!!! They provided us dirty wrapped silverware. Dirty plates and the food was freezing cold. How can you mess up a rare stake and make it well done and yet it be cold. Our server we had Danielle was awful. She had no idea which way was up or down. This place was just awful so bad that even the seat in front of me and behind me are both complaining about how bad the service is. NEVER GO HERE....

27.description: Our waiter was very pleasant and welcoming, however, the service was extremely slow and most items were overpriced.

32.description: This place is terrible. Not that I'd expect amazing service from an Applebee's, but this establishment doesn't even give "alright" service. It SUCKS. Even though they have several tables available, it takes SO long for them to seat you. It takes FOREVER for a server to even ask what you want to drink, forget about how long it takes to actually order. Once you finally get your over-cooked meal, no one comes by to ask if you even want some ketchup to mask the terrible burnt food they just served. We were there almost 3 hours for what should have been a simple meal. Appetizers are painfully overpriced, as well as the entrees. So not worth it. Go next door for some Popeyes, they have better service.

54.description: The food was good... The service was a little better then good and the atmosphere was great... I would recommend....

48.description: Holy Ghetto Applebee's. I was a little frightened coming into this Applebee's and for good reason. First, the host/hostess station has no order or understanding whatsoever. People who came in after us put their names in before us with a little movement towards the front. After getting our names in and seated, we were greeted not by a server, but by a sticky table with so much trash at our feet that we had to brush it aside with our shoe. Being here as a tourist and not knowing much in the way of places to eat and after a long, long car ride from Dallas, we wanted to  just eat and get to our hotel. What a bad start!!Our server came over after about 15 minutes and asked if we were ready to order. As we were placing our order (both drink and food at the same time....lord knows we had enough time to decide), our server was being called Nana by some young kids in the corner, not at a table. After interrupting us several times to answer her grandchild, (also a little shocking as our waitress was somewhere in her 30's) we got our order placed and waited. Our food comes not delivered by our waitress but another server who was very attentive and polite. The food came out being held on the side of the plate by pot holders we knew our food was delivered hot and fresh for us from the MICROWAVE!!! I could have swung by Aldi or Walmart and had better food microwaved in our hotel room. The food ironically was pretty decent. The bread on my pasta plate was hard as a rock though. A poor victim of the microwave!!  After we finished our food we had to ask our waitress probably 3-4 times for the check. Our check was delivered to us 10 minutes later with only the paper, not book or anything and was soaked with god only knows what. In a strange twist of events , our credit card was taken almost immediately and promptly returned. As we were filling out the receipt, the table behind my wife was being cleared off, shocker to see all the food, napkins, straw wrappers, etc.. Being nicely flung into the floor to add to the pile. We were pretty disgusted with this place and wanted to leave ASAP. Upon our drive to the hotel, we stop at a red light only to be attacked by some guy with a bottle of windex and a window cleaner. After nicely telling him we didn't want our windows cleaned he does it anyway, rumbling on about us paying him the next time around. To our shock, this was witnessed by an undercover cop car behind us who grabs the man and put him in hand cuffs and then comes to our window asking if we wanted our windows cleaned.  When we told him we didn't, he cheerfully tells us he is arresting the man and tells us we can go. Holy shit....I will stay away from this part of town. I need a GPS that has alternate route options around the hood. Avoid this Applebee's and it's surrounding areas like the plague. You'll be thankful.

44.description: I left Applebee's on Grand feeling robbed.  I went there to try the unlimited ribs special. The "riblets" were these flat bones with tiny bits of meat on them.  They served a very small portion on the first plate and refills were ridiculously tiny.  You would have to get 10 refills to feel as if you have eaten!  You will never get full on them, unless you find bones delectable, because that's all you get.  To add insult to injury, they seemed to discourage refills!  With tax and a tip, the bill was $20.00.  It was like finding your wallet had been stolen.

24.description: Don't come on a Sunday afternoon. Drinks were wrong twice,  over an hour to get food we ordered. Oh and burgers were tiny!!!!!!!!

7.description: Menu keeps changing, some good, some bad. The service was good but the place has become a dump. The floor was filthy and there were tables full of dirty dishes. Trash throughout the floor. No one swept the floor until we pointed it out. Trim on the walls and booth was broken or missing, a cold draft was coming in through the windows and the men's restroom was dirty and faucet was loose.

49.description: I am never disappointed going here! They don't have many veggie options but the ones they do have are really good, and others can be made as a veggie option instead of meat.

40.description: I'm a simple and easy going guy, so I don't require a lot of fuss over myself or anything too complicated to satisfy me. Applebee's always has a good menus for whatever you're in the mood for. I love the appetizers and if you haven't tried their Jell-O shots, you're really missing out on some good stuff.

53.description: I went here because my family received a gift certificate to one-- and this was the closest one to us. The wait was awful the day we went. They had a really good promotion going on for kids meals, which was a bonus for us, having three and all.Once we were seated, our waitress was really sweet. She had a bubbly personality and interacted well with our kids. The most memorable moment for me was choosing our drink. Our kids were going nuts and my husband and I hadn't had a chance to look at the memu. She named a few things they had-- and when she got to lemonaid, we were immediately interested. We asked what kind she had and she said "Oh, I can make any kind of lemonade. Kiwi, Strawberry... you name it, I'll make it" (or something very similar to that). Anyhow, we ordered Pomegranate Kiwi Lemonades. They were delicious! Refills were free!My kids enjoyed eating with music and low lighting.
