The high chairs were a little sticky... but you know, my kids didn't really want to sit in them long anyhow. They gave us crayons-- which entertained my kids until they ended up under the table. We were at a booth and I didn't really want to touch the floor. So that's where they stayed.The space was clean, given how busy it was. I wish they would have had more staff to accommodate the large crowd.  It would have been nice not to have waited so long. Also, the space between tables was small. So my kids were constantly in the way when they were in their high chairs. People pushing past will knock your kid in the head if you don't have your hand out to protect them. It's not like they're gunning for them or anything.. there just isn't enough room. The food was fine.

30.description: Second time horrible service! Nachos we burnt wouldn't make another one. Manger needs to learn 5 star customer service.

46.description: Liked the food and Maggie the server was real efficient and friendly.  I thought the food portions were real good andi will return.

1.description: Poor staff poor management poor cleanliness poor food. Poor me for going there

55.description: I sat in the corner booth. There are two benches that come together. There's a small crack between the two. It's filled with food, NASTY!  I went on a Wednesday and waited over an hour for my food. Very disappointed. The sirloin on the two for $20 was good. Waitress tried her best.

9.description: We will not to order online for Pickup again.  They got the order wrong and the portions seemed much smaller than what we get when we dine in.  (Would be fine if we weren't paying full price....)    Then, when we called to explained the problems with our order, we kept getting put on hold...no one seemed to want to take responsibility for the mistake.

26.description: Horrible service. Stopped by because I heard of the $1 draft deal and figured, hey let me give applebees another chance. There were maybe 4 tables seated at our section, it was a Tuesday at 4pm, so we figured we could get a beer and some apps. We waited for about 15 minutes and we're never even approached by a server. We just stood up and visited the popeyes, next door, which I recommend. Applebees, Never Again.

25.description: Service was horrible. If you plan on having a night where you are ignored most of the time, receive your drink after you are done eating and than on top of it receive cold food ,along with a waitress that completely ignores you, than this is the place for you. Extremely disappointing. From now on I will inform everyone I know to never go to this restaurant ever again.

12.description: Our server Tabitha was just the worst. First we hear her gossiping about the host which was ignorant, and we could here her clearly. Then my mom receives her chicken dinner, which was suppose to have gravy, and didn't have any. We ask the waitress for a side of gravy and she asks for the whole plate, that she's going to fix it. We wait 20 minutes for gravy? I don't think so. My mom lets the manager know what's going on and says she doesn't want the meal anymore because we couldn't even enjoy dinner as a family because we're sitting there waiting. The manager says Tabitha told him we requested a new dinner that's why it took so long, we never wanted a new dinner why would we want to sit there for 20 minutes while other people's food is getting cold?

59.description: I order once something from there, for pick up. It was microwave "cook" with hair on the top ugh. I almost puke on my self and from that time I stay away from Applebee's.

21.description: Horrible service!!! We sat down and waited 10 mins for the waitress LIZ to come to us. She finally asked us what we wanted to drink. About 8 to 10 mins pass and she still didn't bring us our drinks. The place was not busy at all! We just got up and left. How does she even have a job??? They obviously hire trash that no other restaurant's will keep around. We will never return to this hell hole even if it was free! They also had ghetto Ass music playing loud through out the whole restaurant.

17.description: Second time horrible service! Nachos we burnt wouldn't make another one. Manger needs to learn 5 star customer service.

10.description: I'm never coming to Applebee's again for 2 reasons. First, they didn't deduct from my bill since I said no chicken on my salad. EVERY restaurant I've gone to ALWAYS deducts from my bill when I say NO chicken. I'm saving them money by using less of their food, so they should charge less.Second, Me and my friend both got a salad. Her plate was half full because it was a "low calorie" salad, but it cost even more than mine did. Who does that? Restaurants usually say which items are low calorie, but it's because of what the meal consists of. Not a smaller portion for the same price! NEVER coming here again!

5.description: Went there for a late lunch and to use up a gift card. Food was decent although they overcooked the steak. It was still juicy and tasty all the same. Portion control was clearly going on as the portions were not large. Service was decent and they kept our drinks refilled. Not a location that I will go out of my way to go back to.

3.description: Applebee's in general is an okay franchise restaurant that I don't mind going to. This recent stop just made me realize why I might never think of them as a "sports bar" ever again.Set at the bar around 10:15pm. Placed order. "Give me a mango Margarita, I only want it when the food arrives." "Okay""Also give me 20 wings 10 hot 5 BBQ.....I guess 5 Asian""Okay""And some cheese sticks"(was ordering more wings to take home and cheese sticks were only $4)4min later she puts my drink in front of me WTF! I don't eat at Applebee's often so not sure if she  was being nice by leaving the cocktail shaker which was basically full or if she was suppose to poor the drink in a bigger glass (I end up filling my glass twice due all the content in the cocktail shaker) Cheese Sticks at home usually take about 8min....it took almost 20min for them to bring those out. They were hot so I guess I should be happy about that.Wings came out 10 ASIAN 5 hot, 5bbq with 3 orders of ranch. I know I didn't say 10 Asian because It was the LAST one I ordered because although I wanted to try it. I had a fear it would be something that I didn't really like. On the menu it mentions ranch, blue cheese is extra. due to the wings being cheaper after 9pm (I was just going to order one blue cheese I don't like ranch so again no way possible for me to have asked for this)Although I was hoping for them replace the wings with the ones I asked for. the 10 Asian wings were taken off the bill. If I was given the option I would have waited but since I wasn't I just paid my bill and left. I've only been here twice and this isn't my typical Applebee's that I go to. I'm not in a rush to head to my local Applebee's after this event.

35.description: My fiancé & I usually come have dinner here and in our past experiences we were the poor unfortunate souls who got placed with horrible servers but tonight was the total opposite. We were lucky enough to get a server by the name of Megan and she was AMAZING. She was attentive always checked on us and we didn't feel rushed what so ever. The food was delicious and the vibe of the restaurant was even better. This definitely makes up for our past experiences. I HIGHLY recommend that whoever comes to this restaurant requests her as their server. You won't be disappointed!!!

19.description: Horrible experience. Had to wait for our check for 30 minutes and it wasn't even a busy night. Yes, there was a table in front of us complaining about everything and they were to busy serving them but just because they were complaining I don't appreciate making us wait. Did we have to complain too? I will not be going back and did not appreciate the wait.

28.description: This place is ok. I know that I was overcharged on my cc when I went there, the tip was supposed to be 3 and it was 7.. yeah horrible. The food was okay. Nothing special. Won't return  #thievinaintrite

45.description: By far the WORST kitchen crew I have ever experienced.. Having waited 1.45 minutes for a salad that I never got to eat is RIDICULOUS ... Sadly the most friendly and apologetic waitstaff got the brunt of the WORST KITCHEN STAFF IN THE RESTAURANT BUSINESS ..   I left hungry and angry sadly I was not the only patron... The restaurant is in a great location , but should this continue Applebee's will not survive ... Management you can apologize all you want but focus on FIXING the problem..we the neighborhood would like to keep you open...I personally nor my family won't come back until I start seeing Yelpers post there has been a change

33.description: I work and live in the area, so I come here at least twice a week, well, used to go. I was just there and I had never been more humiliated in my life. We waited to be seated, despite the fact that the restaurant was empty. We ordered drinks, we got our food and hadn't gotten out drinks. We asked for them nicely, the food runner is the host sometimes and he's usually friendly. However, after waiting 30 minutes for the drink, and not getting it, I asked to speak to the manager. Martin was apologetic at first, but when I pointed out that the service had been terrible the whole time, he became very defensive and continued to speak over me, stating that he had worked there for years. I asked for corporates number and for the servers name and he refused to give me both.

43.description: Great food and service the only thing that's preventing me from giving them more stars is I like to do take out a lot they forgot my drink and still I have yet to get a refund or another one!

2.description: I was there with my family, and our server was Andre. He was awesome... Food was delicious, and the margarita he suggested was delicious. Andre was awesome.

18.description: First time ever to Applebee's was yesterday. 4 stars because the margarita's were sooo good! I reccoment the pomagranate frozen one, which I accidently ordered on the rocks but the waitress was super accomadating and switched out for me. Great service and good jams! The food was just okay.

41.description: Went there last night this place is horrible go to chilies instead food was gross came out of microwave. I should have gone to Taco Bell next door instead. The waitress was super rude she threw everything on the table like wtf we're paying for this??? I WILL NEVER GO BACK!!!!

52.description: My wife and I decided to grab a late lunch at Applebee's. We have never been here before and figured it was like Chili's. We were seated by the hostess in a booth and  were told that out waitress will be with us shortly ..... 20 minutes later not one came to our tables. Waitresses were busy talking in the back area. We tried waiving and no one responded. At that point we walked out and no one even talked to us as we were invisible. By far one of the worst service ever in a restaurant. Don't go here, the place is pretty dirty and service is horrible.

50.description: Holy Mole!!! I think we walked into the Twilight zone (episode ghetto Applebee's)  when we stopped in last night.First of all its a cluster fukkkk of a mess. Upon entering who the hell knows who's seating who.Am I supposed to seat the hostess? or is she supposed to sit me.....hummmmm We skipped it and found 2 seats at the edge of the bar.Annnd a sticky edge of the bar it was! dirty glasses were all over the bar. The servers where ghetttoooo! Why hire people trying hard to be what they should be working hard not to be!?!?!?!? to be expected as there was a manager with a tattoo on his neck!...Ghettoooo!The ONLY reason Im writing this review is to rave about how the bartender in the midst of all the crazyness was able to do what should have been the work of 2 people. SHe was kicking azz!I didnt get her name she was a shorter middle aged white bartender.....She was AWESOME!But hell no I am not coming back.Hipster infestation level: 0 This place is too full of real live Chicago diversity for any bike riding bearded skeletor to walk in.

4.description: Worst experience ever, I ordered half rack of ribs with fries and coleslaw. To begin ribs are suppose to come right off the bone and they were hard to even break a piece off. The fries were cold or they were just sitting under the lamp for a long time. I'm a cook my self and I take pride in what I do. Who ever is cooking in the back isn't taking there job serious. That just upsets me that they would bring me a half rack of rib knowing they weren't made with care or respect to the food and also with the fries all old...

6.description: Went in before the remodel and the place was filthy. Garbage under the tables and the tables and seats were all greasy. Ordered there steak medium and the server brought out a super rare steak. I could still hear it mooing it was so rare. I told the server my steak was rare and the server rudely replied if I knew what medium was cause that was it. I told her I've been in the restaurant business all my life and that wasn't anything close to medium. Alive was more like it. So she took it back and brought back the same exact steak but this time a bit more cooked. Gross. Never going back. There's a Chilis and TGIF not to far from there. Go there instead.

22.description: Poor customer service, didn't even receive water for 15 minutes after sitting in to dine. To top it off my pink haired cunt of a waitress had an attitude when we asked who was working our section. I damn near was spitting sand after finally receiving my appetizer of hot wings because I had to ask a whole other employee for water due to the lack of attention my table was getting. Now I'm currently debating on waiting for my entree or telling them to fuck off and just paying for my appetizer and leaving.

15.description: This place is terrible. Not that I'd expect amazing service from an Applebee's, but this establishment doesn't even give "alright" service. It SUCKS. Even though they have several tables available, it takes SO long for them to seat you. It takes FOREVER for a server to even ask what you want to drink, forget about how long it takes to actually order. Once you finally get your over-cooked meal, no one comes by to ask if you even want some ketchup to mask the terrible burnt food they just served. We were there almost 3 hours for what should have been a simple meal. Appetizers are painfully overpriced, as well as the entrees. So not worth it. Go next door for some Popeyes, they have better service.

57.description: I come here often and in my years of coming here I only experienced one incident of bad service and she was in training. My drinks are always excellent and my food as well. Love the hours of operations and prices and vegetarian selection.

20.description: Been here a handful of times. This always struck me as one of the more ratchet locations but the overall experiences were fine. I think Saturday was probably the last time we'll go back though unless they get it together. Seems to have gotten worse since we were last there. The wait wasn't terribly bad but once we were seated it was evident that they didn't do a thorough job cleaning the area up. The whole place could've used a deep cleaning really. There was no silverware on the table. Not that I was expecting bottled water but what we were given tasted like it was out the bathroom sink. The appetizer was mediocre. My meal was fine but my bf was very underwhelmed with his. The server tried to put his best foot forward but you could tell he was being overworked and they were understaffed. They need to evaluate their business model otherwise I wouldn't be surprised if they are closed in the near future.

36.description: Service is slow, just got my order which is wrong. Ordered steak and shrimp with mashed potatoes got chicken with scalloped potatoes. Still waiting for my order not happy at all.

14.description: Been here a handful of times. This always struck me as one of the more ratchet locations but the overall experiences were fine. I think Saturday was probably the last time we'll go back though unless they get it together. Seems to have gotten worse since we were last there. The wait wasn't terribly bad but once we were seated it was evident that they didn't do a thorough job cleaning the area up. The whole place could've used a deep cleaning really. There was no silverware on the table. Not that I was expecting bottled water but what we were given tasted like it was out the bathroom sink. The appetizer was mediocre. My meal was fine but my bf was very underwhelmed with his. The server tried to put his best foot forward but you could tell he was being overworked and they were understaffed. They need to evaluate their business model otherwise I wouldn't be surprised if they are closed in the near future.

3.description: Kinda tricky to find, even on a congested Harlem Ave.  Kept telling myself that I'd make a detour here, which I've been saying for a good 4 years.  Quite old school, nothing fancy on the outside or inside.  They had quite the selection as it obviously is steered towards the Italian area of seafood.  Everything looked really good and they had things that you'd never find in a big box store such as sea urchin and big meaty octopuses behind the glass case.  Didn't get anything exotic as I left with some tilapia, even though I was eyeing the oysters, but they're such a pain in the ass to open.  The tilapia was meatier and bigger than the ones you'd find at the supermarkets.  Credit cards are accepted after $15.

1.description: Awesome place!We come here 2-4 a month.  There's a good selection of fresh and frozen fish and seafood.  The owner is very knowledgeable and will engage you in friendly conversation.Definitely stop in and check it out.  At times, there is limited street parking along Harlem Avenue, but you should be fine finding a spot on a side street.

2.description: The best place to get fresh fish in the Chicago area, period. Particularly for those who like the variety they would get in Italy. Vincenzo is knowledgable and gracious- a true legend!

0.description: The husband and I stopped in here while on our way into the gym across the street.  We have been wanting to try more fish & are so glad that we walked in!!! This place is amazing.  Walked out with a few pounds of octopus, some branzino & roughy.  Can't wait to cook!!!! The owner is awesome!  He even chucked an oyster for each of us to taste.  We will stop in again soon!!!

4.description: It's been a while since I've been here and I'm sorry that's the case. I can't even vouche for sure that it is still open; I've heard that it may have closed down.At any rate, I feel the need to leave a review because this was a great place.I've come here over a dozen times with my nonna (grandma) and have always had a very fun experience, even as a young teen in a fish market. Typically I'd whine about going grocery shopping when I was younger, but as soon as I was able to drive I was WILLINGLY taking my nonna here at least once a week.The location is pretty easy to miss if you don't know what you're looking for; located on Harlem in a very small unit, with no real parking lot available. But should you be accurately guided to this fish haven, it will all be worth it!First, everytime we entered the shop, we were greeted by name. I've always respected and appreciated an establishment that cares enough about their customers' business to recognize your face and acknowledge you by name; really an amazing trait for any business. They would never seem obligated to be friendly and the kindness continued through casual, playful conversation.Aside from the extremely friendly and helpful service, their product was amazing. We would buy fish and meat by the pound here, and they were always generous to give us a little extra. Fresh octopus, shrimp, clams, to the freshest of meats: prosciutto, mortadella, salami; anything you could possible want to prepare your own homemade Italian seafood dishes and sandwiches.Also, I even began coming by myself once I was a little older to buy their focaccia. I still haven't found a place that makes their focaccia quite like Mercato Del Pesce did, and if I ever do, I'll be sure to let everyone know.

1.description: Pharmacy staff always seems to be tired and their customer service is the worst. I been using Walgreens for a very long time and with twins who happened to be diabetic type 1 every other week I'm picking up something. The pharmacy staff is not friendly, is not curteous and can care less about your needs. Staff need to be retrain to care more about the people and not their pay check. Without the people there is no pay check!

0.description: The best Walgreens on my city street drive home from work and the closest to Riis Park. Need Bactine and Band Aids? Need Off or cheap summer toys for that cookout? It's all here. I always think a Walgreens like this one with no direct parking lot-to street access is better. Why? I dunno, just feels that way, okay? Get off my back! Remember to leave via Naragansett if you're headed further east, otherwise getting back on Fullerton you'd have to make the douchey move of a Left-Hand-Turn-Across-Two-Lanes-of-Traffic. Don't be THAT GUY!The employees here are laid back but very friendly. Check the back wall for super specials on vitamins and tinctures!There's a Drive-thru pharmacy here but be forewarned, shorter Rx hours on the weekends!Store HoursM- F: 7:00AM-10:00PMSat: 8:00AM-10:00PMSun: 8:00AM-10:00PMPharmacy HoursM - F: 8:00AM-10:00PMSat: 9:00AM-5:00PMSun: 9:00AM-5:00PM

3.description: I  took my grandsons bicycle to be repaired for a flat tire. Dropped it off on a Monday, picked it up on Tuesday,. My grandson rode it for 20 minutes on a sidewalk and the tire exploded. I took it back so they could fix it. He said the wheel is bent, the tire had a slash and  there are loose screws and it was going to cost me another $20 after already paying him $40. There is no way all that could have happened in the short period of time he rode the bike.  What a ripoff....Take your business elsewhere.

1.description: first of all..very expensive here...and second of all sucks that there are no returns.i dont plan on coming here ever again.

2.description: I love this bike shop. They were so helpful with my new bike and the turn around on my tune up was really quick. The owner explained some maintenance tips, which were helpful. Plus, the price was right!!! Very impressed and will definitely be back!

9.description: I used to live relatively close to this place and whenever I had trouble with with mike I would take it into them. they are great and the hours are reasonable. To this day I would consider going back to this shop even though I'm not that close any more.Prices are very reasonable and there turn around time is pretty quick.

10.description: This store came highly recommended by a co-worker, but I already was satisfied with a different bike shop.  I tried to drop off my son's Raleigh at that other store one evening, but they had closed early.  Remembering my friend's recommendation, I brought the bike into Grand Cycle.  When I got a call less than 24-hrs later and was told the bike was ready for pick-up and the cost was only $25, I jumped for joy!  My son had run over something, and the derailleur was hanging off and had took part of the frame with it.  I thought that if the bike was repairable, that it would cost me an arm and a leg to have it fixed properly.  Since then, I have had Grand Cycle do various repairs to an old Cannondale that I purchased, and I have always been extremely satisfied with the results.  Jan and Anna are very personable people, and it is a pleasure to do business with them.  You can't beat theirservice and their pricing is very affordable.

4.description: My husband brought his bike here for a thorough tune-up before riding the Apple Cider Century this year, and boy do we regret it.  The weekend hours are great, especially since he uses his bike all week to commute to work.  Unfortunately the promised 48 hour turn-around was not communicated to the repair man.  Four days later, my husband called only to find that they wanted his okay to perform the work that they found needed to be done.  He arrived to pick it up only to find that they wanted him to SEE the work that needed doing, then rushed through the fix.  Strangely they replaced his shifter without so much as a peep.  ???A few days later, as my husband's gears pop and grind up the dunes of western Michigan, you can bet he was none too pleased.  I returned in an attempt to get some sort of refund of the almost $200 we spent, but was denied.  Was even told there was nothing wrong!  He wanted me to leave the bike so they could check it out, but there is no way we are leaving any bike there ever again.

6.description: This place is terrible.  All I needed was my left shifter repaired.  A part inside of it was broken or disconnected.  I figured for an expert this would be a walk in the park.  I took the shifter apart myself to see if I could fix it but decided to give up before I broke something.  When I walked in he accused me of having lost parts without even looking at it.  I told him I just took it apart 15 minutes before and didn't lose any parts.  I should have walked out right there.  He said he would look at it.  They called me the next day and said he couldn't fix it (thought this was his profession) but a replacement would be $42.  I asked how much the replacement part was and they said $20.  I said alright, I'll just buy the replacement and do it myself.  I had to go out of town so I had my parents pick it up.  When I got home the whole shifter had been removed, the wire no where to be found and in a bag with no replacement part and a $10 charge.  $10 for taking off one bolt?  Then they said they didn't have the replacement part.  Maybe because I wouldn't pay the $20 install?  I looked at my handlebars and my brake was on backwards and my pads were broken.   Realize my only problem before was that I couldn't shift the 3 gear derailleur and now the bike is completely unrideable.  DO NOT use this guy.  Terrible customer service and completely incompetent.

12.description: excellent mom and pop raliegh bike store.  very nice. very helpful and some of the best prices around.  very happy with my purchase.

5.description: Hate to bust its perfect bubble but....not sure I understand the appeal. I came in for a quick front break adjustment. They charged me $15 which I thought was unreasonable, but I paid it because I do not have the tool or complete know how to do it myself. The woman at the counter was unfriendly (at best). The repair gentleman was a little friendlier and talked to me a bit, but it felt like they didn't want the business. I actually almost said, "I am going to pay you. Do you want to do the adjustment or not?"They eventually did the adjustment and quickly. I believe their prices are reasonable, but they are not terribly friendly to deal with and the shop was dark and kinda dirty. Nothing was well merchandised to look for things I wanted and quite frankly they were so unfriendly I didn't want to bother asking. Guess I gotta find another joint.....

11.description: After my purchase, they give you free service for a year... tuneups..truing...etc.. great place.

8.description: The lady from elmwood park hit it on the head. Im in my late 30s and frequented this place all through my childhood as it was THE BEST BICYCLE PLACE AROUND! THE PROBLEM IS THERE USED TO BE AN OLDER MAN WHO RAN IT AND HE WAS AWESOME. IF YOU DIDNT HAVE ENOUGH MONEY HE WOULD LET YOU SLIDE ON A FEW BUCKS NO PROBLEM. THE WITCH THAT WORKS THERE NOW IS THE OPPOSITE. I NEED A NEW RIM FOR MY BIKE AND SHE SOLD ME ONE FOR ABOUT 60 BUCKS AND THAN TRIED TO GET ME FOR CHANGING THE HUB AND PUTTIN AIR IN THE TIRE EVERYTHING WAS EXTRA, IN MY OPINION I WOULD NEVER GO HERE AGAIN AFTER MY BAD EXPERIANCE, JUST MY OPINION

0.description: This shop is great. They service bikes they've sold there for waaay longer than the posted 1 year. I brought my bike back for a tune-up 6 years after I bought it. They tuned it up for free. I bought a very nice beach cruiser for my 6-year old daughter at a very good price. High quality at a box store price and they assemble it for you professionally. They have affordable prices and they also carry the high-end stuff for the serious biker.Oh and BMX, BMX, BMX. I wish I knew of this store when I was a kid. I have found the owners very nice and friendly, I don't know what some reviewers were talking about.

7.description: This place is one of the only BMX bike stores in the area and the owners are great.  They sell good parts and are nice to talk to also.  Its a hike from downtown for me on the Grand bus but its worth it.

3.description: My hairdresser is out of town so I went here today for a haircut and I must say Lydia rocked the house! She took really good care of my hair. We were a party of three, a child was in the mix, and all of us were highly satisfied. (we all had different stylist). I will go back. What I like the most is that each stylist would check and double check with the customer before they did anything to your hair. Good price. Great service.Thanks Lydia!!!

1.description: Cara is amazing. She is a great stylist. I've referred two people to her so far because her services and customer service is awesome. She doesn't leave you waiting at all. Try her out for your different needs.

2.description: I've always had a great experience here in the Brickyard.  No complaints!

5.description: I've come here withing the past 9 mths about 5 times I would say from what I remember! lol.. The first time I came I went in for a badly needed hair cut and my hair is curly and it's hard to find people to cut curly hair properly and make it look decent with out looking like a lion! lol I didn't wait to long my first time there which isn't to bad as I am extremely impatient lol.  The lady that cut my hair the first time did an good job overal however I requested sidesweep bangs to my right, she did part my hair to the right however when the bangs were cut and I went to blowdry them they had a funny curved and curved to the left :/ kinda weird took me numerous times with the flat iron to try and get them curve to the right.  But over all it was nice.   A few months later I went in for an all over color to get rid of my badly over grown blond highlights and to get rid of them once and for ever!!! The same lady took care of me this time and she did a pretty good job I loved the color and she also blowdried my hair.  I've stopped in a few occasions to get my hair blowdried and the price is a lil ridiculous 40 bucks just cuz I have one long layer :/ but I was pressed for time and did it any way!  BUT I was satisfied.  Now I went in last week for Christmas trim and the lady that trimmed my hair this time was a bit rushy and didnt seem to devote much time on my hair, I explained to her my situation with the bangs and how I would like to get them fixed and she looked at me like I was an idiot but she did it any way.  After I was done I asked if she could pls blow dry my bangs so I can see if they came out the way I wanted.  And to my surprise she said NO!.. I was appalled like really?? I just explained to you how somebody else ruined them HERE at this Hair cuttery and you can't do me a a courtesy I wont take nothing but 5 mins.  She went on on how they dont have a seperate charge for that I was completely blown away by this.. like its just a few pieces of damn hair !! She just said well i featherd them to the right so they should be fine.  I relectuanlty got off the chair paid for my hair cut and DID NOT LEAVE HER A TIP!.Out of all my expereinces at other salons they always blow dry them bangs or offer to do it as a curteousy and she did not!.  I  was pissed but what can you do.  I don't think I will be going back to HER if I do go back to this Hair cuttery.  Hence why I took away 2 stars this experience made me a bit bitter.Hopefully when I got back in a few days for my root touch-up I will have a better time!!As of 12/29/2011 I will no longer be going to this hair cuttery.  I came in to try and get my hair done for the new year and I came in 2 hours before closing time and they would not even be bothered by me.   Between 3 stylist none of them would take the time to do a touch up and blow dry, they kept sayin oh" we can do the color but no blow-dry" and I said well I don't want to pay full price if I am not getting the full service.  To my avail she said " NO" there's no discounts.  I was ultimately appalled and I will not be taking my business to this hair cuttery every again!!! AND NEITHER WILL MY MOM OR SISTER!!.. a true stylist doesn't turn down a potential costumer!

6.description: 1 star only because I had to. Awful experience. Crowded,dirty,rude,unprofessional.I walked in with twin 7 year olds. I was told there are 2 in front of you. I decided to wait . 50 minutes later I had watched 4 random people walk in and be immediately seated. I pointed this out each time & was told they had stopped in earlier. Finally a man & yound girl strolled in and were immediately seated. I walked up to the original girl & said WHy arent you seating us? She looked at me like she haD NEVER SEEN ME BEFORE. wtf!  We left. we will never be back. BLECH

7.description: SO I didn't plan my salon visits very well this time around. I went to my regular place and got a haircut and what I like to call "the works" for a hefty little price. Now, my dilemma...I was in a wedding this past weekend and the personal stylist they had over was pretty pricey as was my regular place for an updo. Having just dropped some cash on my cut, etc., I wasn't about to pay a ton for a one day updo...enter hair cuttery. They got me eerily close to my printed picture that I walked in with and I was in at 9:00am and out by 10:00am (which never happens in my hair world). Calling can be annoying because the language barrier is even more apparent over the phone but once you're here, they get the job done and everyone is really friendly. PS. the girls who paid the hefty price tag were inserting more pins into their hair all night because it kept falling down...not I (insert smug grin here)

8.description: I've tried this place 3 times and had three different women.  The Polish woman with short hair was the best.  A middle aged Latina woman with longish hair and puffy eyes did a poor cut on my son and cut his ear! The guys at the barber shop did a better job for $8 than her $15 cut!

9.description: I'm usually not one for beauty salons as I prefer going to barber shops to get my hair cuts. I tried going to Fade Factory and there was a huge line, along with Final Cuts by Riis Park. I decide to use this as my last resort and as soon as I stepped in I was greeted with a smile. They brought my to a barber and I advised her on how I want my hair cut, she did exactly what I had wanted plus shampooed my hair. I've never had anyone shampoo my hair but me...so it felt nice. It was great too because as soon as I entered I sat upon the barber chair...which never ever happens for me. Sure the hair cut was 15 dollars, I typically pay 5-10 dollars for a haircut. But I get treated as if I'm just another person they have to hurry up with and get rid of, not with this place though. She gave me her business card along with phone number to set up any future appointments. I'll probably be the only guy ever reviewing this place on Yelp...definitely worth it though!

0.description: I have been to the high end hipster places and always leave disappointed and feeling broke. I'm so thankful I found Cara at a hair cuttery! I do admit that communication between you and your stylist is key so make sure that she knows exactly what you want before your start. Cara aims to please. She doesn't second guess the cut that I tell her that I want.

4.description: The ladies who did my hair were nice but this place charged too much for a color and cut. I would rather go somewhere better for the price. However I was lazy during the winter and this place was right by my house

3.description: Loved this place! Recommend it to anyone. Just EXCELLENT work all around. I should also mention they do things ASAP!10/10

1.description: Definitely will be coming back here for all my engraving needs! They were friendly, quick, and more than reasonable with the pricing. I needed a gift engraved, a glass top watch case, within two days..they told me NO PROBLEM..Things Remembered and a local shop by my house made it seem like I was asking for a space ship to be engraved. It looks great and I was so happy. I'm so glad I discovered this gem!

2.description: This place is amazing, and I am so thankful for their help this past weekend. I wanted to have a knife engraved and first took it to Chicago Award Source. Chicago Award Source's engraving wasn't noticeable and looked terrible. Chicago Award Source wasn't willing to try to even fix it and tried to charge me $71 for the disaster they made.I then called BETS for their help. They were able to engrave the other side of the knife, and it looks perfect. I wish I had found this place first. I highly recommend them and will definitely return to this place.

9.description: I had some whistles and clipboards engraved as gifts here. The clipboards turned out fine, as they were done by laser and required little human intervention. The whistles, engraved by hand, did not turn out so well: most were off-center, several had clearly shifted during the engraving process and were fairly messed up, and they were finished a full two weeks after the estimated date. Fine, mistakes happen, but then they tried to charge me twice what I was quoted because they'd underestimated how difficult the job was. Not very professional.I just tried to get get a quote for another batch of clipboards; I'll spare you the incredibly insulting customer service both on the phone and in person, but the price for the clipboards this time was a full 30% more. So much for repeat business.

10.description: I needed a couple of trophies made for an event that I was producing and filming for a client the following day.  We had the idea to make these trophies just the day before and I had no idea how easy or hard it would be to do so.  I called and went to a couple of trophy shops that couldn't help me in the time allotted.  But then I found BETS online and gave them a call; they told me to come in because they had lots of inventory and were sure they'd be able to accommodate me.  They exceeded my expectations!  Not only did they have the mount that I needed, they helped solve a few design issues we had as well.  And they were such a lovely family.  They rushed through my order and got it all done while I went next door and had  a quick lunch.  They were very reasonably priced.  I would recommend them for all you engraving and trophy needs.  Additionally, they sell the cutest little gifts, like these sweet little coins that you can have engraved.

4.description: Work is excellent and well priced - but be prepared to follow up.  Record keeping is sparse, hours are loose, and communication is not great, but the staff is helpful and friendly.  If you can handle the follow up (which I can) this is a great local business that does good work for good prices. I'll definitely go back.

6.description: I've been to BETS before.  They help you make a decision on what kind of Award you'd like made. Trophy, Pewter Statue, Glass Display, Wall Plaque. They also help you out on how and what kind of wording you'd like on the Award. The Crew at BETS were so patient with me as I didn't know what kind of Award I'd like to have made or how I wanted it worded. If you want to give someone an Award for their Hard Work or Major Accomplishment BETS is the place to go.

12.description: I have come here for trophy engraing for several years and find the prices quoted fair and accurate.  I don't think any job ever took more than 3 to 4 days.These older ladies always seemed very nice to me.

5.description: We were in a pinch to get 32, yes 32, plates engraved on a Saturday for an event that night.  Bishops not only got them done, but even stayed late until the order was complete!  They were priced well, they were done perfectly, and they saved us from a potential disaster with an important client.There is something to be said for working with a family business, they go above and beyond to make things work.  Thank you Bishops, I look forward to bringing you more business!  Bravo!

11.description: I went to this store to get a trophy for my soccer team and had a great experience.  They have a huge inventory to choose from and the owner helped me find exactly what I was looking for.  She even gave me a discount and offered to mail the plaque to me the next day.  I will be coming back here for all of my trophy needs.

8.description: I was on a time crunch to have a memorial plaque made and BETS came through in the clutch! It's a small mom and pop shop, but had great turnaround time and were very helpful. Their prices are very affordable as well. I'd highly recommend BETS to anyone in the neighborhood that needs a plaque, trophy, or any type of engraving in a timely fashion.

0.description: Good people.  I will definately come back.  You get very personalized help, which I really appreciate.

7.description: I had an excellent experience with BETS. I ordered a plaque and I never even had to set foot in the shop to get a beautiful custom plaque. Everything was done over email, telephone, and fax.  Our proof was sent to us via fax and once approved it was shipped to us sooner than they predicted for us.  I felt that their customer service was strong over the telephone and that all three women I spoke too were courteous and helpful.  When I received the plaque in the mail, it was pristine and very beautiful.  I am very happy with what I ordered and received, especially given that I never set foot once in their store.

3.description: I've been going here since before they relocated, so about 10 years total now.  I mostly go to Loan for my eyebrows and will NOT trust anyone else to do them. I've had pedicures done here too. Overall I've had good experiences, nice people.

1.description: David is the guy to go to. Takes his time ( & if you read my post u know I lack patience) nevertheless his timing on nail polish is for perfection & that I appreciate. He's not rude and he's not one of those male techs who makes unnecessary convo to be "cool"He is a worker who definitely takes pride in his artwork. Now the ladies who work there well they are your typical nail salon ladies and I definitely don't go there for them

2.description: Good service, nice nails. The technicians here are pleasant with good attitudes, and very pleasant and positives dispositions.

5.description: Just tried this place out today.  I just noticed it the other day while on a walk with my little one.  They are super friendly, and did a really good job on my mani/pedi.  I also had my eyebrows waxed, and that is where things get a little weird for me.  Here's the thing, I absolutely loved the way my eyebrows were shaped but she finished them off with a razor.  I have no issues with her using a razor to finish my eyebrows, but after she was done, she didn't throw it out along with the wax strips.  That makes me think that either they reuse the same razor for everyone OR they sanitize it between uses.  I would feel squicky but somewhat ok if they do sanitize it, but I definitely wouldn't be ok if they reuse them.  I left without saying anything, but if I do try them again I'm definitely asking if they're using a new razor on me and bringing my own just in case.  I'll update my review then!UPDATE:  I haven't been back and I don't plan to.  The more I thought about it, the more I felt squicky about the possibility of them reusing the eyebrow razors, so I'm dropping two starts. I'm still on my quest to find my new nail spot!

6.description: I couldn't possibly love a nail salon more.  Everyone there is so nice and so professional. Amazing prices.

0.description: My favorite place since forever! I used to go to their old location. They do the best eyebrows and nails around. Loan is the best and the service is unbeatable. They even do eyelashes now!

4.description: Had gels done and a nail broke the second day... a lot of times they rush and forget to do parts of the mani or pedi. I personally like going to the young girls that work there most of the time they seem to do a good job. A negative for me is that they NEVER get new nail polish colors. They do not have a lot of them and most of them are bad quality. I have been going there couple years now and there is not much to choose from. Most of the workers are really friendly though. Place is OK but I am searching for a new nail salon.

28.description: One of the best in Chicago!  A must try for chicagoans, bring your $, cash only, but nicely priced.

1.description: Good old school thin crust pizza . Mushrooms were canned but I was starving and didn't care. The crust was crispy and thin but not too thin.

9.description: Fabulous pizza,  like the various options which are equally as well packed with ingredients.  They are very professional and have momentous of  military pictures. It Is perfect for the big gatherings to keep the guests content with these tasty slices.

29.description: Hard to admit but we are definately here at least once every other week.  It is so hard not to rip the bag off of the pizza on the car ride home.  This past week we added garlic and it was just amazing.  I had to force myself to stop eating!

23.description: I really dig their thin pizza. Being new to the neighborhood, we had to locate a new pizza place for those days I have no desire to cook- mostly Friday nights.We've been faithful customers since our first bite and this is our go to pizza place all the time. The only down size is that they don't sell larger pizzas then their Family size, but that's becuase I have teen boys and I have no choice but to order 2 pizzas.I've had pizza in the same area, but so far this is the one my family favors.

5.description: Best pizza around!  It's a small family type place take out and delivery only.  We have been going for so long, they know us. If my husband and I order a pizza, and so does my parents or my inlaws, they joke about it.  Very friendly and great service. Most important, the best pizza! We get all kinds too-pan, thin, double dough, it's all delicious.

31.description: As long as they've been around, I can't believe I've never had Geos Pizza before! I had an urge to try a new pizza so I had a thin crust deluxe (onion, mushroom, green pepper and sausage) delivered over the weekend and all I can say is  WOW that might have been the best pizza I've ever had! I don't know what thier secret is but the crust was phenomenal!!! Super crisp on the bottom, warm and soft with the perfect amount of toppings! I liked that the sauce went all the way to the edge of the pizza, and the inner pieces held up so well. Everything tasted very fresh and not greasy.  I don't know if discovering them is a good or bad thing lol I'm gonna have to try really hard to not overdo it with my pizza cravings now. I was also pleasantly surprised at how nice everyone was on the phone to take my order, only thing to note is that they only accept cash. If you are a pizza enthusiast you MUST try Geos!

25.description: i thought it was just ok pizza.  i usually to to the few trustworthy spots but wanted to try something different.  average tasting sausage pizza.  that is what i orderdered and was thin crust.  the guy working there seemed nice but in just my opinion there is better pizza around this area.  they do not take credit cards but there was a chase at the walgreens across the street.  hard to believe there are still places that only take cash seems like more of an inconvenience then anything else.  but i wish geo's luck...

12.description: Pretty good pizza.  Deep dish is pretty good too.  It's no Giordanos but it's good.  I'm pretty critical with food so it's a big deal to say it's good.

37.description: awesome pizza, whatever you get, thin crust or deep pan.  deep pan is better here than at other places -- the dough is flavorful but not so heavy that it sits in your stomach.  small place, pickup/delivery, pizza only -- but there's something good to be said about knowing what your speciality is, sticking to it, and doing it well.

21.description: My favorite pizza spot in the area. Nothing is even close. Thin crust, cheese is my favorite. The pizza cut is kinda funny...some pieces are less then a bite. Lets be honest...its all about the tast tho. A++

16.description: You can't beat the traditional great taste, sealed in its paper sleeve

17.description: The pizza tastes delicious. But don't forget to take Cash because they do not take credit.

10.description: Ordered a large thin crust for carryout and it was excellent. Paper thin crust that is crisp. While the pizza rocks, their menu isn't very exstensive and they only take cash. All they offer on their menu is pizza, but a very good pizza

11.description: I have been a customer since I was a kid. The pizza is to die for! Family from out of town has me order this pizza every time. One downside is they don't accept credit cards. If there was one thing I would change, it would be for them to take plastic. Otherwise, don't change a thing!

26.description: Been a customer for over 35 years. Great pizza, especially the thin crust. Always order from here when I'm back in the old neighborhood. Highly recommended.  Only negative - no credit cards.

27.description: Great pizza, love the Ricotta cheese as an ingredient!Going to call it 4 Stars for now until I have a few more!My only complaint is the lack of a box, it comes wrapped in paper.....

35.description: I like how the inside is nothing fancy, just a small old place with old pictures pertaining to Italians & park district teams that they helped sponsor, which are common traits of a good pizzeria.  There were 2 young guys & an older man working there at the time.  I've never seen a menu that was so basic.  They only offer thin crust & pan, nothing else!!!  I ordered a medium thin 1/2 sausage & 1/2 bacon for about $12.  Despite the pizza being somewhat overcooked,  it was pretty good, the sausage really stood out.  It tasted like it came fresh from the butcher & was very flavorful.

8.description: Really love this place! I've been moving all around the city in different neighborhoods but I find a way to pick up a pizza from here. The only bad thing that its not a dine-in restaurant and they only accept cash. They have that authentic fresh Italian taste to their sauces and it makes you feel good that you're supporting a family owned business instead of major chain frozen "pizzerias". Plus they do a loyalty service if you collect their vouchers whenever you order a family size to get a free pizza how great it that?

0.description: Pizza is great and reasonably priced. CASH ONLY, but still deserves 5 stars because the service is good and pizza tastes fantastic.

38.description: awesome everything pizza, sausage, GP, shroom, onion - DELISH!  just gooey enough, great sauce, crust, cheese.  no CC's.  small place, pick up only.

20.description: Fantastic pizza! Nothing else but fantastic pizza! If you are looking for wings or salads or breadsticks, you'll be disappointed. But if you are looking for great pizza takeout, this is the place. Thin crust is very crispy and nicely topped with flavorful sauce (not too sweet), and good toppings. The pan pizza is also very crispy on the outside, a little softer and breadier where the sauce touches, and the sauce itself is a little lighter yet more chunky with pieces of tomato in it. While thin crust is my favorite, the pan makes a nice change.The sausage and pepperoni are amazingly good and my favorites. Geo's is really picky about their quality, and it shows. Ricotta makes a nice topping as well with a very different, lasagna-like flavor. It's very tasty on the pan pizza with spinach. The toppings are the usual you will find on pizza--mushrooms, peppers, olives, onions, pineapple, etc. Artichokes are not on the menu, but they do have them sometimes--you just have to ask. We've been eating here for 27 years. Haven't been disappointed yet. Note--bring cash because they don't take credit cards or checks.

19.description: Best PIZZA EVER... Amazing thin crust

33.description: Hands down best pizza place in the neighborhood!

2.description: Old school pizza joint! The place is small and only accepts cash but pizza is always good and fresh.

34.description: Fantastic crispy thin crust pizza!I have been going here since the 1970's Have not found a better crispy thincrust in the world!Try it !

32.description: Pizza !! They just do pizza..and pizza at it's best!  Good sauce, good toppings, good prices!

18.description: Great pizza, love the Ricotta cheese as an ingredient!Going to call it 4 Stars for now until I have a few more!My only complaint is the lack of a box, it comes wrapped in paper.....

13.description: We live a few blocks from this joint and had never ordered. My gal's daughter ordered pizza from here one time by mistake and I FELL IN LOVE. The sauce is phenomenal. And the thinness (made up word) is just right; crispy. Not Chicago's deepdish but NY's crispness.

4.description: Have eaten their pizza for 40 years it is the best on the planet.  Their sauce has a great spice.  Drive 30 minutes to get it

24.description: The pizza tasted pretty good and was ready in a fairly quick amount of time.  However, there were several issues that prevented this from being a 4 star review. First, the prices seemed a bit high for what we ordered. Second, the lack of an online menu forced us to simply call and hope they had what we wanted. This is how we found out they ONLY MAKE PIZZA. No sides, no appetizer, ONLY PIZZA. Lastly, the pizza we ordered was half toppings and other half just cheese (for the vegetarian). When we brought it home we could see that more than half the pizza was covered in toppings and the pieces were in all different shapes and sizes.   Now that I have a menu I can manage my expectations,  making the first two issues moot. Based on how good the pizza tasted, I would definitely order it again

6.description: Mom & Pop place with excellent thin & pan pizza; been ordering from them for 10 years.  Customer service is very good from the person taking your order over the phone to their drivers who are polite and courteous.  This is strictly take-out.  Pizza delivered hot!

22.description: I'm just so fortunate to live in a neighborhood with great pizza joints....But anyways, this place is fire. The pizza sauce used here is kinda sweet but I love it and think it tastes excellent. Great place, just sucks sometimes because they only accept cash.

15.description: Fantastic pizza! Nothing else but fantastic pizza! If you are looking for wings or salads or breadsticks, you'll be disappointed. But if you are looking for great pizza takeout, this is the place. Thin crust is very crispy and nicely topped with flavorful sauce (not too sweet), and good toppings. The pan pizza is also very crispy on the outside, a little softer and breadier where the sauce touches, and the sauce itself is a little lighter yet more chunky with pieces of tomato in it. While thin crust is my favorite, the pan makes a nice change.The sausage and pepperoni are amazingly good and my favorites. Geo's is really picky about their quality, and it shows. Ricotta makes a nice topping as well with a very different, lasagna-like flavor. It's very tasty on the pan pizza with spinach. The toppings are the usual you will find on pizza--mushrooms, peppers, olives, onions, pineapple, etc. Artichokes are not on the menu, but they do have them sometimes--you just have to ask. We've been eating here for 27 years. Haven't been disappointed yet. Note--bring cash because they don't take credit cards or checks.

7.description: Went in there couple Fridays ago. Pizza was above average. ....but if you are buying by the slice,  be waste they are small! !!!!!!The lady working there is nice. The older man not so much! Only cash!

36.description: I've been eating their pizza for at least 30yrs and it is Excellant--the deep dish/thick crust pizza! You have to have it!!

30.description: Good pizza love the cornmeal wish they had apps and took credit cards

3.description: My favorite pizza spot to go to when I want a good thin crust pizza. Amazing pizza not too cheesy, messy or greasy. Just perfect. No place to sit but that's find with me. I'm always on the go. Best thin crust pizza around!!

14.description: I really dig their thin pizza. Being new to the neighborhood, we had to locate a new pizza place for those days I have no desire to cook- mostly Friday nights.We've been faithful customers since our first bite and this is our go to pizza place all the time. The only down size is that they don't sell larger pizzas then their Family size, but that's becuase I have teen boys and I have no choice but to order 2 pizzas.I've had pizza in the same area, but so far this is the one my family favors.

3.description: I used to love this place and its to bad that I no longer live near here anymore.  The place was a lot of fun and the people were very friendly.  I would go here again for a good game of 1 pocket

1.description: This was place was decent, but as a small woman, I don't feel the safest here. Fluorescent lighting (feels draining). some of the people who go here seem a little uhhh... rowdy and intimidating? So I'd only feel comfortable if I came here with some guys in a group. They required a key to grab from the front desk to use the bathroom. The bathroom was dirty, broken toilet paper holder, and the toilet paper sitting on the window. Just didn't seem very clean. There is a ping pong table as well. And an air hockey table. It is byob. They do have snacks. And a jukebox. Nothing was really wrong with the spot. Pricing was fine. I just don't see myself going out of my way to come here.. I'd probably prefer a different spot and would be willing to drive further, say it were just for my sister and I.

2.description: It's fine place to play pool. It smells like smoke all the time. I would go here with a group not alone. It doesn't feel all that safe. Would I visit again?? No.

0.description: Neighborhood pool hall that's BYOB. They have a jukebox and snacks if you're feeling hungry. The pool tables are Brunswick official ones. I really like this place.

4.description: You want to play some pool? I used to love to play pool; unfortunately I haven't had the time recently. I was just reviewing Chris's, when I remembered playing here too. While not as famous as the other pool hall, they have a nice place to get your game on. The tables are decently maintained and the place is in good shape. What more could you want than another nice place to shoot pool.Pros: Good locationCons: None Cost: $$ of 5Overall Rating: 3.75 of 5Recommendation: Recommended

58.description: We decided to try FBR based on the generally positive Yelp reviews. Now, I cannot say anything better than 4 stars because this was my first "adult" furniture shopping experience and it is hard to say if I got a good deal or did everything right, but for the four stars I'm giving, I think they did great.The positive:The couch got in early.Delivery was on time.They took the old couch away for free! (Not their usual practice.)The couch is very comfortable and we love it!Super easy to use the Yelp coupon.The negative:We had a lot of questions about couch construction that they just couldn't answer and had to spend a lot of time looking up online. During delivery, the paint on our front door frame got pretty wrecked.All of the couches are custom orders, so to an extent you are trying out what is there and then hoping for the best. The so-so: We think the price was good. It was definitely within what I was prepared to spend and the couch is really delightful. Overall, if we had to go couch shopping again? We'd totally go back. It was basically a good experience.

56.description: The staff is awesome!  They are honest about what is available and what takes time to deliver based on your wants and needs.  I walked in sore from sleeping on the floor and left with a mattress, with the owner [because I walked to the store], who delivered my mattress right then. Tony, I am so glad you are in Chicago!  I am sure LA misses you, but I am glad that you are here and have helped me!

29.description: My boyfriend and I had a great experience with Far Below Retail.  They have great furniture for excellent prices.  We got a 93" sectional for $800 and we love it!  Delivery was set up for the next day, was seemless and they were right on time! I would recommend this place to anyone looking for affordable furniture!

42.description: I showed up in Chicago without any furniture and came here in search of a bed, so I walked into the store not really knowing what I wanted or needed, but Tony and Erin were both extremely helpful and very friendly. After they gave me a brief tour of the store, they let me explore at my own pace (and even offered drinks) without ever pressuring me to make a purchase. I ended up buying a mattress that day and I was able to get the mattress delivered early the next day. Overall my experience with FBR was a positive one. I might have been able to get a lower priced mattress or found a bigger selection elsewhere, but great customer service is often hard to come by.

23.description: Erin and Michael were incredibly down-to-earth and helpful. My boyfriend and I waltzed in right before closing on a Sunday, told them exactly what we were looking for, and within minutes they had found us a good couch at a great price. They even offered us beverages and a place to store our recently-bought groceries so we could take our time choosing. We had gone to Roy's Furniture TWICE, but they had nothing in stock that we liked. Far Below Retail is a small little store, but they have quality items and more in the back. When Mark came the next day to deliver our couch, he was careful and fast. At first it didn't look like the couch would fit in our apartment doorway, but he tried various angles and eased it in, put it together and left. I've never seen such a pro-- thank you Mark!

47.description: We were looking for a deal on a desk for our apartment and I found this place on Yelp.  They were open later on a Saturday and when we got there, although there wasn't a huge showroom, the deal is there are catalogues with many pieces of furniture to choose from.  They go to their warehouse every Tuesday to pick up items that were ordered, and they either deliver or you can pick it up.  Well, small showroom didn't bother me a bit.  I found the PERFECT cofee table for our new sectional and it was a good price, as well, considering that it folded up so that you could use it to eat dinner at or play cards at the couch, but also folds back down to normal coffee table height.  I can't wait until it gets delivered.  There's usually a delivery fee.  Let me just say that the customer service is extraordinary and to me, that's something I truly value.  I want to know people appreciate my busines and they, for sure, do!  Please support them the next time you're in the market for furniture.

8.description: We moved to a high-rise condo in Chicago earlier this year from the suburbs in San Diego and found Far Below Retail on Yelp.  Allison, Erin and Tony spent a lot of time with us helping to select the right pieces for our condo.  They were patient and had some fun ideas for us.  Here are a few photos - black end table, couch and rug are all from FBR.  Great people, great company to do business with!

31.description: This place couldn't be better. Erin is the best! We were in the market for a sleeper sofa for a new second bedroom. We couldn't decide if we wanted to go with a cheapy one or get a nicer one for when guests stay. We had looked all around at the big furniture stores and had a couple of "finalists" in mind. We came to Far Below Retail since the reviews were so good and it was close to our church so we thought we'd give it a try. As soon as we walked in, Erin and Tony were so welcoming, friendly, and gave us the low down and a glass of wine for me and beer for the husband. Erin sat with us and told us about the different options of sleeper sofas. It's a big warehouse, but only a handful of selections on the floor, which I could see as a bummer since I like to see something before I purchase it. However, they are helpful enough to make you feel comfortable about buying something through them in one of their catalogs.Erin walked us through the catalogs and told us the different price ranges. She was extremely knowledgeable about her furniture and I really felt like she was trying to help us find the right piece and not upsell us. When we came back two days later to make our purchase, Erin walked us through all the final decisions and even pulled couch pillows off of their models to help us find the perfect fabric. We decided on a beautiful Rowe sleeper sofa that was in our price range. Definitely a better deal than most places we have been to, and you just WANT to buy from them because they are so darn friendly and down to earth. Erin quoted us the amount the first time we came in, and our final price stayed true to that amount (plus taxes and delivery) which was great, because I feel like most places will pull random charges out of nowhere when you are about to hand them your credit card.Would highly, highly, highly recommend this place. Erin and Tony are so great, and you'll want to just sit and drink wine and look through catalogs with them. A great Chicago place, we'll be back for all of our furniture needs.

34.description: I recently bought a custom bed, dining room table, chairs and end tables from Far Below Retail and it was a great experience from start to finish. The downside of the place is that there's a 90% chance you'll find what you want in one of their many catalogs and not in the showroom. It's the price you pay to save a significant amount of money. If you aren't comfortable ordering large furniture out of a catalog this place probably isn't for you. Now for those who don't have a problem with it and still want great furniture at unbeatable prices then all the employees here will make it a great shopping experience. They'll even pour you a glass of wine while you shop! I was helped by Tony & Erin and they truly care about their customers and I highly recommend checking this place out next time you're shopping for furniture.

16.description: Friendly... knowledgeable....good prices... and they offer you refreshments?!? Brian and Erin.... the dynamic duo. I highly recommend Far Below Retail. They will shoot you straight, work within your budget and your options are endless. We were beyond happy with how our browsing turned into buying very quickly. There was never any pressure, we were just finding everything we needed right in our budget. We looked up the mattresses they sell online (enso). Enso's had great reviews and they were coming in UNDER the prices listed online.  My boyfriend and I are counting down the days till we get our new bed!! Cannot wait! Thanks Erin and Brian :)

13.description: My husband and I have been needing a new couch for awhile since our dog has been in the process of smashing all of our cushions over the past couple of years. We walked in here around 4 on a Saturday, and by 5:30, we had picked out a couch and 3 barstools. They even offrered us drinks while we browsed.There was a mixup with the color of the barstools when they were delivered but it was sorted out promptly. This is a great and very affordable furniture store. Definitely check it out!

11.description: Tony and his team are amazing!You walk into the store and instantly feel comfortable; as if you are walking into a friends apartment. I bought a studded bedframe and mattress for my second bedroom and couldn't be happier. I highly recommend. Great price too!!

39.description: I recently purchased two bar stools and a chair from Far Below Retail. I wasn't sure what exactly I wanted when I first arrived at the store, but Erin and Alison both were incredibly helpful in the process. I found pieces that I'm happy with, and at an incredible price too! I will definitely come back in the future.

37.description: Great place! I went there to look at mattresses. They were incredibly friendly and helpful. Even offering us a beer when we came in. They have great prices, and we had shopped around. The owner Tony was very easy going and even delivered the mattress to us the same day. I would highly recommend checking them out.

0.description: I had such a great experience at Far Below Retail with Tony!He is extremely helpful, friendly and professional. Looking for furniture, mattresses, cabinets- Tony's got it all!

38.description: Very reasonable. There was no pressure, which was great. They listened to what I had in mind and my budget. I am very satisfied and would recommend them to anyone.

51.description: This Sunday morning we drove to their location. I parked a few blocks away and waited 10 minutes for the clock to hit 11AM. Walked down to the store front to find the shop locked. By that time it was 11:10. We called and heard the phone ringing and ringing inside.  Waited a few more minutes and we left. On the way out there was a couple of woman who were just as surprised to see the store was locked. As we were leaving I saw them walking back to their cars.  For me it was an inconvenience but management should be aware that I then drove to a competitor and made a furniture purchase.**Tony the owner sent me an apology and offered to make it up in the future. Shows that he does care and this must of been a one time occurrence.**

27.description: We bought 4 counter stools.  At the time of purchase, Erin had us sign something in small print which we did not have a chance to read.  She told us it said that if we returned our purchase, we would only get a store credit and not a refund.  OK, we signed without reading it, but we were also NOT GIVEN A COPY.  A few days later our stools were delivered by Mark, who was very nice, but he opened ONLY 1 of the 4 boxes, took out ONLY the cushions and announced, "Yeah, it's all here."  When we went to assemble the stools, we noticed there were no screws in the box, and some other parts were missing.  We also noticed the box was broken in two places, and there was the return address of a woman from Michigan.  We took pictures of this box.  Apparently, she returned this, the box was damaged and parts were missing, but FRB still tried to push this merchandise off on us.  The second box we opened was better, but there were still missing screws.  The third and fourth boxes were OK.We returned the two defective boxes and asked for two NEW UNASSEMBLED stools.  When we called to inquire about the replacement, we were told they were ready, and one was assembled and the other one was in the box.  I told the guy (Tony) we did not want them assembled--just NEW AND IN THE BOX.  He proceeded to ask me why we did not want them saving us the trouble of assembling them.  I told him he sounded just like the Comcast service rep from hell that went viral on the internet a few days earlier.  He just chuckled.  I repeated that we did not want the assembled stool, only 2 new unassembled ones.  (Frankly, I think they scavenged the two boxes we returned, got some screws from some nut and screw jar they have in the back somewhere, and tried to pass off the assembled stool on us instead of giving us a brand new unassembled one.  Just my opinion...)  We did eventually get two new unassembled ones and all is well, but no one should have to go through this.  As a result, we will not return.BTW, I just read in someone else's review that they also signed something without getting a chance to read it.  BEWARE OF SIGNING SOMETHING WITHOUT READING IT, AND MAKE SURE YOU GET A COPY IF YOU DO SIGN IT!!!  Pressuring people to sign stuff without having a chance to read it, and then not giving a copy, is just bad bad bad business.  They are getting a good average on Yelp reviews probably because they make good and/or the dissatisfied customers don't complain.  Nonetheless, no one should have to go through bad experiences buying furniture.  Period.

32.description: The only reason they don't get 5 is that I waited a couple of weeks longer than they said to get my snack tables. No biggie but truth & accuracy, right?Otherwise they have some nice stuff not bad priced. And so what if most stuff is from the catalog? I wouldn't know what I was looking at if I didn't have someone to help me. And they will take as much time & energy for my snack tables as they will when I come in to buy that leather couch (one day, one day...).

54.description: I HIGHLY recommend Far Below Retail. Allison and Tony are so helpful. I moved in to Cobbler Square in Old Town and needed help buying furniture on a budget. Not only did they help me find the best quality for my cheap dollar amount, but they also hand delivered it to my place the same day. Tony was awesome! He just put my couch in the back of his pick-up on Easter Weekend and took it directly to my place, for almost no extra charge. Selfless and courteous. Great place to shop. I'd suggest them to anyone.

48.description: This place is fantastic.  After checking out all of the other decently priced furniture stores in the city, I ended up here.  The quality of the furniture is great, the selection is wide and the salespeople are incredibly helpful.

44.description: This place is great! They offer you beer, wine or water as soon as you walk in the door! They also said they are planning on having bloody marys on the weekends! The staff is great.. really nice and informative .. they aren't push at all either ! They work w major places like ashley furniture so you can get quality furniture for a reasonable price ! Defiantly check this place out! It's a hidden gem!

24.description: Service and price are the reasons to shop here.  I had been looking for a sectional couch and I shopped all the expected downtown options - department stores ($$$$), furniture stores ($$$), even used furniture places (think bedbugs).  FBR didn't have the couch I wanted on the floor so we went to the catalogs and spent about an hour picking the couch, the fabric and even the pillows.  They told me it would be about 4 weeks for a custom order.  4 weeks later my couch is delivered, it looks great and the quality of the furniture is as good as I would have gotten from the department stores.  The biggest benefit is that the price was about HALF of what I would have paid at one of the other downtown alternatives.

7.description: We again came to FBR to find a padded foyer bench.Erin again found an item to suit our needs available within a week from the manufacturer.  We paid (including the delivery charge) and once again received on schedule delivery from Mark and his helper.I highly recommend visiting FBR when looking for home furnishings! The value received, the price point, and the service are outstanding!

49.description: I just relocated from NYC with no furniture. I walked in there on my way to moving into my apartment. 2 hours later they delivered my couch, mattress, box spring and bed frame! I'm sure that's not typical delivery time, but I'm beyond impressed!! Moving is so stressful and my experience with FBR was so easy! Good quality and great customer service? Can't ask for much more! Prices aren't bad either.Edit**A few weeks after I bought my furniture, they sent me a groupon reward for $80-that was 3 months ago. The other day in the mail, they sent me a handwritten thank you card with a $30 gift card! I will recommend this place to everybody I know!

40.description: So I moved into the Gold Coast neighborhood and was looking for some good deals on  new furniture for my swanky new pad.  I asked the management team in my building and  they told me about a  privately owned furniture shop in the area that does great custom orders at low prices. This place is awesome! Super friendly staff with high energy and great customer service! They have a good selection of ready to purchase furniture as well as limitless custom order fabrics and hardware! I have already purchased a white leather couch and am headed back for some custom bedroom furniture!!  Now all of my friends see how cute my place is so they shop there too!

53.description: Tony goes all out to make you happy - above and beyond for sure. After hours of trying to get a big ass couch through my tiny hallway we had to give up. Erin was on the ball and helped me pick out something that would actually make it in the apartment. I am happy to throw business their way!!!

30.description: Friendly... knowledgeable....good prices... and they offer you refreshments?!? Brian and Erin.... the dynamic duo. I highly recommend Far Below Retail. They will shoot you straight, work within your budget and your options are endless. We were beyond happy with how our browsing turned into buying very quickly. There was never any pressure, we were just finding everything we needed right in our budget. We looked up the mattresses they sell online (enso). Enso's had great reviews and they were coming in UNDER the prices listed online.  My boyfriend and I are counting down the days till we get our new bed!! Cannot wait! Thanks Erin and Brian :)

46.description: I went to Far Below Retail after reading reviews online.  This trip, I was purchasing furniture for my daughters first apartment.  We wanted to purchase first time, but not disposable furniture (been there, done that).  Allison was wonderful!  Not pushy, so helpful in making our decisions.  Visited a couple other places in the city and realized that FBR was the best choice for us to get this process going.  I highly recommend using FBR.  This was, for me, the easiest transaction ever!  Thank you Allison for making my daughters place functional and stylish!

1.description: Great place and kudos to the designers; the young lady spent the better part of a day picking out custom Rowe couch and chair.   Alison is really good at what she does, not pushy, and has a great eye for color matching.Product is top quality so far;leaps and bounds beyond anything I bought before. Minus one star because when they say 4-6 weeks they mean 6 weeks minimum. Not FBR fault but dang if my back doesn't hurt from sitting on a computer chair for that long.  Also, delivery was prompt and on time,but dude definitely was a bit "energized" if you catch my drift... No issues though, he did his job, albeit alone and super fast lol...

55.description: I had the best experience with Tony and the folks at Far Below Retail.  The best part of the whole experience was that they have an absolutely no pressure selling approach!  Tony worked with me for almost two hours until I found the perfect fit for my living room.  I would reccommend them to anyone who is looking for a nice peice of furniture at a fantastic cost.I will return!

9.description: I really wanted to give a small, non- chain store a chance.
