I order a capucino which was also very tasty I had to order a second round. They have a variety of gelato for desert as well. I gave them 3 stars because the service was a bit slow and they only accepted cash. Other than those 2 things I will definitely go back and try the rest of their menu.

22.description: Because we had a good experiences in the past  and we like to support local business, we came by for a quick family dinner on an unusually slow Friday night. However, the service was pretty bad. There were only about 2 other tables with people, and still our waitress's appearances were few and far between. The prosciutto sandwich was decent, but they really skimp on the meat.  We tried coming once before after we bought the Groupon, but they were unexpectedly closed, even though according to the hours posted on their website, they should have been open. This happened to be the last week before the Groupon expired, and we were unable to go again. I tried contacting Caffe Italia via Facebook to see if we could still use the Groupon post expatriation, since they were closed on a day they should have been open, and all they said was I could redeem the Groupon for the value I purchased it for....Kind of a crappy way for a small place to treat customers who live in the neighborhood, but oh well. When we tried to redeem the Groupon for the original value, the waitress said we couldn't because the manager didn't renew his contract with them.  Like I said, we try to support local businesses, but between the service and the management's disorganization and lack of proper customer service, we'll look for other places to patronize in Galewood/Montclare.

15.description: Leave it to snow flurries and a ton of traffic for my coworker to ditch the commute back to the burbs and park us a couple blocks from Caffe Italia. Though I had heard about this spot, it's a first for me.I must admit, the decor was more about the roast-ability of coffee as opposed to chowing down. Still, I was looking forward to being dazzled by yet another Italian port in any snow storm.Our hostess/server got us going with drinks right away; we thought she was great. My friend ordered the calamari appetizer and I went with the grilled eggplant. Both sounded pretty good. As we waited, this little place began to fill up. Our "insalata" arrived and to me it reminded me of true tapas portions.I really enjoyed my eggplant; it had a nice cilantro kick. By the time I looked up to ask how the calamari was ... it was gone. Well, okay, I guess he taught classes without a lunch break today?Our server was on top of everything and we appreciated that. My friend opted out of the salad, but I ordered the Caprese and shared it. It was a little watery, but the tomato and basil were super fresh and they used a halfway decent olive oil.Although I sort of felt I was dining alone, my colleague perked up after deciding on the tomato and shrimp linguine. Sounded fine, but give me some kick in the hopeful form of the red pepper rapini pasta dish with alio e oli. Both of these little "tapas" entrees were tasty but they ranged in cost from 15 to 18 bucks. No major complaints.Caffe Italia boasts great cafe'. Well, they had great cafe'. Nice.For a first time, I somehow feel my experience was all over the place. Maybe it had less to do with the food and more to do with my dining companion. Still, no matter the traffic or precipitation, I most likely will try Caffe Italia again and see what happens.

7.description: We had the WORST experience at Caffe Italia that we've ever had in a restaurant.  We are never coming back and could not recommend this place in any way.  Intending to celebrate a birthday, we recently made a reservation for a large party on a Saturday night, calling early in the day to make sure they could accommodate us.  When we arrived, we discovered they'd gotten the reservation time wrong & had sent home their entire staff.  They blamed us for it, then lied to us about being able to accommodate us anyway.  The owner/manager assured us he could still accommodate us & could cook all the orders by himself.  He also promised to call back staff (who never actually showed up) in order to help him.  They ended up only taking orders for 4 of us and NEVER returned to take the rest!  When I tried to get the owner's attention to ask what was going on, he wouldn't speak to me, completely ignoring us.  I then told him that since it was now clear he wasn't able to accommodate us as he'd promised, and refused to so much as explain to us why, we were going to leave.  Then he responded that he was about to serve the orders he'd managed to cook (individual pizzas).  They were never served, and the only thing they managed to get on the table were 2 bottles of wine (which we'd had to pour ourselves), for which he handed us a check for $88!  These people are desperate, pathetic, rude liars whose complete ignorance of customer service will certainly be their ultimate undoing.

36.description: Very classy /chic restaurant on Harlem Ave.  They serve REAL Italian food.  No, NOT Italian American food!!  I mean, really real Italian food that you would find in Italy.  Everything in this restaurant is premium quality: the coffee (rich and smooth), the octopus sliders (perfect texture, not fishy or chewy), the pasta (kissing my fingers! mmmuah!) and the tiramisu the is made in house and is like no other tiramisu I have ever had.  The gelato looks amazing too (I did not taste but plan on returning).  The atmosphere was classy, modern Italian, with excellent wait staff.  It's a place where one could just stop by just for cocktails, coffee, ice cream, or a whole meal.  It's also worth noting that everyone in the neighborhood knows about and raves about this restaurant.   It was full of locals so you know its good!!

30.description: Bravissimo! Buonissimo! Second time I've gone to Caffe Italia, this time for lunch, first time for coffee and gelato. Great place! A true Italian cafe/trattoria. From the decor to the Italian voices on the radio playing in the background. Most importantly however, is the superb quality of the dishes. It matches the high quality (and style) of food that you would very often find in Italy. We ordered two paninis, the prosciutto and the Italian tuna salad. Delicious and plentiful. We only ate half each and took the rest home. Both were served on toasted Italian bread and came with these scrumptious polenta fries. You dip the fries in the included tart and slightly sweet tomato sauce. Prices are very reasonable, especially given the quality. $8.50 for each of those paninis at the time of this writing. Service was attentive. Check it out.

3.description: Was craving some gelato and decided to walk on down. The gelato was definitely on the pricier side I think I paid like $4-$5 for a scoop... Kind of ridiculous. Pretty decent gelato, but not the best I've had.

14.description: We went here for lunch. The two of us split a pizza and it was delicious! It was seriously a perfectly made pizza. Great prices and a decent selection of food. Their dessert menu looked fun and had a good variety. We got coffee after and it was fresh roasted and had a strong authentic flavor. Service was average, our waitress was attentive. We were one of three tables so it wasn't busy. The owner came by and said hi which is always impressive. We will definitely be back.

1.description: Update.... Longtime coming.... I did return to Home Depot with complaints and pictures in hand to show what my issues were. They gave me a small monetary refund... Which was enough to make me happy for the time being.... But I do only go back here now for paint, and that's only out of desperation if I can't make it to another location.

9.description: Walked through the entire store only 1 associate said Hi.  We were looking at kitchen Cabinets a guy sitting there new approached us or even lookup .

23.description: If I could give a - star I would. Nothing good to write. No service what so ever.I spended more than $ 20,000 in this home depot  to remodel my new building and it was the worst experience of my life they  wasted endless hours of my life for stuff that should take minutes.NEVER AGAIN !!!!!!

5.description: This by far is one of the worst customer service Home Depot's in the state of Illinois.  I went in  to purchase a grill and needed assistance. I asked the nice lady at the paint section to page somebody to come to the garden section to get my grill and put it on a cart so I can take it to check out. I wait 20 minutes and I have to go to the manager to get the associate to show up to his section. Of course shows up after the manager has to page him and was waiting for him in the garden section. he then says he's going to get a cart and I wait another 20 minutes and at this point I decide to lift the grill myself while another customer holds the shopping cart so it doesn't move and put it in the cart. I see the associate talking to another associate and then I see the same associate talking to a customer when this whole time he was supposed to go get the cart and he went all the way in the back but somehow ended up toward the front of the store passing me twice.  The manager was very accommodating and it's not her fault that she has an employee that just doesn't care to do his job when he's working.  I honestly will not go back to that Home Depot I would rather drive an extra 20 minutes to get better customer service.

25.description: No customer service whatsoever.  Go to Lowes down the street!

12.description: Sorry, pathetic and horrible customer service.  My Goodness, I have never visited a Home Depot as worse as this one.  Ok, let me break it down.   on 6/5/13 I'm desperately trying to find a specific Marble Tile to complete a home project, so I go online and Home Depot's website states that this location has what I need in stock.  So, I drive across the city heading to this store and decide to call before I get there just to make sure.   After  being bounced around for about 45 minutes, no lie, I finally get some Manager named Tony that tells me to hold on and he will check his stock.  He never returns to the phone.  I call back, no one answers.   I call back and get immediately transferred to some young lady who said she would go check the inventory for me, she never returned to the phone. Called back again and another associate told be they had 71 in stock.  I asked, do you you have 71 pieces or 71 boxes, she went to check and never came back to the phone.  Finally called back to speak with Mr. Inept Manager, Tony, he proceeds to out-right lie to me over the phone by telling me that the tile I needed was not in stock.  I ask, are you sure, he says yes, he's sure.  I ask, are you positive, "because your website is usually accurate".  He insists that they have none. I hang up.   Something keeps telling me this guy is lying his ass off, he's just too lazy to go check.   Determined, I pull into the lot of this Home Depot and proceed inside heading towards the flooring section. When I get to the flooring section what do I see?   Voila!  Sh*itloads of the tile that I need sitting right there on the shelf.  Tons of it!  If I hadn't really needed this particular Tile, I would have told Home Depot to go f*uck themselves.  And to Tony, you are one sorry excuse for a Manager.  No excuse you offer can justify such lousy customer service.    Hopefully Yelp won't fold to big company pressure and remove my review, these stores can't get away with this type of service.    Wish I had taken my $526.17 somewhere else.I would be remiss if I did not thank the young gentleman, Danny, for helping me load my car with this purchase.

21.description: Update, after the "new" Lowes has ad time to settle in, it's gone downhill and the Home Depot has remodeled, and I prefer HD again (also, Lowes management has made some well-publicized decisions on a corporate level that make me not want to shop there) . I still encounter unacceptably high odds of not finding a nut or bolt that I need, but HD is still probably better than Lowes on that front, too.

16.description: Purchased a storm door with a $57.00 installation fee. After weeks of delays,all their fault, I was contacted with a more expensive door and the installation moved from $57.00 to $97.00.. The installation sale had expired. Expired because they lost my order and even didn't know which door I had selected.. Dishonest..Avoid like the plague.

17.description: I love places like Home Depot, I'm like a kid in a candy store every time I go. I just wish they hired people who actually knew what customer service is. In my experience the staff is horrible... They seem very annoyed by their customers. Lowes offers better service but it shows in the pricing.

10.description: I've tried to call this location to find tool rental prices, but when I can finally get on the line with an employee, I ask for it specifically, and she "transfers" me to some other department which automatically hangs up.This has happened three times and I'm sick of it.I would give it 1 star, but I was in there a few times when the few select employees (mainly men) were actually very helpful, kind, and friendly. I just wish all of the employees cared as much. The women seem to hate their jobs and not care about the customer.

11.description: Horrible customer service.  The management at this location made me question the entire Home Depot chain. That being said... I contacted Home Depot's 800 phone number and explained what had happened, the lady here was extremely helpful.  The 800 number helped me find another home depot with smart, helpful management.I will never return to this location unless I somehow find out that the management has been replaced.

26.description: I am going to agree with Nancy on this one.  Quite possibly the worst Home Depot that I have ever been too.I have 2 very unfortunate incidences to report in the past 4 1/2 months..The first was the purchase and installation of my new water heater.  I placed my order over the phone, and everything seemed copacetic. I gave them all my necessary measurements and details.  ( I had my husband measure.) The salesperson and I agreed on the 12 year GE.The day arrives for the unit to be installed.  The job was assigned to this particular Home Depot, and they jobbed the work to an awful company by the name of PIT. 2 guys pull into my alley, go through my basement door and then inform me that in order for me to have the hot water heater installed, I would have to give them $250 COD.   They then told me that sorry, I'd have to settle for the 9 year because a 12 year won't fit.  I think the fact that I am a woman gave these two jerks the stupidity to think that they could take advantage of me.  I immediately called Home Depot's home services department to find out if this was correct.  No one had informed me that I was to give anyone anything COD.  I was correct.  They were trying to scam me.  Their home services department called PIT to find out what the heck was going on.  Of course these guys lied and said no, they did not ask me for that amount of money, they lied and said that it was $60 in additional parts.  I was relayed this info by their home services department and instructed not to pay anything COD and that the additional $60 would be put on my Home Depot card.  And the hot water discrepancy?  Let's just say that these jerks didn't have any other water heater on their truck.  In finalizing the installation, these jerks did not supply me with any warranty information, manuals etc.  They then proceed to ask me again for the $250 in which I informed them that I already spoke to home services and was instructed not to pay them.  They were not happy.  I then tried repeatedly to obtain the warranty info and manuals from this particular location to no avail.In November of 2007, my husband special ordered a new screen door for our back door.  We had custom ordered a security door at another Home Depot many years ago, and did not have any issues.  He went over the size specifics with the mill worker on duty and went over the the details on how to proceed measuring for this particular door.  Our door did not arrive until 3 days before Christmas Eve.  It was way too cold to try and install it.  We finally had one day of good weather and my husband proceeded to install it.  The measurements were all wrong.  Why because the guy on duty told him to measure from the inside, not the outside.  We called them to complain and they basically told us tough luck, it's a custom order, all sales are final.  My husband had to build a new frame around our door frame in order to make it work.  3 days later, the entire door split in half sideways, not from where my husband installed the frame or anywhere near the pieces that he had to install but the actual door that we received, where the glass is held in place by the two pieces of aluminum!  The nails that were in place to hold the actual door together were to short and exposed the particle board in between.  It happened when I was home alone with the little one, and I almost fell down the porch stairs.  It was really heavy, and I had a really hard time carrying it down the steps.My husband called to complain and speak with a manager 4 times as it was a manufacturer defect.  We just wanted someone to come and look at the door and replace it.   No one would return his calls.  After a week of being told that the managers were away or they were in a meeting, and not receiving any call back, I pulled out my bitch card and called corporate.  I had all the info on the door, when phone calls were made, and names of who we dealt with.  I also had pictures of the damage ready to email.  Corporate was very apologetic and accommodating.  They returned our purchase in full via gift card so that we can purchase a new door altogether and not have to deal with this particular store again. After I use this card, I think that I will be taking all my future business to Lowes.

22.description: I went in today to purchase a few things. I needed white 4 door pulls and they only had 2 (and one of those was scratched). I needed a door stop (for the door handle) and they were out of stock. I had 2 staff members helping me and we still couldn't find anything I needed. For such a big store, they were out of alot of stuff. Too bad, because I had to take my business elsewhere. I would have preferred not to make the wasted trip, but live and learn. Staff was friendly, but really just shrugged their shoulders when we couldn't find what I needed.

0.description: This looks like pretty much any other home depot but is not as good as some of its suburban sister stores. The staff is a little less friendly and knowledgeable than their farther out stores and the selection a little less, but its in a convenient location if you are going in/out of the city and need something

20.description: I'm sorry to have to report that the very thing I praised this HD for -- the good quality of their plants -- is no longer a factor.  The last time we stopped in, the plants looked as if nobody had bothered watering or caring for them in weeks.  Many were dried up, disease-ridden or otherwise very unappealing, and they were all at full price.  Sorry, no.  The prices here are close to or in some cases higher than local independent garden centers, Meinke's or Urhausen's, and with quality like this, even convenience isn't going to be an issue.  Avoid this place.

19.description: They need to install some Cellphone antenna booster Amplifiers inside the store specifically for 3G on AT&T serviceOnce you walk in the store you'll lose 3G signal on the AT&T networkfoursquare.com/venue/104…

2.description: So today i had to go to Home Depot to get some items that i needed to do some repairs.When i walked in i was welcomed by one of the store employees and they gave me the sales booklet, also was offered a shopping cart  which I did not need but it was nice of them to offer one to me. Very easy to find where i needed to go so i went to plumbing and i was looking for my item. Unfortunately i was unable to find the item there so there was two employees that were there and i asked them for assistance and one employee took me to the paint department and showed me the item i needed. After i got the item i went to back to hardware to get some screws another employee was there and asked me if i needed assistance and i informed him i needed  5/16 screw that was 7in or longer. I was informed that they don't have that long of a screw but its possible to make it. He showed me what i needed and we put something together and it was perfect.On my way out i figured i use the self checkout because i didn't want to wait a a small line. Even though there was not many people. When i wen to check out i noticed that the self check out helper was actually doing her job and not just standing there. She was very helpful to the customer next to me. She help her work the system and then asked me if i needed any help.So i had a good experience this time in Home depot lets keep it up because i will be coming here more often.

18.description: I'm sorry to have to report that the very thing I praised this HD for -- the good quality of their plants -- is no longer a factor.  The last time we stopped in, the plants looked as if nobody had bothered watering or caring for them in weeks.  Many were dried up, disease-ridden or otherwise very unappealing, and they were all at full price.  Sorry, no.  The prices here are close to or in some cases higher than local independent garden centers, Meinke's or Urhausen's, and with quality like this, even convenience isn't going to be an issue.  Avoid this place.

13.description: Uh well, some employees try hard but lack the requisite knowledge. A visit to the Home Depot to the home improvement amateur and/or professional is akin to death and taxes--inevitable at some point. It doesn't mean we have to enjoy or approve of it....

4.description: I came here to have a board cut, ask 2 employees if they can have someone called to the cutting center waited 10-15 minutes no one came finally when some big guy decided to help out he said that I can cut it myself as a female , do you know how hard it is to use a saw, he didn't ask if he can be of assistance, I did not want to even give them a whole star, very unprofessional at this place I looked at the workers here all they did was walk around NOT doing anything just lost, what is wrong with the managers here , don't they know how to put their foot down and get on their employees about actually doing "work"... Then when I go outside to my car another employee that drives the vans was yelling at a customer to move her car out the way

24.description: They need to install some Cellphone antenna booster Amplifiers inside the store specifically for 3G on AT&T serviceOnce you walk in the store you'll lose 3G signal on the AT&T networkfoursquare.com/venue/104…

6.description: I ordered over $4000 worth of flooring that I spent an extensive amount of time preparing to have installed.  (moving furniture, disconnecting TV, taking the day off of work, multiple phone calls to make adjustments that Home Depot suggested).  Today, the installers showed up to tell me that the flooring I chose would require several thousand dollars more of work to level the floor or I would have to chose a different kind of flooring. Interesting, since I specifically talked to the HD rep who gave me the quote and to the ordering dept about this issue before I placed my order.  So here I sit.  Just sent the flooring I ordered back and have to start at square one.  Definitely will not be at Home Depot.  Lesson learned.

15.description: Waited in line a full 20 minutes to rent a saw only to be told none available because the last customers that rented all the saws returned them without safety equipment. How about a board with a listing of what's not available so time wasn't wasted?

7.description: Not even deserving of one star! I went to get keys made and the girl working was so ignorant!  No one was around to help. Then when she finally helped me she didn't even give me decoration designs. And didn't say thank you, no customer service at all! Then I went to look at paint, because I'm starting a new paint project and needed advice. There was one gentleman who was at the paint desk slammed with customers! I walked around to find someone to help me, and there was no one! I left all my stuff there and went to Lowes instead! The only thing I unfortunately paid for was the keys I already made. I will never shop at this Home Depot again. What a shame.

8.description: This place is the pits. I was there Thursday evening and the store was empty. I made two purchases that evening. I needed help loading the bag of concrete in the car. And I waited 12 minutes. Needless to say, I returned the concrete and my other purchase of $168. The return associate identified another associate as a manager when I requested a manager which I advised her that she was not a manager because I asked her too to call a manager. The return associate then advised me she did not have the capability to call for the assistant manager and that I would have to request him at the cashier area which I had already done 5 mins prior . Manager came and claimed that he was not called when I initially asked for him which means that the first associate failed to call him when I requested him. This store was so horrible I had to contact Corporate about my experience. Which Corp said that they were surprised however the yelp reviews about this location is true. Avoid this place unless you want to experience horrendous service. Now the electrical associate was helpful.

3.description: No need to write a bad review when everyone else has for me. But the one star is because I do like Home Depot. They need to lay off 80% of the employees and hire people that are willing to work! Starting from the top down. This is truly unacceptable. There's still that 20% that can make the cut. I would be ashamed if I worked at this establishment and was to read reviews others before me have wrote!

14.description: SO helpful after less than adequate experience at Broadview store. Employee knew exactly what I needed and where it was located. In/out in 10 minutes!!

1.description: Good place for a stiff drink and free beer wash.

0.description: Look up "dive bar" in the dictionary and you will find a picture of this place! Great service, good prices, and friendly regulars. Add it to your pub crawl ASAP.

1.description: Just another place that I have to visit when I come to this side of side. I love the pan that they sell here. It's fresh, sweet and very tasty. There empenadas are excellent. Much better then getting donuts and if you spend more then 5 bucks you can use your credit or debit card.

0.description: Try the Puerquito!Yes, it means little pig but it's not really an actual pig.Pig shaped cookie..has a spiced flavor to it. Almost like gingerbread but there is no ginger in the cookies as far as I know.

28.description: I Love this place, my family has been coming here since I was a kid. So, that's about ** years. (hey I'm a lady and I'm not giving any clues about my age) I have had probably everything on the menu. For example during my younger years I was addicted to mozzarella sticks and chicken strips. (BTW, They have an AMAZING homemade RANCH sauce). OK, then on to the teenage years, I think i lived on garlic bread and beefs and sometimes both together... YUMMY. Now I'm a pizza and pasta and WINGS kinda girl. They have the best thin crust cause its sooo thin. I probably sound like I'm 350lbs. But rest assured I'm not some crazy cat lady with a bunch of cats or massively obese either. But, they do have great food. BYOB is pretty cool too although I'll admit I never took advantage of it. Try it out!

1.description: Old school, Chicago pizza place. Best way for me to describe it. Ordered over the phone and went to pick it up. Had no idea what the place was going to look like. Has a great old sign out front, and the inside is dark and out dated. But the pizza is pretty good. It's so old school, they don't even use a box! It's in a bag and on a cardboard disk. Awesome. You never see that anymore and it was a throw back. Not sure I'll order from here again, not because the pizza was bad, just so many other options close to my home. But I do recommend you give it a shot!

9.description: This is the best Belmont Ave. Pizza in the city. This pie is made with a old natural Chicago style flavor. The interior is beyond retro as it hasn't been touched, I don't think, since the 50's. Even the outside sign is old with the worded phone number. My friends father own pizza places all over the Northwest side from the 70's until his death. This is the only pie that tastes like that one. Olive oil in the sauce for sure. Try it, you'll like it.

29.description: I love Franks!  Franks Pizzeria has a very comfortable and cozy atmosphere-I love the grape lights hanging thoughout the resturant.  The food is outstanding.  I love their pizza-its nice and thin with great cheese and sauce.  I love that they make their own italian sausage!!    My favorite pizzas are Franks Special, Cheese and Sausage, and Italian Beef with Giardinera.  I think Frank's has the best food, and my favorite italian beef sandwiches!

23.description: I have known about this place for a long time and finally went in to try the pizza tonight with my wife.  I have been drawn by the 50's era neon sign outside for a long time.  The interior is small but cozy.  We ordered the cheesy garlic bread as an appetizer and a ham and pineapple pizza.  The cheesy garlic bread was fantastic.  It was perfectly toasted and super cheesy and awesome- highly recommended.  When our pizza arrived, it looked delicious and I am happy to report that it tasted as good as it looked.  Nice big chunks of ham, great sauce, and perfect thin crust.  The only downside was the wait.  We didn't have to wait long for the appetizer, but the pizza took quite a while.  However, it was worth the wait.  There is also an antique scale/fortune telling machine in there that I wanted to run away with.  For one cent you can pick which question you want answered, and it will answer it for you.  The waitress didn't understand my fascination with it.  It was awesome.

5.description: The place itself is super cozy and old school. The pizza is delicious! I had a thin crust cheese, with buttery crispy thin crust, and the sauce has the perfect level of sweetness to it. Will come back again soon! I am very picky about my pizza and happy to have found this gem of a place. Service is also quite friendly.

31.description: I really do like the thin crust pizza here and yes they use a great tasting sausage! Everything is very fresh and not too greasy considering it's a very thin crust pizza. I did not  know about the mon/wed half price specials. I stopped orderering from here because I thought they were a little pricey. (It would cost me over $20 for a 14" with 2-3 toppings) I was also dissappointed that they do not offer anything larger than a 16". (when feeding a small group I'd prefer ordering an 18" pizza)  I've only ordered for pick up and delivery from here. The interior dining are has a few booths in a dimly "romantically" lit area that gives off a very old school italian garden feel (lots of dark wood, lattice and vines) Looks cozy although I have yet to see anyone inside eating there. Also upon enterintg it has a little bit of a musty smoker smell that reminds me of walking into a tavern in the middle of the day and I'm not sure I could dine in that but the pizza is still very good.

25.description: Okay, I guess I have to finally admit that I am a bit of a food snob.  When the husband suggested eating here, I was less than pleased.  We walked in and I was still unimpressed.  But, I am willing to give almost anything a shot and I will readily admit that often "divey" places have really good food.Now - keep in mind that we did not order the pizza, so I cannot comment on that.  Service was excellent - the young woman told us all about weekly specials and their delivery range and brought him more bread and butter right away.Husband ordered cheese fries to start and that was pretty standard cheese goo from a can or tub, but the fries that I snuck (no cheese goo) were actually quite fresh and crisp.He then had the meat ravioli on special with a house salad with blue cheese dressing.  I got the fried perch with baked potato.  We also had a few small loaves of bread at the table.  The bread was excellent - fresh and hot.  The perch was pretty standard frozen stuff and the baked potato was a bit overcooked, but certainly edible.  The husband thought the ravioli was also from frozen and the sauce too "oiniony" and he didn't like the garlic bread - which was just like every char broiled offering from my days in Addison.I ended up liking the place more than I thought I would when I saw the napkin "doily" on the table and was handed a take-out menu as the menu at the table.  He didn't really enjoy his food other than the fries,  but would like to try the pizza.  I will push for delivery rather than sit here.I have to laugh at the reviewer who thinks this place is "romantic".  I read that in the restaurant and could not stop laughing.  That person needs higher standards or a better idea of romance.  I'm thinking they also think Olive Garden is "fancy" and Outback is a real "steakhouse".  This is a dive -there was tape to match the pleather seats on the wall for Christ's sake!

12.description: Five stars would of been given but their customer service sucks However the pizza is awesome so I just put up with it

37.description: Not fancy place inside but it is clean.  I have only had the pizza from here and it is very good.  I will have to try something else from here.I used to go here more often, when I was getting 40% off through idine.com.  The discount is no longer 40% so I don't go as often.I would go again for the pizza and will have to try something else.

21.description: I dined in here this past week and was pleasantly surprised with just about every aspect of it. Sure, the place is a bit dated with their decor, but I like that. The garlic bread appetizer was mediocre, but the double-dough thin crust pizza was delicious. I would definitely dine-in again, in addition to using them for carryout.

16.description: Came here with my brother twice and both times I left satisfied. I have tried both the double dough and thin crust pizzas with sausage and both were excellent. They do have an extensive menu, but have only experienced the pizza. It's also a good place to dine, if you like a dark, quiet dining room with dated decor, but I kinda dig the "old school" feeling to it.

17.description: Just moved into the neighborhood and tried the thin crust pizza.  I'm born and raised in Chicago so I'm a bit of a pizza snob.Crust:  Very thin and crispy.  I love pizza with crust like this, but keep in mind it is not as filling so you may need to order a bigger pizza than you're used to.  (A-)Sauce:  Average flavor, not too sweet or too tart.  It could have been laid on a little thicker. (B)Toppings:  Good quality, again, could have been laid on a bit thicker.  (B)Overall: (B+). A bit too expensive for what you get.  I would order here again for sure, but didn't like it enough to become a regular without first trying all the other pizza places within a couple miles.

10.description: I have driven by the place a million times and finally got delivery tonight. Super fast delivery, friendly driver even better chicken! Fries were ok, I blame steam in transit. Coleslaw had good balance of sweet an tang. Two chicken dinners (4 pieces each dinner, hot out of the fryer, crispy and delicious) at a very reasonable price. Can't  wait to try their pizza! Would love to know the history of this place. I hear it's been there about 60 years.

11.description: My family and I have ordered from thos place 1 a week for about 35 years. Amazing thin crust and sauce. We since moved out of the area but try to get back every now and than and I order it non cooked.

26.description: We tried this place on the strength of its Yelp reviews, and once again, Yelpers, you steered us in the right direction.  The pizza is tasty, and the sausage is excellent!  everything was very fresh.  The burgers really made us happy, as did the chocolate shakes.  The only thing that didn't quite do it for either of us were the fries.Yeah, it's a bit pricey, particularly on the burgers, but knowing that you're going to get a quality meal is worth a lot, IMO.

27.description: It's a little on the pricey side but I can live with that. Good thin crust pizza and two blocks from my house. I don't need my neighborhood pizza place to do anything other than give me awesome thin crust pizza.

35.description: Ordered from here the other night. Pretty great thin crust. The Frank's Special and a couple High Life's- a proletariat's life for me.

8.description: Solid establishment, and a local favorite.I don't think it's the best pizza in town, but its very good indeed. When I think of 'local Chicago thin slice' this place is exactly that. They've been doing it the standard way for a while and it works for them.

0.description: New to the neighborhood and I did a quick yelp search to see if there was any good pizza nearby. SO HAPPY I ordered from franks. Service was delightful and quick, the delivery driver was so kind. And the pizza was AMAZING! Everything you could ask for in a Chicago delivery pizza. Square cut and delicious sauce. They've earned themselves a repeat customer! :)

20.description: Just moved into the neighborhood and tried the thin crust pizza.  I'm born and raised in Chicago so I'm a bit of a pizza snob.Crust:  Very thin and crispy.  I love pizza with crust like this, but keep in mind it is not as filling so you may need to order a bigger pizza than you're used to.  (A-)Sauce:  Average flavor, not too sweet or too tart.  It could have been laid on a little thicker. (B)Toppings:  Good quality, again, could have been laid on a bit thicker.  (B)Overall: (B+). A bit too expensive for what you get.  I would order here again for sure, but didn't like it enough to become a regular without first trying all the other pizza places within a couple miles.

19.description: I dined in here this past week and was pleasantly surprised with just about every aspect of it. Sure, the place is a bit dated with their decor, but I like that. The garlic bread appetizer was mediocre, but the double-dough thin crust pizza was delicious. I would definitely dine-in again, in addition to using them for carryout.

33.description: Went here not too long ago and it's a unique little restaurant. The inside has a few vinyl booths in the main area and that's it. The dining area is clean, intimate, and complete with make out lighting. Only had the sausage pizza and its very good. A thin crust, good sauce, a little greasy, and the sausage is good quality. What makes this place a winner is on Monday and Wednesday it's half price pizza night (pickup, dine in, or delivery according to the sign) and it gets a +1 star since it's BYOB. So for $8 plus tip I can dine in, order a huge pizza, drink some beers, and it's close enough where I have the freedom to stumble home if I choose. Although it's not well known, the NW side of the Chi has as good a selection of thin crust pie as any area of the city.

2.description: The pizza is really good thin crust pizza. The pizza is not the problem! The customer service here is really bad. No politeness, no thank yous, no smiles. So rude! Customer service should matter but it doesn't to Franks. Their pizza is overpriced so I always order on Monday when it is half price. It's not half price on "holidays" so President's day and Pulaski day our full price Monday's because a holiday falls on them, ridiculous. I'm sure they lose so much money on these holidays because no one is going to pay full price for this expensive pizza. Hopefully you're listening Franks! You are losing business!!!

34.description: Walking in, there's 2 old thick-wooded doors that greet you and the inside felt like a log cabin.  My first impression was that it had a nice old romantic ambiance, which would be very difficult to duplicate anywhere else. Also, it seemed like a place that probably catered to the senior demographic, which would explain why its been here since 1952.  I'd say you could seat around 30 people before breaking any fire codes.  Its more of an old fashioned restaurant than a carryout place since a waitress took my order to go.  I went with something that they're known for & got a large sausage (homemade) thin crust ($14), which took 15-20 minutes.  Oh yeah, I can see why people have made a big deal about the sausage topping.  Very flavorful & they weren't skimpy on the amount either.  The sauce was slightly sweet, while the crust was soft, fluffy, and wasn't too thin.  Reminded me of Salerno's in Berwyn, which is a pizzeria that my family is very fond of.

32.description: We just moved to the neighborhood and were hoping to have a great pizza place within walking distance.  Definitely fit the bill!  Great thin crust pizzas and the Italian salad is enormous and full of great ingredients for the price.  Waitstaff is very efficient and friendly.  We will definitely be regulars!

18.description: My sisters and I took my mom for pizza, she hasn't been here since  since her twenties, she always talks about how good the pizza is!!  Well they delivered, we ordered half cheese half sausage and it hot crispy and delicious. We also ordered the combo platter of appetizers and enjoyed those. Our server MaryAnn made the experience  A+ she was fun and funny and a delight, we can't wait to take the whole family  back for half price pizza day. We also like the throw back  atmosphere, it brought me back to my childhood for sure.

13.description: The pizza here is pretty darn good.  Inside takes you back to the 1960's.  Grab your favorite six pack or wine and enjoy a good, no frills dinner.

4.description: The pizza is okay.Their service needs some help though. I ordered online and walked in, a lady just asked "pickup?". I said "yes" and she disappeared into the kitchen. She came back eventually and said it would be out. No mention of how long. So after awkwardly standing for about 10 minutes, I finally decide to sit down. Another 10 minutes pass and I'm pretty sure that they're desperately baking my pizza because they didn't start it until I got there. I watched the ladies argue about something in front of the customers and I watched very slow service for the diners inside. Eventually one of the ladies came up and handed me the order like I was a nuisance.I also got cheesy garlic bread. There was a lot of cheese and the dipping sauce was good. I bumped this to A-OK because of it.

24.description: I'm solely rating this place on the pizza not the dining experience.  My friend and I ordered a small stuffed pizza to pick up and I was designated to be the pick up person lol..My first time entering this place I thought I went in the wrong door!! This place is the definition of my term "a whole in the wall" meaning very small but great place to eat!!! Not the most pleasant to the eyes but rather romantic and SMALL and cozy!Any how I arrived pizza wasn't ready yet they girl who came to attend me was very friendly and told me it would be about 10 mins. So I waited for just about 10 mins pizza was fresh and hot!!! I must say it sucks that the special they have on Monday's doesn't apply to the stuffed pizza! 12inch pizza cost 25 bucks with 3 ingredients.   I must say its rather pricey for a " a hole in the wall " type place but once I for home and took a bite it was great!!!I'm crazy about a nice crunchy crust and this pizza was just that cheese was melting nicely a little on the greasy side but then again what pizza isn't!!! This was only my second time having pizza from there and both times it was stuffed pizza and I'm looking forward to trying a regular thin crust pizza!! Maybe then I will add another star :)

6.description: Great pizza and burger. Nice stuff and atmosphere. I reccomend for people that want to eat something in itallian taste.

22.description: Nice folks working there!  Pizza was delicious for a fair price!  They have daily specials so I'm gonna keep trying their menu.

15.description: I'm solely rating this place on the pizza not the dining experience.  My friend and I ordered a small stuffed pizza to pick up and I was designated to be the pick up person lol..My first time entering this place I thought I went in the wrong door!! This place is the definition of my term "a whole in the wall" meaning very small but great place to eat!!! Not the most pleasant to the eyes but rather romantic and SMALL and cozy!Any how I arrived pizza wasn't ready yet they girl who came to attend me was very friendly and told me it would be about 10 mins. So I waited for just about 10 mins pizza was fresh and hot!!! I must say it sucks that the special they have on Monday's doesn't apply to the stuffed pizza! 12inch pizza cost 25 bucks with 3 ingredients.   I must say its rather pricey for a " a hole in the wall " type place but once I for home and took a bite it was great!!!I'm crazy about a nice crunchy crust and this pizza was just that cheese was melting nicely a little on the greasy side but then again what pizza isn't!!! This was only my second time having pizza from there and both times it was stuffed pizza and I'm looking forward to trying a regular thin crust pizza!! Maybe then I will add another star :)

7.description: Frank's is a great neighborhood joint with some of the best thin-crust, Chicago style pizza in town.  The crust is very thin and crispy, the sauce is tangy, not sweet, and the sausage is fantastic.  Nothing but good flavors.  They deliver and it is BYOB.  Old school place, Sinatra playing in the background.  Nothing fancy, but excellent food.  This is my go-to spot for thin crust pizza.

36.description: Though somewhat mysterious from the outside, this is a quiet, yet romantic place to dine. We went late Friday night and were the only dine in guests, though there were quite a few dine out guests coming in for their pizza and the weather probably had a lot to do with it!  Prices are reasonable, service is good and the food is great ... especially their pizza!! If you're looking for a new place to go that's not a chain... we'd definitely recommend here! Or even if you wanna enjoy a pizza from here and have it delivered ... I'm sure Darrel is right that the pizza is still hot!!  Nothing bad to yelp about here!!

30.description: This is my most favorite pizza in all of chicago.  You have to get their homemade sausage.  Everything is delicious from their salads to their pasta and of course pizza!!

3.description: Great pizza! Best in Chicago! Can't go wrong with thin crust or deep dish. Service is friendly and great for pick up and dine.

14.description: Had dinner here last night it was great! I had a group of 5 and all left very satisfied. Pizza was great we tried the sausage and cheese and also had  a cheese pizza. Both pizzas were very delicious, crust thin and crispy. The sausage was very good quality. The restaurant is very cute and romantic, going back for date night so we can sit in a booth. The place has been around since 1952 which makes me want to keep coming back. Good food going to try the pasta next time and some more pizza of course! And it's BYOB bigger plus!

58.description: Wow- simple and really good- I had the steak sandwich which was probably sirloin on a french roll, onion and tomato- really great flavor from the grill and fresh cut fries. Best fries I've had in a while. No frills here, its all about the sandwich- My friend had the Shish kabob sandwich and she loved it, I had a bite too and it had a really nice flavor. If you want a really good sandwich and fries in an old school setting this is for you.

56.description: LOVE MR D'S!!! When I spent time serving overseas this was that sacred ' first meal when I get home' meal...shish ka-bob sandwich, extra lemon, and their #2 rated fries in the Redeye last year....squeeze one lemon wedge on the sandwhich and one wedge on the fries, ketchup, and watch OUT!!

29.description: This is a five star steak sandwich here, folks!!! This bad boy had SO much flavor and was so juicy that I kept thinking there was some cheese in there somewhere, but came to find that there wasn't and it didn't even need it!!Mr D's is a complete "what you see is what you get" kind of place. No smoke and mirrors here, you walk in, sit down, order and you can watch them cooking your food right before your eyes. The place is tiny, the walls are bare, and the customers are all locals, mostly blue collared fellows stopping in on their lunch break. The staff seemed like a father and son operation. I LOVE the exposed kitchen, the meats looks freshly prepared and there was a whole potato sitting right inside the fry chopper, so you know it's the real deal fries.Steak sandwich....First of all, you have to appreciate and enjoy the flank/skirt type steak. It's a bit tougher, just a tad bit chewier at times. But the secret is that it really holds in the flavor of the marinade or seasonings that Mr. D is using. I ordered mine with tomato and onion and the veggies were VERY fresh, well seasoned and enhanced the sandwich no doubt. So did the bread, which was like a french bread bun but not as firm, almost like a burger bun. This was key b/c is allowed the juices to quickly soak up in the bread, which gave it a cheese filled texture.The fries were excellent. Someone else mentioned they tasted like Gene and Judes and I completely agree. However, the fries at Gene and Judes, IMO, get a bit mushy when wrapped up with the dog. The fries here at Mr. D's stay crispy and crunchy as soon as they hit the table. Prices appear to have gone up a bit here. My steak sandwich was $7.15 before tax. But I would pay it in a heartbeat, as I know sit down places with fancy decor and all would charge twice as much for a steak sandwich like this. If you're in the area and want a quick bite, this is definitely a place to consider.

42.description: Love hole in the wall places like this.  Menu is small, but they certainly deliver in quality.  As mentioned, the Steak Sandwich was awesome, well seasoned, tender and flavorful and was complimented perfectly by the fresh bun.  Need to go back asap to try the Shish Kabobs.

23.description: One of the best if not the best steak sandwiches I've had. The fresh cut fries are awesome. The Shish kabob and burgers are great too. One of the best food spots around the neighborhood. Not too expensive either.

47.description: My parents ate here since they were kids and I too grew up on it. They have the BEST fries, shish-kabob and steak sandwiches!!!! Its a hole in the wall place owed by a sweet family who knows you by name. Its nothing fancy but its just really good!! My family jokes about how sad I would be if I could never eat their food again or if they ever closed how I might cry.

8.description: Absolutely amazing food. Had the steak sandwich and was blown away by how good it is. Great price and great food!

31.description: the best beef around....wayyy better then mr heartburn beef.

34.description: Went for the first time today. Had the shish-kabob sandwich. It was so delicious. Grilled to perfection and the pork was tender and flavorful. Will definitely go back!

16.description: Go for the steak sandwich....but i can't get enough of those fresh cut fries!!

13.description: My parents put my sibling and I on this place since we were tiny. Mr D's is the local hidden gem of the Belmont Cragin neighborhood. Their burgers, freshly cut french fries and my favorite, their Steak Sandwich! If you live nearby please stop in and don't make it to Mc Donald's instead! & if you do not live nearby it's worth the drive!

11.description: Awesome kabob sammiches.. Small menu but Everything is great! The only down side is that they close too early!

39.description: I used to work right across the street for 7-years, so I've had many meals at Mr. D's.  This place is a classic, old-school diner.  Mike and Ann, the owners, are very friendly, and have been working side by side for over 30-years.  The shish-ka-bob sandwich and the steak sandwich are both excellent!  Some times it can be hard to find a table.

37.description: Been going to this place ever since i was 11. Burgers and the steak sandwich are a must if going here. Best fries in the city imo. Friends that have moved out of state and return to chi beg to go there. Only negative are the hours. Only open til 6 pm if im correct. Go here!

0.description: This is an easy 5-star recommendation.I have been coming to Mr. D's for over 25 years, back to when we lived 2 blocks away and would stroll over for the BEST steak sandwich money can buy.  We moved from the old neighborhood many years ago and now it's a 40 minute drive to Mr. D's but it's worth the drive.  Honestly, the steak sandwich and fries are as good today as they were two decades ago. What makes this steak sandwich THE benchmark that all others are measured against?  It's char grilled over an open flame and seasoned with an incredible spice and seasoning mix that is irresistible.  When you ask The Main Man what's in the spice shaker, you'll get a knowing smile and that's about it.  Just the right amount of fat on the steak gives it extra flavor.  Yes, the fries will remind you of Gene & Jude's but they are BETTER!  They are more crispy right out of the fryer than G&J's.  I've had the shish kabob as well and it's very good but the steak sandwich makes Mr. D's a destination "joynt".  Mr. D's is a Great Neighborhood Restaurant!

38.description: AMAZING FOOD!! love the steak sandwiches!  Full of flavor.. they close early thats the only thing that sucks other then that its a true father and son restaurant and I love it!

51.description: Mr.D's is 5-star worthy hands down one of thee greatest sandwiches i have ever eaten in my life!I don't even know where to begin really.The steak sandwich was cooked perfectly.Tender,charred,juicy and very very flavorful.The fries are great to.I feel almost shameful that I didn't know about this hidden treasure until a few days ago.The sandwich was so good,It made me want to smack my girlfriend!I literally tried to bite her hand off for trying to steal some of my steak sandwich.I wanted to savor every bite of this sandwich all by myself no sharing.IMO if you love steaks or steak sandwiches,Mr.D's is an absolute must try.I went to bed dreaming about eating another steak sandwich you know that's not even right.

27.description: Hands down the best steak sandwich in Chicago. They keep it real simple with a grilled piece of seasoned steak (i think its skirt), tomato and onion. This place is a true hidden gem. I lived near this place for years and never went in because it looks like a hole in the wall that tosses frozen meat on a flat top and frozen fries into a deep fryer. This is a hole in the wall however fresh cut fries, and literally THE BEST STEAK SANDWICH I have ever had.

32.description: Great char grilled steak sandwich. Very tender. Kabobs are always great. My only hiccup is the fries, sometimes they are a bit soggy, however always we'll seasoned. Great overall neighborhood joint.

54.description: The best steak sandwiches in chicago!!! Unbelievable fries! Must try, but be prepared to crave it!!!The only way not to love this places basic yet unique flavors is if you do not have any sense of what good flavor is!

48.description: The fries are beyond amazing the burgers and stakes sandwiches are on point every time. No seasoned fries but they are better than five guys.

44.description: My FAVORITE shishkabob sandwich in the city!!!! Hands down 5 STARS.Too bad you'll drive past it and never know its there UNLESS someone tells you about it or you find it on YELP.Old Chicago AT ITS FINEST!!!! Mom and Pop restaurant where pop makes the food and mom works the cash register.Everything is always fresh and absolutely delicious.This is THE SPOT for a great shishkabob or steak sandwich.Well worth going out of the way for.Lucky for me Im all up and down this area so getting here is a cinch.LOVE MR.D's!!!!!!!

24.description: Great little neighborhood spot!! No frills, just good ol' burgers, beefs, etc. I'll be back to try the infamous steak sandwich!

7.description: Mr D's it's a family business. The couple who own the place is very nice. The sonny to. It's like it is nothing special about that place but still I want to go there. Husband grilling and frying. Wife or sonny on the register. It's a FAST FOOD place with a nice twist. I really LIKE the personal touch there. At the lunch time, there is a line. Food is GOOD. We gonna LOVE the fresh cut fries. For me, once a week is a must...... :)

49.description: All you have to do is follow the smell!  This little shack is family run and is a diamond in a ruff!  Their menu is limited with the basic burger, hot dogs and fries.  The must try item here is the skirt steak sandwich, it's seasoned just right and grilled to tender perfection and topped off with a side of yummy greasy fries!  If that's what your craving then Mr. D's won't disappoint and you won't be able to find a better fast food joint in the area!

40.description: Since one of my friend seems to frequent this place and likes to give rave reviews about it, I said sure why not since its in my neighborhood.I never really noticed the building before, it kinda just blends in with the neighborhood, doesn't stand out much. As of the interior, that doesn't say much either, very simple with a simple menu. If only I had enough money I'd would like to be one of their investors to help remodel the place. Upon entering I see a woman and 2 other guys, I assumed the woman and older man were the owners based on the few pictures I saw hanging from the wall. Like the fact that the actual owners are putting in work, don't see that much anymore.Ok so about the food, I decided on the pork loin kabob since the place is calld "shish-kabobs" Also that's the only kind of kabob on the menu =/ the rest of the menu has hot dog's, burgers, steak sandwich's, and Italian beef. The fries are fantastic! Super hot and fresh. I did see a potato slicing machine right on the wall =)As for my pork kabob, the taste was decent. Only problem I had with it, was that it wasn't cooked all the way thru =/ more on the outside if anything. Nice neighborhood spot, all sandwiches come with fries!!! Great deal right there =DNext time I should try the steak sandwich since that's what a lot of customers kept ordering that day.

30.description: I love this restaurant it is basically lunch and early dinner sandwiches only. They primarily have a neighborhood and local businesses clientele they have been around about 40 years. The fries are the best anywhere and i eat out a lot. The meats are grilled really tasty. I love the combos and burgers big and tasty. But what brought me here 20 yrs ago was the steak sandwiches juicy tender and seasoned just right. The Chilis excellent. It's run by mom, pop and son they are the friendliest people.

46.description: Ambiance: not much to say here, it looks like a run-down counter with simple chairs and tables you might find at a church cafeteria. The service was a little brusque with not a smile to be found... except for those eating.Food: Simple and good. Thin (~2 mm) wide well-seasoned piece of steak that hits the grill and half-cooks half-catches of fire is sandwiched between a large chewy roll with onions and tomato. There is little to criticize as the meat is tender, super tasty, and smoky from being set aflame. The fries were a good texture and well-fried without being too processed like a fast-food chain. Definitely worth the $7 for the meal although would be nice to buy the sandwich individually from the fries but  its a common strategy to increase profits because potatoes are dirt cheap relative to other ingredients. I recommend giving this place a shot if you're nearby.

1.description: I have been coming here for many years.The best steak sandwich I have ever hadThe food is great the reason  I gave 4 stars The son is not to friendly. He seems like he doesn't want to be there.  Smile a little

55.description: There are few places on this planet that hit the spot for me like Mr. D's does. I don't come here often, but when I do, I always regret that I don't come more often.Don't get discouraged by the location or the dinky little shack; the food in here is the real deal. They offer typical Chicago fare, at very decent prices, and always made extremely fresh and made to order. I usually say otherwise, but this actually IS one of the places where I come for the fries. The proprietor is an older Greek man with his son working the register, and sometimes his wife working alongside them on busier days. The fries are freshly cut for each order, and double fried to perfection. He gives you one giant russett potato, so it's a really good portion. I talked about the fries, but I still haven't gotten to the best part; their steak sandwiches. Everything about them is perfect. From the roll, to the medium well, deliciously marinated steak, seasoned with a little bit of oregano, and loaded up with onions, tomato, and au jus. I think the charcoal grill is what makes these steak sandwiches, as well as the freshness of the steaks. It's just so juicy and so smoky, and with the perfect fries, it's hard to get any better than Mr. D's. The steak sandwich hits the spot so well for me, that I don't usually have room to try anything else. My whole family raves about the Shiskabob sandwiches from here, as well as the cheese burger, and the beef.Mr. D's is one of your typical looking, but very unique Chicago dives that everyone should try. It's even been featured on Chicago's Best and a couple of other foodie shows. Forget about all of that though, and just come for the food, because for that Mr. D's gets a 6/5.*When you eat at Mr. D's, never pay up front! Order your food and sit down and eat it, then pay when you leave. It's customary here.

9.description: Best Steak Sandwich around! Fries are awesome too. I've never tried the shish kabob or anything else, frankly. It's like a steak sandwich version of Genes and Jude's. Brings back memories of my younger years. Whole area around the place smells great.

26.description: I love the nondescript exterior and the classic vibe of the place. The shish-kabob I got was great. It was tender, juicy and filling, grilled fresh right it front of me. Prices aren't too bad either, all sandwiches are under $7.50, and they include a fair amount of fries.

25.description: This place is as Chicago as it gets. A counter, a flat top grill, deep fryer and 3 tables and a cooler full of rc cola. Probably the best steak sandwich I have ever had in my life. It kills me that I don't live closer to this place so I can go at least once a week.  The sandwich was so simple it was perfect. Steak, onions and  tomato. Oh and a few extra fries I shoved into it. Go to this place. You will not be disappointed.

12.description: Best Steak Sandwich... All sandwiches come with fries, what more can you ask for. I guess their feature on Chicago's Best boosted up there prices, but still worth the flavor of it.

59.description: Great stuff. Been there twice. AWESOME FRIES! AWESOME BEEF KABOB! GREAT Cheese Burger!!! Guessing he uses tenderloin for the kabob. Delicious! Grape Soda!!! Yummy! Run by Father/Mother/Son. Love it!Another great local joint! 4 tables.....Going back for sure. Next time, Steak Sammich!!!!!!!

21.description: This place is crazy good. Its one of those lowkey spots that look pretty normal but the taste and quality is out of this world. Real fries , steak sandwich is the bomb. Shishkabobs r the shiznit

17.description: Been going to this place since I was a little kid... best shi-kebab sandwiches I've ever had in my life. I recommend this place big time!

10.description: This place is perfect for a quick bite and if your a parent who wants to be left alone cause it's not a place where kids will find you lol. Burgers and steak sandwich are amazing, fries are perfectly cooked which means not over done nor under cooked. Price is reasonable and the cook is friendly.

5.description: Love this place!! Steak sandwich and Shish-Kabob would be my favorites, usually get both.Cash only, all the menu items come with their awesome fresh cut fries.The only downside is their limited hours. Always get cravings for Mr D's on sundays or after 6pm when they're closed.

3.description: On the corner of Diversey and Normandy, there's an old white house where you can see human traffic and grilling goodness.  Hence, do not be afraid to walk into the door.  Oh by the way, lunch for two (2) is under $20, so have your cash ready. Daddy J. and I were 100% sure that we made the right decision to come here for lunch.  Speaking of the grill, that thing was HOT.  Fortunately, the Midwestern chilly late August sorta kicked in, not to mention the ventilation here was quite alright.  We had their signature steak sandwiches, with raw onions and tomatoes.  O.M.G.  Daddy J. and I kept on "bubbling" our heads (well, we weren't high), but it was because our food was Delicious, with a capital "D."  Every order comes with made-to-order fries, super amazing that was!  The man of the house, Mike, was very hospitable and beyond nice.  He treated each and every customer like his family.  Although the seating wasn't, at all, ample, Mike would come out, wipe the table, and invite us to sit down.  Rosa J. and Daddy J. were not strangers of making friends with "strangers."  When there's great food on the table, you can miraculously turn enemies into your friends!  Mr. D's Shish-kabobs is located in the Montclare neighborhood on Diversey, near Harlem Ave.  #76 (Diversey) CTA bus is accessible since the bus stop is front of the most aromatic White House.

35.description: You know what I love about this place the most, CONSISTENCY! Small family ran restaurant that's only open til about 5 or 6 pm. Their steak sandwich is amazing as many times as I've had it it's always tasted great not burnt and not dry and full of flavor. They also have really good burgers that have that "off the grill" flavor served with a basket of fries. If you want some great mom n pops food this is the place you have to check it out you won't be disappointed!

19.description: This is my favourite hole in the wall type place ever. Family owned and run from the start. I recommend the steak sandwich. Fries are in my opinion the best in town. Dont pass this little gem up!!

28.description: Love, Love, Love Mr. D's!!!Let me just say that the D in this case stands for delicious;-) I started coming here when I was 8 yrs old with my dad every Saturday. We would stop in for a shishkabob & steak sandwich with grilled onions & xtra au jus. Now in my 30's, I'm still making my weekly visits but now it's with my kids and they love it! His food never changes, still the same juicy sandwiches and fresh fries I remember that keep me coming back for more. I'm still in awe at how he never forgets a name and always remembers to ask me how all family member's are by name. Only flaw I can think of is they're not open on Sundays and they usually close for a month in the winter. Which has me itching for a Mr.D's fix in December, but No worries, I still LoVe this place!!!

45.description: WOW... everything is fresh and love how it is a cozy place. My favorite is the fresh cut fries dipped in the Au Jous. The only thing that sucks is they don't serve chicken!! I don't eat red meat or pork but boy did I want to eat that steak sandwich that is extremely popular!! My bf said it was the best sandwich of his entire life. We have the same taste buds so I know it was worth 5 stars. PROS: Food and serviceCONS: Not in downtown and no chicken

33.description: Great place. So good I went 2 days in a row. Steak sandwich with fries first day. It was very good. Went back to try the kabob sandwich and to my surprise it was even better. The fries were so good I didn't bother putting ketchup on them. They were way better then the duck fat fries that hipsters wait in line for at a certain hot dog joint.

43.description: Quite simply brilliant. I will be so sad when this place gets discovered by the masses. It blows a place like hot dougs out of the water without the ridiculous line. Please diners drive ins and dives never come here. Keenan area that has so few good restaurants this is truly a diamond in the rough.  You can thank me later

2.description: Hands down the best value steak sandwich in Chicago! If you want a good ribeye steak sandwich this is the place. People are friendly and the food is outstanding! Everything is flame grilled and tasty. This is definitely a carnivore's paradise.

18.description: This place is as Chicago as it gets. A counter, a flat top grill, deep fryer and 3 tables and a cooler full of rc cola. Probably the best steak sandwich I have ever had in my life. It kills me that I don't live closer to this place so I can go at least once a week.  The sandwich was so simple it was perfect. Steak, onions and  tomato. Oh and a few extra fries I shoved into it. Go to this place. You will not be disappointed.

41.description: steak sandwich ($6.50) - 3 stars. The steak was nicely seasoned and not dry, but as a sandwich, it was lacking oomph and wasn't balanced. Like I took a bite and was not impressed by how the sandwich tasted as a whole. Maybe too much bread-to-filling ratio, or the fillings weren't working well together for me. It didn't help that I wasn't a fan of the bread, but then I'm really picky with my breads. If this sandwich had used Romano Brand's bread and was paired with a nice, melty cheese, then it'd rate at least a 4.5.pork kabob sandwich ($6.60) - 3 stars. Same issues as with the steak sandwich. Did not eat the bread. 4 pork cubes to a sandwich. It's a waste for me to order this again because I'd be paying about $7 to eat a pork kabob, 2 tomato half-slices, and a lemon. I did enjoy the smokiness to the pork.

52.description: Order a Shish-Kabob at Mr. D's and watch them remove a skewer of pork and onions from a marinade and set it on a scorching-hot grill; then enjoy the spectacular aroma as the fire works its transformative magic!Once the meat is beautifully charred, they place the Kabob in a bun and remove the skewer. This Kabob is a wonderful combination of tart-savory-sweet-moist-brilliance! It is always Great!The French Fries are always terrific too. French Fries come with every sandwich, but you'll want an extra order as well; I usually do... The fries are peeled(though, some skin does remain - Yum!) and cooked fresh throughout the day. Sometimes the fries come out a little extra crispy; sometimes a little less crispy... I do prefer them a bit more well-done, but either way, they are always great here.Street parking is available throughout the neighborhood.

50.description: I'm not a greasy food fan, but this place has amazing steak sandwiches. For like $7-8, it's pretty cheap too. That's really all you need to know.

4.description: Mr. D's aka Mike and his wife and son has been serving outstanding food with lots of love for three decades in this Montclaire establishment.Everything and I mean everything is superb made to order in front of you. Succulent steak sandwich ,pork and beef kabobs sandwiches,outstanding burgers,Italian beef,fresh cut hands down kick ass second to none fries yeah that good. You must put them on your bucket list and make your way over people I guarantee taste bud satisfaction. Very affordable,clean interior and exterior,small indoor seating,plenty of free street parking. You will find city workers,police,com ed workers vehicles outside because they know this place is the kick ass food destination. I highly recommend this place you will thank me later,HAPPY EATING

6.description: I always pass by this place  and it's always people there . Today was my first time going there and I must say the food is VERY good . I had the steak sandwich which was awesome and the Fries. . will be coming back for more ;)

22.description: I grew up in the area and haven't been here in 20 years or so.  I couldn't remember how the food was since it has been so long.  Though I have been on a yelp sandwich review kick and trying different sandwiches and subs around the area.  So I had to try the steak sandwich here.  I have to say it is excellent, probably the best streak sandwich I have had.  Nothing fancy, just some tomatoes, onion, bread, and some good seasoned steak.  It really has excellent flavor.  Plus they give you a nice amount of fresh cut fries, which were great as well.  Have to not wait 20 years to come back to this place again...

15.description: Yes. Best steak sandwiches ever.  Just look around at the crowd and you'll know, these guys know how to eat. Try to get there later in the afternoon. These guys like to roll in around 11 on weekdays.

57.description: Stopped in on a Monday, and the place had a lot of foot traffic, many regulars coming in for their fix of either the steak sandwich or cheeseburger... I had the kabob - it's pork grilled to perfection.  Four (maybe five?) large chunks of the tenderest, no grizzle, no fat tenderloin made into a sandwich with onion and tomato. I will admit the 'char' flavor was just a tad strong, but nonetheless it was a delicious sandwich.  Very good fries, akin to Gene & Jude's.  My son had the steak sandwich which I will admit was AMAZING.  great flavor, super tender, again - no grizzle or fat, just thin slices of perfectly cooked meat on a delicious bun with grilled onions and tomato.  We both left with full bellies for $15.99, which includes two cherry RC colas... the only drawback is that it's open only till 6 during the week, good thing I live close!

20.description: Ok, it's a bit scary from the outside and the inside is a notch below a "dive", BUT if you are into authentic Chicago neighborhood joints that serve up outstanding Chicago-style grub, THIS is the place.  The 1st time I dropped in, I went with the steak sandwich.  It was so damn good (charcoaled marinated steak, tomato slice, onion on a hoagie-style bun smothered in nicely done hand-cut salted fries) that I HAVE to order it every time I go.  I can tell everything else they serve is just as good, but I gotta have my steak sandwich.  Absolutely no frills at Mr. D's (no fountain drinks, just canned RC Cola), but it doesnt matter when the food is this damn good.

36.description: Awesome fries, Awesome Ka Bobs, awesome steak sandwich. My favorite food in chicago. I have always hated steak sandwiches but the one at Mr Dee's has no bones, gristle, hunks of fat or any other nasties. The only steak sandwich in the world I will eat. Just awesome. Small menu but how much do you need. Hipsters, yuppies, and torists stay away please. Don't ruin this place like you did Kuma's.

14.description: This is a five star steak sandwich here, folks!!! This bad boy had SO much flavor and was so juicy that I kept thinking there was some cheese in there somewhere, but came to find that there wasn't and it didn't even need it!!Mr D's is a complete "what you see is what you get" kind of place. No smoke and mirrors here, you walk in, sit down, order and you can watch them cooking your food right before your eyes. The place is tiny, the walls are bare, and the customers are all locals, mostly blue collared fellows stopping in on their lunch break. The staff seemed like a father and son operation. I LOVE the exposed kitchen, the meats looks freshly prepared and there was a whole potato sitting right inside the fry chopper, so you know it's the real deal fries.Steak sandwich....First of all, you have to appreciate and enjoy the flank/skirt type steak. It's a bit tougher, just a tad bit chewier at times. But the secret is that it really holds in the flavor of the marinade or seasonings that Mr. D is using. I ordered mine with tomato and onion and the veggies were VERY fresh, well seasoned and enhanced the sandwich no doubt. So did the bread, which was like a french bread bun but not as firm, almost like a burger bun. This was key b/c is allowed the juices to quickly soak up in the bread, which gave it a cheese filled texture.The fries were excellent. Someone else mentioned they tasted like Gene and Judes and I completely agree. However, the fries at Gene and Judes, IMO, get a bit mushy when wrapped up with the dog. The fries here at Mr. D's stay crispy and crunchy as soon as they hit the table. Prices appear to have gone up a bit here. My steak sandwich was $7.15 before tax. But I would pay it in a heartbeat, as I know sit down places with fancy decor and all would charge twice as much for a steak sandwich like this. If you're in the area and want a quick bite, this is definitely a place to consider.

1.description: This place is amazing.  The thing I love about it is that it is kid friendly. (For anyone that has boys.) I have been taking my son for a couple of years.  The  drive from the city is worth it. My teenage brother also votes this place as the best.

0.description: Many very skilled barbers are within the doors of Platinum Fades Melrose Park to ensure you receive a quality cut every time. Lots of TVs for your wait time entertainment. Just don't drop in without an appointment during a rush hour and expect to get your cut within the hour..

3.description: Super China Buffet was not my choice for dinner; we were party to a birthday party here instead. So I had the opportunity to evaluate the buffet without having to consider its costs.It is remarkably crowded here, to the point that you're probably going to be almost running into somebody every time you get a plate of food. To make matters worse, for some reason there aren't any forks at the end of the buffets. Just spoons and knives. The forks are off on some other table, and it took me a good five minutes to figure that out. In general despite appearing to be located in a recently-constructed strip mall, the place looked dusty and aged.The food ranged from decent to awful. You should stick with the steamed fish; both the tilapia and salmon were flaky and tasty. The steamed octopus with jalapeño (I did not know this was even a thing) was a weird combination of flavors, but decent. There was some sort of springy, fried fish ball with a stick in it. Seek out the dishes with real crab meat.And that's the end of it. The onion rings and anything with imitation crab meat were terrible. The crab rangoon wasn't too bad, but pretty plain. The pineapple chicken was made with boneless chicken thighs (good) but otherwise pretty plain; the Kung Pao chicken next to it actually made me nauseous, which doesn't happen all that often. Fortunately they have Vienna sausages wrapped in bacon, because... well, I don't know why, but it was all right.I didn't tempt fate with anything in the warmers, and anything and everything in the dessert section just wasn't good unless you stuck with the fresh fruit, of which the selection was also limited. There are many better places in the city to spend a few bucks for unlimited amounts of dinner.
