1.description: We ended here after one of our favorite China buffet places were closed and this was the only  one open. The food was ok. They had a decent  selection but nothing really tasted off the charts. It was sorta bland and  even with a bunch of sauce didn't  make it much better. Probably  won't  be back  again.

2.description: This was a horrible experience Pay 25 bucks for two food was super cold temperatures were off kids running around and ants by the plates very disgusting place do not go here city needs to shut it down!

9.description: Typical Chinese buffet, but with a larger selection of crap.  The place is FILTHY and your arms stick to the tables.   There are bottles of hot sauce that you need a hazmat suit to touch.  There are nothing but shitbags with tons of rowdy screaming kids eating here.  The worst part are the people who stand in line for the crab legs... as soon as the tray comes out the first person in line takes the entire thing.    Food is meh.... it's edible, but I wouldn't call it good by any stretch.  We gave it two tries and will never go back again.

10.description: Yeah. No. Not good.

4.description: Worst buffet I've ever been to. Food was awful. Service was awful. The place was filthy and there were dirty dishes stacked everywhere. I'll never eat here ever again.

6.description: Do not go here, go to Home depot for food before you go here for food. IDK how this place has ANY repeat customers. They ONLY thing I could eat were the hush puppies and boy did I have a hard time finding out just how nasty all the other (including the fruit) food was.We will not be back, the place is one of the dirtiest I've been to and it seemed like it was doing a really good business. Everything was just gross, felt like I needed to shower after being there for 30mins.

12.description: Lunch buffet is $7.99 M-THI went here back in December and ate like I never saw food before.  The rest of that night I clutched my stomach in agony.  Was it something at the buffet?Not sure, but when I decided to return I purposefully avoided the sushi.  I just wasn't sure if I could trust it.So, what do they have here?Lots of meat.This is probably how they draw in a steady stream of customers.  I was happy to see all the tropical fruits they had out.  Mango, papaya, cantaloupe, honeydew, sliced oranges and pineapple (although I'm pretty sure this one was from a can).There's a few veggies out there.  The spring rolls just have cabbage in them.   There's even some pico de gallo out, but I'm never sure what to put it on.As I mentioned there is sushi, at least one roll is vegetarian.  There's plenty of things on the menu that are "American" food.  Drinks come from a fountain, but there is also tea and coffee.  There are about 6 desserts along with soft serve.While its a little difficult to find all vegan/vegetarian fare here I think its possible.The staff is courteous, they charged me the lunch price at 3:15 when the dinner price begins at 3:30.  Appreciated because I know I wasn't going to finish in 15 minutes.Check it out if you're in the area.  Be warned, I hear its packed on weekends.

5.description: This was once one of my favorite buffets although I hadn't eaten here in quite some time. A friend and I finally stopped by here again last week for dinner and were sorely disappointed. The selection appeared to be much more limited than previous years. Although I was able to locate a few of my old favorites, I didn't really enjoy most of it. Nothing really had much flavor to it and much of the food tasted as if it had been sitting out for quite some time. Sad to say the quality of this buffet has certainly gone down.

13.description: The service was good. The food was downright disgusting, I wouldn't even come here if someone offered to pay. I thought to myself "how bad could the sushi be at a Chinese buffet??" it was beyond awful. Some might tell you to stick to the Chinese food but even that I found to be gross. If you would like to survive this horrible experience that you are going to have if you decide to go there... just do yourself a favor and stick with the cheeseburgers located all the way at the back, they were alright.

11.description: Huge variety of food but all of it was cold! Disgusting. I would never go back to the place! Waste of money.

8.description: we stopped here for dinner. i really cant complain. the food was good, the options were plenty. the staff appeared friendly, it was busy, but the place was large enough for the crowd that was there. we are  picky when it comes to asian food. this place was good, we plan to return.

0.description: For 10$ this place is not bad. I actually enjoyed some of their food. The spinach was good, sweet potatoe, tilapia, SUSHI, donuts, rice, shrimp, octopus etc. there were some items that were dreadful. They could have some tastier options. And they could clean up a little better. But all in all an ok buffet.

7.description: I'm personally not a fan of buffets (unless in Vegas), but my dad is a fan anywhere. So we stopped in here once. My favorite thing was the sting beans...yummmy!! When I eat a chinese buffet I try and stick to the veggies and fruits. I don't know but I get scared of the meat since I have a sensitive tummy. I DEF stay away from sushi in these joints it never looks to have quite the right coloring. I really really really wanted some crab legs, but the heffers before me ate ALL of them..jerks!! People need to learn how to share. I saw someone with a plate piled high of just crab legs. Save me some dammit!!

1.description: Worst place ever the girls we're no help, one was on the phone talking and while on the phone asked if I needed help huh no your on the phone I noticed as soon as some African American people came she hang up and started helping them fast and completely paid no mind to me seem kind of racist to me you of her part..... The worst customer service ever I will not recommend and will let my friends know about this store

0.description: I tried on many pairs of shoes in this store. The lady who waited on me is a manager, so she also had to deal with a customer who wanted to return used shoes that had been purchased a long time ago, in between bringing me shoes. I thought she handled that situation well, and she was patient in bringing me the many different running shoes and insoles I tried on. I have wide feet for a woman, I guess, so most just did not fit right, and a couple had extra fabric over the toe/tongue area inside where the lacing starts, that scratched me. It was just the way they were sewn. I wouldn't call it a defect. She was real patient and finally advised me to try the shoe store Champs, which is nearby.

1.description: I've been coming here since 2009Great group of guys (Barbers) here. You have 5 choices of Barbers here depending on what day you come. I've tried them all and usually use Ron or Lorenzo  on Wednesdays. After a few visits you'll have decide which you prefer. At this time haircuts are at $16. Eddie and Lorenzo still do the 'old' shaves with the single blade if you want. Never a Dull moment here with these Guys. Saturdays can be busy in the mornings but light in the afternoons. Enjoy!

2.description: Finally a Barber shop that gets me back into bed with my wife. My Barber (Andy) did a phenominal job and did what 8 beers can't do for a woman...make me look at least presentable. The atmosphere is friendly and the job gets done. I recommend father and son to  come in for a trim!

0.description: I read alot of these reviews and see that "this place used to be good before the e-cig place got there." Or "the guys talk to much".  B.S.! Still same guys, just smaller space than before and still get a great cut!  And as far as the talking goes. People its called a "barber shop" not sports clips or great clips, if you want your lame cut with no convo than go to those places. I have been going to this place since i was 17, i live in Carol Stream now, and still make the trip back here for my cut.I go here for a great cut and good convos, if your not a fan of that than don't go or write bad reviews about it!

3.description: Have been here about 3 times and every time it's about an hour to two hour wait with no type of line or ordering, sometimes random people going in front of me, finally when I'm getting my haircut it seems like they forget they own a business and always stop to talk on the phone, text, or just simply leave me in the chair for a couple minutes. After the guy finished cutting my hair he put some gel in my hair without even asking. Worst barbershop service ever. Two star for the haircut or else it would of been one.

1.description: These people.are the worst .when they don't want to attend they "close up .they need to watch them selves

2.description: Just moved to the area and I needed a haircut so I checked this place out. That was a mistake....When I walked in I felt like nobody wanted cut hair lol, at a barbershop? There some people waiting in front of me and I noticed there was no particular order. At one point there were like three "barbers" just standing around while there were people waiting. Finally one of them told me I was next, but I told him there was a guy in front of me who had been waiting. Probably another mistake....Finally I get called up and I tell the guy I want a blowout, and he kinda looked confused. He went and talked to another barber about it, that was the first red flag. Then I showed him a picture of how I wanted my hair, you know like barbers are suppose to do. He took about an hour to cut my hair, he paused and talked, watched YouTube videos and TV, and sometimes would come back to check on me lol. It was the worst haircut ever.When I finally saw my hair it looked like I was in the army? I mean nothing like a blowout. I wasn't surprised. I paid the dude and left.Definitely the worst business I've ever been to, not just barbershop. Avoid.

5.description: I use to be a customer of Vito's on North Ave. but Sammy has moved on and no longer cuts hair.  So I tried finding another barber who does fades really well and stumbled across this place.  I figured since it's called the "hall of fades" how can I go wrong?  I asked for a "high and tight" fade but it didn't turn out so well.  I even showed him a picture of my hair should look afterwards but I think he got a little confused because he cut my hair unevenly.  I looked like Mr. T with an asian fro!!The barber that cut my hair had a very raw style, held my head to the side until it was pressing against my shoulder and I was thinking "what is this?? The WWE?"  All in all though, I still gave him a decent tip for trying.  I have a rule to always try a place twice before I pass judgment so right now my rating is "I've experienced better".One more thing, I had my wife fix my hair with the "high fade" when I got home.

6.description: It figures that soon as I move away from the area, I then discover a barbershop that specializes in my choice haircut. Luckily, I still work in Melrose Park, so when I'm hurting for a fade, this place is a very short distance from the workplace.Lets see...how can I sum this place up as quickly as possible. Okay. You know the movie Barbershop 1 & 2 (Ice Cube, Cedric the Entertainer, Anthony Anderson)? Imagine the younger Latino version of that. Yes, the demographic of employees and customers here is young Hispanics, in search of their fade, blowouts, and faux-hawks. Kinda nice to have a place like this in the burbs. It's kinda odd they lack a cash register. But the prices are pretty reasonable. So with Fade-Inn being too out of the way, Ithis might be my new barbershop of choice. It's unfortunate I didn't know about it sooner before I might become too old for this place!

7.description: My son's like getting their hair cut here.  If you like it short and fades and all that then this is a good place the owner is cool real nice guy.

8.description: I recently moved to the west suburbs and was looking for a barbershop that did the type of haircuts.  I also needed this barbershop opened late since I typically get out late according to barbershop standards.  Well this place has it!  They are typically opened to at least 7pm and upwards to 8pm wed-thur.  Instead of having one barber with a line of 4 people they were fully staffed until closing time.  Terrific!  They charge $12 for a cut and do an excellent job.  Plus they're right next to a Little Cesar's so that takes care of dinner!

0.description: This place has survived and flourished for good reason. The parking there sucks because you are right next to 3 busy restaurants but the service and environment is what makes it the best (in my opinion) in the area. I have been coming to this shop for about 5+ years now and I have yet to find anything wrong with the service. There are many regulars that attend and of course they will usually call ahead to make an appointment. This is not uncommon and walk-ins typically have to wait between 5-20 minutes before being called on depending on the day they come in and volume of customers. There are plenty of barbers on staff at any given time and the owner of the shop is almost always there to ensure good customer service and regular greetings to walk ins and new customers. I usually get a low razor fade and have had my hair cut there by half the staff. They have all done a great job. My main barber is Ace (aka Ace Boogy, aka Ace the Barber, Aka the best in the mid-west) and as expected from any of the barbers, he's professional, respectful, and maintains excellent attention to detail. My recommendations for new customers are to walk in, loosen up and enjoy the atmosphere and conversation. You can also get movies and music from "D's mobile entertainment" on certain days of the week. What more can you ask for?

4.description: I've been going here the last 3 or 4 years. Great place and great staff.For a nice fade see Angel enough said.

28.description: Love the burritos at this joint. It's not exactly the place to eat in, but the food is worth the visit.  Tip: Free parking located in the back. Free tortillas if you eat in.

1.description: BEST Mexican food in the area! This is a fact people. Very very authentic, crazy fast service. You barely eat 5 chips and here comes the food. Real steak, not dog meat like a lot places. And El Pastor on the spot? Yes Sir! Why only 4 stars then? Cash only :( this would be an instant 5 stars if they took credit cards, how many people carry cash these days? I don't. Only to eat here.

9.description: Ordered veggie tacos to go. There was meat in them! Disappointed and disgusted. And still hungry.

29.description: The place looks like a dive from the outside, inside doesn't look like much either.  The food though is surprisingly better than most places that I have been to.  The carne asada is char grilled to perfection, the al pastor isn't too porky and fatty and marinated just enough, the burritos don't fall apart and the tortas are the best I've had in the neighborhood. Try the Al Pastor Torta ..you won't regret.

23.description: Clear cut, authentic tacos. Waaaaay better than TBK down the street. Horchata is on point. 4 types of tasty salsas w free chips when you eat in. One star short of 5 and thats only because its cash only for a debit card girl like myself.

5.description: This is my late night spot to grab some good food.  Tasty, but a bit expensive. I recommend the gorditas and fajitas.

31.description: I'm not a big fan of TBK so this is my go to choice for quick inexpensive Mexican food close to home.  I like the steak tostadas. Loaded with delicious charred steak (RARELY ever get a "chewy" or fatty piece) and a strong, sharp queso fresco cheese can't beat it.  Unlike other places I've gotten tostadas, these really  hold up til the end. They are not the usual sloppy wet mess that I usually end up with. The rice, the pico de gallo and hot salsas are also very good. My only gripe is that they only accept cash.

25.description: Funny, I always thought it was Taconaz, as the Z is followed by a picture of a taco. Doesn't look like an O at all. In any case, it appears there are multiple locations now and that they've changed their phone number for some reason. Make sure you're calling the correct location, as there is a definite communication gap.The chow is totally acceptable. Verde is on the unnecessarily hot side, which is unfortunate for burrito and bistec people. Please keep this place in business and, if you are fluent in Spanish, schedule a meeting with the owner and tell him or her how they could benefit by better English communication. Hell, I might just do that myself.

12.description: There are few taco places around the city and in the suburbs that i like. You can call me a taco snob. The tacos & salsa are superb & the waitresses are really sweet and attentive too !

21.description: Amazingly good Mexican food, the food comes out fast and hot. Food has flavor on like tbk. The service there kind of sucks it depends on what days you go or what waitress you have.. Yes the bathroom is pretty bad so I suggest to use the bathroom before you go there.

16.description: The food is decent, on the greasy side...but that's dismissable. Have eaten here a few times and am never blown away with the food but it's not bad food either. The bathroom is pretty small and not pleasant. My biggest complaint is that its hard to communicate without speaking Spanish. It would just be a lot easier if I had someone taking my order that spoke English. Not a huge deal but definitely makes it more uncomfortable ordering food.

17.description: I absolutely love this place tacos de carne asada are the bomb. I've had the tacos from their taquero at a party the carne asada and al pastor is amazing.  The restaurant doesn't look like much but the service is good and the food is great my only complaint would be that it's cash only.

10.description: I just moved to Chicago and have visited a few Mexican joints here.  But so far this one has the best tasting food and considerable portions.  Don't judge the place by the outside... The food is great and has tons of flavor!!!!!

11.description: This place has the best carne asada tacos and burritos in the area. Open late. Cash only.

26.description: This is such a great little spot.....I have been ther emore time after Midnight than I can remember, BUT.......It tastes great when you're sober too. Love the little Salsa Trio they bring out, awesome Guac, great chips, love their Nopales! I have eaten food in Mexico and California, this is REAL!!IDK why I am NOT giving it 5 stars.....but 4 is very solid!!!

27.description: This place has some of the best tacos in town. You can also get tacos de tripas that are not found in many places. The place looks old and not very appealing but the food rocks.

0.description: Good asada

20.description: Had two delicious chorizo tacos and a huge serving side of rice, good late night food for this part of town.

19.description: This is such a great little spot.....I have been ther emore time after Midnight than I can remember, BUT.......It tastes great when you're sober too. Love the little Salsa Trio they bring out, awesome Guac, great chips, love their Nopales! I have eaten food in Mexico and California, this is REAL!!IDK why I am NOT giving it 5 stars.....but 4 is very solid!!!

33.description: My boyfriend was in the mood for some nachos tonight. We normally go to Taco Burrito King, but he's not a fan of the nachos there, so we decided to try this place. Kind of a small and janky looking place, it seemed very promising as we drove up. You can smell the delicious grease from outside. I got my hopes up. We ordered, got our food, and went home.I dove into the bag and grabbed the tinfoil that held my cheese quesadilla. When I opened it, I was sorely disappointed. It was TINY! I'm used to the giant quesadillas that I get from TBK and various other places. This one took 3-4 bites to finish, the sour cream was runny, and the tortilla was dry and gross. My boyfriend said the nachos weren't terrible, but they weren't good. I thought the toppings looked like dog food.Advice: don't waste your time. Drive the extra 5 minutes and go to TBK instead.

2.description: Good food. The server's were polite and fast. I can't wait until they expand their restaurant across the street, the place gets pack.

32.description: if u want real mexican food. u need to come here. the tacos that are asada con queso r the effin bomb. i had two of them today with my man lol. insteas of going to the one on harlem where i live by i went to the one on central ave by diversey. and they have the best sour cream ever. my man is honduran and he totally agrees. it taste like something that u'd get from someone house at a ranch. the secret is that they probably put milk in it. this is the only thing i have tasted. but my man had lomo and pastor and he said they were. awsume. the tip with any type of food is looking inside the place to see wut kind of people r there. if u see all these polish people it probably aint that good. no offense my best friend is from krakow and she agrees lol. like tbk. so if u want ur white food go get ur damn quesadilla that taste like crap jajaja. u see in latin america we believe in portion control and usually the tacos and quesadillas r the size of small womans hand. :) like that guy said maybe not as good as the pasadita. but they r way too expensive and the salsa isnt good sometimes. at least here there is parking and the cream is the bomb and free too.

18.description: My favorite taco place in town ... Worth the 25 minute drive!! Best tacos del pastor and steak tacos

13.description: Burritos and tostadas are amazing. Im assuming everything else is, but thats all i get.

4.description: "What an absolute dive!" Those are the words I used to mutter every time I would drive by this place. This is the epitome of never judge a book by its cover.  I don't remember the circumstances as to why I finally tried this place, but I am just glad that I did. This is one of my favorite Mexican Food spots in the city.I always go for the Steak torta, side of rice, and a refreshing horchata. That is my go to order, and I am never disappointed. I have also tried most of the tacos here, and they are nothing but delicious.  My only thing is the ventilation is not good here, so I come out smelling like grilled meats.  I don't mind the smell, but just not on my clothes. I will gladly have t-shirts that smell of grilled meats, if the trade off is food from this place. If you are ever in the are, do yourself a favor and give this place a try. Just tell them Peter sent you. They will have no idea who you are talking about, but go ahead and order anyway.

24.description: Do not go here.  This place has gone downhill.  The food is bland and will give you the "runs".  I eat a lot of Mexican food, I'm married into a Mexican Family.  Trust me, avoid this place!  I would eat three day old TBK before this place.  So sad, it used to be good.

6.description: Love this place food awesome price is great! Only minor issue is cash only don't come without cash.  Tostada is filled with meat, cheese, Avocado the works my favorite and weekend menudo a must have!  Open all the time.

22.description: I was feeling the need to get a little food to hold me over until I could get to the restaurant I was heading to for lunch so I ordered one ground beef taco and a bottle of Coke to go.  My total for one taco and a bottle of Coke came to $4.21 which means it would have had to have been to the world's best taco to make those prices reasonable.While I was waiting on my food I used the restroom.  That was the worst decision I made in my visit here.  It was dirty and about the size of a small closet with urine on the floor.  Then the icing on the cake is the graffiti on the walls in the restroom.After the bathroom disaster I was so disgusted that I didn't even bother looking around the interior of the restaurant for fear of what I might see.Needless to say the bottle of Coke was ok.  Hey, it was cold so other than the temp there's nothing that can go wrong with an unopened bottle of Coke.  As far as the taco goes it was ok.  I was expecting more based on the big sign outside saying "Authentic" Mexican food.  Granted the flavor was closer to Mexican flavors  than say an Americanized Taco Bell one, but it fell far short of the "authentic" flavors they advertised.  It basically tasted good, just not as good as other Mexidan restaurants that do serve authentic flavored food.  The one really good thing about the taco was that there was a lot of stuff crammed in that little taco.Will I return here?  That is highly unlikely based on the terrible condition of the very cramped bathroom and the mediocre "authentic" flavors.  I've eaten tacos at other  Mexican restaurants around town and this one is not even close to authentic in my opinion.  If you want real authentic Mexican flavors I'd recommend that people go to the small restaurants that are so plentiful in the general area around the 5200 block of W. Fullerton which isn't too far away.Who knows maybe the other items on their menu are priced better and have better flavorings, but I don't see myself going back to find out after seeing their bathroom and paying so much for one small taco and a Coke.  Overall a bad experience for me.  I strongly recommend that others try someplace else since there are so many really good Mexican restaurants not too far away from here.

15.description: Tortas are yummy and I am picky about Tortas.  Need cash though that's the sucks part.

7.description: When I think tacos I think Taconazo! I am extremely picky when it comes to tacos. Everything has to coincide. The chips, the salsa, the horchata. If your salsa is nasty I won't even try a taco! Safe to say Ive been coming here for more than 5yrs. I know the number by heart, the ladies know me by face and my kids. They know my kids orders, it's the cutest! Looks are deceiving on the outside so don't let that stop you from coming in. Food is greattttt! Downside of this restaurant is the bathroom. It's so tiny and graffiti everywhere. Hopefully they expand. But even if they don't I'm still coming to eat!

8.description: What can I say? The food here is amazing and cheap. The portions are very generous, and the amount is incredibly reasonable. I like that the food is very fresh and authentic.

30.description: This place was pleasantly surprising. Unlike those commercialized TBK places, the steak here is awesome! Try it and you will be surprised but eat there, do not take it to go.

3.description: OMG I love my Mexican Food and believe me when I ever I see a new mexican restaurant. I'm like lets give it a shot!!  We usually do and that's myself and my daughter. I love this restaurant that I take my all my co-worker and introduce them to my cheap Mexican spot.  There is one little thing that you might not like that it's CASH ONLY.

14.description: I was feeling the need to get a little food to hold me over until I could get to the restaurant I was heading to for lunch so I ordered one ground beef taco and a bottle of Coke to go.  My total for one taco and a bottle of Coke came to $4.21 which means it would have had to have been to the world's best taco to make those prices reasonable.While I was waiting on my food I used the restroom.  That was the worst decision I made in my visit here.  It was dirty and about the size of a small closet with urine on the floor.  Then the icing on the cake is the graffiti on the walls in the restroom.After the bathroom disaster I was so disgusted that I didn't even bother looking around the interior of the restaurant for fear of what I might see.Needless to say the bottle of Coke was ok.  Hey, it was cold so other than the temp there's nothing that can go wrong with an unopened bottle of Coke.  As far as the taco goes it was ok.  I was expecting more based on the big sign outside saying "Authentic" Mexican food.  Granted the flavor was closer to Mexican flavors  than say an Americanized Taco Bell one, but it fell far short of the "authentic" flavors they advertised.  It basically tasted good, just not as good as other Mexidan restaurants that do serve authentic flavored food.  The one really good thing about the taco was that there was a lot of stuff crammed in that little taco.Will I return here?  That is highly unlikely based on the terrible condition of the very cramped bathroom and the mediocre "authentic" flavors.  I've eaten tacos at other  Mexican restaurants around town and this one is not even close to authentic in my opinion.  If you want real authentic Mexican flavors I'd recommend that people go to the small restaurants that are so plentiful in the general area around the 5200 block of W. Fullerton which isn't too far away.Who knows maybe the other items on their menu are priced better and have better flavorings, but I don't see myself going back to find out after seeing their bathroom and paying so much for one small taco and a Coke.  Overall a bad experience for me.  I strongly recommend that others try someplace else since there are so many really good Mexican restaurants not too far away from here.

3.description: By far the worse McDonald's to go to!!! Everytime i go here there's always an issue with my order!! Ughhhhhhhh. Either fries are cold! Drink is not filled up or they just forget to take my dam order becuz they open a double drive order taking!!! Tonite is by far my worse!! I order my favorite mcrib and it came in a bun!!!! WTF!!!! My strawberry lemonade had no strawberries!!! After fixing my drink I double check the bag to find my mcrib in a bun WTF!!!!! They said oh they didn't tell you when u ordered we ran out of the mcrib bread!!! Hell the F'n no geezzzzzzzzzz!!!!!

1.description: This is the worst McDonald's ever! They never get your order right and the ice coffee tastes horrible! I have officially learned my lesson, NO more McDonald's!!!!

2.description: This place is very disorganized.The employees are going around with sad faces. The atmosphere is horrendous..The one on Cicero and Hutchinson is my fav....

9.description: This place has the worst staff ever!!! McDonald corp should get control of this restaurant. I have never saw a business allow it's employees to act this way to customers. Every time I have been it's been terrible service!!! I guess you can't expect much from a McD employee, but civil social interaction is a minimum!!!

10.description: You want to eat sad cow, come here. this place is f****** disgusting. I mean what do you expect from McDonalds people don't understand they can barely speak a lick of English. They are rude they don't know how to take down orders this place among pretty much every other McDonalds in Chicago is bad.

4.description: This McDonald's will mess up a wet dream. They mess up my order every single time I go. And now there is a video with roaches at that location.

6.description: Fast and friendly drive-thru service, good soda, good fries (just a bit over-cooked) and such quality chicken nuggets - it's as if they were made for Ronald himself! After swearing chicken nuggets off for a year, they just may have wiped the official "Black X" status off. This location has restored our faith in the chicken nugget. Hallelujah!

12.description: GREAT McD's!! All-time favorite now and only one I want to go to with the kids.  The place was recently redone and everything looks beautiful! Granite countertops galore including over the trash bins!  The employees were all friendly and professional.  I'm so excited about this place! Not at all like a cheap fast food joint at all! Like they say - I'm lovin it!

5.description: I've gone to this location a few times, each time giving them the benefit of the doubt but each time being disappointed. Yesterday was the 1st time we dined in & it to was horrible! I've never been here where the wait wasnt ridiculously long & yesterday was no exception! We got breakfast items & they were not as hot as one would expect for the wait! Plus they were obviously slapped together! The orange juice was also gross! So I dumped it! And the dining room was covered in dust! Isn't there a health code that states restaurants must be CLEAN!!??

11.description: Wow can the service here get any bad. I've been standing in front of the counter waiting to order but the staff doesn't even acknowledge me. I'm the only customer waiting in line. The staff is just talking in a group behind the counter. WOW!!!!

8.description: *** No stars.I've had plenty of issues with this establishment in terms of service & waiting.After sitting for 2 minutes at the 2nd window for drive thru, I was told to pull up and wait for 2 orders of fries.I was like, "okay.. Maybe they're frying a new batch."4 minutes passed, I saw 3 customers/cars behind me come and go. When I got my order, fries weren't salted, and wasn't exactly as fresh as the wait should've been. I literally come here as a last resort now.. If I'm too hungry to go elsewhere.

0.description: Yippee I Yay!This is what my life has come too...reviewing McDonald's...not a fine dining restaurant!The weather has been horrid this past week...couldn't take the little one to Gymboree because they are closed for remodeling this week, the parks are out of the question, and I just didn't have it in me to visit Chuck E. Cheese for the umpteenth time this month.I took the little one to this particular McDonald's because they had an indoor play area.  I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was somewhat clean, and that the play area only had 1 entry/ exit door so I didn't have to be paranoid that he'd run out the other end.  For once, I was able to sit down and relax while he played, and I actually was able to eat half of my Asian salad..which was definitely not as gross as I expected it to be.  It was actually very tasty with red peppers, fresh lettuce, edamame peas, mandarin oranges, almonds, and grilled chicken.  My son actually ate every Mcnugget which was a shock to me.  The service was a bit slow there...but I think that it was because they had so many picky diners that night...go figure...why order a cheeseburger when you want everything held?  Why not just order a piece of bread with cheese? Anyways.  I haven't been inside of a McDonald's for years, and this was a nice welcome back.Update: 1/28/08Ewww.  I guess alot of people have  discovered that this is a great place to go when the weather is bad.  Place was absolutely filthy today.  What the heck is that gray schmuck around the outside of all the air holes?  Place was jam packed today with kids and people who were way to huge to be playing inside the play area.  There is a sign posted that clearly says that the area is for children under the age of 8.  If you weigh more than 50lbs, I don't care how old you are, you have got to go.  If you're 8 and you weigh 100lbs...you really shouldn't be at McDonald's.  Tons of creepy looking caretakers.  A few of them told me that they had been there for over 4 hours already.  Yikes!  I guess there are people who really take advantage of the word free.  After my little one was body slammed one too many times, I had enough.  There was also creepy guy that kept going inside the play area and I have a total paranoia that everyone is a possible child molester.  I couldn't tell what was going on inside the slides and play area, so I scooped up my little one and immediately ran for the doors. Buh bye, it was nice knowing you.

7.description: I've not had one good experience at this McDonald's.  The managers don't speak English yet they have attitude and want to be sarcastic and they are clueless.  The employees have no clue what they are doing either but who can blame them if the managers don't either.   The food is always cold or they get the order wrong  EVERY SINGLE TIME.  I went thru DT and they didn't know what to do with the McD's app and how to punch it for the coffee.  Then the manager Alex, continues to speak to me in Spanish even though I'm speaking English and she's sarcastically telling me I have to buy 5 coffees at once to get a free one.  I just wanted them to mark it as a punch for the purchase not get a free one.  Get a clue.  I don't want anything free.  Just get it right for once.  I've learned my lesson and those who know me know I mean it when I say I will never go back.  I'd rather go out of my way then deal with these idiots.

0.description: Wanted a quick bite and got a quick slice and drink for $3.  Slices were big like Bacci's big!  Inside was small, had a few tables and a Foosball table.  It had a smoky, doughy flavor with not that much sauce.  Menu selection is very big and I'd be hard pressed to hear anyone complain about their prices.  The surrounding area is rather dumpy.

3.description: This place is atrocious. Everyone who works there is nice, that's why I'm giving two stars... but the food is just an abomination. I've had cold "beef", moldy tomatoes, uncooked cinnamon twists, frozen cheese, and who knows what else. Avoid it if you can!

1.description: Check your bag before you leave! The order is wrong 75% of the time. You say no lettuce, you get TONS of lettuce. Say no tomato, you get TONS of tomato. Ask for extra sauce, you get NO sauce at all.This week I asked for an order of Nachos Bellgrande with the new zesty nacho sauce on it, this sauce comes on the Grilled Stuft Nacho. Asking for the new sauce on my nachos confused the heck out of them. They kept saying the nachos come with a cheese sauce already on it. I said I know that, but I want the zesty nacho sauce on them. They were still confused.I started to get confused by their confusion, how hard is it to put some zesty nacho sauce on my nachos? Finally the guy said we don't have that sauce anymore. I'm thinking, yeah you do, it comes on the new Grilled Stuft Nacho.I explained exactly what sauce I was talking about, he said we don't have any sauce called zesty nacho sauce. I explained again that it's the sauce on the Grilled Stuft Nacho. He said that's zesty jalapeno nacho sauce on there...I nearly passed out from the ridiculousness of it all. Here we are having a stupid conversation because he calls it zesty jalapeno nacho sauce and I call it zesty nacho sauce, which is what the taco bell website calls it. This guy couldn't put two and two together and realize we are talking about the same thing because I left out the word jalapeno.In the end, once I thought things were cleared up, I still wanted the nachos bellgrande with the new sauce...and he said they already come with a cheese sauce!At that point all I wanted to do was go back in their kitchen, fix myself an order of nachos bellgrande and ladle the darned zesty nacho/zesty jalapeno nacho sauce on them myself, but I gave up instead.

2.description: Really friendly staff, great food.

5.description: The big guy that runs the drive thru at night is awesome! He never forgets any of my food, always fills my drinks to the top, and doesn't skimp on the sauce!!! He is always fast and friendly!!! I go back to this taco bell cuz this kid runs the drive thru so awesomely! Thanks dude, if you are reading this! You are awesome at your job!!!!

6.description: Bought four bags of ice for $.99 each. This is the best deal considering McDonald's now charges $1.09. I know this is a weird review, but hey, it's always good to know where to get your ice for parties.

0.description: This place seems to be one of the better managed Taco Bells in the area. It also has Long John Silvers combined with it, which is a plus, as those are now scarce in the Chicagoland area.The service is always friendly and fast at this location, and the manager that is on duty seems to be the same gentleman from previous visits. He is always friendly and accommodates me as I'm a picky eater (who can be picky with Taco Bell?) the only downside of them not getting 5 stars, is that most of the time I go in to order (take-out, I don't trust drive-thru), the cashier is always a different one and just doesn't seem to know all the diff. options for a meal/ingredients, which (s)he have to ask the manager. Otherwise no big complaints...

4.description: I wholeheartedly admit that I love this particular location.  It is in the heart of the Home Depot parking lot..and they also feature Popeye's Chicken and Long John Silvers!This place was a destination for me when I was pregnant.  I was able to order whatever I craved instead of driving to different locations.  I still love Taco Supremes and Popcorn shrimp.  I don't care how many points they are, how much fat they contain, or how unhealthy it may be for me.  It tastes good.

3.description: I took an old pair of three way infinity reference series speakers to Mick.  He re-foamed both woofers and put new life into those puppies!  They are up and running again.  Turnaround was awesome. Took about three days to get them back.  Cost was very reasonable as well.  Thanks again Mick, fantastic job!

1.description: I had a set of Jensen Sound Lab Mode 15 speakers that I had gotten from a friend and the speakers had deteriorated but I didn't want to throw out these two very large units without checking to see about repair. I took it to J & J and they repaired them a very nominal cost and they play terrific now. I highly recommend them.

0.description: My musician friends and I have been sending speakers to Mickey to recone for decades.  A lot of our speakers are Jensens from Leslie Speakers (Hammond organs) as well as a variety of guitar, PA, and audiophile speakers.  Mickey always does a great job, his pricing is reasonable, and his turnaround is quick.  I wouldnt send anything anywhere else.

2.description: Great small independent shop run by a straightforward and friendly guy who gets the job done quickly and at a reasonable price. The reason for 4 rather than 5 stars is that I can't say if my speakers have the same exceptional sound quality after the repair as before they needed to be repaired.

5.description: Top notch,...  Mick brought my 25 year old Infinity RS 6001's back to life.  Mid and woofer drivers needed to be refoamed.  Turn-around was quick and the price was reasonable.Check J&J out.

6.description: This guy is great!  I took an old beat out speaker from my 60's Nutone radio in for repairs and he had it ready for me the next day!  The next day!!!  Great service, courteous and friendly!  Thanks again!!!!!

7.description: Mick did a great job on my speakers. Spent the extra time to figure out what was wrong. And stood by his work completely. It's hard to find someone to do this kind of work these days. Nobody repairs anything anymore so it's great to breathe new life into my speakers. I'd definitely use him again.

8.description: Unprecedented!  Mick was as quick & efficient as they come!

9.description: I walked into this place expecting the kind and warm customer service experience like you'd expect from a small independent business thats seems to have been around for a long time. Unfortunately the gentlemen that greeted me was anything but kind or warm (or polite for that matter.) When I mentioned that I had a pair of powered studio monitors that a friend of mine had left me when he moved out of my apartment this guy immediately stated that they don't deal with 'amps' before I even had an chance to finish my sentence. I said to him that I didn't even know if it is the amp that was the problem with the speaker and that is why I was there, to find out. I asked if we could plug them in and check to see if it was something to do with the speaker or amp. If it was the speaker I'd have him repair it. He then asked if I had any of the cables which I didn't as they were likely packed away and taken when my buddy moved out. He didn't have any power or audio cables apparently either...How a speaker store doesn't have any kind of audio cables for a powered monitor is beyond me....Anyway, this guy apparently doesn't want your business so go somewhere that does and is willing to take a few extra steps to earn it.

10.description: If you need a speaker re-coned, this is the place to go to. Folks in Chicago don't know how lucky they are to have a shop like this.

4.description: Really good guy!  Knows what he's talking about.  Honest.  Pleasant!

3.description: this place kinda reminds me of a dollar store but better cuz they hav more products but nothing costs more than $5! wooo hoooo! its a great stockin stuffer store! got a few cool things in here the other day while my girl got a bunch of bagpacks! good deals 4 a lot of stuff but other stuff is not worth paying much 4 it. seems like a store 4 kids 2 spend their allowance on!

1.description: Great location, near by for those last minute gifts for any occasion. Good prices, always something new every other week. Great friendly staff and quick check out even with long lines. I recommend this location to any looking for good items at affordable prices.

2.description: This place a variety of different things much like a dollar store.  It's very well kept not messy or disorganized in anyway.  They have a lot of neat and interstings things especially for children if your lookin to buy decent toys for a very cheap price!. I tend to stroll in in every now and then never found the need to buy anything but I am always amazed at what surprising things they have.  I will be paying another visit soon to finish up some christmas shopping for my neice and nephews!!.  I don't get why people are saying it's junk they wouldn't want, with the economy the way it is there are a lot of things at the store that you can use on an every day basis and don't break your pocket doing so!!.. It's a discount store and it has good quality things !! Let's not be too nit picky on everything it's not target people!

5.description: Wow, I really hit the jackpot at the Brickyard today. I had happened to see an ad in the Red Eye for Five Below and was like "Huuuhhh?" How have I never heard of this place? Five Below is like a hipper, cooler dollar store with better, brand name merchandise. Everything is $5 or "below", get it? I picked up a cute backpack, Scunci barrettes, a big ole Powerade (for $.69!), a funky wallet....oh! And these little Oxy Clean purse size sprays that I have looked EVERYWHERE for! I was so shocked and happy to have found them here! Anyway, my whole stash of fun stuff was $26. There was other cool stuff I wanted to buy too, but didn't want to go too crazy. I was just generally impressed by the stuff they had ...all under $5. Cool store...fun place to go when you have the impulse to shop but want to spend less than $5.

6.description: Not a bad idea for a store. Not a bad name either. Unfortunately its mostly junk i wouldnt want. The things i was interested in were priced at five dollars but i wouldnt even pay two. Why pay a security guard ali g lookalike to protect this crap?  The only things worth buying were the candies and the joke items. But you can also get that stuff at any dollar store.

7.description: This has definitely become one of my favorite places to buy inexpensive items that I may need and the SNACK COLLECTION is like no other. Everything is LITERALLY five dollars and below and someone could easily get themselves in trouble piling on a bunch of the awesome five dollar items they have here (The last time I came I spent about 40 bucks). Everything is nicely organized by sections and the staff have always been friendly. They have some stuff that you can't find as cheap in other places. For example they have Ramune at about 1 dollar and you can't find that for less than 1.50 at Asian supermarkets. There's a nifty little collection of DVDS. Stuff that isn't anyone's favorite, but is pretty well liked. I love coming here!

8.description: I love this store. I wandered in one day to see what this store was about. Everything is $5 and below.  You can find tons of things that you would at many other store for very cheap. iPad & iPod/iPhone accessories for $5 vs. $30+ at Best Buy - yes please.  It's a no brainer. It depends on what you're looking for or need but you can get lots of different kinds of accessories.  Cell phone car chargers for $5, can't beat that. Not even the mall kiosks can. They keep this place pretty clean too.

9.description: It's just another discount store that is made to look cool; like another reviewer said, they sell a bunch of crap I don't really want/need.  I did want the Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix DVD they had for $5.  Only one cash register was open, even though it was the weekend, and the cashier was taking his sweet time or something.  He didn't even get through one customer in that time frame, so I just left.  I'd rather pay $9 at Target.  Time = money.

0.description: Today I attended the Grand Opening Celebration of  Five Below, a NewChain of Discount Stores, A Dollar Store of Sorts selling everything at the cost of $5.00 or Below.Chicago, a Breath of Fresh Air is here and is definitely worth checking out.A Brand New Store, Everything Sparkling and New, Brand New Merchandise,The truth is Items will cost you between $1.00-$5.00, so not everything is $1.00 but... Five Below has so much to choose from, this store is so welcoming and I actually purchased more than I initially thought I would..:)Lovely New Items in Categories such as Sports, Media, I bought a great case for my I-Pod Touch for $5.00!, Crafts Galore, Party, Room Decor  that was so Cool I wanted to bring home a Couple of the Fuzzy Purple Pillows!Toys for the Munchkins. Books, and Clothing Items, T-Shirts for $5.00, and other assorted items.I just had to buy myself the T-Shirt that said "I'm hanging with my Peeps".Lotsa Candy and Munchies which I avoided but everything was displayed perfectly, Props to the Folks at Five Below, Great Merchandising and Visuals going on here.This Store was Jam Packed, there was a line wrapped all around to the back of the store.But.. the Line moved quickly and the Cashiers at the Front of the Store handled everything perfectly...I met one of the Managers at Five Below Today and he was on top of everything, running the show beautifully.This is one of the first Five Belows that opened today here in Chicago, however more are on the way and that will be good for Chicago..I Love the fact that this New and Exciting Store is here, I have gotten so Bored with the other discount stores here in Chicago..It takes many components to run a good store.. Management, Employees, Company Morale...,it starts at the Top and Customers have and will continue to pay attention to this.. Five Below seems to have alot of the good stuff going on here...I was very impressed by what I saw today, I think that 5 Below will do very well here in Chicago...And because I was one of the first 300 people who made a purchase today I received a free Five Below T-Shirt.I was also offered free Ice Cream but I took a pass.Summing up, if you would like to experience a new, fresh, approach to discounted shopping I would definitely recommend Five Below.So, check them out when you can..I am definitely Pro Five Below..

4.description: Great place for teenagers or college kids to decorate their rooms, and they have some cute home stuff and kids toys.  It's not a regular dollar store with cleaning products, food, etc.   They have a huge selection of cell phone accessories like cases but avoid buying any electronics here... The $5 dollar cell phone charger I bought was sparking and overheating and went right in the garbage.  The $5 earbuds sounded so horrible I threw them out too.

3.description: I came here to get Canadian passport photos done, because I had to find a place open on a Saturday.  The shop looks like it largely serves the Polish-speaking population, but the photographer, Stefan, was professional, courteous, and very efficient - I was in and out in less than 10 minutes, with photos in hand.  It costed $35, and at least I know they're done right.  Thanks for making the experience painless!

1.description: I needed picture for Polish passport and I went to 113 W. North location which is a 5-10 min walking distance from Polish consulate. Quick, painless and easy. 35$ for 2 photos, with 12$ for extra 2 copies. I had no problems in the consulate with pictures done here. Pricewise is for you to decide.  It was acceptable for me. I recommend if you applying/renewing Polish passport to stop here first, get the picture done and walk to Polish consulate to get things done there. BTW, application for Polish passport is easy to fill out, don't pay anybody to fill that for you. Hope it helps.

2.description: I needed the passport-style photos for applying for U.S. citizenship and didn't want to take chances to take it at a drug store.  I wanted to get it done right, once for all, so I asked for my fellow yelp genies for recommendations.  This location is the sister location with the one on 113 W. North Ave.  it's run by, assuming the guy who took my picture, Stefan Tomczynski.  Surprisingly that the only review that has been written was three (3) years ago.  The whole process was done within five (5) minutes.  Unfortunately, they only take cash but there's an ATM nearby.  He obviously knew what he's doing and there's a chart listing the types of services they charge so everything is legit.  The pictures do look better than what you would've got at a drug store.  Trust me.  I knew that because I did it for applying for permanent residency four (4) years ago.  I probably spend less if you were to get it done at a drug store, but based on the Tomczynski's reputation, it's better safe than sorry!  He was curious about how I found this place.  I told him yelp directed me to here.  Hey, you gotta understand the power of social media nowadays!  By the way, you get two (2) copies of the pictures for $17.  I'm not gonna say if it's pricy or not.  Just knowing that you probably need those photos for an important reason, will you rather trust an associate at a drug store who didn't really have any training whatsoever to execute this task, or will you rather trust the expert who appears to know what he's doing?  You decide.

0.description: I had my passport photos taken at the 113north ave store I had photos taken for my canada usa and australia passports All were correct and have been approved by all three different countries. Great fast service and low price for professional resultsThanks again Charles L

3.description: They call this particular gamestop a "store of the future." If so, then the future is bleak indeed. Sure, it has those fancy touchscreens and demo stations, but the staff is entirely surly, unhelpful, and only cares about wasting everyone's time by pushing pre-orders and magazine subscriptions. Save yourself the trouble and find yourself better deals online.

1.description: This gamestop was a little frustrating. there are a few people working in the store, but not very helpful. Every game i picked up and took to the front to purchase ended up not being in stock. They sold me video games that were scratched beyond repair and was not even playing. After asking a few times if a certain game required more accessories, was told no, only to take it home, open the package and see that accessories are sold seperately. i ended up taking the games to another gamestop and exchanging.

2.description: I came here to buy my husband a ps4.. I traded in his ps3 for it. While in line, a customer traded me a cord I was missing for my place in line. I thought it was a great deal because it saved me $15. It was almost my turn so he was seen right away. An hour later I realized why he traded me. His transaction took at least an hour. I was reading the promotions on the window and the employee working had nooooooo idea how they worked. I literally explained them to both him and he customer. He explained everything incorrectly and made it a very confusing situation. He consistently gave incorrect pricing. The manager had to step out to take the long line of customers just making simple purchases. He kept telling his employee to move to the next screen to get the final prices with promotions and everything. He wouldn't do that and even once he finally did, still gave incorrect information- actually making the customer ahead of me put things back thinking he was getting a bad deal when he wasn't. Anyways, same thing happened to me but I work in retail and understood what should have been happening; even with all the wrong information he was throwing at me. I went behind the computer and explained it to him.. Even told him what the final price would be and he insisted I was way off until he saw the total. Then he just said "well I don't know," and insisted he was correct. It was an over two hour long, very frustrating, experience.  I will not return. I would recommend another store until the employees are properly trained.

0.description: O MAN! THIS PLACE IS FU**IN AWSOME!""?!?! I went in there and was immediatly greated by 3 gorgeous ppl who offered me a hand job! It was the best hand job ever

This is a terrible place to get treatment for varicose/spider veins! I came in for some minor treatment of spider veins on my legs. I had the treatment done before about 10 yrs ago at Vein Clinics of America at the Shaumburg location & new what to expect. I had 2 sessions & all the veins were removed.  However, instead of regular scerotherapy treatment, I received the laser treatment & told it was more effective. I left there with laser burns all over my legs. I went back thinking that that it wasn't  their fault the laser did not work out for me & willing to try the effect sclerotherapy shots that worked for me so well in the past. Well after treatment on one of my legs & waiting 2 months to heal, I can honestly say, I don't think these people know what they are doing. All of my veins are still there. If I had to say it actually looks like the veins are darker & there are more of them in my thigh area. Not one area is clear. What a joke of a place. $200.00 per treatment for what? The only thing I got was ripped off. Do not go to this place!

58.description: I'm not Italian, but growing up in Addison, I feel like I had the experience enough to know good Italian food.  This place, unfortunately, didn't bring us any.  We felt totally ignored service-wise, and there were plenty of waiters on staff when we were there.  It seemed like we were interrupting a private party with all the regulars and suffered for it.  The food was really bland and very greasy, with no special touches.  The prices were high for the area and there are definitely better choices within a short drive.  We won't be back.

56.description: this is an ok place but why go here when you can just go to sabatinos on irving park just a couple of miles away agostinos food is good but i think its over priced and they dont give you enough but there Fuchetta is to die for

29.description: Been here 3 times since Dec. 2013. The ambiance is a bit "Good Fellas" but we would put it ahead of Piccolo Sogno, Coco Pazzo and the rest. Service is terrific. Tony, the owner's son, has a wealth of experience at high-end restaurants and an encyclopedic knowledge of food, preparations and sources.

42.description: FAMILY STYLE DINNING...with a FEE! We celebrated Mothers Day here and the place was packed!!! It was fun but be warned ITS FAMILY STYLE DINNING eventhough there is a charge for splitting plates. Confusing huh?? Clearly this was the place to be because everyone and their Mothers were there!! Ha! Our waiter appeared shy and reserved with a slight accent and wasn't extremely helpful but he was nice enough. I just wished he would have explained to us the portions and the fact that it was FAMILY STYLE DINNING!! So be prepared if the menu reads Chicken Vesuvio or Chicken Parmesan they do not mean a meal for one with perhaps a side of mashed and veggies or pasta because my 16yo got a plate with 2 chicken breasts and that's it! And my 18yo cousin ordered the same thing, 2 chicken breasts. I'm sure you're thinking "of course it's Family Style, it's Italian" which usually is but we were mislead because the menu clearly read EXTRA CHARGE FOR SHARING PLATES. Well The good thing was that after waiting a full and complete hour : the food was flavorful and authentic so we will be enjoying our leftovers everyday till midweek. Buon appetito

23.description: Eating here was a very nice experience.  The small bar was filled with men and women yelling and screaming in Italian while watching the Eng vs It soccer game. Very serious about their soccer.We did have a reservation on a Saturday night which I think is recommended The wait staff was superb. The food was delicious. If you didn't see something on the menu they could make it for you, no problem.I had an appetizer for my entree of rolled eggplant normally comes with one they gave me two.  I was there with 3 other ppl and they loved their meals. Bread is offered with olive oil. Soup or salad came with all entreesAfter dinner they bring you a heaping plate of fresh fruit. A nice ending to a delicious meal

47.description: I'm mixed (but more leaning towards the negative) about this place.  The parking is at best crappy for this place.  I did NOT see one marked handicapped parking spot in their private lot.  While that may not matter much for many people, my father uses a wheelchair when he goes out, so the struggling to find a parking spot as well as being able to get him in and out of the car kinda knocks out 1 star off the bat.Service is slow.  Very slow.  I contemplated leaving because it was too slow.  Maybe I am impatient, but I felt abandoned before the meal even started.  Pacing during my dinner was also slow.  Sorry, but I don't like to spend 3 hours to have a simple dinner.The food, when it did come, was overall good.  We started with the fried mixed seafood appetizer, which was simply amazing.  The soups of the day were simple, but well executed.  Our veal entrees tasted good, but I felt it was oily and incomplete as it was only 4 thin slices of meat and a sprig of vegetable.  I was not impressed with dessert - my cannoli  was at best 1/3 filled and looked like an afterthought.  I didn't feel it was worth the $4.I did notice during my one trip to the mens room that the soap dispenser was broken, and looks to have been that way for awhile.  No other soap source was seen.  Makes me wonder how their staff is washing up...  another star taken away for that.

8.description: Excellent service! I had the mussels with linguini in a red sauce which was perfect.  We also had the fried calamari, which normally I prefer the grilled but I must say the fried tasted light, not greasy at all.  We of course had the buffalo mozzarella caprese salad!  Yes we will be back!

31.description: I heard so much hype and finally got to go, but the negative outweighed the positive. Atmosphere is a cross between a diner and a basement. Food is good but definitely not worth the high prices (my salad tomato was rotten too). Service was rushed and impersonal. Head east to Sabatinos for a warm authentic fun Italian night where the price is right!

34.description: Amazing. The fish comes out as if they pulled it right out of the Adriatic sea, cooked obviously. IL Risotto al pescatore, awesome. One of the rare spots to find Mozzarella di Bufala in Chicagoland ( mozzarella from buffalo), which comes from my fathers province in Italy, naturally I love the stuff. Anybody who complains about price, or quality of food for this restaurant, should stick to eating at Olive Garden. I will make an effort to come and eat here, any time I'm on Harlem Ave.

16.description: I love this place. One of my favorite italian restaurants period.  The ambiance: 5 stars.  Great for family, work or friends.  Service is 5+ stars.  They are awesome.  And the best is the food.  Everything is fresh, great portions and fantastic.  Steaks are great but my favorite is the seafood.  And they serve plenty.  My biggest gripe is parking.  I always miss their lot and it's always full.  Because they are a great place.

13.description: I had the pleasure of dining at Agostino's after a graduation.  My own! Friends had recommended it and I wasn't arguing.  Tasty food, from appetizers to desserts. Service was excellent and the overall atmosphere is terrific.  Italian food just the way I like it.  Agostino's has restored my hope in finding great Italian food in Chicago.  Ask for the specials and go for those!

11.description: We were part of a large group celebrating a birthday.  Let's start with the staff m--as they were fantastic.  They managed our large group so well.  Ever present and serving and filling and re-filling but never were intrusive in any way.  They were incredibly polite and very, very good with their recommendations.  My wife and I both had the red snapper full fish and have to say that it was better than Bartolotta's in Las Vegas.  Felt like we were on the Amalfi coast in terms of flavor and taste--simply fantastic.  The staff did a great job and kept patient with us as we enjoyed for over 3 hours.  Great family place and incredibly authentic food.

39.description: What an amazing little place!  Agostino and his wife are both extremely hospitable and the food they produce is divine!  I like sitting at the bar and eating so I could talk with agostino and the girl behind the bar!

37.description: I used to LOVE this place...I would even drag clients from downtown over here because it was a great restaurant, authentic Italian...and that round corner hidey hole booth was awesome!That was probably ten years ago.  I still loved this place for many more years, but I hadn't been there lately.  I'm not sure if they changed owners or what the story is, but we got seated in what looked like a banquet hall...I didn't even know that room existed before that.  The whole dynamic of the place in the banquet hall thing sucked.  And we got pretty much ignored as the waitstaff fondled a table of eleven (probably thinking bigger tips).  The hostess/manager apologized several times (and she did it nicely) as I had to keep coming up and asking her if someone was going to wait our table of two....or ask us if we wanted another drink....or dessert....*sigh*Agostino, I loved you!  I miss you!  But I have to find somewhere else that will actually pay attention to me AND have good food and atmosphere.  This place used to ROCK.  I'm sad.

0.description: When the Pizza Lady speaks I listen, especially when it comes to Italian food.This may be the first time I have been to an Italian restaurant and NOT ordered pasta.  Why?  Well, it came on high recommendation from Pizza L. that the seafood dishes at Ristorante Agostina were particularly special.  Our recent meal certainly validated her recommendation.We started with a half dozen baked clams.  Although very tasty, they were puny.  Next time, we'll skip them and order one of the other appetizers.For my entree, I chose the grilled seafood platter which comes with cuttlefish, octopus and shrimp.  It is grilled in a basic garlic and olive oil sauce with just the right seasonings.  At $31, it's not a cheap meal but, trust me, it is well worth it in terms of quantity and quality.  I order seafood (and prepare it at home) often and the grilled seafood platter was outstanding. The preparation was simple but executed perfectly. It reminded me of a great meal i once had at a little Italian place in San Francisco decades ago.  My wife ordered the cod daily special which was prepared in a light white wine and EVO sauce.  It was once again, a generous portion and perfectly prepared.  We shared a small side of broccoli and it was delicious as well, and I don't even care that much for broccoli.We both ordered house wines by the glass (chianti and chardonnay) and they were very good and were fairly priced for the size of pour.We finished our meal with the complimentary fruit plate that was brought out.  Delicious pears, orange and kiwi fruit were a nice finish to our delicious meal.Ristorante Agostino has a small parking lot immediately to the north of the restaurant.  Pay attention because you might miss it.  We went on a Tuesday night the week between Christmas and New Year's.  By 6:15 the place was packed.  As mentioned, I love my seafood and have my favorites that we have visited for years.  When it comes to seafood, Ristorante Agostino is right up there with the best of them.

38.description: LOL, just noticed this reply.  And I remember it like yesterday.  Think your missing the point.  He didn't tell us it was EXPENSIVE when we ordered it, we found out the price when we got the bill.  Then we got the snooty, "IT'S EXPENSIVE" when we inquired about the high price.21.95 for buff motz for an appetizer(?)  If the norm for that is 8.00 - 14.00 wouldn't you admit it would BE NICE to let your customer know the high price.  It's obvious what happened heWant a good, really good, gourmet Italian meal with fair prices and never being ripped off, go to ZIA'S in Edison Park, you'll LOVE IT!

51.description: Yummmmm. We've been coming here for years, most recently last weekend for my birthday. Amazing zuppa di pesce, grilled calamari, and home-made ravioli that were little pillows of deliciousness. Friendly wait staff and a table side visit from the owner really let us know this is a quality place.The wine list is good, if anything negative at all could be said the atmosphere is pretty routine and the bar is tiny.Just go for really authentic delicious food, you wont be disappointed.

27.description: I love this place. One of my favorite italian restaurants period.  The ambiance: 5 stars.  Great for family, work or friends.  Service is 5+ stars.  They are awesome.  And the best is the food.  Everything is fresh, great portions and fantastic.  Steaks are great but my favorite is the seafood.  And they serve plenty.  My biggest gripe is parking.  I always miss their lot and it's always full.  Because they are a great place.

32.description: Had another amazing dinner here last night.  Starting with the fried calamari which has such a light and lovely batter, it's hard not to eat  the entire platter (a generous portion).  That and the fresh bread, evoo and parm could be a meal.  However we soldiered on to the eggplant roll (the appetizer) that was stuffed with veal, cheese, peas and covered in an awesome tomato basil sauce... So fresh.  We decided to restrain ourselves and split a dinner.  Thank god we did.  The special (there were many to chose from) lobster ravioli with a creamy shrimp sauce was amazing.  So rich!  We took most of that home, sipped the rest of our wine and nibbled some complimentary fruit and rolled on home.  Great service, local Italian community brought great atmosphere.  Molto bene!

54.description: I dined here last night with a group of 12. They were accommodating, and we only had to wait a little while in the tiny bar. The service was good, and the food was okay. For appetizers, we ordered the Calamari, which was tender and yummy, and the Caprese, which was great. My entree, on the other hand was just OK. I ordered the Grigliata Mista di Pesce, (Grilled Seafood Assortment )$27.95. Everything was super fresh, but it was in some sort of garlic oil, I mean DRIPPING in oil. I love grilled seafood, but not when it is drenched in oil. It certainly doesn't state that on the menu, otherwise I would not have ordered it. I think everyone else enjoyed their entrees. Complementary fruit plate follows the meal, with the largest grapes I've ever seen, whole apples, oranges, and sliced fresh pineapples. I also ordered the Tiramisu for dessert, and it was super coffee charged. I mean...WOW! If you love that flavor, you'll love this dessert.I will definitely go back, but will have a different meal next time. I liked the staff, as well as the intimate atmosphere.

48.description: Straightforward food, no surprises.  Dined here for the first time with friends and thought the food was just okay.  We had a variety of dishes from seafood to pasta dishes and all were fine.  The prices were a bit higher than I would have expected given the neighborhood.  The place caters to families which makes it VERY noisy.  I used the restroom before we left the restaurant and it was filthy.  I was glad I didn't see it before we ate our food because it certainly would have ruined my appetitie.

44.description: Excellent family-owned restaurant.  I always enjoy the fresh ingredients and the special entrees that are not often available in the US (the zucchini flowers, the wild boar...)  Highly recommended.

24.description: I have been here twice.  Both times with a friend who always starts with...."I know a place".    This is an old time, "I know a guy", Italian joint.   be very careful, as the bar pours some stroooong drinks.    Even my cranberry seemed strong.     we ended up just ordering appitizers and only 1 main course.    I was stuffed for 2 days.   it was a great 3 our meal.    i cant give specifics about the plates we ordered.    6 apps were shared.  I loved 4 of them and didn't like 2.    i was adventurous trying the new food, but just didn't like the taste.   Fantastic seafood.     Bread was really good.   Atmosphere fantastic.    Really impressed with whole evening.

7.description: This place is the real deal when it comes to an authentic, Italian meal. My grandmother (who has passed) was from the boot so my dad grew up with some of the best Italian food. He raved about our meal here. They had excellent specials and lot of unique dishes. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the service was outstanding!

49.description: So here is the deal about Italian food.  So many restaurants particularly downtown try too hard with Italian food.  They try too hard not only with the food but the restaurant decor.  When you have Italian, you should feel like you're chowing down on huge portions of the old family recipe. Not intricate pasta delicacies all fancy and stuff. Thats not Italian. Thats yuppy. Agostino serves Italian food.  I ordered the Sapore di Mare for the second time tonight, and it was absolutely wonderful.  To begin, for a low-key Italian restaurant, they do have an extensive wine list. The bread served is always warm and freshly baked, with a perfectly crunchy crust and soft, warm center. The wait staff has been wonderful each time, and being Italian, you know right off the bat this place is legit. Now back to the Sapore di Mare.  This seafood dish, served with a melody of incredibly fresh and tasty seafood, including clams, mussels, huge shrimp, octopus, squid, and crab, is served over perfectly cooked linguine in a godly spicy red sauce.  Just the sauce and noodles alone are enough to make me smile for weeks.  The seafood makes it all the better.  Frutti de Mare is basically a staple for me, no matter the Italian restaurant, and this by far is the best seafood in red sauce I've had. The outside seating is very nice, not the best location to enjoy a meal (feet from Harlem Avenue) but it is a great option.  All around, if you are looking for overwhelming serving of  delicions, authentic, wicked Italian fare, this is it.  If you want fancy yuppy stuff. Try Coco Pazzo.

40.description: Always great food and great service at Agostino's!  Their seafood is fresh and their service is wonderful.  I would highly recommend them for any thing from a date night to dinner party.  After dinner they bring you out the most ripe and delicious fresh fruit which is such a wonderful touch.  A family favorite is the Zupe de Pesce (huge platter of mixed seafood and shell fish cooked in a zesty red sauce with pasta).  It is awesome!

53.description: If this place is suggested by a cab driver, beware! Not being from here, we took his advice to eat based on his godfatherly-relationship with the staff. The complimentary bread was very dry and flavorless. Even dipping it in oil and vinegar did not help. The salad was nothing to speak of and desperately screaming for vinegar or dressing of any kind. The chicken was obviously mystery meat pressed into a breast-like form...and the tomatoe sauce was just that--no spices like an Italian meal should have. The prosciutto was somewhat anchovie-like and the only saving feature of chicken agostino was the artichokes they took out of a can. Not recommended if you are searching for "authentic Italian food"

30.description: Amazing Italian food & service. If you like seafood this is the place  for you

46.description: My family has been eating at Ristorante Agostino since they were at the previous location and an up and coming actor was there one night while we dined at the table across from him... Liam Neeson.  He seem to really enjoy the food, but that was more than a few years ago.  Not sure if Liam still dines at Agostinos, but we are still going for the most delicious authentic Italian cuisine!  From the Linguini con coze to the grilled seabass, the food is always prepared to perfection and served by any one of the amazing staff.  Our regular waiter, Teki, is always smiling and is very attentive.  Making sure the meal comes to the table prepared as ordered!The only complaints is the parking is not great.  Enjoy this neighborhood gem and order the Mussels Marinara to start off your meal.  You will be very happy you did!

1.description: Great food and feels like old school Italian cooking at its finest.  We ordered zuppa do pesce, mussels in marinara sauce, rapini, fettuccine alfredo with chicken.  Everyone loved their dish with no complaints.  The waiter at end brought us  complimentary fresh fruit which was really refreshing to end dinner.  Thank you & we'll be back!!

55.description: I like this place. It is full of old school kind of charm. By that I mean there are many misguided suburban ideas going on here in terms of service, decor, presentation.  But the food outshines it all.So what if the interior looks a little like the 1980's . Or maybe like some family member has been watching too much HGTV and went wild with Home Depot products. So what if my waiter talked on and on with his buddy at the bar about the 3-way he had the night before. Eeeew. Whatever. LOL. The bottom line is that this place never fails to deliver.  It may not be "cuisine", but it is always right on with all the standards and the fish is always fresh and flavorful - if you are not eating the fish here you are doing yourself a disservice. The wait staff and the patrons add a lot of color to this place, you definetly expect Tony and Carmella to walk in at any time with their posse. Expect a satisfied, full tummy.

9.description: Warm and friendly place.  Seafood specials were wonderful. The signature veal is outstanding. The kitchen closes unusually early especially for an Italian restaurant so get there early or you will feel rushed.

26.description: Too bad there's not a 6th star!  Have eaten here many times over the past 10 years.  What a jem!  Whether it's momma or poppa that's cooking, the food is tremendous and the service, impeccable.  Authentic Italian cusine to die for!

25.description: I have been here a couple of times with my family for special occasions (my parents live within walking distance) and the food is amazing and the service is great.  The couple times I went there weren't too many people so I hope more people learn about it.

12.description: Best seafood in town. Great customer service, one of our favorite restaurant for family dinners. Thank you for great food and many memories!!!!
