On my way to visit a relative this early Sunday morning, my husband and I decided to stop for a bite just before going to our visit. We pulled into a few places on our route and they were all full and with the limited time our options were running slim until we drove past 4Yolks. We found a parking spot and once inside we were immediately seated. The place was 3/4 full which was a good sign. I decided to order something different than the traditional eggs plate. They had a cinnamon swirl sandwich with eggs, your choice of meat, cheese, and a side of hash browns. You can see it is all fresh and made from scratch. It was delicious! Fresh coffee and attentive service also sold us on coming back for sure! Gracias, 4Yolks! We'll be back!

28.description: I absolutely love this place. They have so much of a food selection that would please anyone. It's a very quiet and comfortable little place. I highly recommend it! Service is fast and friendly! Bon appetite!

45.description: .. What a wonderful experience.. We were greeted with a friendly hello, seated promptly and our server came over quickly and introduced himself (Gabriel) which I love when people introduce themselves.Coffee is really good , as is the Oj and the food was served quickly and I really wish this local new favorite breakfast place a long successful stay.. Oh and the menu is very extensive but breakfast is served all day.  Please stop in and support 4 Yolks. You will be happy

33.description: Very good food. Notice, I didn't say great. To me, if you want great food then you will be paying a lot more money and you need to go to a banquet hall or the sorts, not a family restaurant. The staff if fantastic and friendly. Especially the tall guy. (Said his name but I do not remember! Sorry bud!!) Great  diverse menu. Water constantly refilled. Thought I was a fish!! Must try breakfast one day. I give you an A+.

43.description: Just stopped in for the first time and I must say I was highly impressed. We were greeted right away and attended quickly. I had the banana walnut / brown sugar pancakes and I must say they were Grrrrrrreat. I will be coming more often to try other pancake combos

2.description: A low key spot, friendly waitress. This place caught my eye because of the location and after looking the reviews up on Yelp I figured I give it a try.I ordered the chipotle skillet and I was not that impressed. The tomatoes in the skillet were bigger than the pieces of steak. It seemed like they cut a skirt steak in half and then cut that into tiny little pieces. ProsStaffMenu optionsPriceConsQualityJust not up to standards when it comes to breakfast spots for me. If you're in the area take the time to check out Blossom Cafe, the premiere breakfast spot in the area. Cheers,

18.description: My wife and I went there on a Sunday. The restuarant was crowded and we sat down. Then we waited and waited for service. We kept flagging somebody, but nobody came. finally we did get service, food was good ant the manager apologized and gave us our meal at half price. I would go back, but apparantly they can't or don't know how to handle a crowd.

41.description: Quiet, clean and impeccable service is what you can expect at 4 Yolks. I did not like the watery bearnaise sauce or soggy muffin, I would not suggest the eggs benedict.  However, the soup of the day and blueberry pancakes were delicious! I saw extremely pleased with the service which is why I would go back to try it again!

50.description: Good quick service.  Serves breakfast from 6am to 9pm.  I would recommend the pancakes.  The bacon was a bit over done for my tastes, but that is a personal preference.

4.description: Excellent food, and plenty of it.  Service is good and quick, wish I had found this place sooner.

6.description: Outstanding neighborhood restaurant serving superb food,breakfast,lunch,dinner specials every day. Fresh soups daily,my favorite would be Sunday which is cream of chicken rice. OMG a must try destination. Great service,outstanding food,affordable meals,clean establishment.

22.description: I like this place.Plain old neighborhood spot.  Do not blink or you will miss it!Service good.  Food good.  May try her for a meal other than breakfast.Raisin French toast was okay.  I prefer the bacon and eggs.

15.description: I like this place.Plain old neighborhood spot.  Do not blink or you will miss it!Service good.  Food good.  May try her for a meal other than breakfast.Raisin French toast was okay.  I prefer the bacon and eggs.

20.description: I really love this place for breakfast their food is so good best frenchtoast in town and the waitress is so nice I will keep going here ...

36.description: Today was my first time here and we'll definitely be back! Don't be turned off the the sketchy sign outside, the restaurant feels warm and inviting inside! We had the eggs florentine and a Greek skillet--both delicious. Pancakes were also a hit, and they had fresh fruit as a side. Portion size was good and our bill was under $20! Can't wait to go back.

14.description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon for brunch for my sisters birthday a total of 5 of us and a child.  The place is fairly small and doesn't have much room to accommodate large groups. MY VERY FIRST IMPRESSION I would have to say was walk out.  The place was somewhat busy not to the point were I felt it was ok that were not acknowledged when we walked in. NO hello no wait here  and there aren't any signs to wait anywhere. So I was a little pissy when I wasn't greeted as we stood there looking like dear in headlights. We managed to seat ourselves in a table large enough for us 5 and the waitress came back and just asked what we wanted to drink. Not the most warm welcome  but however we did not leave and continued to explore the menu. I ordered a meat skillet with over easy egg and it wasn't too bad.  Food was cooked to order but I wasn't impressed but I also didn't think it was horrible.  Everyone at the table did enjoy there food and it came out in a timely manner and the portions were pretty large. I may think about coming back to this place because it's so close to home, but they need some serious work with their customer service and this place will be in great shape!..

29.description: I use Yelp quite often, for everything from restaurants to car repair shops, but I've never written a review.  There's a first time for everything and my experience at Cassona compelled me to finally become a Yelp contributor.I have been shopping for a reasonably priced sofa throughout the last couple of months and was not terribly pleased with anything until I went into Roy's furniture last weekend.  I will not deride Roy's in a review of Cassona, but I was less than thrilled with the experience I had and decided to shop elsewhere.Fortunately, Cassona had the same make and model in their very nice store.  I called ahead to ask for the price and was initially disappointed to hear that the model I wanted was more expensive at Cassona, but the manager was willing to price match with absolutely no fuss, simply thanking me for bringing my business to her store.  Upon arriving, I was immediately greeted by a fantastic sales associate and the manager.  Now, I absolutely hate environments where salespeople are present, whether it be jewelery stores, car dealerships or furniture stores.  It always seems the associates are looking at me as though my presence is inconveniencing them unless I cash in my 401(k) to by an expensive item (I was overwhelmed by this sensation at Roy's).  Well, my experience at Cassona was perhaps the most pleasant "large" purchase transaction I've ever had.  Everyone was incredibly friendly without being overbearing and genuinely wanted the best for me, their customer.I was there to buy a sofa, of which they have a decent selection in the relatively small store.  They also have a decent selection of other furniture and rugs as well as some pretty unique pieces.I have yet to receive the couch I ordered and will update my review when I take delivery.  I expect that the sofa will arrive in the quoted 4-6 weeks and that any issues I have will be quickly addressed.  I'm not easily impressed, but Cassona delivers on all fronts and I had a truly wonderful buying experience.  I will definitely be back for any furniture needs in the future.

42.description: This is a place that I really really like their style of furniture.  But there were some issues with out couch that caused the drop in price.My fiance and I buy a couch.  We select the style and fabric really really fast.  We already did research online and knew what we wanted.  Then we go and put a down payment.  We are given a 6-8 week window for our couch.  3 weeks pass (we're on vacation in Oklahoma visiting her family), and we get a call saying that the fabric we chose is from a fabric mill that is closed.  So we head back to Cassona right after we get back home.  We are informed that the manufacturer did not even start building the wood skeleton to put the fabric over so once we select the new fabric it will be another 6-8 weeks.  Then comes 4th of July week and the furniture maker is closed that entire week, and apparently that does not count as part of the 6-8 week deliverable window.All in all we get the couch about 12-14 weeks after we ordered it.  I do not think I will purchase from them again, unless there is a dirt cheap price.

23.description: Stopped in the other day just to take a look around. They have a pretty good selection and some comfortable looking items. Also, the prices seemed reasonable. What I liked best was the staff. The guy was SO amazingly friendly I felt like I was on a hidden video show or something. Maybe it was the Zombie Pub Crawl that put everyone in a great mood. The guy definitely earned Cassona a spot on my "friendliest places" list

47.description: I recently purchased a love seat and end table from Cassona. The love seat arrived 2 weeks early and everything looks great in my apartment! Good selection and the guy that helped me was very nice. This seems like a locally owned business so it felt good supporting a neighborhood retailer over a big chain.

8.description: In pursuit of a couch for our new apartment, boyfriend and I wandered into Cassona yesterday afternoon and did some test sitting in couches. We had previously had a really rotten day of couch shopping at discount stores like Ashley, The Room Place and Value City Furniture, etc. These places did not have fabric options and I found, perhaps surprisingly, not that much cheaper than Cassona .... plus most of the couches were ungoldy uncomfortable and certainly of a lower quality. I wanted a gray couch which is apparently impossible, IMPOSSIBLE I tell you, to get at these aforementioned discount stores. Walking into Cassona I was presented with at least 3 beautiful gray couches plus tons and tons of fabric options. All the couches were very comfortable too, it was quite hard to decide since I was finally faced with beautiful couches in fabrics and colors I loved that had actual lumbar support. We ended up deciding on a 3 person sofa with chaise. The chaise is moveable/removable as it comes with a long cushion and an ottoman underneath that can be moved to the middle or other side of the couch, plus an extra cushion if you want to remove the ottoman entirely. The versatility to change the couch is a great option. The couches all seem to come with 2 accent pillows too and we got to choose through many many more fabrics for those. What I liked most about Cassona, other than the beautiful and not absurdly expensive furniture, was the helpfulness and honesty of the staff. John helped us yesterday and offered lots of helpful tips in choosing a couch and a fabric, explained the different kinds of fabric and how they wear and should be cleaned, explained the warranty and didn't pressure us to purchase. It was nice not feeling uncomfortable about coming back the next day to think it over through the night. We did in fact come back today and the owner helped us place our order and answered more questions. Everything about Cassona is class, from the style of furniture to the care from the staff. Quite a different experience from Ashley Furniture and Value City where I didn't have a singe sales rep offer any information on how the fabric wears or how one should clean it etc. I cannot wait for the couch to arrive! Living around the corner I will definitely be popping in to check out other pieces from time to time.

31.description: I can't say enough good things about my experience here, I would give 10 stars if I could. I moved to a new condo and abandoned a lot of old furniture starting off with a clean slate in the new pad. I needed a dining room set, a full bedroom set and complete furnishing for my new living room. Combine this with the fact that I am clueless and illiterate when it comes to interior design and that sort of thing, I didn't even have the terminology to say what I liked or wanted !! So it was a with a lot of trepidation I ventured into the store in Andersonville, the first encouraging sign was that they let me browse, a sales person checked in with me when I arrived and then let me explore and look for ideas. When I finally had some clue as to what I wanted I was lucky enough to be looked after by John who was amazing. He very patiently went through my lists, spent ages going through swatches with me, gently and diplomatically eased me away from my more horrendous choices and was genuinely interested in making the whole process work for me. At no point did I get the feeling that I was being encouraged to buy the more expensive choices and because of the size of the order he worked out a very generous discount. The furniture arrived this weekend and I could not be more pleased, I had brought some photographs with me of my new place on my first visit and that helped a lot, now that its all installed the entire package works. The delivery was efficient and very professional. My impression is that the philosophy in this store is that If they help you make good choices they will have a happy (return) customer and that's more effective in the long run than just selling you the most expensive item on the floor. It certainly worked for me, I'm back next week for round two, the rugs and tchotchkes and stuff to 'pull it together', under John Zotti's careful eye of course !! Awesome place, awesome people, I couldn't be happier with my experience.

34.description: Modern but does not miss on function. Love the cleanly designed furniture and unique one of a kind accessories. Prices are reasonable for their quality, probably in between Crate and Barrel and Dania. I had a difficult time finding a buffet longer than 66" for my dining room and found the perfect one from here. I also bought the matching table. I ordered a backordered mirror and was worried about whether it would arrive before housewarming party. Alma (the owner) made sure it arrived a week before the party. Sometimes they sell floor samples for half the price if you don't mind minor, barely noticeable scratches. That means a few hundred dollars savings.

16.description: I love this store. The guys are really helpful. I usually spend a lot of time lurking before I come to a decision about buying a piece of furniture. I made my first "adult purchase" of a sofa from here a little over a year ago. Good, clean lines. I haven't had any problems with mine, but was assured that if there were, I could contact the store immediately for resolution. Today I just received delivery of my new coffee table. Delivery guys 15 minutes early even! They put the table together quickly with no fuss, and I am now typing out my review from the comfort of my awesome lift top coffee table!

13.description: While walking to Starbucks one day I went in here to browse and saw a beautiful painting that I was thinking I had to have. I talked to the staff and they were SO nice it was unbelievable how comfortable he made me feel. I came back with my GF so she could see how beautiful the painting was and he let me put money down and pick it up later. I finally got it home and it looks beautiful in our space. Highly recommend!!!!

11.description: Visited these guys twice over the past week (2 weekends in a row).  Worked with the manager (Angel).  He was very pleasant to work with, really just a nice experience.  They have a great selection of high quality modern furnishings and accessories.  Very reasonably priced as well.  I wish we had discovered this place earlier on in our shopping process, we likely would have bought a decent amount more furniture from them.

39.description: This review is based mainly on the great service I received. I've never actually visited the store; this is an online purchasing story. Here's what happened. Desperately in need of a bed frame, I'd scoured many affordable furniture stores in Chicago only to come up empty. Then, I found one I really liked at an outlet store in Evanston, but the price wasn't right. (I'm not spending thousands of dollars on a queen-sized bed frame that I'm exchanging for a king as soon as my bedroom gets bigger.) Back to my story. On a whim, I searched online and found my bed at Cassona -- and for much less! So, I called and Angel was so helpful with the order and scheduled the delivery within a couple of days. The delivery men arrived on said day promptly and were very professional. The bedframe was beautiful, but after they left, I noticed an imperfection in the staining of the wood. I called Angel and he ordered me a replacement, which was delivered about four weeks later. Based on this great service, I'll be back to Cassona for my next furniture purchase.

37.description: Alma and her staff at Cassona will bend over backwards to make sure you get just the right furniture! The store was well lit and comfortable and the selection was great! My wife and I were in there last Saturday and we were greeted warmly by Alma and her friend who is a professional designer as well as a doctor! She was there to offer free decorating advice for the day. My wife kept her busy for well over an hour. The only thing we need to do now is make a decision.

0.description: After a nightmarish experience trying to buy a bed at Roy's (seven months after placing my order, we still didn't have anything, and they were dodging calls and emails), I emailed a bunch of other local Chicago furniture stores to see if any of them could special order the same bed.  Within 30 minutes of hitting "send" I received an email back from Alma, the owner of Cassona.  She said she could special order the bed, quoted us a price, and, after telling her about our problems getting the bed at Roy's, she "guaranteed" us that she could deliver the bed within 10-12 weeks and PROMISED that we would be completely satisfied with Cassona's customer service.  Even though the price was more than at Roy's, the reality was that Roy's price was irrelevant:  if they couldn't actually deliver the bed, then the incredibly low price didn't matter.  Despite not having stepped foot in the Cassona store, we took a chance and trusted Alma to make good on her promises.  She clearly wanted our business, seemed very organized and professional, and had the benefit of excellent reviews on Yelp to reinforce what she was promising us.The result:  Cassona has absolutely earned our business from now on.  And I say that despite the fact that we actually had some bumps in the road.  Not only did Alma stick to her delivery promise, but she was actually able to get the bed here earlier than expected.  Unfortunately, when the bed showed up, there was some damage to it (from the factory).  I informed Alma, sent her some quick cell phone pictures, and she promised us she'd get the damaged part replaced.  A few weeks later, a replacement footboard arrived (again...it had to be special ordered, so it wasn't like she could just swap it out from Cassona's own warehouse).  Unfortunately, that one was damaged as well (it was clear that there was a quality control issue at the manufacturer that had nothing to do with Cassona.  Because it was a special order, there was no way to check for damage before it arrived).  Shocked that this could happen twice, Alma kicked it into overdrive and worked with the manufacturer to get a second replacement footboard expedited, and in the end, we ended up with the bed we wanted.  It looks great and we're completely happy.Despite this longer-than-expected process, Alma provided AMAZING customer service.  She regularly emailed us with updates and kept us informed on progress, and even when she went on vacation, her staff picked up right where she left off and continued to stay in touch.  They were completely organized, and there was never a point where we felt like we had been forgotten about.  Each time we had a delivery, Alma was able to get us scheduled very quickly, and her delivery guys did a great job (they showed up on time, and were very efficient). Ordering furniture can be a bit of an adventure, and special ordering makes it even more so.  All you can ask of a retailer is that they keep their promises, do their best, and treat you properly.  Cassona did all of that.  The damage problems weren't their fault:  all they could do is react to those problems as quickly as possible and try to make things right.  And that's EXACTLY what they did.  If not for the manufacturer's quality issues, Cassona would have delivered the bed several weeks earlier than promised, and that's how they should be judged (along with how they worked to resolve the problems).  That's why I wanted to leave such a thorough review:  they deserved to be acknowledged for their excellent efforts.  I would ABSOLUTELY order from Cassona again, and if you're reading this, you should too.  They will do everything possible to make sure you have the best possible experience.

38.description: It's only in the last few years that I've graduated from Target and IKEA into the world of good furniture. In that brief time I've come to really appreciate the guys at Cassona in Andersonville. (Sergio and Tony I *think*).Totally helpful ... they deliver honest (not sales based) opinions when you ask, are very patient when you have color swatches spread out all over their floor, and are just fun to talk to.

51.description: Gorgeous furniture, v. unusual. Well made, sturdy - really unusual, creative pieces here.

27.description: We love our new sofa from Cassona! The staff was super fun and very helpful. Totally check it out for all of your decorating needs in Andersonville.

32.description: I've been shopping here for accessories since I've moved to Chicago but recently decided to purchase a sofa for my new place. The small staff was beyond helpful and patient with all of my questions. It wasn't your typical furniture store environment. I spent what felt like hours going through sofa styles and swatches while the staff remained helpful, never making me feel pressured. The Sofa arrived last week (on time) and I couldn't be happier! Definitely  recommend this shop!

48.description: I have bought 2 beautiful furniture pieces from Cassona, as well as a statue named Gorda. I love the furniture in this store. They were delivered very fast and on time. However, I tried to purchase an ottoman and placed the order. I put a deposit down and waited the 6-week estimated time. Then, I was told it would be another month. Then, I was told after that, another month. And so on, until 8 months passed and I finally got my money back because I was tired of waiting. The people are nice there, but the store needs to cut off their suppliers who can't produce. The store worked with me to decrease the cost for the delay and offered free delivery, but enough was enough. I'm bummed because I liked the ottoman. Long story short, I think the furniture is top notch. I wouldn't buy anything that wasn't in stock.

44.description: Got a couch and chair here with the fabric I wanted for about 1/3 the price of Crate and Barrel / Room and Board equivalents.  Delivery was prompt and as promised.A minor complaint - when they delivered the couch it baaaaarrrrely fit through our hall and scratched our wall.  Their initial call was to tell us that "our delivery driver told you it was a tight fit and you said to go ahead so we shouldn't be responsible."  Well, there was a language barrier there, so I'm not sure how that conversation could have occurred.  I just hate when, before getting the whole story,  a store manager sticks up for their employee at the expense of the customer.It took a couple of weeks, but at the end of the day the owner from the Evanston store came by to look at the minor damage and it was fixed appropriately at no cost to us, so was just a small deal in an overall smooth transaction.  If I needed something else to furnish my place I would probably check Cassona first and hope for another good deal.

24.description: I went back to Cassona and ordered a media console. The staff was very helpful and my furniture arrive early and the delivery men were on time! Another great experience with Cassona. If you are in Andersonville you should stop on this great shop.

7.description: Really like the contemporary yet warm-homey furniture, art and accessories here! I returned twice in two days!

49.description: Lots of the standard, practical furniture pieces most people need at least a few of (yeah, I'd love to fill my place with Eames and Nelson, but I've got two college educations to fund) but lots of unique stuff.If you want something funky and modern but of decent quality, this is a destination store.  I fell in love with the chair/bench made from a gathered bundle of vertical wood.  Now that you know I'm not a furniture or architecture critic, check out the photo I uploaded - yelp.com/biz_photos/O4Xq….  This chair was incredibly comfortable and designed like nothing I've ever seen.Prices are fantastic!

40.description: I really have to give props to this place.  Our sales guy, Angel, was not only patient and not pushy, he was truly helpful in assisting us in choosing some nice pieces, even dissuading us from several things because he didn't think we should spend that much, etc.  The best part?  After having already ordered a bed, sofa, and chair from Pottery Barn, we walked out with the same -- plus a rug and two lamps -- for $800 less than we spent at PB for those three items.  (Needless to say, I cancelled my PB order and went out for a nice dinner!)  Anyway, SUPPORT this local business -- you'll get a better deal, too.

30.description: Potentially one of the best furniture stores in the city.  It's a small store, but wonderful taste, very high quality/unique pieces, and reasonable prices.   We just bought a really unique bedroom set and coffee table from there.  John and Angel are extremely helpful and knowledgeable (They even let you come in with your dogs if out on a walk).  I liked the style of something on the floor, but it wasn't the right piece.  John spent time with me going through their catalogs from that furniture maker as well as others until we found just the right pieces.   They were delivered last weekend and I'm in love with them. I also commissioned an independent furniture maker to design/build 4 custom pieces of furniture for me. While at my house, he commented on the high quality of the bedroom set from Cassona. If in the market for furniture, well worth the trip to Andersonville to check out their store.  Furniture is great, prices are great, and John and Angel are wonderful.

46.description: We bought a large furniture item here, and the price and service were great.  The price was not the cheapest out there, but the people that work here were so nice and helpful that it was worth the extra money.  the cassona in evanston is also good, though I think the selection in andersonville is better.

1.description: To begin, I do not yet have my couch but I have to compliment Cassona just for the experience of shopping for a couch.  At the beginning of my visits to the store it was just to enjoy the beauty of everything.  All the pieces are amazing!I visited this store many a time with various friends and family members - they agreed with my assessment.  Then there's John and Angel.  No matter the time or day I was there John and Angel were ready to help and just as ready to stay out of the way.  My father brings his own measuring tape holstered to his belt.  Angel remarked "They don't need our help. This man came prepared!"   However, their help and advice is invaluable and they think of every detail of which I had no idea could be involved in a couch. I'm fully confident that I'll love my couch and I'll update when I get it.

9.description: I've had nothing but excellent experiences with Cassona:1)  I purchased a Rowe sofa from Cassona a few years ago that I absolutely LOVE!  However, I've had some issues with the springs.  The parts are under warranty but full warranty service with labor is expired on the sofa.  I reached out to Cassona to ask them if they could assist me with figuring out how to get it repaired, and Alma not only first contacted Rowe and found out all of the details about what was and was not covered, and how to handle things through ROWE, if needed, but she actually spent the next month getting quotes from local repair shops and was able to help me find a very inexpensive, but highly qualified, in-home repair person.2)  I purchased a coffee table that was marked down to sell, first they gave me a huge discount on the delivery, and then, when the delivery person was out sick, Alma showed up with a young man from the shop.  They brought the table to me in her vehicle and assembled it for me instead of making me wait and reschedule with their delivery service.I love their interesting and beautiful furniture, and I can't say enough good things about their service.  This is truly a fantastic place to shop for furniture!

26.description: I recently bought a sofa here. Angel was super helpful when picking it out. There are a lot more things to choose when ordering than I had planned for, but they made it easy to do. The sofa is made in 'Merica, which is nice, and was custom made shipped in 6 weeks. The quality seems very good, and the guarantee was also pretty solid. They will replace the foam basically forever if it ever sags. The price was pretty decent too, certainly not IKEA, but quite a bit cheaper than Crate and Barrel and the like, and it looks great.

25.description: This review is long overdue, my new sofa arrived in October and I couldn't be happier.  Prices are better than most similar larger chains, and the quality is really good.  I was happy to support products that are made in the USA and certified sustainable.  The thing that will keep me returning to Cassona though is the amazing customer service.  John was amazing to work with, very patient with my million questions and helpful with fabric selections (especially something that would hold up to pets) and different options that he could work out with the manufacturer (things like tufting, pillow splits, leg design). I felt like a VIP customer even though I was only purchasing one sofa and I truely got a custom piece.  I called back with a few follow up questions and even the owner had knowledge of my order.  Angel provided great communication regarding delivery and the delivery people were helpful as well.  Overall great service from everyone at the store, I have recommended Cassona to everyone who asks about furniture and can't wait to go back when I'm able to make another purchase.

12.description: This is the first place that I check when I need any new furniture.  I bought my first "grown-up" sofa from John last year and have been a loyal customer ever since.  The reason is because of the staff (John has been my main salesman) and the care that is given to make sure that everything is perfect from the initial order to any issues that might come up once the pieces are in your home.  The prices are fair, the selection is great, and overall it is a fantastic place to find your new furniture.Michael B., Lincoln Park

21.description: Had a great experience at the store! John was knowledgeable about the furniture and very helpful in helping me choose the color for my couch and pillows. The store has a good selection of furniture from all over the world and I was very excited I finally found the couch I loved after looking for 2 months. I am definitely shopping there for more furniture when I need it!

17.description: I recently bought a sofa here. Angel was super helpful when picking it out. There are a lot more things to choose when ordering than I had planned for, but they made it easy to do. The sofa is made in 'Merica, which is nice, and was custom made shipped in 6 weeks. The quality seems very good, and the guarantee was also pretty solid. They will replace the foam basically forever if it ever sags. The price was pretty decent too, certainly not IKEA, but quite a bit cheaper than Crate and Barrel and the like, and it looks great.

10.description: I bought my furniture from them and they have such a great staff!

5.description: Just moved to the area and walked by the store a couple times. Window had great items so we went in. We really liked a lot of pieces, but I'm so indecisive so we went in another 4 times. Each time the staff was amazing, patient, helpful but not at all pushy. They gave you their honest opinion and let you go from there.  Angel and John are amazing. Finally on the 4th time in, we purchased our sectional sofa. John was so incredibly patient with me as I walked around the store a million times, carrying swatches all around, then he stayed late to make sure our order went in on the same day.  I highly recommend this place and plan to be back to get more items very soon.

3.description: Jessica and I love working with the Cassona team - Alma, Angel, and John. They are very friendly and really know their stuff! We like that they work with domestic manufacturers as opposed to big box stores that source primarily from overseas. Not to mention, you can customize to your liking.We purchased a couch earlier this year and have been very pleased with the quality of the piece as well as the service delivered by the Cassona team. John guided us throughout the entire process from design to caring for the fabric.Currently, we are taking a look at purchasing a leather accent chair. We stopped by the shop last weekend to take a look. Alma and Angel took the time to educate us on the leather varieties and provided us with a couple of great options. We are so excited to purchase within the next few months!!Always a pleasure to stop by, say hello, and see what's new in the store!

35.description: I recently bought a lovely set of dining room chairs that I had my eye on for ages.  The wait was worth it as the chairs are lovely and very comfortable. The staff, especially Angel, was very friendly and helpful and even assisted with putting a few of the chairs together when I was having trouble.  Well priced and unique furniture, great location and superb staff!

19.description: Stopped in the other day just to take a look around. They have a pretty good selection and some comfortable looking items. Also, the prices seemed reasonable. What I liked best was the staff. The guy was SO amazingly friendly I felt like I was on a hidden video show or something. Maybe it was the Zombie Pub Crawl that put everyone in a great mood. The guy definitely earned Cassona a spot on my "friendliest places" list

28.description: I purchased a couch here 4 years ago and its the coziest coolest couch ever. Recently I decided to update my loft with a sectional and I knew exactly where to get it. The guys who work here are super helpful and fun. I had a minor problem with the button on my first couch coming loose and Angel said he would email the manufacturer about it to see what they could do. I noticed a huge stack of papers and notes behind the desk and I was thinking, he clearly has tons to do, i wonder if he will even remember this.This is what earns you 5 stars.. following through with what you say you will do and going above and beyond for your costumers. Within 2 days he had emailed the manufacturer and cced me on the email. The other thing that is impressive about Cassona is you are getting a custom made couch for a very good price. You choose your couch fabric, pillow fabric and what style of wood you want for the legs.  They also have some really neat lamps and picture frames. Thank you Cassona for making couch shopping enjoyable!

45.description: Purchased an ottoman/cocktail table from here and was told 6 weeks for delivery got it in 3! very helpful and friendly sales staff. I will be buying more furniture here in the future.

33.description: Over the years, I have bought many beautiful items from Cassona and I would highly recommend anyone looking for furniture to stop in and have a look. The store is full of unique pieces at very reasonable prices. The owner, Alma, is very friendly and helpful, and can order many items not in the showroom, if necessary.  The mattresses were surprisingly affordable and comfortable; as a local chiropractor, this was of tremendous value to me!

43.description: We've been in Cassona several times since this past summer.  Even though the first few times we were just browsing, we were greeted in an extremely friendly manner and made to feel welcome.  There were some great art prints that I wanted but just couldn't afford this past summer.  Yesterday, I walked in to find the paintings I wanted at a 30-40 percent discount.  I bought three.  The two gentlemen who work in the store are very personable, will chat with you about a multitude of topics, and be genuinely interested in anything you have to say.  I really love shopping and supporting local businesses; I will go back to Cassona and purchase other items as I can afford them ;-)(fyi-their fashionably classic items even non-sale priced are reasonably priced, but I'm on a budget)

2.description: John - you the MAN. This review is dedicated to John at Cassona. And so begins my letter (only slightly dramatized for effect).Dear John,Before I walked into Cassona I had the fear of the sofa gods wedged deep in my soul. Wash codes? Mid-century styling? Rolled arms? What is happening? Please no. You saw me for the deer-in-the-headlights I was and adapted accordingly. You did an outstanding job of giving me your best suggestions based on what I liked. As time went on, and you thought I could handle it, you slowly gave me information about why the couches you had suggested were high quality. All the while being patient with my naivety and indecisiveness. It was perfect.And in the end? I purchased an outstanding sofa. (Mid-century light grey with WS wash codes for those of you playing at home.)Thank you John!All my best,MattMy suggestion to you, reader? I think you know that I'll be back.

18.description: Lots of the standard, practical furniture pieces most people need at least a few of (yeah, I'd love to fill my place with Eames and Nelson, but I've got two college educations to fund) but lots of unique stuff.If you want something funky and modern but of decent quality, this is a destination store.  I fell in love with the chair/bench made from a gathered bundle of vertical wood.  Now that you know I'm not a furniture or architecture critic, check out the photo I uploaded - yelp.com/biz_photos/O4Xq….  This chair was incredibly comfortable and designed like nothing I've ever seen.Prices are fantastic!

41.description: Who knew Andersonville had such cute shops?  Not I!  I need to head up this way more often, if only to come to places like Cassona.After brunch Sarah B and I walked around for a bit, and we popped in here to look around.  They have lots of great modern but classic furniture (which is what I like) at really inexpensive prices.  I immediately found many, many things that I loved...  but then my wallet remembered I'm unemployed.  (That's *really* starting to crimp my style, yo.)I actually found some really cool coasters that match some prints I have hanging in my living room so I ended up buying them since they were so inexpensive.The man working here was SO nice, and fun to talk to.  While we browsed and I admired a couch he pointed out some fun features of it (yeah, I'm SO coming back for it when I get a job!), and while he checked me out we talked about traveling.  When I said I was German and Irish, he laughed and said I must know how to party.  Hehe.  He was super fun, and I'll definitely be coming back here when I have paychecks again.

50.description: Fun furniture, great accessories.  You will not find repeats of items found here- in other stores.  Some very interesting wall hangings hand created by traditional artisans in Mexico.  Fantastic colors in bed linens, custom orders.  My favorites?  Incredible, heavy, but well designed ceramic wall tiles in these funky red/mocha and bit of pumpkin colors with leaf designs. Sounds strange I know, but a fantastic accessory, they had 3 different tiles, at 19.95 each, they were an absolute steal!  I WILL be back!!

4.description: We have had our Rowe sectional from Cassona for almost a month, and are very happy with it.  It seems like the reviewers here, on the whole, have already nailed it: Angel and company are terrific. They're experts, and they really try to make you an expert, so that you can make informed decisions. I walked out of Cassona really feeling like we made a sound, informed decision, and I cannot say that about a lot of places. A truly rare, pleasant and ultimately rewarding experience.

6.description: I'll preface this review by saying this was among the last stops we went to when looking for a couch.  We tried everything from large chains to other small boutiques and everything in the middle.  John Zotti is by far the most helpful sales associate I have ever met in the history of my furniture buying life.  He went into specifics about the quality of each different manufacturer without being asked and possessed a level of knowledge that others did not come close to as well as informing us of what to look for if we were to buy elsewhere.  The store carries manufacturers that you can find in other local stores (Younger, Rowe, etc.), but the prices are comparable and the customer service is second to none.  If you want to find a great sofa and receive a free education on what to look for - go here and ask for John, you will not be disappointed!

22.description: You really get what you pay for in terms of quality here. My husband and I were able to find a quite affordable dining set here BUT it has not held up well at all. Just a bit more than a year later, two of the chairs are broken and the cheap finish on all of them has come off. They're also a non-standard size, so your typical dining chair covers don't work for them! Another issue we had with Cassona is that the merchandise was NOT delivered when promised. We ended up waiting for three months and were then delivered a dining table with warped wood on top. Another eight weeks later, we got the crappy set we'll soon have to trade in.Yes, the people who work here are nice, but why shouldn't they be? There are a lot of nice people in the world and being nice at what you do simply isn't the same at being good at what you do. Also, they are not so nice when you're calling to see where your furniture is or what can be done about the shoddy merchandise that's been delivered.

15.description: As my sister-in-law (and fellow Yelper, Elizabeth W.) said when she saw my Fiancée's and my condo for the first time, "Ahh, to be gay and fabulous...!"Well, I owe Cassona a thank you for the fabulous part!Having a partner who is a director of interior architecture makes picking out decor or furniture extra difficult.  While I love modernity, I also value comfort.  Decorating our new condo was not going to be an easy task.After chatting my favorite Yelper, Nicole V., we visited Cassona to look at their furniture pieces.We worked with Cassona's awesome duo, Angel and Jon, in selecting, personalizing, and purchasing a sofa.Our gorgeous klein sofa sectional was made of a tough and edgy, yet soft fabric, had an extra wide chaise perfect for naps or cuddling, and a possessed a modern look while still providing back support and having various pillows.  After our couch was delivered, we returned to Cassona to check out a bed frame we had seen.  Sure enough, we fell in love.  Our king sized bed frame was hand-crafted and stained by the talented Canadian manufacturer, Huppe.  We chose the Silk design due to its natural walnut material, and the headboard with five joint sections (or reveals) which peek through to the wall behind.  We felt obligated to also purchase two nightstands ("his" and "hers," if you will) which attach to the bed frame and float above the floor giving the entire piece a 'feng shui' feeling of warmth and relaxation.Cassona kept us up to date with when our furniture would arrive to their store and when it would be delivered to our condo.  The delivery guys were quick in setting up the pieces, cleaning up, and describing any details about the pieces (i.e. how to separate and combine the different sections of the sofa).Best of all, other than what has already been stated, they LOVE Yelpers.  I saved 10% off my entire purchase (trust me, it added up) simply by checking in to the store on the Yelp app.  I'm all about a good deal!  If you're looking for beautifully crafted, creative furniture pieces, be sure to visit Cassona.

20.description: Angel and his staff  are the best!!!  Courteous, competent, patient service, delivery as promised.  Merchandise is varied, fairly priced, and high quality.  I bought a sofa with which I am very happy.  Keep up the good work in Andersonville guys!!!

36.description: Update.  Such contemporary, stylish, not over-the-top furniture at affordable prices.  Interesting accessories as well and the whole team is so friendly and helpful.  They provide great design suggestions and they are not pushy.  They were so patient with us as we shopped and even played with my daughter and helped her walk!  Tip:  They have a parking lot in the back.  Wish I had known!Didn't end up buying any furniture but the owner(?) was so friendly.  She even offered for us to bring the chair home to see if it looks good there.  For most of their furniture, they have many fabric choices to choose from.  Would love to go back for other furniture.

14.description: I just received my couches today . The customer service is good in the store not so great by phone . My order took a lot to be delivered . The quality it's average  to be honest I was expecting better quality. I will update my review once I get more use of my couch .

1.description: Very rude, don't go to this place unless you're Polish. That's how they made me feel. I'm sure the food is probably very good, but I'll never find out now. My wife told me last year they treated her the same way, so I figured I'd go this time. The result was no different, just poor customer service.

9.description: Kolatek has terrific,fresh deli items. Homemade soups that are delicious,a good variety of baked that day European breads. If you are lucky enough pick up a just smoked trout....AMAZING!. Pierogies from the deli are like Grandmas. Heres the only downside NO ONE speaks a word of English, just grunt & point . (sometimes the lines are long)

12.description: They bake the best bread on the world!!! My favorite is Adam & Eve - you must TRY it - it's delicious and healthy. I drive more than 20 miles once a month to buy 10 of them. [I freeze it and eat every day as a "fresh" one after defrosting]. It's contains spelt and rye flour, sourdough, honey, yoghurt, flax and sesame seeds. I love it!!!

21.description: I love Polish sausage, but unfortunately my head gets puffy after I eat your run on the mill Polish sausage because of the MSG, nitrates and other chemicals they add.  To my surprise they have some all natural Polish sausage at Kolatek's that I can eat to my hearts content.  Be sure to ask for it because some of the other sausages do have the usual suspect ingredients.They also have a nice variety of organic stuff, nice cheeses, and great baked goods.  Sort of like a Trader Joe's but no booze, and with a bakery and ready to eat stuff like they have at Wholefoods.  This is a good place if you want some nice organic and natural products mixed in with some ethnic staples.  I highly recommend the nalesniki, good stuff! It's also nice to be able to fill up your cart and pay $50 instead of the $150 I usually blow at Wholefoods.  I shop here every couple of weeks.

16.description: Checked out this place for our wedding cake after receiving a tip from one of our Polish friends. All in all, I was flexible with cake and the price was very right. My husband wanted something more Polish and less Americano super sweet and typical. We met with Bart and he helped us pick out cakes and made suggestions. We  had 2 layers of tiramisu w/ mandarin oranges, and 1 layer of 'Ambassador' cake. Both cakes are delicate, have some fruit and they are GOOD! Picked up some fresh rye and it was still warm- YUMMY!!! Will be doing some grocery shopping for some fresh Polish grub. The fact that they bake their own bread on site makes them better than Bobak's and Caputo's.

17.description: I love Polish sausage, but unfortunately my head gets puffy after I eat your run on the mill Polish sausage because of the MSG, nitrates and other chemicals they add.  To my surprise they have some all natural Polish sausage at Kolatek's that I can eat to my hearts content.  Be sure to ask for it because some of the other sausages do have the usual suspect ingredients.They also have a nice variety of organic stuff, nice cheeses, and great baked goods.  Sort of like a Trader Joe's but no booze, and with a bakery and ready to eat stuff like they have at Wholefoods.  This is a good place if you want some nice organic and natural products mixed in with some ethnic staples.  I highly recommend the nalesniki, good stuff! It's also nice to be able to fill up your cart and pay $50 instead of the $150 I usually blow at Wholefoods.  I shop here every couple of weeks.

10.description: This place is never a disappointment. Great deli with delicious prepared foods, hands down the best for Polish stores. The owners make sure to keep a high level of quality with the prepared foods. Makes me feel like I'm eating my grandma's potato salad and fried fish. So so yummy and 100% authentic! Mniam!Oh and let me not forget to mention the baked goods! Fantastic rolls, bread and amazing deserts!

5.description: I'd give them 4 stars for the food, but 1 star for the service. Unless you speak Polish, good luck communicating.  I won a $50 gift certificate from a  radio station  for this place,  when I checked out I was told that I had to spend the total amount of $50 or more as they cannot give me change. I said I'm fine with that - I'll just take the store credit. They told me that I had to use the entire $50 today as they don't give credit. I call bullshit on this place especially when it says nothing about that on the coupon.  I'm a single person and don't need $50 worth of food at one time.  I'm sure Andy's Deli on Milwaukee, or any other place would be happy to have my business because it will be a cold day in hell I come back. If they thought by advertising their company on the radio and offering gift certificates is going to help bring in new customers,  they need to learn more about attracting new customers because they didn't win me over today. And here's a concept,   if you're going to move to the United States and open a store, why not LEARN to speak the language,?! But of course they have mastered  how to add and subtract in our currency. If  I lived in Poland, or any other country,  I would learn their language.....

11.description: Great Polish food! Deli, bakery etc. delicious.

3.description: Great food and people.  Nothing like a mom and pop bakery with better quality ingredients and service.  If language is a barrier for some folks you can still point to what you want, right Mike L?  Doubt they'll miss ya though.

0.description: I brought some smoked Kielbasa home from Kolatek's to California.  Oh my, did my family enjoy our Polish dinner here.  The very best Kielbasa. The servers called out my number in Polish, but no issues, i got my turn at the deli counter and had great service.  They were able to put the sausage in a shrink wrap package for the airplane ride home for just 80 cents more.No smells in the suitcase that way.  I highly recommend Kolatek's.

20.description: Checked out this place for our wedding cake after receiving a tip from one of our Polish friends. All in all, I was flexible with cake and the price was very right. My husband wanted something more Polish and less Americano super sweet and typical. We met with Bart and he helped us pick out cakes and made suggestions. We  had 2 layers of tiramisu w/ mandarin oranges, and 1 layer of 'Ambassador' cake. Both cakes are delicate, have some fruit and they are GOOD! Picked up some fresh rye and it was still warm- YUMMY!!! Will be doing some grocery shopping for some fresh Polish grub. The fact that they bake their own bread on site makes them better than Bobak's and Caputo's.

19.description: Excellent and courteous service even when store inundated with customers. The bakery section is, as stated, outstanding. Bought the daily special rye bread, four loafs for $2.00, cut in front of you at the bread slicer. Even better is the kielbasy. This time purchased the Slovenian, the smoked, and the regular, two links each. Walked out of the store having left them with well under $15.00. We don;t get food like this back in the central VA area. It's a must stop every time I pay respects nearby at Elmwood and with friends elsewhere in Chitown. And, I'm a native southsider so I all the famed places down trhataway. A trip to Kolateks (and Cuputos for Italian stuff) is the must do of my regular trips back to the city.

2.description: Love walking here. Super close to my house and I can get almost everything I need.Great selection of breads and pastries and home cooked meals that will make your mouth drool. The lady at the deli would let me sample everything. Even the home cooked pierogies, she let me have a whole one. Super delicious. Ended up buying a cake for my friends birthday and a couple sandwich meats for the deli. I loved that this polish store didn't treat me any different because I wasn't polish. Everyone made me feel welcome and like a normal customer. Will be back here all the time.

18.description: a polish delicatessen to end all polish delicatessens.  they have it all out there and it all looks and tastes fantasticgreat deals too, each day of the week a different bargainwhat a beautiful bakery counter off to the right in the store, sample their homemade breadsparking lot in rear.  tip on 1st thing upon entering - take a number, then decide what you can't resist today

13.description: This is the best Polish deli and bakery I have been to in the Chicago area. All the polish deli items are great, the Sausage, Krakowska, and Kiska are great. The breads that they bake (they have a huge variety) are the best I have had in the entire Chicagoland area. And the coconut topped cheesecake I bought was to die for. I heard about the place on the Mightyhouse radio show. And my wife and I are thankful to them for leading us to this gem. We will be making our 40 mile trip to Kolateks on a regular basis to stock up on polish deli, and baked items (especially the great bread).

4.description: Thinking about you walk into Whole Food but your surrounding peeps are speaking Polish, yes that's what Kolatek's looks like.  This entire store feels like a "mini Whole Food."  They have a strong bakery department, which features lots of Polish specialities and has an impressive presentation.  However, I didn't find the deli section as magnificent as their bakery department.  I would still prefer Montrose deli for soup, appetizers, salad, and other Polish yumminess.  However, what wins me over is their frozen section.  It looks clean, well-stocked, and extensive.  They carry Alexandria's pierogis instead of Kasia's.  I can't wait to try them!  I don't live nearby, but I'm on a mission to visit as many Polish deli as I can in the city because I have an unexplainable obsession to Polish food.  I will be back with my hubby so that he can carry the groceries for me!

6.description: The freshest and most delicious selection of baked goods and meats,

15.description: They have expanded their store in the last year.  It was much smaller a year ago.  Now they have a large parking lot in the back and you can enter from the back or you can try to battle Harlem and park on the street. They have a great deli section with good prices and an awesome bakery.  They bake all their goods there and rye bread is always fresh. Everything always seems fresh and tastes good. I'm giving it one less star because I don't do all my grocery shopping here and can't comment on the rest of their products.

7.description: So many strange meats hanging up by the deli!I got some creamy borscht with cream that had been severely burnt, that tasted like beets mixed with cigarette ash.Also, I had a couple of chocolate pastries that were not the best. BUT it doesn't matter, because this place has CHIA SEED KOMBUCHA in a neighborhood where that's impossible to find. The ultimate pick-me-up, right by my favorite yoga studio in the universe.

8.description: Good food but there are only 2 tables. Couldn't eat there because they were occupied by teenagers

14.description: Great place for polish food.

3.description: I am a big fan of Jewel Osco,and find myself going even more and more since dominicks was shut down. This location, is huge, clean, and staff is always friendly. The location is pretty sweet too, smack dab in the middle of a shopping plaza that has plenty of stores to browse.

1.description: I've been coming to this Jewel for years. I wouldn't be surprised if it closes down within the next few years. Jewel has become the Kmart of grocery stores-- severely outdated, overpriced, and in almost every aspect, inferior to its competitors. I only keep coming back out of convenience; it's open late and close by. I could write what's wrong with Jewel, particularly this location, but I'd end up writing a novel. So I'll try to get to the point. The produce is of poor quality here and to say it is overpriced is an understatement. $60+ for dead roses in cheap vases-- the floral department is a joke. You might be able to pick out a decent bouquet of flowers if you're lucky, but even then, again, they're most likely overpriced. In a rush? Too bad. Expect to stand in line for a while- there are about two cashiers at any given time. And the self-checkout lanes always have someone holding up the line there too-- which leads me to my next point: look at the surrounding area. It's been going downhill fast for quite some time now unfortunately. Don't expect much from the employees or the clientele.

0.description: The pharmacy is excellent, they care about their customers and are very sweet.I have been using this establishment for almost 15 years and I have no complaints.  Even the time, that is needed to fill a script is very short.  Thank you ;)

2.description: I have been coming to this Jewel since they first opened. It's quite convenient and I go at least once a week. Yesterday, I went to Jewel to go grocery shopping and guacamole was on the list so I asked a nice employee where the guacamole was because I could not find it. He asked another employee for an answer and he said that it was currently being made. At that point I know guac wasn't going to make it into the cart. However! The employee I talked to told me that the guac would be available in 10 minutes (yay!).  In the meantime, I gathered other necessities. A few minutes later, a nice young man came up to me and my sister with two freshly made packages of guacamole! WOOHOO! My family really enjoys this Jewel's guac and my mom also mentioned it has gotten better.The customer service is great..oh and so are their chocolate chip cookies.

5.description: Perhaps I am paying too much for my gorceries, but I am still not paying as much as Whole Paycheck would charge - AND, the real plus of Jewel is that I know that they will have the item and brand I need.  So, I'm fine with a little upcharge when I don't have all day to drive around in search of something.  And, I actually like this Jewel - a lot.  The people who work here are really nice and they will help me find weird requests when a recipe calls for it.  Plus, because this one is in a very diverse area of the city, we get lots of imported foods and a huge selection of peppers.  (My sister is very jealous when she is searching for them to make her salsa each year).  My favorite part of this Jewel is the foreign food aisle - where else can you pick up Pimms, mushy peas, polish fruit juice AND japanese candy all in one stop?  And, they have a coinstar that you can get store credit or iTunes cards on - bonus!!

6.description: This Jewel doesn't even have a natural/organic/healthy food aisle. Jewel is like McDonalds, not spectacular but dependably surprise free. At least it was until today.Avoid this location.

7.description: I have never been to a Jewel where the seafood section smelled like it was in need of Monistat 3. Seriously. And everything was way overpriced. $2 for a two-liter of Coke. I expect this from a convenience store, but from Jewel? C'mon!

8.description: This is a Jewel.Unless you're coming in for the 10 items for $10 deal of the week chances are...you're paying too much.Don't feel bad. we've all been there. Sometimes you have to go to Jewel and experience the walk of shame as you carry your $50 bag of groceries to your car trying not to notice how incredibly light it feels. It's OK if you have to cry in the car.you're not alone.

9.description: This Jewel has pretty much all your needs, including a pharmacy! Even has a RedBox inside, however their self-check out areas are clearly what slow the place down. Even though some people expect them to get you out faster, I think they are a nuisance and a "live" human can help bag and check you out quicker!

10.description: I used to stop here on the way home, for convenience. Not the greatest Jewel location - some Jewel stores have good produce, a cool international foods aisle, etc. but not this one.Recently I stopped shopping here entirely because they got rid of shopping baskets. Seriously? Yeah. What kind of a grocery store doesn't have shopping baskets? I'm not pushing a stupid cart around to buy like six Lean Cuisines and a box of Corn Flakes. Weak.

4.description: I come I this jewel almost once a week and they always have everything I need! From meat to my Hispanic foods that I cook with!At times it can be over crowded but since it's the closet jewel to my house I've gotten used to it. Only downfall is the friendliness of the cashiers. They always seem unhappy and don't greet when you walk tithe register.

12.description: I try to avoid this place when at all possible. And driving out here westward on Fullerton is a pain in the ass no matter what time you go. So the last thing I want to do is have to return something here, which I have done several times. The store itself is kinda depressing too. And it just feels dirty. We have gotten some essential things here like a stroller and diapers, and a high chair online. Everything else we usually try to order online or get from somewhere else. However it is the only Babies R Us around, and sometimes you have no choice.

3.description: Bad personal, I hate when I'm going to pay and the cashiers are talking and laughing each other and they don't even pay attention to the costumer and then I say thank you and they don't answer back because they are to busy gossiping.

1.description: Dont know why they are rated so low. I initially registered w Tagret, but Target discontinued too many things too frequently and their process of signing in and viewing and editing your registry was too unorganized. Registered w Babies R Us online, and LOVED their registry process!!! I also frequent and also favor this particular store. It's always stocked, there are always friendly employees, and their aisles are very organized. The hubby was working one day when I was still pregnant and I was nesting, and I went to buy a Britax stroller and car seat combo. The box was SUPER HEAVY and HUGE. I had no prob getting help w my item. Happy w this particular store!!!!

2.description: I have been to this location many times! I have shopped a lot there and given them a lot of my money! The reason I'm giving it 1 star is because I think she's a manager was extremely rude and they should teach the staff then what to say on the phone! I had called to ask about a product being sold there the lady I had talked to said they didn't have it and she checked other stores for me. So melrose had my product I went there they no longer had the Christmas promo bottle and was told to bring my receipt to the other location. Did that and my total was 71$ because I had banked my rewards up to 60$ I was not qualified for the promo fine! But when your staff says something you should be honoring it! But w.e I bought the bottle any way... But wish I haven't because the way she walked off and made a noise under her breath! Not appropriate at all! And yes I called customer service.... If u don't like your job then don't work there!

9.description: AAAAhhhh!! baby warehouse! Overwhelming..We never found the section for cloth diapers so I don't even know if they sell them. They weren't in the zone labeled "Diapers". Odd.They do have a whole jungle of baby furniture, clothing, baby needs- you name it, they've got it, except apparently if it is cloth diapers.This place is a warehouse for sure. I just don't feel good inside. :-/

10.description: So, yes, the exterior is very shady, BUT this review is based solely upon their customer service!I have not set foot inside a BR Us in over three years, and considering I have spent about a millionth of a second around small children in that time...this place can be very overwhelming.Thank goodness my friend created a nice registry to help guide me through the maze of Baby 101. I started at the desk, where I asked to have a registry printed off under my friend's name.  I guess the glazed look on my face startled the woman after perusing the goods, so she brought me over to a particular section, where I was introduced to baby car mirror's...she has children of her own, so she also made some other suggestions based upon the registry. Fast forward, and now I was on to find baby teether's (there are so many!). Another team member assisted with this and then handed me over to the Assistant Manager.  The AM was very nice and was unable to find what I needed. He said he would be back, but I later saw he had to jump on the register, so I let that one slide.I think what prompted me to actually write this review, was the fact that when the lines began to grow, a cashier opened a new line and instead of letting the people in the line that had been waiting, she took the people who had just arrived, which prompted the Manager (whom was my cashier), to correct her in a professional manner, and asked her to say "Next Guest, Please" (or something along those lines). Regardless, it was like a breath of fresh air, that the Manager worked with her employee's like that, and it restored my faith in humanity, and customer service!!

13.description: NObody was available on a Sunday afternoon to assist us on the floor with cribs.   I (8 months pregnant) waddled to the front of the store to ask them to page someone.  She did.  Nobody showed up.  I finally saw someone in another dept. and asked if he could help in furniture.  Nice enough guy but he should have said "no" to me when I asked if he could help.  He knew nothing but tried to act like he did.  His only solid advice was "so you know you have to buy the mattress too, it doesn't come with the crib". Um - yes, thank you, I did know that.  VERY disappointed!

16.description: The store is ok, the neighborhood is not. Be careful when going here.

6.description: When I had my baby shower, I registered at BRU. The fact that they specialize in whatever you need for your baby, makes it so convenient. But convenience comes with a cost, even though you could probably get it cheaper at Target or Walmart, there's no guarantee they will have the product your looking for though.

15.description: OMG.  Customer service is awful.  Avoid this store at all costs.  Well worth the drive out to Lombard to go to that location instead!!!

0.description: I ended up registering here for my baby shower. I didn't think their prices were so bad. Yeah, you can shop around... but I wanted my friends and family to see everything I wanted in one easy place. (Which translates to less duplicate gifts for me). Overall, I ended up with two duplicate items. We exchanged one of them already with ease.The staff was friendly. When we were looking at strollers, someone walked over to tell us more about models we were looking at. I like that they have the displays, but wish they were all on the floor. I wanted to test out ease of use. So I was rolling them around. Play yards and similar items are all on the floor for you to look at and choose from. They also put all the highlights (the wonderful things you generally have to pull out your phone and look up) on the side of each item.The girl who set us up for our registry was really friendly. She told us about classes they offer from Mederma. She also answered questions I had when comparing two models. She gave me advise on bottles.... none of that was necessary, but I did appreciate her opinion. She had recently had a baby.My husband and I went into the store to exchange one of our duplicate items about 5 minutes before they closed not too long ago. There were two employees in the store and they could have very easily locked the store early, or sent us on our merry way. Instead, they walked us through the store and showed us where items we were looking for were located. And they were friendly. (I did forget to do the phone survey....).

5.description: We just has the worst shopping experience ever.  The staff is rude and incompetent.  After 15 minutes at the register watching 3 different people unsuccessfully scan our coupons, my wife nearly had a meltdown.  I had to get her out of their our she would've slapped someone.  And I wouldn't have blamed her.  During this waste of time experience, we were trying to purchase an extremely expensive item and at the check out line, one of the managers who was trying to help the other idiots scan coupons told us that the expensive item we were trying to buy will likely break so we should buy the expensive warranty package.  Specifically, he told us that 7 out of 10 of these items break within 30 days.  What kind of crap are you selling?  And what kind of morons are you employing?

11.description: This store is terrible. My husband and I went on a Saturday morning to buy something off a registry. First of all, the whole store just looks shady and cheap and disorganized. After looking where we thought the item, should be (a set of onesies) and not finding it we asked someone. After hunting around for a salesperson for quite some time, we found an associate who didn't seem to understand what we were asking for because she couldn't speak English very well. Instead of pointed us to where the item was/helping us find it she told us that "it should be over there somewhere" and pointed to the general area of about 5 racks. At this point, I had to use the bathroom while my husband continued to look. While walking to the bathroom, I passed a pile of poop (yes, human feces) smeared on the floor. An employee walked by, looked and it and kept going (I assumed to get cleaning supplies or at least alert a manager and put a cone over it or something). I went to the bathroom, had to wait for a huge family to use the bathroom (where none of the kids washed their hands or were told to and then proceeded to go out and play with toys. Ew). I was probably in there a total of close to 10 minutes. Plenty of time to get something like a pile of feces cleaned up or at least get a cone or warning tape around it, right? Nope, clearly not a priority for this store. Apparently their policy is to just leave poop in the middle of the floor. So incredibly disgusting.When I got back to my husband, who still hadn't found the item and couldn't get any more help, I told him about the poop and we just got out of there and went to Target instead. Much better experience:)Add to this that I'm 5 months pregnant and we're about to register. This experience, combined with other things I've heard, is making us strongly reconsider registering at Babies R Us. If we can't even find one item, or get help with it, how will registering be?!! Plus, do I really want to have my friends/family go to an establishment that leaves feces on the floor?!!!!!

8.description: What is going on here? I have yet to go to this store because they never have what I am looking for every time I call. We are then forced to rent a car to go to the other branches. Dealing with them on the phone is a tedious task within itself. This last time, I had to call three times because nobody ever picks up in the Babies'r'us department. Then, when you call the Toys'r'us branch, the first person you talk to puts you on hold for 15 minutes, then a second person picks up and asks what you are waiting for which means you have to pose your question all over again, and then you are put on hold again. Then the connection drops and you have to call back again and talk to a third person, who asks you the same question and puts you on hold again. This is the textbook definition of "waste of my time" and bad customer service. What are all these "sales associates" doing there if no one can get me the info I need? It seems they all disappear in some vortex hole and never return. Why have this branch in the first place if your inventory as well as your staff is mediocre?

4.description: I had a great time ordering online the item for my baby but unfortunately horrible experience when I got to the store to pick it up. It's not the first time it happened. First time I was picking up another thing  I thought maybe the employee is new that's why she has no idea where to look for the item I ordered. I had to wait 15 min for her to get someone to tell her how to get the item and where it was. Second time I had to wait over 30 min and it's not that easy while pregnant  !! First they couldn't look up the order even after I gave them the order # then the guy that went to the back to get the item kept coming back with the wrong item. I thought store pick up was supposed to be easy and fast but i have to say I was never more wrong. I have a baby registry with babies r us that I'm think of canceling because I just don't want my guests to experience the same issues I did!!! I'm not sure if other stores are the same but this locations in the horrible. Employees have no idea what they are doing there. Manager named Matt wasn't helpful either. But after looking at the employees and at him I don't feel surprised at all. I will not be going back to this location ever! I don't recommend you go there as well !!

14.description: First off, their return policy could really be better.   I received items from here that were neither on my registry nor accompanied by a gift receipt.  Even though these items had actual  Babiesrus price tags on them - they refused to give me a merchandise credit or anything.  Secondly, this location is sooooo inconvenient for anyone who lives in the city.  I'd rather drive out to the Babiesrus on Touhy in Skokie since it's near the expressway and has other stores I would go to around it.

7.description: I really, really regret registering at Babies R Us.  I thought that since they had more of the stuff I wanted (cloth diapers, better strollers, nicer pumps...) I sort of had to.  Let me just say, it was still a mistake.First, their PRICING is atrocious.  Easily 20% higher than elsewhere.  Why are we asking our friends and loved ones to pay more?  Second, their REGISTRY is all screwed up.  I had two showers and between the two received more than 10 duplicate gifts.  Embarrassing to me and a PITA to have to return stuff.  I know that sometimes gift-givers forget to have stuff noted on the registry, but this is just too often to be a human error on my friends' part.Third, their SELECTION is almost always out of stock or online only.  Stuff disappears from their shelves so fast it's almost not worth registering!Don't do it.  Don't be tempted!  Just register elsewhere, you'll be glad you did.

29.description: I liked that food but I found the waitresses racy uniforms not representative of my homeland. I would be too embarrassed to bring my American friends there.

42.description: I attended a concert here and I am assuming they changed the set-up to accomodate more people. The stage is actually in a good spot - it is in a corner in the back of the cafe, so no matter where you are sitting, you have a good view of it. Although the decor was not visible underneath the many people who flooded in to watch the concert, I did like the modern look of the exposed brick wall. The bar is alonside one of the walls on the way to the bathroom (someone really must have put some thought into the set-up).Parking is a bit hectic, because they do not have their own lot, but we were able to find a spot along Belmont about a block away. Considering that the concert attracted many people, I would say that the parking situation was not bad at all. This was my first time at Cafe Prague and I understand that they regularly feature local artists. I did not have the opportunity to try the food, but definitely will the next time I'm there.

23.description: Staropramen is on tap here! Can you ask for a better beer? Very Europe feel to this place! Usually had something exciting going on here, from bands, samplings or new Dj's! It's a must do if your in the area! Have a Staropramen and enjoy the outside area! We'll worth the trek!!Seriously the nice staff ever!!!

8.description: We had dinner here on 5/31/15.  The food is wonderfully and beautifully presented.  Our server, Oaxana, was delightful.  I did not get the manager's name, but she was very welcoming.  The atmosphere is warm and friendly.  We will definitely go back.

31.description: This place is such a gem! After a trip to Prague, we were hankering for some traditional Czech food. You HAVE to try the dill potato soup--- DELICIOUS! The prices are very affordable and the service was top notch. Their lattes weren't half bad, either. Be careful! The food is so good you could find yourself ordering the whole menu.

34.description: We actually stumbled upon Cafe Prague because were looking to go to a different restaurant when we realized that restaurant was closed. Thankfully, we pulled out our handy dandy yelp app and found Cafe Prague to be close by. We thought why not?The restaurant is a bar/restaurant with a large dancing floor space.
