The lights were dimly lit and I thought the place was going to turn into a club. It didnt.  There were a lot of patrons here hanging out so it looked like a local hang out spot. People really like it here!We looked at their menu and it had a lot of good looking dishes. We ordered:Homemade potato pancake--savory herbs and hand grated potatoes pan-fried and topped with garlic, sour cream and chives.  We opted to also add smoked salmon. The dish was super good!Slow roasted crispy skin pork shank--I did not try this dish but my friend said the skin was not crispy. She said the skin was more roasted and chewy which made the dish really rich. The meat was fall off the bone tender though and she enjoyed the dish.Grilled trout--I did not try this dish but my friend enjoyed it.Moravian pork--The pork was served with garlic and onion with a side of homemade sauerkraut and homemade dumpling.  The pork in this dish was flavorful and tender and the homemade sauerkraut was SO GOOD. I was not really a fan of the homemade dumpling though.Czech fried cheese--Its made with brie or muenster cheese and served with french fries and a side of tartar sauce.  I did not really like the cheese but I enjoyed the french fries and tartar sauce. For dessert, I ordered the crepe dessert without the crepe, which was basically two scoops of vanilla ice cream topped with blueberry cream and freshly whipped cream with a drizzle of chocolate syrup. It was DELICIOUS! My friends tried the apple strudel and the ice cream with raspberry syrup. They also enjoyed their desserts.Our dinner from start to finish was great. Our server was really nice and attentive. What a great accidental find!

16.description: Staropramen is on tap here! Can you ask for a better beer? Very Europe feel to this place! Usually had something exciting going on here, from bands, samplings or new Dj's! It's a must do if your in the area! Have a Staropramen and enjoy the outside area! We'll worth the trek!!Seriously the nice staff ever!!!

13.description: Had a great experience eating here! The waitress was very kind and offered great recommendations, and let us try a sample appetizer on the house. Our drinks were never empty and she was attentive without being in our faces. Let's talk about the ambiance. Simple but elegant. The music was great. Lots of Melodic metal ballads and dancy cover songs. And best of all, they are OPEN LATE!I had goulash which was tender well seasoned , and came with my favorite, potato pancakes. My boyfriend had chicken schnitzel with gooey cheese and mushrooms with mashed potatoes. So freaking good!Will I be back? Oh yes.

11.description: We have gathered as a small group of friends twice, and both times were fun, delicious, and memorable...which is saying something since their drinks are potent and flow like wine...or, in CP's case, like plum brandy!! *The food does not fail!!  We ordered a myriad of items and it looked like a king's feast complete with a giant shank resting atop an enormous bed of sauerkraut. The potato pancakes are my fave and the mushroom soup is the mister's. He had been dreaming about it since the first visit. The biggest problem with the food is you order so much and barely have any room for it when the actual meal arrives because you've already scarfed down this light and fluffy pate (I don't even eat that but it's sooo good!) and other appetizers you just had to have. Oh, yes, we are a bit loud from time to time, and not once did we feel shamed for enjoying ourselves. Because of all of the above, this has become our new fave meeting place to share and catch up on our lives. *they also have flaming absinthe shots and a number of delightful martinis.

39.description: Closest Czech restaurant to the North Shore.  Otherwise, you have to drive further south to Berwyn.  @alan S. - you are right that the setup is "interesting".  It is a mix of bar, cafe, disco and restaurant.   The menu is pure Czech, but the decor is modern and the clientele is Polish.  It's a taste of modern Eastern Europe.

37.description: Went in, not knowing what to expect.  The Czech places that I'm accustomed to had  retirement-home clientele, old dated interior, and big portioned meals that were cheap.  Cafe Prague isn't one of those places.Inside was anything but dated, had the exposed brick thing going, which made the interior look modern.  The set-up was different as it looked like it was half restaurant/dance club.  The constant loud trance music was a bit much, especially for 3:30 on a Thursday, which felt like walking into a trendy salon.  Had my heart set on the beef goulash but the barmaid said that they didn't have any and she said in a cute and enthusiastic heavy eastern European accent to not go without trying one of her homeland favorites, either the Moravian Pork or the Czech Roast Beef in Creamy Sauce.  Hungry and enjoyed hearing that accent, I decided with the Czech roast beef in creamy sauce.  The few slices of roast beef with bread dumplings covered in some type of yellow gravy didn't look appetizing at first, but the sauce was pretty tasty, had a definite sour cream taste to it.  Roast beef had zero fat on it and was very good.  The sliced bread dumplings had pieces of bacon inside.  The lady there was nice and very pretty, but expect to feel a little out of place if you don't speak Polish.  3.5 starsFYI park in the Walgreens lot for a spot

0.description: Uplně Výborný! As one reviewer notes "...by and for Czechs..." but also for anyone that appreciates new and different experiences in dining.Brought a large party for a special event. The staff treated us with friendly efficiency, style, and class. The decor breaks from the traditional, beloved, beautiful but folksy, artisan-based woodwork, paintings, and artifacts of a Bohemian mountain lodge and moves toward casual, wide-open, urban upscaled dining, drinks, and entertainment. The menu is simple but every appetizer and dish displayed a passion for the art of cuisine and took well known everyday dishes by Czechs to the next level. Dishes were brought promptly. Servers were attentive. The beef goulash was succulent, the beef melt-in-your-mouth tender, the gravy perfectly seasoned and paired with a merlot was memorable. There was not a complaint in the crowd. They have a nice selection of Czech beers on tap and an ample selection of beer, wine and liquor overall. You can watch all Hawks games on several monitors at the bar. Most of the staff speaks Czech but all of the staff is professional and friendly. All of this for very reasonable prices.Cafe' Prague vy jste super!!

38.description: When you hike out this far out to the west side, chances are you will get past the K, L, M, O, and maybe even P streets. Out by Cafe Prague you'll run into the mad Polish hood where if you don't speak English, you might feel just a little bit out of pace! After a Chicago Fire game, my friend suggested we head to Cafe Prague for his brother's birthday party. It was a great event hall, there was a DJ table set up, balloons, lights of all colors flashing and disco ball overhead. It was class and people were dressed nicely celebrating.Not speaking Polish, I quickly spurted Okocim when asked for what I wanted. Okocim it was and Okocim was magical.  There was tons of foods and great desserts lying around everywhere but after spending the entire evening at the Fire game and Johnnie's Beef, more food was just not possible. We were seating at a long table with over 20 people there and people shuffle around the table and around the food at the table nearby.Music was everywhere blasting loudly and there were plenty of people dancing. If I was Polish, Cafe Prague would be my #1 event venue!!!

27.description: The service was excellent. The Czech beer was delightful. The food portions were generous.

32.description: Doesn't get much better or more authentic as far as Czech food goes. The menu offers a good variety of meals to choose from, but isn't overwhelming. Every time I've dined there the food has been cooked and seasoned perfectly. Fyi, the portions are generous so be prepared to take home a doggy bag.

44.description: Moved to the neighborhood a few months ago and tried this place for the first time last night.  Good food, great prices, and friendly service!

24.description: Hubby took me to this great bar/restaurant. Food and service here are wonderful! Definitely recommend their mushroom soup - never had this with dill, potatoes, and a poached egg. Yum! I also recommend (and never heard of) their fried pickles, but they were filling too! We had an excellent waitress - Tereza M! Very attentive and provided awesome service. Never had to hail down any waiter/waitress for anything. Milada, the owner, is very welcoming and a great hostess! She made us and our friends all feel like family. Highly recommend this place!

7.description: Always great food in this classy restaurant. For me it is one of the best restaurants and I would recommend it to everyone

40.description: My Girlfriend and I went on a Sunday Afternoon around 4:00pm.  We both had the Moravian Style Pork Slow Roasted Pork with Aromatic Vegetables served with Sauerkraut and Potato Dumplings!!!   The sauerkraut is homemade/handmade, no sulfites, no MSG!!!   The vegetables were just some tiny and thin fried onions that were garnished on top of the pork, they tasted yummy.  This was so good; I thought it was even better than what my Bohemian Grandmother would serve up!  I was very impressed.  Nice looking place to come anytime, especially at night to party and have some good drinks.      Awesome beers on tap, Czech beers rock!  Not much of a tap selection but for 4 Bucks for a 1/2 liter, that great!!      My server was nice.  The other people eating their shared some of their potato pancakes which were tasty.  We left feeling stuffed and happy.  I look forward to many returns.  I will bring my dad and grandpa for sure!  This is the kind of yummy, savory and delicious food we grew up with.Order or even take a sample of the different beers!  = )  Enjoy!

30.description: I'm giving 5 stars because of the Absinthe fountain service, and the amazing service in general.  The bartender/manager was incredibly helpful and obviously cares about his business and customers a great deal.  It turns out I might not be such a fan of Czech food, though - either that or we ordered poorly. Even so, I will definitely be back!

46.description: I am obsessed with stealing wireless and their iced coffee. Pretty good place to chill on a lazy summer afternoon. It's usually freezing, there's usually somebody in here who knows who ever is working and they're hanging out, and there's lots to look at with the giant windows. Haven't had the food yet, but they serve their iced coffee in these cool giant glasses. The different areas to sit are cool, and they have a pretty nice bathroom.Yeah, I'm a fan.

1.description: My wife and I lived in Prague for a long time and we've always had a hankering for a good svickova or Smazeny Syr and Cafe Prague nailed it! Run by Czechs, clearly for Czechs. Great beer. Great food and the weird Czech decor :)If you get 'the traditional fried cheese' which is Smazeny Syr, get it with Muenster cheese. Also the sirloin in cream sauce (Svickova) is a great meal. Being Czech don't expect the service to be on point, they're slow, but hey in the Czech Republic its the same so just go in with that mindset. You are stepping into a Czech establishment. They're very polite and helpful though, which is not what you get in Prague.On our last visit we took some friends and they absolutely loved it. I would recommend to anyone who wants the authentic Czech food and experience and not want to pony up for a flight to europe, go here! You won't be disappointed!

9.description: I've been here seven times now and every experience has been excellent.The servers are all attentive, nice and extremely helpful in making food and drink recommendations.  For purposes of comparison I've been to the other Polish and Czech restaurants in the are and find the service here well above the rest. The atmosphere is simple but tasteful.  The value for the quality of food is exceptional.  I can recommend the beef goulash with potato pancakes, the shnitzel and the pork shank as well as the selection of beer.  If you're up for some Czech spirits try the Becherovka, Fernet and the plum brandy.They usually have the game on (Blackhawks, Bulls, etc.) at the bar so I go here instead of the sports bars in the area when I want to watch a game and drink a beer.  However, I haven't been there for the DJ nights yet, so can't comment on that vibe.

26.description: I feel like I ate at a completely different restaurant after reading the other reviews. My boyfriend is Czech and has lived more of his life in the Czech Rep. than he has in the US, so finding decent places that remind him of back home is a difficult task.I'm assuming like myself, all the other reviewers are American. However, I've had a lot of authentic Czech food and usually the flavors are more bold and the portions are larger. I also thought this place was really steeply priced for what you get. I split an entre with my boyfriend and had a couple beers and our bill was like $60 bucks. Maybe you city folk are just used to being robbed..The only saving grace is that the staff was very friendly, and the atmosphere was what I expected (very similar to Bistro). The beer selection is great but it's fairly standard for what Czech bars and restaurants located in Chicago have to offer. I would probably stop in again for a beer if I'm in the area, but I'll stick to cuisine at other places since this is just too far from my neighborhood.

25.description: Cafe Prague is the place to be! Very chill and cozy ambiance.. having a dance floor/stage area makes it a great venue for many different events! The food is very tasty! Ive had 7 different items in the menu all but one were very good.. The half duck,It's because it was the Bomb! I licked the whole platter clean! Great staff, they were all friendly, accomodating and pleasant! (Also HOT! )Me and my fellow Chicago Ducati Riders are very fortunate to have been introduced to Cafe Prague and its beautiful owner Milada! Cafe Prague is CDR's official Bar/Restaurant destination!

12.description: I have visited this place three times, yesterday being my most recent. I went with a friend were surprised to see kids running around. At times kids sitting around the bar area with I'm assuming their parent. I was also confused by their concept, alternative music? Bar and family restaurant ? Weird mix.Food wise, we both had salads and both were disappointing. The lettuce tasted like it had been too long in the fridge. I had nothing to drink but water, and even that wasn't filled promptly by our distracted waitress. Quiet annoying since she seem to check on everyone else ( we were in the bar area). On the flip side , coffee was pretty good!!! Two stars for it!

21.description: Cafe Prague is one of those rare places that survived Internet cafe era, Wi Fi revolution and recession without loosing its cool.  I really liked it when they had books and art pieces for sale, it always felt very cozy and relaxed. Now ( I went to Prague cafe last weekend on 10/3/14) they cleared the books area for a stage and dance floor. While we were enjoying a couple of glasses of Czech wine, suggested by our host, the servers were preparing everything for some formal event. The setting looked very elegant and stylish, made me consider this place for our future parties.    The food is decent, but we didn't order much: potato pancakes with goulash , mushroom soup and the apple strudel for dessert.  I was little bit disappointed with the goulash taste and presentation,  but the apple dessert eased this impression.  It was light and delicious.   The prices are acceptable,  the atmosphere pleasant. Really nice, attractive servers and attentive owner. Overall, place worth visiting and coming back.

17.description: best  czech restauranr round IL . best czech beer czech food .  alwas smile server .  .  every week different food . . i have freid cheese  with potates  freid  alwas the best .

10.description: Great food and service but definitely felt like more of a club/lounge than a restaurant. Went here on a date night with my husband and expected a nice, soft lit romantics place for dinner but it was completely different than what I had imagined. Not terrible, just not as I had expected. They have great Martinis and Eastern European food for good prices and it was relatively quiet, apart from the pumping music that made it feel like a club. This is definitely a place to go to for just drinks to hang and not so much a date night. I'm only giving it three stars because they're going through this process of figuring out of they want to be an upscale restaurant or a club/lounge. Easy to find parking though!

5.description: Wow. Not sure where this is but it's like 6.5 miles west on Belmont.Went here for the bf's birthday with his family. Got there at 6:30pm and ended up staying until 1am. Let me explain...We get there and order drinks. I had the staropramen which was good and ended up drinking that all night. I started with the mushroom soup and then the goulash for my main. My food was really good. For those of you who are cooler than me, they do have absinthe but my wilder dranking days are quite rare now.The best thing was that around 8ish the DJ starts playing quite a bit of disco a la Bee Gees. Then as it gets later he starts playing a lot of obscure new wave and lesser known 80s music. Shut. The. Front. Door. I. Die.After the 'rents pay and leave, we go to the bar and have a few more drinks. All of the staff here was nice and they spoke English for us. Make sure your phone is charged so you can shazam all these songs. I knew they would play One Night in Bangkok, but the lesser known Boney M (not Rasputin!) was a surprise. We actually got out to the dance floor for several songs. Definitely a fun Saturday night!

3.description: We had them cater for an office lunch and I have to say I will abslutly be coming back.This has been one of my favorite sites to get authentic Czech food that reminds me so much of the time I spent there. So when it came time to order something different for lunch for the office. I knew exactly where to go! I was expecting to hear a few complainers since you can never please everyone. But for the most part everyone loved the Czech food and was excited to be able to try some dishes from an area of the world that they normally don't get to eat from. The Sopsky salad was a favorite of the office with my favorite Svickova and the Bread Dumplings came in a close second. They were easy to work with and delivered exactly what we wanted at the time we needed it. We will be ordering there again for sure!

35.description: Great drinks ! Never disappointed. Try it on an off night it's the best! Also mojitos and frozen strawberry margarita is fantastic !

19.description: Great service!  Friend took me there to watch the Hawks game.  Never had to wait for a drink. The food was amazing.  Even tried a new app that was little pieces of bread with pork and cheese.  The owner let us try it for free.  Would suggest to all my friends.  Had a great time.  Meal and drink for 7 people was only $150.00.

28.description: The service and the food were extremely pleasing.  It is quite nice to sit back have a coffee or a great glass of Czech wine/ BEER with delectable food.  The atmosphere is very pleasing.  I have been to Cafe Prague for special events/dinners and  every time it is wonderful. I highly recommend Cafe Prague.

45.description: Great food and atmosphere.  Points off for pushy waitress who tells you things you want don't "go" together and shoves other meals on you.  Super slow service but reasonable prices.  Two beers, a coke and three meals was only $40.

33.description: This was our first time here and I must say great food! I will definitely come back. The service was also wonderful. Our server was very nice!

43.description: I give cafe prague 5 stars because they have an interesting set up. The place has an internet cafe, restaurant area, bar area, and a reading area filled with books, CDs, magazines all in czech. They also have good margaritas, different selection of food, and alot of side dishes. I have tried their goat cheese side dish with a glass of wine. However, my only complaint is parking . Most places in the city have tight places for parking.

2.description: Finally, summer in Chicago has arrived.  Rosa J., Daddy J., and Mama J. were checking out the Montclare neighborhood on the western boarder of the city.  I "yelped" Cafe Prague ahead of time.  Cafe Prague is located near the Belmont and Rutherford.What an Oasis!  The lady servers there were absolutely gorgeous!  When I asked for recommendations, one of the beautiful young ladies quickly explained some of the Czech staples.  In the ends, Mama J. went with the traditional halusky (a noodle-based dish with bacons and sour cream); Daddy J. picked beef goulash; I chose the grilled filet mignon.  The beef goulash also came with a choice of bread dumplings.  While I wasn't crazy about the taste of bread dumplings (semi-bland and doughy), the beef goulash was tender and filling.  If you typically like any western-style comfort food, beef goulash would potentially be a great belly-warmer when the harsh Chi-town winter season comes around.  Although the traditional halusky was listed as an "appetizer" on the menu, whoever with a small appetite should be fine with this dish alone.  The combination of the potato noddles, fried bacons, and sour cream were quite delicious.  However, I know many of you aren't the fan of sour cream in any shape or form.  You might want to skip this one if you dislike anything with an acidic flavor.  On the other hand, my grilled filet mignon was cooked appropriately according to what I requested (medium).  It was juicy, with a plenty of sauce to keep the meat moist.  With one (1) starter and two (2) entrees, our total came to $41.90.  I thought the price was fair for the neighborhood standard.  Cafe Prague also has a small, yet well-decorated patio facing Belmont Ave.  They also have a separate area for bar patrons.  We saw a Czech-style birthday party going on at the adjacent table.  As an immigrant myself, it's always delightful to find a place to celebrate and make myself at home in a foreign country.  This afternoon I got to know a little bit about the Central Europe, and walked out the restaurant with a full stomach.

18.description: Really liked the restaurant. Good food and service. Oksana waiter friendly and attentive

41.description: This place is a short walk from my new place, so I stopped in one day after a long moving session. The service was friendly despite my lack of ability to speak polish (restaurant a few doors down, not so english speaking friendly). The service was a little slow but the food was good and reasonably priced. We were there on what was a comedy open mic night - but unfortunately it was all lost on us!

4.description: It has been 10 months since I first stepped into Cafe Prague and I am please to say that everything I expressed in my first review is true today. The food remains varied and prepared with care. Malada's kitchen continues to balance its traditional Czech fair with wonderful salads-the Caprese- and fish offerings- the Grilled Trout..  And the Garlic and Mushroom soup have yet to be surpassed by any I've had in the city.. My recommendation as we enter 2016: be more aggressive with new menu offerings. Just don't touch the Mushroom or Garlic soup !5 Stars are now gladly bestowed.

6.description: Food is amazing there! Staff is very nice and helpful. The only thing I didn't like is their DJ. He is very rude!!! My friend had her 21 B-day there and when she came and ask him to play her favorite song he said that he doesn't work for her and  she can listen to those songs that he has in his playlist. Most of his songs were Polish and since we are not Polish we didn't really enjoy it. When you have B-day dance part is very important and that polish DJ just ruined it.

22.description: A co-worker and I stopped in Cafe Prague for lunch and were very happy with our experience.  The food was great and the staff was welcoming and accomodating.  If you are looking for good food and a relaxed environment for lunch this is a good place.

15.description: Came here originally a month ago for a wedding party and food was amazing.  Which I would have given 5 stars, however we ordered food for pick up yesterday and it wasn't good.  Fries looked very good but tasted old.  Mushroom soup was good, but super sweet.  Two people that had mushroom soup had stomach pain.  Chicken with mushroom and cheese was very good.  Very sad that food was not as good as when we went the first time.

20.description: Yum, yum Yum. My Step-Father found this place and insisted we try it out. As usual he was right. I ordered the Dill soup and also the Chicken and Mushroom Ragout for lunch. Our server gave me a weird look but didn't say anything. The Dill soup was HUGE! No wonder she looked at me oddly... so. much. food. I do wish she would have said that the soup was big enough to share with the entire table, but I get why she didn't... maybe too polite to call me a pig lol. She was pretty on top of her game.The Dill soup was incredible. I would recommend it to anyone. It also was way too much. I ended up taking the Chicken and Mushroom Ragout home so I am sure it wasn't as awesome as it could have been fresh. As a leftover I thought it was pretty good, though the Potato Pancakes didn't make it... sob ;(My honey got the Caprese Salad which he felt was a bit bland, I agreed with him. The Basil was a bit overwhelmed by the amount of oil. He also got the Beef Goulash which again we felt was a bit bland and my Step-Father had made mention of this at the beginning but we still wanted to try it.My Step-Father got the Garlic soup & really liked it much to the dismay of Vampires throughout the Schorsch Village. He also had the Vegetarian sandwich and felt it was extremely tasty.

36.description: cool and cozy place for a coffee

14.description: Cafe Prague is the place to be! Very chill and cozy ambiance.. having a dance floor/stage area makes it a great venue for many different events! The food is very tasty! Ive had 7 different items in the menu all but one were very good.. The half duck,It's because it was the Bomb! I licked the whole platter clean! Great staff, they were all friendly, accomodating and pleasant! (Also HOT! )Me and my fellow Chicago Ducati Riders are very fortunate to have been introduced to Cafe Prague and its beautiful owner Milada! Cafe Prague is CDR's official Bar/Restaurant destination!

12.description: The book selection used to be a lot better. So, either I totally cleaned them out, or it's always a hit or miss. (Or maybe I've told too many people about it.) There's a sea of broken toys in this place, and my children are always begging to take something home. Why...I'll never know lol. They have managed to find a few electronic gems in good working condition and like new. But, typically, if I buy something just to satiate them, I'm throwing it out a couple of weeks later anyhow. I don't have the patience required to search through resale clothing. My mother on the other hand is there almost every Monday, sifting for new and like-new items. I like buying, but not the sport of shoping. It's a hobby I'll never understand.

3.description: Since when is cash not a valid currency? I attempted to purchase $35 worth of clothing with clearly legit $100 bill and the cashier said the store it's store policy not to accept anything over a $20 bill- no $50s or $100s. I'm good. We will go somewhere else.

1.description: Use to like this place.I will say it is spacious, clean and has fitting rooms.Just not getting a good vibe anymore.Place was fairly empty.  Employees congregating and socializing.More than 1 was swearing as I was going up and down the aisles.They seem to enjoy walking  infront of you.One employee asked when breaks were starting.  The response she got was "It's only 5:30. They have always started at 6:30."  My goodness.  If the place is empty give the girl a break.  Happy employee, happy customer.

2.description: I do love this place, there are always some great treasures and great prices. However this location is dirty. Usually thrift stores are, but there were wads of hair on the ground, broken things about, and dirt everywhere. In addition, the check out lines are very confusing, and I was cut multiple times, and employees seemed to not care. Frustrating!

9.description: This is my favorite Unique in the city.  I always go on Mondays which are sale days.  This Unique is a little different because instead of 50% off on Monday it's either 33% or 66% off.  I think it's because they know how  unique their products are compared to other thrift stores, even other Unique's.  The location means that the donations they receive are from a diverse population with a variety of tastes. You get the normal Target and Kohl's brands to boutique brands that a teacher like me could never afford.I live in the suburbs and think this Unique is totally worth the drive to stock up on new clothes and other goodies.

10.description: This is one of the better Unique's.  It's in a great location in a strip mall so it's easy to get to with easy parking.  There's lots of discount stores in the mall (i.e. dollar tree, aldi) so you can do all your discount shopping in one shot.  This is the Bricktown location and their pricing always differs from the rest of the chain.  We went on an early bird Saturday where items were either 33 or 66% off, all the other Uniques were 25 or 50% off.  We got there a little after 9am when they first opened, I expected a mad house but it was quite empty.Their game and puzzle area was very well organized. Reg price is $1.99 so we got games for $0.99 and $1.50.  The clothing is organized just like everywhere else - by color and style/type, i.e. sleeveless, short sleeves, sweaters, etc.  I didn't find as many brand name items at this particular Unique as I have at others, and what I did find was a bit overpriced.  Like a brand new Aeropostale mens polo for $13.99?!?  But I did walk away with a brand new Athleta tshirt that retails for about $40 for $6.50, 33% off and at about $4.50 it was mine!We've definitely put this Unique on our radar the next time they have a sale (or we happen to be off on a Monday or Thursday morning, ha) the discounts are deeper here so it's worth the trip out just to grab a better deal.

13.description: Been shopping at unique for years, here since they opened, as with all t-stores you have to go often to find what you want or need, but it usually, eventually turns up!  Having said that, yes, since the remodel prices are OUTRAGEOUS!!!  $2.99 for a, get this this, empty mason jar, when a new set of a dozen with lids and caps is $8 at Target!! WTF!! (excuse me) I read a LOT of books, and with hardcovers now $1.69 each, not sure if I will continue to shop here.  Going to go back to the Diversey store and check prices there, have researched Sal army locations and will check there and get back to y'all.  I hope someone from this location reads this and acts!!

16.description: I got lured here with a $5 off coupon from my neighborhood Unique advertising the grand opening of this new location.  After driving all the way there and spending more than an hour to find ten dollars worth of stuff so that I could use my coupon, I felt utterly duped.  My usual thriftstore mojo, that always works for me at the other Uniques, was nowhere to be found at this store.  I got nothin' cuz they got nothin'.  Maybe it's the suburban shopping mall location.  Maybe I was just having a bad thriftstore day.  Other people seemed to be finding stuff.  But this particular location seemed to have little that was desirable or cool.   Granted it was a clean, orderly store--one of the bigger ones of their stores--and it was filled with stuff, but apparently not much cool stuff.  But if you're just looking for average stuff rather than great finds, they seemed to have plenty.  And on Mondays, all their stuff is 66% off during their grand opening period.

6.description: I really like the changes they have made to this store. Now 2x the size, more variety of clothing, dressing rooms (yeeesssss) and a lot cleaner!!! I go here on mondays when the have the 66% off and go crazy lol. Great quality clothes to me donated.

15.description: I really love this thrift store. I donate and shop here on a pretty regular basis. As a previous poster mentioned, it is a great place to get books. I also have good luck finding quality clothing for my kids.

0.description: After visiting the location in Cragin (on Diversey Ave.), this location appeared to be somewhat higher-end looking because of super-organized racks, a nice panoramic view as soon as walking in, and the presence of security who was vigilantly making his rounds.  This is also the only location I've seen that has a restroom available for customers.  Other locations are only available to employees.  The staff was also professional and didn't hear profanity coming from their mouths.  We had a pleasant time browsing and maneuvering in the store.  Although I didn't purchase anything since I didn't see items I wanted or needed at this time, I will from now on make sure I visit this store as my first stop of the day whenever they have a sale.  This is probably the best Unique location in Chicago.  It's located on the tail-end of Fullerton Ave.  CTA 74 bus (Fullerton) will take you there.  Get off at Narragansett and walk into the shopping plaza.  It's located across from Aldi.  It also has ample parking if you drive your own vehicle.  The alternative route to this location is to take CTA 86 bus (Narragansett) and get off at Fullerton.

5.description: My oh my, did I just step into what I thought was the impossible for a thrift store?  Yes ladies and gentlemen, this place is huge AND clean. Aisles and aisles of clothes, and other random items. I'm sold on this Unique, it's not gross like the others I've been to.  And again, my disclaimer. Sanitize those digits when you leave!

11.description: As far as thrift stores go,it is quite good.Yes, you have to do a LOT of looking,but...that IS half the fun of thrifting,right??They have some good,some bad and some ugly. I do like that the selections are sorted by color,so you can at least narrow your search to the color you want.If you go on Mondays, you get half price.If you are looking for some basics,it is fine.If you are looking for designer or upscale items, you might get lucky and find them here,but,really, go to a designer resale shop if you want higher end items

8.description: It's shocking because I have driven past here a million times but have never stopped in. I love the Unique chain of thrift stores. You always find a diamond in the rough. My latest experience was no different! Three (count 'em) three items for $10.95? You really, truly cannot beat it! I got a cute distressed black lightweight "denim" shirt, a cool part jean/ part camouflage skirt and a "look like it had never been worn before" zip up skull emblazoned hoodie type thing. All totally my style, totally "Rihanna worthy" and all for the amazing price of .....let's hear it again....$10.95. I would say this is probably my favorite so far based on the finds. Great store, great location (located next to my other fave stores), and great deals!

4.description: It turned to shit. And more ignorant people. And they jacked up the prices.dont like this store anymore:(

14.description: It's not all that unique to be honest.ProsUp to 66% off certain items on Mondays.Apparently people don't read  anymore so I get dibs on all the books. Tons of clothes.Great for people who really need these items and can only afford a small amount.Consyeah they have tons of clothes but this is only a plus if you're stuck in 199266% off means nothing if everything is crapSome items can be pricey and WTF will be said often.ok, this store is definitely not the caliber of most Brown Elephant stores or any of your more popular places but it might have a few diamonds in the rough. If you have time and patience then give this one a shot.

7.description: When losing weight, thrift stores are your best friends. Why pay retail price when your size is going to change soon enough? Its definitely hit or miss. I do come pretty frequently and end up mostly with t-shirts.Its funny how much you can really spend when not paying attention to the sale tags. Today, I was behind some Polish lady buying a few things, including a bag of toys.Cashier takes bag of toys and shows the manager(?) that its opened.Cashier: I'm sorry we don't sell opened bags.Lady: I opened it, my son is playing with two of the toys. (Clear view)Manager(?): I'll give it to you for $3.95. (More than original)Lady: Fine...Really? 1. Polish people open anything packaged for inspection/sizing. I mean anything. That's why half of K-Mart's Hanes Underwear Packs are opened.2. All the toys in the bag and the toys the kid was playing with matched.PS, does anyone know where their hoodies are? I know its summer but I could not even find them in the winter.

address: next to Dollar Tree across from Aldi

12.description: I gave 3 stars because of the price and the  fact they are open late!! Pizza's are just ok. VERY saucy with little to no cheese and a sprinkle of sausage to boot... Disappointed

7.description: Really good pizza. Its a toss up between colutas, giovannis, and sorrentos. They are all completely different as far as their sauces are concerned, but all very good in their own way. Really small joint. One or two tables in here. Parking can be a pain. Really nice folks that own the place. Delivery has always been fast.

20.description: This is the pizza place that me and my family have been ordering from since I was a kid. The pizza is great in my opinion. Since I'm close, I get my pizza in about 20-25 minutes on average. I usually order cheese and mushroom. They have good meatball sandwiches too (although sometimes the meatballs are more bread-crumbs than actual meat!). The ravioli and mostacolli are always good. Their lasagna is tasty.They give you a free garden salad with entrees, but skip it--it's terrible! I've never ate inside the place (it's really small), but they mainly do carry-out and delivery.

19.description: Pretty good pizza and seriously ridiculously FAST (almost creepy). Not the absolute best in the world but good enough to go back. Reasonably priced. BUT the delivery guys never want to actually come up the stairs...is this laziness? fear? Who knows. worth trying anyway.

1.description: I have to knock some major stars off of my long-standing Giovanni's rating. Lately there have been repeated problems with my family's food orders, enough so that I think it is a trend, and need to mention it to potential customers.Perhaps Giovanni isn't as involved as he once was? This seems to happen at all of my fave old time Chicago pizza joints, dad leaves and the food quality plummets.. Or they get swamped with orders because of great reviews and simply can't keep up? I hope not the case here, this is and has been one of the great values in the neighborhood.. But.. at least 6 out of 6 past orders were wayy sub par - and that says a lot. Some examples of recent problems:- The trend started with a misdelivered/lost order. The order was resent and no harm done, food was okay, but was very very late.- From that point on, it seemed every order was late - this from a place that is maybe 5 minutes away.- Pizza toppings ordered 'not in stock'- We request crisp/well done crust always.. and got  2 pizzas with soggy mushy crusts.- Another order - Eggplant Parm, which I order a lot, arrives ice cold - not just from cold weather - but ICE cold. As this order was late, again (and again, all the late orders are a new thing) I just reheat it and eat it - and - I get a whomping case of food poisoning from it, ugh. This indicates that a) they are no longer serving fresh Eggplant Parm, but are freezing it and nuking it and b) somewhere along the line, the food is sitting around and festering at the wrong temp.- Then.. Our most recent order.. More than TWO HOURS after we ordered, we receive a call saying our order will be on its way 'shortly'. TWO HOURS to tell us this? And we are pretty much regular customers - for years, you'd think maybe someone would have taken a minute to let us know they were in the weeds a little earlier?? Needless to say, we declined and ordered from somewhere else (Frank's, if you must know :-D) and sadly shook our heads.We will continue to try Giovanni's, but it will no longer be our #1 go to place for awesome thin crust & parms, unless we see the downward skid reversing itself.Money and time is too tight to be gambling it away on potentially late/cold/wrong/bad food.Sad day for delivered dining in Montclare :-(

2.description: Very good thin crust and stuffed pizza. It's also very reasonably priced and they offer specials.

9.description: This was my first time ordering from here, one of my friends recommended me here that the pizza was good.  I ordered online through GrubHub, like my friend always does. They completely messed up my order. I ordered a XL pizza whole pepperoni and mushrooms and half with sausage.  I got half cheese and half pepperoni, mushrooms, and sausage. I called to complained, a man answered. I explained how I ordered it online. All I got was a smart ass answer saying if I ordered from the phone this wouldn't have happened. How can I trust someone to take my order listening if they can not read from a paper and tell the price difference when they sum up the total of halves ingredients to full price ingredients. I don't care how good your pizza taste if you can not give great customer satisfaction.

6.description: Great pizza we got the football pizza it was huge and yummy good. The pizza was cheap and they strlayed open late

18.description: If u are lookin' 4 DEEP DISH pizza. This is where it's @. I swear the crust is like home-made cornbread & I don't neva eat the crust on NO pizza. It's A MUST wheneva u n da CHI

10.description: I have to give it three stars because we ordered 2 deep dish pizzas and we were delivered 2 pan pizzas.  Despite being delivered the wrong pizza.  The delivery was quick.  The pizza was hot.  The delivery guy was very nice and the pizza was really good.  The sauce was very nice.  We will order again because we'd still like to try the deep dish.  Hopefully, the second time around, we will receive the correct food.

13.description: This was my second time ordering from Giovanni's and I am very pleased again. My order arrived 30 minutes earlier than told. Pizza was hot and delicious!! Strongly recommend the pizza.

16.description: Good food. Crunchy fries. Thin burger, not really juicy. Their cannolli is good too but I wish they'd give you more than 1 for $2.50.. good for a quick bite. Very quick delivery.

17.description: When we used to live in the area this is the place we would order from and not because it was close but because they have great pizza for great prices. Collect 20 coupons and get a free pizza. I love everything about them from the sauce to the crust to the cheese. I don't think it's a great as La Villa's pizza but it comes pretty close and they have a great delivery time too. Oh yeah if you just want a slice, stop and get one. I actually just had this the other day, and it still holds up to the quality that I have always gotten from them.

15.description: $2.50 for an enormous slice of yummy pizza. And I can walk to this place. Enough said.

0.description: Very good thin crust pizza and very affordable i would definitely recommend this place if your looking for good quality thin crust pizza on a budget

5.description: Great pizza! This is my neighborhood spot!!!Pretty good deals on 2 large pizzas. Gotta love the sausage pizza!!

11.description: First off, let me say how I love the inside of this place.  It had that old run down pizzeria motif which I found very charming.   It reminded me of Sal's pizza parlor in Spike Lee's movie "Do the Right Thing" only alot smaller.  There's only room for a few tables and high countertops with tall chairs.  Its definitely an ambiance that isn't seen too much.I ordered the 14" stuffed pizza ($15) which took about 35-40 minutes.  It seemed like it was just old man Giovanni and his 2 short helpers that ran the operation.  I never had a stuffed style pizza that was so unmessy and easy to eat.  It didn't leave grease blotches everywhere and the tomato sauce didn't fall off my slice either.  There was also so much cheese on it that it made the sauce pretty secondary, which is a first for me.  Crust was chewy and the sauce was inbetween chunky and smooth which was great.  Pizza was overall good, but might be too cheesy and rich for some people. There's no private lot so be prepared to park in the residential area behind the place.

8.description: I stopped by for lunch. I might have to say it was one of the best I have had.  I liked the deep dish Chicago style.   The food was good but the waitress was not the best.  I don't like to ask for a refill when my glass sits empty. We ate at the downtown west Jackson location.  Never figured out why they so see your glass empty and they ask if you want a refill?   Not only was the food good but the smell of the restaurant inside was very nice.  I hate musty places.  A good smelling place is a sign of a clean restaurant.  Go to an old Pizza Hut and smell. If you can find one.

3.description: They have the delicious thin crust pizza!I always order the same thing, which is the medium pizza with pepperoni, sausage, and jalepeno with cream cheese jalepeno poppers. The ingredients are good quality. The thin crust pizza is actually thin and not doughy which I love, although I always order mine extra thin & extra crispy because that's how I like it. The sauce isn't sweet, but is savory yet flavorful. I love ordering from here when I have visitors because everyone loves it.This is a small mom & pop place that I used to order from many years ago when my sis used to live in the area and now that I live in the area, I order from them. My parents used to have a small pizza place like this back in the day, so it brings back fond memories. Anyways, I hope others order from here as well. Its very reasonably priced and they have great deals!

14.description: I love the pizza from this place. I lived only a couple of houses from there and I tried almost the whole menu. But seriously I love the pizza and lasagna. It's a cute neighborhood pizza joint.  Ooooooohhh! Also they just came out with a mexican pizza. It is absolutely delicious!

4.description: Awesome thin crust pepperoni pizza! Also customer service was great! It's a small joint, but good food. I would give it 5 stars, but parking is terrible. You have to park around the corner to go eat there if you drove.

1.description: The bar must be okay, since I see a bunch of people going there every weekend.  However, the patrons are rowdy, inconsiderate of the residents, and many are a bunch of exhibitionists who like to pee at the parking lot (also owned by Raul; the owner of the "Lounge" and "La Estrella Grocery Store").  The parking lot could be illuminated a bit more to make its patrons feel more safe, and also to give them the impression that indecent exposure won't be tolerated; however, that's not the message the owner gives the patrons.  Therefore on weekends we get a lot of cars screeching from out of the parking lot, boisterous patrons, drunks, empty beer bottles on our grounds.  If the owner doesn't care about the neighborhood, what makes the patrons think he will care about them if they drive home intoxicated and end up dead behind the wheel?

0.description: This is where me and my dawg Leo came and got a couple of drinks before headin to O'malleys(see previous reviews for the goodies). I never knew this place was here!!! Passed it many many times and never noticed it. A couple of Hdtv's on the wall, good palce to catch a game and get ripped!!! like we did as we watched USC beat the snot out of the the Boston college Pigeons!Nice little neighborhood bar on the northwest side. I like it!Beers werent expensive, nice bartenders(Polish chicks!)and you can order food to be delivered to you while you get hammered at the bar! nice!shake & bake seal of approval!Hipster infestaion level:  1 as I see some potential for a wannabee hipster from the hood to try to come in here and pretend to be EMO or whatever...Maricuecos!

3.description: Now, while reading this, please keep in mind that I am currently involved in a Biggest Loser competition, and therefore, prone to drool over any carbs and somewhat limited in what I can eat.  That being said, man is this place good food!!My husband read about the place in the paper from a write-up and decided he wanted to have lunch here on Saturday.  I decided I could afford the splurge and off we went.  I ordered the stuffed cabbage with potato dumpling and green salad.  He got the full-on fried breaded pork with dumplings and sauerkraut.  Everything tasted so fresh and good.  I went with the mushroom sauce on the cabbage and this was so much better than the usual tomato sauce that everyone uses.The pork was extremely juicy and the dumplings were cooked with pieces of bacon!  I cannot wait to go back when I have no restrictions and have some soup and dessert.  The menu is pretty extensive and they are attached to a large bar, so they have tons of drinks and beers available as well.One star off for the typical lack-luster european service.  Although seated quickly and food delivered, she never checked on us, refilled our water or came to collect the bill at the end.  We're not high maintenance, but just let us know we exist now and then!!

1.description: I came here for lunch with a friend to try some polish food..should I note that I came with a polish friend & he ordered in polish for me....I immediately noticed that the waitress spoke mainly in the polish language...and when I tried to speak to her in English..it seemed like it was a little more difficult to understand me...hm..Pierogi ($8.99) - it's polish style dumplings and you can choose a variety of options for the stuffing...I enjoyed the potato & cheese stuffing the mostPotato Pancakes - it comes with coleslaw and shredded beets..the potato pancakes tasted good..Customer Care - nice, but the lady mainly spoke in Polish to my friend and couldn't understand me fully when I spoke in English... I couldn't get the waitress' attention when we needed our check...and our waters were not filled (not once--even tho it was empty)....so maybe after all.. I would say.. not too great w/ the customer service..I'm not Polish and it was my first time trying Polish food so I'm not sure if this restaurant was great or not...the food tasted a-ok to me...

2.description: Me and my Polish fiance went here for dinner this evening. Aside from the worst service ever, I was totally displeased with the quality of the polish cuisine and the lack the cocktail options. (we go out to Polish restaurants often)As for the service, the Polish server was very snippy and unaccommodating. She immediately spoke Polish to us, then was aggravated when she realized she had to speak English to me, and Polish to my Fiance. (We are in America) I asked her if I could order Potato and Cheese Perogies (the menu called them dumplings).I asked are dumplings and perogies the same thing on your menu? She rolled her eyes and with an attitude and a laugh she said "no they are not". I felt insulted and completely judged.We were never given water and our drinks sat for way too long with no attention/service. The server sat at a table in the back (where we could see her back) and she acted as if she was rolling silver but seemed to be looking at her phone when I approached her. I actually had to come to her to check out and was given no attention after ordering whatsoever. The food was less than "so so". I have had much better Perogies elsewhere. GO ANYWHERE ELSE. The only thing nice there is the furniture.

9.description: This is a great modern Polish restaurant.   The menu is full of old school Polish standards but with a fresh approach. The food was excellent, I had the pork in mushroom sauce,  sauerkraut, beets with horseradish, and potatoes for side dishes.  My friend had the duck and loved it.   They had a live band playing and the servers were great.  The dessert pirogi is awesome.

10.description: I came here with a group of friends.  We were 9 in all.  every once in a while, a bunch of us get together and do something we call "International Food Club."  =)  This was our Polish food outing.  Half our party happens to be Polish too.  The food was excellent and plentiful.  Prices weren't bad either for the entrees.  All the entrees get two sides too.  I ordered something from the pork menu.  It was like a pork chop or steak rolled with mushrooms and carrots on one side and plum sauce on the other side, rolled toward the center.  I had red roasted potatoes for one side and a cucumber salad as my second side.  We all ordered drinks.  My favorite at the table was the beer my friend ordered.  They have some beer that has some raspberry flavoring syrup added in, and that was excellent!  Another friend and I decided we would split our plates too, and he got a veal dish which consisted of a ground veal steak that was mixed with other things before being cooked.  Pretty good.  i had a Tropicana to drink, which was a bit sweet for me.  I initially asked for a diet cola, and then said to give me a Tropicana instead.  I did this the first time she came around, so I was a little upset when she brought me both drinks thinking I had rdered both or maybe just trying to charge for both.  However, when I sipped on my Tropicana, I decided to keep the cola since the tropicana was so damn sweet.  It was pineapple juice, malibu, midori,  and triple sec... maybe.  Another friend had pierogis filled with some cheese.  I don't know what kind of cheese, maybe ricotta.  The food was plentiful and we had a lot of trouble finishing the food, and most of us didn't finish!  We were STUFFED, UNTIL....We got free dessert!  The dessert menu is huge and tempting, but we were all so stuffed we weren't going to purposely order dessert at this point.  Of course, we all forgot we have two stomachs!  One is for dinner and the other for dessert!  there's ALWAYS room!  Our waitress brought us all free dessert!  That was awesome!  i don't know if she liked us or if we seemed a little disappointed with anything (I'll get there in a minute).  The dessert was a two tart-like breads with some kind of white mousse in the middle and a side of whipped cream and strawberries.  Amazing!  There was also live music.  This was very nice for the price!  I can't remember the music, I think it was jazz with a female doing vocals.  It was very nice though and soothing.  The atmosphere was also incredible.  This place had candle lights on every table and the lights were dimmed.  The decor is kind of fancy, but not over the top, it's red walls with beige/tan accent walls, very nice lighting/ceiling fixtures, and fireplaces.  You can come casual  or make it a romantic evening, because it works either way.Why they lose a star and what was disappointing?  You get the feeling money comes pouring in from drinks, because they have so many drinks on the menu!  This is good of course!  Drinks are a bit pricey though, not unusually pricey, but like any other place... mine was $7.50 if I remember correctly.  However, when I was done with it and finished my diet cola, I wanted a glass of water as did anyone else who had finished their drink, but this place does NOT serve tap water.  So, if you ask for water, you're getting a very fancy little green, glass bottle of water, and it will run you about $4.  So, we couldn't get any water.  This was the downer, and the loss of a point.  Tap just isn't too much to ask for and a lot of us just wanted something flavorless and cold to wash down the meal and drinks, especially since my drink was so sweet.Also, just for convenience, DO NOT TAKE Lake Shore to get here!  you will drive down Belmont for like 20-30 minutes! Price....  ALL THE FOOD, drinks, desserts, good laughs cost us about $20/person with tax and tip already included.  It wasn't bad =)after dinner mints and matchbooks at the bar =)

4.description: Not impressive at all. Went there few weeks ago for dinner with a group of friends... The food was OK...pretty 'bland', not very flavorful at all. The waitresses- dismissive and not friendly at all. Come on now, have your staff look presentable & ask them to be nice to your patrons. The decor of the place is nice...but that's about it. Not going back...

6.description: I used to come to Ferajna more often and I decided to get back and have a dinner with my friend. My freind is from India, so I wanted him to try something different. We were kind of disappointed because it wasn't really what we expected- typical Polish food.  I had a sweet and sour chicken with rice and set of sides. The food was tasty and fresh and plate look artistic, but if you want to have real Polish food go somewhere else.

11.description: Ferajna ? Never again, we were the only once in the restaurant and have to wait 20 minutes for server to ask for a drinks...food was so so, nothing special there are plenty polish restaurant in the area you should try

5.description: I went there for a baby shower yesterday. The food was really good, but they could do better with a dessert (cakes).I liked that there was a separate room only for the shower. The reason why I give only two stars is the manager/waitress; a girl in short, black hair. She was giving the attitude the entire time, NEVER smiling. She behaved like it was someone else's fault that she has to work there. She has no idea how to work with people and manage people. She even didn't try to be nice to the guests. My friend, who was throwing the baby shower, liked everything but she said that the manager was the reason why she wouldn't recommend the place to others, unless it is a quick, causal dinner. Then you have a better chance to get a nice waitress :)

7.description: The food was good, but we were made to feel very unwelcome - hence the low stars. We got seated at a VERY small table in the corner which I felt was a penalty for not speaking polish. The waitress was VERY rude, spoke down to us very disdainfully and never came to check on the table after the food was brought. I gave up trying to get another drink even though I was very thirsty after spending the day moving into my house. The food was good although pricey. Sorry, but I can't justify spending the $s if I am going to be treated badly because I do not speak polish - I am not in poland, I am 3 blocks from my house! If the service were friendlier, I would not hesitate to make it a "regular" as I could walk here in 5 min.  I will not be going back any time soon unless I can find a translator to dine with me.

8.description: It seems to be okay but there are better places on Belmont.

0.description: Great place , great food , good prices the drinks need a little work but over all a great place... And soups are delicious

1.description: I don't really like this Sally's. A lot of the people that work at this location honestly don't know what they're talking about. And every time I go here 15-20 minutes before they close, they ALREADY locked the doors and lights are off and don't let you in.

0.description: By far my favorite Sally Beauty store location.The staff at this particular Sally is definitely the friendliest and most helpful.  I have been to others in the city and this one was a breath of fresh air.  The sweethearts gave my little one a lollipop while we were waiting in line.I needed a replacement for my Aveda paddle brush.  One of my dogs chewed the end.  Instead of paying $14...I found the exact same brush with out the brand name for $3.99!I also discovered that their gel cake eyeliner at $4.99 glides better and stays on longer than MAC's $15 fluidline.I also come here for DIY hair dye and nail supplies when I don't have the time to have it professionally done.Do yourself a favor..Spend the $5 for their yearly membership...the amount in discounts that you receive will pay itself after 1 visit!  I forgot to bring mine but they were kind enough to give me the discount without it just this one time.

Bought a new mattress from American Mattress and didn't want to pay full price for a bed frame.   I was quoted $49.99 plus tax at American Mattress for a full-size frame.  Home liquidators gave it to me for $35, no tax.  Fast, easy, transaction.  Friendly staff.  I was also surprised that their other furniture was affordable - couches, tables and beds.  I would go back if I needed some inexpensive furniture.

1.description: When people said it was small, I was confused.  It's a medium-sized supermarket with a full-sized drugstore in it.  However, there is no hippie food section.  The guy said that all the health-food stuff was integrated in the rest of the store, but it just wasn't really there, or atleast what i was looking for, and have found at other Jewels.

2.description: Always long lines and BAD customer service. Sometimes I forget and go there and always tell myself not to go again. Maybe now I'll listen. Stood in one of the only two lanes open and waited a LONG time. Cashier was trying to work out something with a customer, entering and reentering and entering and reentering check or something. The customer finally left, leaving her groceries and leaving the cashier still trying to get the check or coupon or whatever it was to go in the machine. Sorry I don't know what she was doing; she never looked up or acknowledged the rest of us customers. Asked the bagger if we should go to the other line, which now had 8 carts in it and she said, "Probably." Asked if she could call someone to open a register and take us in order (lady in front of me had small children) (well behaved ones!). No  answer. Someone came to help and I asked her and she said it was time for the employees to take a break.So I went to Dominick's on Cumberland. Passed three employees standing outside talking....

0.description: Good and fast customer service.  Prices average. I like their drive-up too.

3.description: They have been doing a good job recently on their offers. I was in the parking lot sales recently and ended up buying stuff I don't always need because of the good prices they offered.

1.description: I think only 2 people who work there know anything about the tools they are trying to sell, and the third guy is just so good at sales you beleive him, doesnt help you get harrassed by almost every employee to buy a membership coupon thing, I even recall the manager yelling at an employee for 100% interaction even if its an old lady looking for a box of screws.Tools are cheap, so cheap that 3 in every 5 screw driver sets have an uncut philips head in it. no cameras, so people steal quite often, almost bought an empty box of gloves before I realised they were too light to be full, how they stole them amazed me.

2.description: Hire people who actually know what there selling. I don't know seems to be there favorite word.

5.description: One of my tool store favs. I just need it to be larger so I can spend more time shopping.

6.description: This Harbor Freight is bigger, cleaner, & better than the 3 others, & thankfully it's on the North West side.  The selection of tools that they carry is outstanding ! !  I wouldn't buy the drill that I use every day here, but for tools that see occasional use, you can't beat Harbor Freight (unless you are allergic to anything that says China).  I usually come out of here about $80 lighter, & the sampling of common purchased items include...  Drop cloths, disposable paint brushes, plastic organizers for nuts, bolts, & door stops, bungees, air compressor hoses & adapters, files, picks, a magnifying glass/tweezers combination that is just the best splinter puller, an angle grinder, an attachment for when your drill won't fit into a small space, a flexible attachment for when the previous drill attachment won't work, a mirror on a stick when looking around corners that your head won't fit, gloves, flash lights, jig saw blades, metal drill bits, glass drill bits, grinder wheels, etc.  The prices are great, the selection is outstanding, & this is a good place for a new homeowner to start his tool collection.

0.description: Quick, efficient, and helpful folks. good sales going on during the holidays. Sign up for additional $$$ off or download snip/snap for immediate discounts. Convient location and huge lot for parking.

4.description: BAIT AND SWITCH.Was there during one of their tent sales, long story, but got the manager there on 10/13/13 at 9 am was rude, refused to honor a yellow clearance tag and pretty much called me a liar...I'll never go there again.Been a harbor freight customer since the 80's From no one I'll go to Lombard, or just mail order the stuffI joined Yelp just to write this review

3.description: I give this place three stars because it didn't have anything I really wanted. With that being said, it has every single Polish item your little heart could desire.They also have a nice little bakery that smelled awesome so dieters beware!And if you aren't Polish or sometimes thought to be Polish then you may stand out in this place like a sore thumb. I felt as though I had happened upon some sort of secret club because that's the vibe I got...not to mention the pointing and staring (ok, that didn't really happen but it might as well have).Also, I've noticed this a lot with smaller grocery chains. A lot of the stuff on the shelves is out of date or right at the sell-by-date. This makes me feel weird because it means they don't have anyone checking into this.Will I go back? Probably not. It's close, but there are other options.

1.description: Walked in there hoping to purchase ready to eat meals. Waited for my turn after like five people. Far from greeting I did not even get ackknowledged. Waited for the worker to ask me what I wanted, did not happen. She walk away from counter. When I ask her for help, she starts talking to her co worker in polish. They both looked at me and seemed confused and kept talking in polish. There are other employees who notice the incident but fail to act. I got frustrated and walked out of the store. Would rather spend my money elsewhere.

2.description: This is a nice small store and a great place to get cusine de france French bread.

5.description: My friends and I have a weakness for ethnic food markets. It's not just that you can get far better deals in them, it's the sheer exoticism of these places that really appeals.  There's nothing oppressively sterile or buttoned-up about places like Avenue Food Mart, a nifty Eastern European (mostly Polish) market that's just around the corner from DOM ITP on Belmont. There's a small bakery and a deli/meat counter , but they were both so jammed that I avoided them as much as possible (My last trip to Caputo's made me want to take a hatchet to the idiots who park their carts diagonally in the aisles and then stand next to them talking on their cell phones or staring blankly into space.) But there's more than enough to see in the rest of the store. The produce section really isn't much to crow about, which surprised me a little, but there's a very nice dairy section where we found the elusive Danio coconut yogurt and bought the last three cartons. As for the rest, it can be summed up by saying: If it's a vegetable, you'll find it pickled.  If it's a fruit, you'll find it made into preserves of some sort.  If it's a meat or fish, there'll be tins of it in various forms, most often pâté. If it can be made into cookies, candy or some other sort of pastry, you'll find a package of it, and you will be overwhelmed by walls of condiments (How many different sorts of mustard and horseradish can one person keep in their fridge?), juice and tea. The liquor section is smallish, but there is a lot of beer and vodka, and liqueurs you've probably never heard of before.You will buy things even if you're not sure what they are because they look so good.But the bottom line at a store like this is that you'll get a lot of bang for your buck, and have the opportunity to try things you might never have tried if you'd stuck to Jewel or Dominick's. You might even find that you love the Polish rye you can't find anywhere else, or the lingonberry horseradish, or the celery salad, or the mixed fruit syrup... I could go on and on.  Just go in with an open mind and a spirit of adventure. You really can't go wrong.

6.description: This is one of my favorite Polish food stores in the city. It's not too big but certainly not too small.  It has just about every single type of Polish food you'd want. Baked goods, fruit, a huge deli, packaged teas, soups, anything! The prices are great and the employees are pretty friendly. It's totally out of my way but I drop by there after work every once in a while to pick up my favorite Polish foods. Even my dad, who is a harsh critic of Polish delis, is a fan. :)

7.description: I frequent Avenue because it's close to home for me and have a huge selection of Polish/European groceries. I wouldn't necessarily say it's the best there are several other places in the area but I have my staples that I pick up here and have never had any complaints. No complaints about the food anyway, I did stop in to pick up a few things for Wigilia since I was hosting it this year and the place was crazy crazy packed!!!  They have very good polish rye breads, bakery items, teas, chocolates and cheeses. They don't have the best or largest produce section but I don't usually go there for that. The deli gets really busy but they have delicious meats/sausages my personal favorite is thier Kabanos and the gypsy ham.! They also have prepared items like pierogis, bigos, soups etc. but I have not tried these yet (im spoiled from my Aunts cooking) This place can be a little intimidating for anyone who doesnt speak Polish  since its the prodominant language spoken there even though the employees do speak english.

8.description: This Polish food store is huge! They have fresh baked bread and tons of veggies but the deli counter is the money maker. It is about a half a block long and has pretty much any kind of sausage ever made. They  also have prepared food like breaded pork chops, potato pancakes and cabbage rolls, that you can take home and chow down. They even have freshly made soups. Top it off with a trip to their liqor section and you've got yourself a great night!

0.description: For the longest time, I considered Gene's Sausage on Belmont near Laramie (the place across from Jade Dragon Tattoo with the giant cow on top) to have the highest quality Polish deli in the city. Well, Avenue Food Mart gives them some serious competition a few miles west of there. I used to shop here more often when I lived in the neighborhood, before it burned down and rebuilt nearly a decade ago. I haven't visited them for some time. Coming back after a long absence was a real eye-opener.I was in the area, so I thought I would stop in and get some Easter basket essentials. I was mainly looking for Andrulis brand farmer cheese, which Jerry's and Shop-n-Save by me no longer carry. Not only did I find it at a great price, it became my one-stop shop for everything else in my Easter basket: round hams about the size of a baseball, small sausage loops to fit a candle in the middle, hot horseradish spread, and even a beautiful chocolate and white glaze Easter bundt cake from their huge bakery selection. Avenue's centerpiece and anchor is their enormous deli, spanning the width of the store. Not only does it carry every variety of sausage, ham, poledwica (Canadian bacon) but also has fresh fish, meat, and cheeses. They also have ready-made soups, salads and other Polish specialties. Since it was 2 days before Good Friday, the line was huge and I was #89 though #77 was being served at the time. The number dispenser is off to the left of the deli counter, near the dairy section, which made it confusing just to get a number in the first place. However, I counted 12 people working in the deli area. My turn came in under 10 minutes and I got what I needed quickly. Avenue makes its own sausages and even has a real smokehouse. Not the corrosive liquid smoke that can dissolve stainless steel, but real smoked meat. The flavor makes all the difference in the world. And they don't overprice their meat as if the products deserve some "premium markup" of a boutique/import grocer. I bet the local residents must love the smell of freshly smoked meat in the air daily. That alone would keep me coming back.Avenue also carries lots of Polish imported chocolates, jams, syrups, candy and cookies. They even have Polish children's books and a good selection of magazines. There's a liquor section too. Produce is their one weakness, so I can't give it a 5-star rating. Checkouts are quick. Be warned that the predominant language spoken is Polish. When they call your number at the deli, watch the display board carefully unless you can count in Polish. Same with the checkouts as the cashier greets you with "Dziendobry!"

4.description: While it beats going to Jewel or Dominicks, Avenue still is far from being the best Polish supermarket in the area. Huge deli, lots of candy and jams, but a rather small selection of items besides that.Also, their prepared foods always taste off to me. Everything is too salty and they have a lot of downright bad, seemingly "experimental" recipes... A while back they used to make fried rice and sweet 'n sour chicken, I'm not even joking. It was pretty ridiculous. Needless to say, I'd avoid that aspect of the store. If you need some fresh bread and other sandwich-making necessities, however, this place serves that purpose just fine.

28.description: Like any other business where you work  for commission this happens, but they are  ridiculous here.. they fly at you like vultures right when you enter the store.  Even when I just go to pay my bill, i have to take out my envelope before i enter the store, so they don't attack me.The quality of the furniture is not great either .  I wouldn't buy furniture from here again.

1.description: We are very disappointed!!We got a very lovely couch from themWe have not yet received a bill in the mail from them,we called to ask about why we haven't received a bill from them.They had the wrong address,we told them the correct address,and yet still no bill ,We called again,the (lady was very rude),they never had fixed the address to the correct one.Once again we called,to fix the problem,again.This is very inconvenient, its a hassle,and a headache,because the problem was never fixed ,they never corrected their mistake they made in the first place!

9.description: Wondered into Room Place one day while shopping to update my flat, the sitting room in particular. The low prices,  especially on sets, were accommodating to my budget. The sales people were friendly without being overbearing. Korinna, who is Russian but looks a lot like a famous Bollywood actress, was personable and  knowledgeable. She helped me select my first set, and I will be back soon for more!

23.description: I would have given this store a 4 or 5 because the furniture was stellar, but towards the end of my visit when I was making a purchase, I met the General Manager of the store. This woman was rude beyond belief and turned my experience upside down!She spoke down to me like I am an idiot- when I'm pretty sure I'm more educated than her. She was pushy- trying to convince me to purchase a warranty for every piece of furniture I planned to purchase.  When I opted out, she got snippy.  She had that look on her face you just want to smack off.  BAD customer service.Other than that, great furniture.  Marco was sweet and a great help! Don't ask for Kris.  She will ruin your experience.

5.description: Went to the room place today to purchase a bed, sale person Elizabeth was wonderful, took her time, gave us our space, did not pressure us, was very knowledgeable about the different mattress if you go to the room place on Harlem ask for her, you could tell she loves her job and try's very hard to give the costumer what they want, very professional thank you Elizabeth

25.description: I ordered a desk from roomplace website and it was delivered quite late and there were a bunch of broken and damaged pieces inside.  Also, there was nowhere on the website that mentioned that I had to assemble this unit myself and therefore need to return it for a full refund.  I tried calling several times and was put on hold, so many times.Since The Roomplace has been uncooroperative and unresponsive to my request.  I have placed a claim with  the Better Business Bureau  in effort to resolve this matter and retrieve my money.  It is a shame it has come to this and I will do everything in my power to let the world know how terrible a company Harlem Furniture and Roomplace has been with some of the worst customer service ever experienced.  I know this email will most likely be ignored and it is too bad as I used to be a good customer of Harlem Furniture and still have some pieces that I enjoy.  I find it hard to believe that this company chooses to do business this way.  Not even a simple reply to my unread emails.

12.description: We could have given our business to any furniture store. We chose The Room Place to purchase our recliner.Not a smart move on our part..........We visited the store on a Friday to purchase a recliner. We found what we wanted and approached salesman to initiate the sale process.After providing the necessary delivery info, we were taken over to the cashier to pay for our recliner.The salesman stood with us and confirmed that our recliner would be delivered Tuesday of the following week. Easy enough eh? Not so fast........I took that Tuesday off from work in anticipation of the recliner deliveryThe day arrived and I waited until 3pm before calling to check on delivery status.It was then brought to my attention that I was not even scheduled for a delivery on the particular day! I was informed that someone called several days prior and left a message stating the item was on backorder for another month.We confirmed the cell phone# they had on file was correct.I'm not sure who they called, but it sure was not yours truly.I never had any missed calls or messages from anyone concerning this purchase.Bottom line:  I took a day off for nothingI will give them some credit for finally reimbursing us only $25 for our troubles, but overall the lack of proper communication and follow up was just abysmal. Lastly, keep in mind that the delivery appears to be performed by a third party which further complicates matters. Our next purchase in June for an entire living room set will now be made somewhere else.
