21.description: PLEASE beware!Over the weekend we made a few new purchases.: 1. two replacement chairs 2. sofa & loveseat.Firstly, the two new chairs look identical to the old ones, but the quality is NOT the same. They're $10 more, the "leather" feels a little off, the back padding is thinner, and they're completely uncomfortable to sit in. I don't mean less comfortable than the originals; I mean... uncomfortable. The cheap cushion seats are too firm and round, and don't have enough give. So it takes a little effort to not slide off. As well, the backs are entirely too far back to sit comfortably. This we were willing to accept, and just... cut our losses, learn from the mistake, in the name of having a complete set, as 2 of the chairs we purchased 2 years ago didn't hold up. The sofa, however, is a nightmare.Our sales man Marcos gave us a price for a powered sofa and manual loveseat. We spent over an hour in the store asking specific questions to make sure there would be no hidden fees or fine print issues. He was very clear on what we wanted and we were very clear on the price. We double checked, and we triple checked.Yet, when delivery day came, we ended up "stuck" with 2 manual pieces. We were told that Marcos made a "mistake", that we could not return the furniture, and that they would not send us the sofa that we actually ordered. The price Marcos gave us was supposedly wrong, and for two manual pieces instead of 1 manual and 1 power. They're refusing to honor what's on our receipt as well as the verbal agreement, and they're refusing to take the furniture back. No, not even an exchange paying the difference.They honestly expect us to pay nearly 3 grand for an order *they* messed up. Frank said we had to talk to Chris, the manager. Chris said Marcos (who is also a manager) could fix it. Marcos said he'd call back, but didn't. Louis called instead and made a very bogus offer. The excuses from Louis ranged from "Marcos had a death in his family, so he was confused and made a mistake" so we should just accept it,... to accusing us of changing our minds ... despite the fact that our receipt says 1 power & 1 manual. Despite the facts that we called IMMEDIATELY after delivery, and that they all *know* Marcos made a mistake, as each one of them stated so. Louis eventually told us to speak with Chris, who had already told us to speak to Marcos (who she claimed to be very angry with). And after 3 days of utter nonsense, I submitted a complaint to the Better Business Bureau.Louis eventually offered to let us exchange the sofa for an additional $100, claiming that the manual is $300 cheaper (which is not true). We declined the offer as we were given a price and a receipt at the time of sale and should not be asked for any additional money to cover *their* mistake. After their initial unwillingness to work with me, there was no way I would agree to even that. We told him to honor the receipt or take it all back. He even tried to "reason" that we received a 19 inch TV (which is about the size of cereal box), as if it had anything to do with the fact that they messed up our order. The lack of professionalism on all their parts was both infuriating and astounding.**UPDATE**- A month later we received the correct sofa... thanks to the BBB complaint.

16.description: This place gets 2 stars for having nice furniture but pushy customer service. I came in and specifically said I was just looking but one of the people still took it upon themselves to "show" me around the store all while being extremely pushy. I get that these people work on commission but there was no need for the employee to tell me that she wants to make a sale so she can eat next week. I'm pretty sure the only thing I ended up getting at that place was guilt. Nope never again.

17.description: one star is extremely generous, they do not deserve 1 star not anymore of my business. I purchased a Dining Room set with buffet and hutch a few years back. It wasn't until recently that I was doing a deep clean of every single piece when I noticed damage to a few pieces. 1 chipped corner on a glass shelf, a crack in the wood of one of the legs of a chair, a gouge on each arm of 2 armchairs.  I read through my 5 year warranty (it would have served better use as toilet paper) and it clearly states that gouges are covered as part of a single incident. It also states to report warranty claims to Guardian within 30 days of noticing the damage. It does not state get in your time machine and pinpoint the exact time stamp of when the damage occurred.  I called Guardian to report the damage the same day I noticed it. I went through all of the questions with the representative, who was extremely rude, and at the end she tells me that my claim is denied solely because I reported them all together and they considered that multiple occurrences.  The chipped glass is one incident, the broken wood on the leg is another, the gouge is another, etc.  Yet somehow they are considered multiple occurrences of damage to the same furniture. I ask if I would have called 4 separate times and reported each one by one would the claim be approved and she told me yes. ARE YOU SERIOUS?!?!?!  I asked to speak to a manager and she told me she was the end all be all and there was no one else to speak to. She said I could call the room place if I wanted to. So I called the room place where I purchased said items and spoke to a useless manager named Fred.  He seemed annoyed and took my phone number and name and told me that i would get a call back from customer service in 48 hours. fast forward to 1 week and I finally get a call today from customer service.  I explain the situation and she tells me that they agree with Guardian on the grounds that I reported all separate incidents at once.  I posed the same question to her as I did the Guardian Rep, should I have made multiple phone calls? SHE SAID YES!  Ok, im sorry for being an honest customer, I guess I should have lied because it seems like the room place encourages their customers to lie.  I have already filed a complaint with the BBB on Guardian and will be doing so as well with The Room Place. In addition, I will make sure everyone is aware of The Room Place's questionable business practices on ever social media outlet I have access to.  You will never get one more penny from me.

10.description: I was afraid there was going to be a problem from this place after I read all the bad reviews. For some reason my husband and I bought a bedroom, not looking at yelp first. I almost always check out yelp before going places I've never been to. Our experience in store was at first kind of odd with the first sales guy Chris he treated us as if we had no money and wasn't going to buy anything  and actually sent another guy over to help us. The other guy muhrad was very friendly and helpful. So anyways we bought a beautiful bedroom set. Everything turned out good.

11.description: We move to a new house, the room place was on TV with all the good sale. We need furniture, bed and more. My sister purchased  mattresses for 3 rooms. The sale associate added some item that he didn't acknowdlege us at all. We came in talk to the manager, he yelled out and walk away. Then I called the manager on the phone to see if we can settle the case. He never return my call. They wouldn't let us return the items when the sale associtate just add it in by himself. Tried to took advantage that my sister couldn't read english that well nor speak. So Be careful when you buy furniture or anything for your  home.

26.description: About 8 months ago they had a sale and like a moth to the flame, I fell for it. Actually, I needed to replace a 15 year old living room sofa set I had, so it seemed like a good time to do it.As expected in a commission-based place they are aggressive, but these people were outrageous. If you didn't have a sales person walking next to you, you become a target. Ok it's been 8 months and my sofas look like they're already 5 years old. I don't have dogs that could mess them up, I'm not a behemoth of a person, it's not like I weigh 400 pounds or have sex on them everyday; come on, it's only been 8 monthsI called them because my sofas should still be under warranty and reluctantly, they sent out a technician. He came, made some notes, asked some question, and photographed them. A week later I got a call from customer service stating the sofas are in their opinion are perfectly fine. I told them the technician stated there is a foam core failure and their response was 'yes that's noted, but that's not covered by the warranty".So now, I'm still making payments. My sofas are not comfortable since the foam has failed. To add insult to injury, I just saw a sale advertisement from them and my sofa is now half the price I bought it for 8 months ago. (mmmmm .... I wonder why)  It's funny (sad actually), but my 15 year old sofas even in their decrepit condition are equal in comfort at this point.I wouldn't buy furniture from here again.Pros: Their salesCons: Poor quality furniture, Overly aggressive sales peopleCost: 1 of 5Overall Rating: 1 of 5Recommendation: Avoid them

27.description: I recently moved, and when I did, I decided that I needed a new couch.  I had a few basic guidelines: I didn't want to spend more than $600, it had to be comfortable and look decent, and I wanted someone to deliver it (rather than moving it myself).  These guidelines pretty much ruled out IKEA (remember, I wanted a comfortable sofa), Pottery Barn, Crate and Barrel, CB2, Z Gallerie, Restoration Hardware....... Harlem Furniture was the last placed I looked.I went in not expecting much, and wound up being very pleasantly surprised.  I ended up purchasing a very modern-yet-traditional looking sofa for $600 (delivery and tax included).  It's cream microfiber with espresso-colored wooden legs, tailored, but still very, very comfortable.  If my apartment were larger, I would have bought the entire room group, which was only $1200(!) and included the sofa, a loveseat, and armchair, 2 tables and 2 lamps.  I think that's an amazing deal, but alas, I'm short on space.The salesman who helped me followed me around the store while I shopped, but he was never pushy or intrusive.  The delivery guys showed up on time, got the sofa up 2 flights of winding stairs like it was nothing and had the whole thing set up in my apartment in the space of about 8 minutes.Is it the nicest piece of furniture I'll ever own?  Of course not.  But it's perfect for right now, and I am pleased enough with the whole experience that I am planning on going back to purchase the matching armchair and ottoman.  I'd gladly recommend this place to anyone who is looking for some decent-looking furniture that doesn't cost a gazillion dollars.

0.description: We moved in to a new house that we recently purchased.  Mama J. and Daddy J. wanted to contribute a dining room table set for us.  I didn't have a high hope on this place initially, especially after seeing the current Yelp rating.  As we walked in, Mr. Mourad Barkati greeted us and was ready to sell!  The Show Room was surprisingly large; options were plenty and qualities seemed to be compatible to the national-chain furniture stores.I have to admit that I'm no expert at furniture.  However, parents have done their research and read many Sunday paper ads.  In this case, I let parents call the shots while I was observing Daddy J.'s interactions and conversations with Mourad. They apparently had a sale going on.  We settled on the deal with a genuine marble dining table with seven (7) matching chairs for $1250.45, which included tax and delivery fee.  Mourad was very patient with Daddy J.  He was professional and enthusiastic.  We would definitely recommend Mourad, if he is ever available in the store.  I'm now waiting for the items to be delivered at the end of the week.

20.description: I am reviewing on the basis of customer service only, I have not received my furniture yet.  I would like to say there is a salesman there by the name of Hector.... Hector from Aguadilla Puerto Rico who spoke my language, was friendly and very helpful!  I couldn't be more pleased and I would recommend him to anyone who goes there.

19.description: This place was aweful....walk in walked out...not only did they not give the $50 gift card when walking in the door, I passed five sales associates that did not have a customer also did not ask if I needed assistance. With money in my pocket, they made me realize my money was best off at another store, corporate will here about this store!!

2.description: Purchased a mattress, pillows and television here last weekend. Sales Rep Nigel was knowledgeable, courteous and easy to work with. Checkout was easy, thanks to the attentive cashiers. Everything was delivered 2 days later. Delivery was smooth and at start of the time frame they gave us. Looking forward to using them for future purchases.

18.description: PLEASE beware!Over the weekend we made a few new purchases.: 1. two replacement chairs 2. sofa & loveseat.Firstly, the two new chairs look identical to the old ones, but the quality is NOT the same. They're $10 more, the "leather" feels a little off, the back padding is thinner, and they're completely uncomfortable to sit in. I don't mean less comfortable than the originals; I mean... uncomfortable. The cheap cushion seats are too firm and round, and don't have enough give. So it takes a little effort to not slide off. As well, the backs are entirely too far back to sit comfortably. This we were willing to accept, and just... cut our losses, learn from the mistake, in the name of having a complete set, as 2 of the chairs we purchased 2 years ago didn't hold up. The sofa, however, is a nightmare.Our sales man Marcos gave us a price for a powered sofa and manual loveseat. We spent over an hour in the store asking specific questions to make sure there would be no hidden fees or fine print issues. He was very clear on what we wanted and we were very clear on the price. We double checked, and we triple checked.Yet, when delivery day came, we ended up "stuck" with 2 manual pieces. We were told that Marcos made a "mistake", that we could not return the furniture, and that they would not send us the sofa that we actually ordered. The price Marcos gave us was supposedly wrong, and for two manual pieces instead of 1 manual and 1 power. They're refusing to honor what's on our receipt as well as the verbal agreement, and they're refusing to take the furniture back. No, not even an exchange paying the difference.They honestly expect us to pay nearly 3 grand for an order *they* messed up. Frank said we had to talk to Chris, the manager. Chris said Marcos (who is also a manager) could fix it. Marcos said he'd call back, but didn't. Louis called instead and made a very bogus offer. The excuses from Louis ranged from "Marcos had a death in his family, so he was confused and made a mistake" so we should just accept it,... to accusing us of changing our minds ... despite the fact that our receipt says 1 power & 1 manual. Despite the facts that we called IMMEDIATELY after delivery, and that they all *know* Marcos made a mistake, as each one of them stated so. Louis eventually told us to speak with Chris, who had already told us to speak to Marcos (who she claimed to be very angry with). And after 3 days of utter nonsense, I submitted a complaint to the Better Business Bureau.Louis eventually offered to let us exchange the sofa for an additional $100, claiming that the manual is $300 cheaper (which is not true). We declined the offer as we were given a price and a receipt at the time of sale and should not be asked for any additional money to cover *their* mistake. After their initial unwillingness to work with me, there was no way I would agree to even that. We told him to honor the receipt or take it all back. He even tried to "reason" that we received a 19 inch TV (which is about the size of cereal box), as if it had anything to do with the fact that they messed up our order. The lack of professionalism on all their parts was both infuriating and astounding.**UPDATE**- A month later we received the correct sofa... thanks to the BBB complaint.

13.description: In early September I went to The Room Place. I have to say they have Amazing things their!!! Beautiful!!! Their is something for everybody what ever taste you may have.  I purchased a couch and a coffee table and some throw pillows from a wonderful, helpful sales associate by the name of Alina Grossman. She was so helpful. I had gone back again to order an area rug and asked for her and she was once again very pleasant and helpful and actually made shopping for my place even more fun and exciting. It was as if she was excited for me. I also picked up a few other things while I was their. They were heavy and she even helped me to my car. If you go to this location of The Room Place DEFINATELY ASK FOR ALINA!!!!! You will be glad you did. I am so HAPPY with my purchases but what also made it great was working with such a pleasant person such as Alina.

4.description: They will try to up sale the guardian protection and I must say buyers beware!! Don't bother investing in this protection plan it takes too long to file a claim for them to tell you the issue is not covered. Although they will provide you with a pamphlet letting you know what is covered, let's just say that's the basics. They need to provide further information on the protection plans coverage!

24.description: I went to this location last weekend (july 4th) looking for 2 rooms of furniture.  I was quickly greeted at the door by a salesperson named Christine.  I explained to her that I was just looking and would find her if i needed anything.  She proceeded to follow me around the store and gave me information on all of the items I stopped at.  This was after repeated requests that I would find her if I needed anything.  She wearing really hard sole shoes and every time I moved in the store I could just feel her and hear her walking behind me  every time I moved.I did see a couple of pieces I liked but I will not purchase it from this location.  The salespeople are so aggressive in their tactics that it just turned me off to the whole store.

6.description: Not sure why this place gets such poor reviews. Maha was my sales person and very nice. She wasn't pushy at all. My furniture arrived and after the movers left I noticed some damage on the bottom of the dresser. I hadn't taken the extended warranty so I was worried it would be a battle to get a new dresser however customer service was very nice and had my dresser replaced with no hassle.

22.description: I would give a 0 if I could.  I have had one problem after another with this furniture.  Most people just keep passing you to another until you threaten with more legal action. boo.

15.description: The Room Place in general DOES NOT HONOR THEIR SATISFACTION GUARANTEE!If you buy anything from here, when the delivery people come, MAKE SURE YOU DO NOT SIGN THE PAPERWORK.  They are trained to run as soon as you do.  CHECK THE FURNITURE VERY WELL, most of it is damaged.  MAKE SURE YOU LIKE THE FURNITURE BEFORE YOU SIGN ANYTHING!They are trained to get you to sign a piece of paper, which is a contract.WE CALLED CUSTOMER SERVICE TO COMPLAIN ABOUT A PIECE AND WE WERE OFFERED TO RETURN IT, BUT THERE IS A $70 FEE TO COME OUT AND GET ITThey are criminals - they do not care about you - they provide cheap furniture and their sales people are good.  They will NOT be there for you in the future, you are simply quick money.  please please please be aware!  i cannot emphasize this any more clearly!!!please do not make the same mistakes we do... we filed a complaint with the better business bureau

7.description: The use deceitful practices in order to close sales.  BUYER BEWARE!!!  I have told multiple people not to shop here and to go elsewhere.  Backhanded shady business, where they only care about getting the sale and their commission and will flat out lie to get it.We were sold on one thing and given the old bait and switch.  Customer service was zero help and actually told us that it was in the "fine print" of our contract which we signed so they are not responsible.  We spent over $4000 with them and of course the monthly payments were double what they told us multiple times they would be!!!  Double!  And we were up-sold on more stuff that we didn't intend on buying because they said the payments for $4000 as opposed to $1000 would only be $24 more per month because we would get more time to pay it off.  We simply would not have bought if they had been honest, and they knew that.  So they simply lied and told us what we wanted to hear (multiple times).  When we got our bill, they simply told us we "signed a contract" and that it wasn't up to them, the bank handles that stuff.  Well, then they shouldn't have price tags on anything in the store, as the "bank" makes the prices.  And chances are it will not be what they told you.  But by that time, you have had the furniture for over a month and you cannot return it.  Plus they would make that SO expensive (and out of your pocket) they would scare you out of doing that.Very shady business with a lack of ethics and morals.  They do not treat people right and only care about the sale.  We would have returned as we were satisfied with the bed we bought for the kids room.  Except for the fact, that it didn't come with an essential part in setting it up, which they tried to sell to me for more money and an additional delivery fee.  Our bed (wife and I's) was overpriced and not that nice.  Wishing I would have gone to a mattress retailer in hind-sight.  Anyway, will NEVER give this business a single dollar ever again!  Highly recommend you read these reviews before going there.  Wish I had!

8.description: Seen The Room Place had a nice sale going, so hubby and I stopped in here. We knew what type of couch we wanted but needed to check them out. Elizabeth was our sales lady (very nice), we told her we knew what we wanted and just wanted to walk the place to see what they had. No problem, she didn't leave but she didn't crowd us either, she gave us our space but was close enough just in case we had questions. Thanks for the nice couch!

3.description: My name is arturo Becerra I did buy furniture at Harlem location and my experience wit jorge luna my sales associate was fantastic he gave me a nice deal on a bedroom set and marriages--I will de finally recommend people to buy at the room place especial  wit jorge luna sales associate he provide a nice customer service...

14.description: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER. THEY DON'T EVEN DESERVE ONE DAMN STAR!!! I will never purchase another piece of furniture from The RoomPlace. Their customer service is absolutely horrible! I ordered a bedroom set from this location. One of my dressers delivered had a hole in the back, my mattress was dirty, my mirror was scratched, and they left a bunch of garbage in the back of every dresser. When I called customer service to get all this taken care of, they said we have to send a technician out to fix all the issues. I can't picture how the technician is going to fix a hole in my dresser?? He did fix the scratch on my mirror. He took pictures of my mattress and told me to wait 3-4 business days and someone from customer service will call me back Nope, no one called me and I waited a week. When I did call back they said we can't exchange your mattress because of the stains. I will never recommend this place to anyone, nor will I purchase another piece of furniture.

3.description: The workers here cant speak english. I ordered something she got my order wrong and then they got mad and didnt give me my food.  Some1 shud really gonthroq an egg at them n

1.description: Chicken is awesome. The staff not so much. Ordered a five piece tenders got 3 tenders and 2 tiny pieces of breading. Walked in to show them literally 30 seconds after I got my food pointed it out to the lady and she says that it's five. I said the 2 pieces of breading is considered tenders? She said no then proceeded to say that she remembers putting 5 pieces in the bag. Really?  I'm going to get out of my car to come and tell you your short 2 pieces cause I want to cheat you? I ask for the manager and some kid comes over who looked scared cause I think the staff intimidates him since half of them look like gangbangers. All said and done I got my 2 pieces but wasn't happy I had to put up such a fight.

0.description: My dad likes coming here. Fast, friendly service (at least for me it was). One complaint is the seating area. If someone would step out once in a while and wipe down the tables, that'd be great.

2.description: Unbelievable here. Everyone is playing behind the counter as I am standing here waiting for my order. Last time I am coming here for sure.

5.description: Slow service, they need to learn how to count $ even though they use the computers the staff still don't know how to count...

6.description: I said 2 orders of red beans and rice,  got home and saw that I had 2 orders of mashed potatoes (hate their mashed potatoes). I'm an easy going guy and I won't complain about much of the food, it's good and typical of a Popeyes,  but PLEASE just get my F/_/c king order right!!!! One of my biggest problems with fast food restaurants which is why I could care less about them protesting for higher wages.

7.description: Wow - I had an entirely different experience than Angie. (the first and previous reviewer). We ordered a 16 piece tender combination with 8 biscuits and 3 large sides. We actually received more than 16 good-sized pieces and an extra biscuit to boot. Attendant told me it would be about a 5 minute wait, but I think it was even less than that. The manager gave my 10 year old nephew a cup so he could enjoy some soda pop while we were waiting - no charge.When we got the food home, it was nicely done and cooked without any excessive pockets or spots of grease. Total opposite experience of my venture to the Popeye's in Oak Park on Madison Ave (see my review). This place is definitely worthy of a return trip.

8.description: Who's got two wings and is mighty tasty??? A chicken.  Who's got two thumbs and LOOOOVES chicken??? THIS GUY.   To me Popeye's has the best tasting fast food fried chicken in the world...the world I tells ya!!! Sometimes the service can get slow, but that's because people be going cray for that  insanely delicious, battered and deep fried bird.  I rarely eat here, I almost always use the drive thru.  The chicken is always moist, and crunchy, and mmmmm-mighty tasty.I also recommend the cajun rice, and the can't go wrong with some corn on the cob.  I can smell that chicken just typing this review.  Well I gotta go.

9.description: I have ordered here a total of 5 times, all through the drive-thru, and I have never received my food at the window. I have always been instructed to pull into a parking space and wait. I have worked in fast food (however many years ago), and I feel that the amount of times I have been asked to move and wait is a bit wonky. I normally order standard items from the menu, so the fact the don't have chicken available for passage through the window makes me a bit annoyed. However, it is fast food. It is what it is.

10.description: The food is ok, but the staff makes it a two star restatraunt.  There is a Latino lady with scary drawn on eyebrows and lots on makeup is the worse! She usually works the drive thru and always have an attitude.  Especially when you ask for items like napkins and hot sauce!  The manager looks like a tall indian man who is either clueless or cares less about the customers.  I've come in here on two seperate occasions only to find out I was shorted biscuits because the guy who took my order doesnt know what a dozen biscuits is.  Oh dont dare come in with a coupon, they act like you printed it at home or something!!! Beware of this place and count EVERYTHING when leaving!!!

4.description: Rude, Slow, Ignorant!!Witnessed on 12/25/14 @ 630pm."Wida" (cashier that day) was cursing right in front of her customers to the cook in back. I was a few customers behind waiting to be assisted and she was so loud! "Omg haha I'm gonna kick your ass" -- was what she said. I said ok maybe it slipped out, but it continued on... Eventually when it was my turn I made it very obvious with my head turning to the direction over hearing on her & his response so fortunately she gave up & realized how loud she was.  I waited twenty minutes for my order & I was very patient. It's christmas - no one wants to work. BUT! When your on the clock you should act like it. Especially at the appropriate pace. Watching the cashiers walk back and fourth distracting the back employees was really ticking other customers off. So many Mis-packs were being made so basically everyone was rechecking their bags. It was a struggle and for the manager to not care made me change my mind about this place. If you don't care about proper customer service, do you even care about your customers period? Sucks - I live a block away and now I'm driving to Belmont and Laramie for my fries :( a mission and a half!  Oh well.

1.description: Friendly neighborhood old school Chicago Bar.

0.description: The Banana Spider is a wonderful summer drink that tastes just like liquid Hawaii.An invention of Paradise Club's current proprietor, you have to go to the city's premier Polish Tiki lounge to get it. When you get your Banana Spider (or the Scorpion, or whatever other tropical mixed drink you prefer) it will come in a beautiful ceramic tiki mug. You might as well drink it with your eyes closed, not because it's that good (though it is) but also because it's too dark to see a thing in this fading 60-year dive which is thrifty with electricity. There are only three lightbulbs going at all times, two of which illuminate the fishtanks. A gloriously garlanded plastic Buddha basks under a third as if it were the Hawaiian sun. If you ask for help finding the restroom the bartender will briefly turn on one more light, the "Kings" light above the men's room or the "Queens" light above the women's room.Not to say this place is stingy... if you're a bar snack afficionado, this place ranks tops with complimentary bowls of mixed pretzel sticks, potato chips, and bugles- which must have been cryogenically preserved because I thought they stopped making them in the '70s.Though this lounge features prominently on the specialty niche business review site CriTiki, it has somehow eluded Yelp all these years, which is a shame. These days it's pretty quiet, and if you go on a weeknight you'd need to bring your own Tiki party to take the place of the young and the Polish who have fled the neighborhood for lower taxes in the west suburbs. Still worth a visit.

1.description: First off, never have I went to a chipotle that closed hours due to a meeting? Second, it's always dead in this location & the workers go so fast. The music is so loud you can't hear or understand what they are saying. Anyways... WHY ARE THEY GOING SO FAST!!!?? There's no one in here so why rush it. Plus they never give enough. Waste of $

9.description: I love their food but they are very stingy with the meat other than that I love the food

23.description: Worst chipotle in Chicago! They are so messy!!! The cashier was so rude! And the food wasn't cooked well, I love chipotle but I will never come to this one again! Really wish I didn't have to put a star to add a review, very disappointed.

5.description: If anyone is trying to apply at this location don't do it, they will call u to 4 interviews and maybe to a 5th one they will just make u waist ur time just to tell u that u aren't hire..!! Chipotle doing 4-5 interviews? Are u kidding me? Not even a real company will scheduled u for 4-5 interviews. If u go apply to a real company for an accountant position they will call u to 3 interviews. But at chipotle u are applying to make burritos, cashier and maybe grilling the meat this company is a joke who ever is interviewing are not even professionals

25.description: Didn't this place used to have good food?  Stopped by here with my father for lunch and had the barbacoa tacos and posole soup.  There just wasn't anything remarkable about it except for the big pieces of fat and gristle in my taco that I had to spit into a napkin.  The posole was ok but not well seasoned.

12.description: Not a fan of this chip, they barely put anything in your bowl rice, veggies and especially stingy with meat. The chip near the HIP mall is the best !

21.description: Love it! The workers are friendly (except for a few) and most of the time dont charge me and my wife for our drinks or extra meat. Maybe its because we are regulars here. Food is yummy!

16.description: Chipotle is hands down my favorite food chain. They offer food that is friendly to my vegan preferences, but it tastes great and is easily accessible.This location is my favorite location and I eat here 1-2 times a week. Friendly staff, clean, and food is never anything to complain about.If you don't like Chipotle in general, don't review this place with 1 star - you people make this specific location look like scum when in reality, you just don't like the type of food they serve. I don't like sushi, so I wouldn't go to a sushi restaurant and give the lowest possible rating because I didn't like the food.

17.description: Went a couple times to this Chipotle at the brickyard and havent had any problems. Staff was friendly and patient, I never feel rushed, food was great and hot, place was clean yet small. Its fast food... I mean if you want candles on your table and someone to check on you so you can personally complain then go down the street in any direction, to the nearest mexican restaurant.Ps- the guacamole and chips are awesome, don't skip them when going to Chipotle!

10.description: Went here after 5 pm tip: do not go when busy!'I went here after complaining to the home office about the nasty customers at the other location, and they gave me a gift card to try to save a customer.Unfortunately it seems the whole friggin chain in the Chicago land area has no quality assurance standards.TiP: Not only was the vegetable guy hurrying me. He was just rude.I noticed that the co worker next to him, was pouring sour cream all over the  hot and mild salsa and the corn mixture.The vegetable co worker kept asking not once not twice what I wanted and I was like three people away from the vegetables! like he had a hot date to go to!So I gave him the hold on and he responded "you dont want nothing?" I said to him: "hold on I want to see what you people are doing up here!" and then told him "I see you cross containing everything up here I just want the regular salsa because I see that you have sour cream everywhere"The funny thing was that the co worker who poured sour cream into everything kinda looked at the two salsas and corn and was suddenly quiet. I was very hesitant to purchase a $7 helping of a mountain of rice, lettuce tomatoes, and a scoop of meat!Next time if there is a next time I will just walk out. With the bowl half made.

11.description: Well my first chipotle experience and it sucked the girls making our food did it so sloppy then I wanted nothing spicey and it was a d it was cold both meals so I asked if I can please have a remake the girl looked like it was a problem said it will be made. my hubby and I sat for about 20min and still nothing I asked for a bag cause I didn't eat my cold food either!! And asked to have my remake to go waited another 5-10min. A girl who just walked in to her shift made my food to go..so food was cold and not good and where they couldve made up at which is costumer service was bad too... Not what I expected at all the cashier was nice...

26.description: Good, quality food and friendly, efficient staff. Overall, a good value for what you get.

27.description: Alright, I'm definitely not a fan of this place, the burritos are just okay and a bit pricey if you ask me. If Free Birds ever comes to town it will wipe out the competition. Enough of that though back to business, so you don't get much with this burrito and it's semi-filling. I guess if your into the hype go ahead and check this place out but you'll be disappointed. There are much better places to get a burrito don't waste your money here

0.description: People are stupid complaining about them messing up their burrito because they had to wrap it twice because the tortilla broke. How is that messing up your burrito? I love this place. This is the only Chipotle I actually love and always get good food. No complaints from at all. I had a few back in the day but looks like they fixed their issues. Just one thing that I absolutely hate as a new parent is that Chipotle's dont have a changing table. I come here at least once a week and sometimes I'll have to change my babies diaper in the car because I have no where else to change her. Changing tables! Charge me 10 cents more I don't care. Just get us parents a changing table!

20.description: Chipotle is hands down my favorite food chain. They offer food that is friendly to my vegan preferences, but it tastes great and is easily accessible.This location is my favorite location and I eat here 1-2 times a week. Friendly staff, clean, and food is never anything to complain about.If you don't like Chipotle in general, don't review this place with 1 star - you people make this specific location look like scum when in reality, you just don't like the type of food they serve. I don't like sushi, so I wouldn't go to a sushi restaurant and give the lowest possible rating because I didn't like the food.

19.description: i love chipotle so i had no problem with my friend askin me 2 meet her here! this location is where the old brickyard mall use 2 b. good food as usual so no complaints here.  theres so many stores in this area so we decided 2 do some shoppin afterwards.

2.description: Usually I avoid corporate food joints like the plague.  I haven't been to Macdaddys, Buger King, Windys, etc in years. However, sometimes my brain's wiring goes haywire in the Subdural Cortex and it leads me to Chipotle. Specifically the one here in Brickyard. I need to get that checked out.My usual order is a Chicken Burrito with white rice and black beans along with other toppings that vary. One thing that separates this place from the others is the burrito is never fully wrapped and is a complete mess when I try to eat it. Did I fail to mention that is a good thing?  Now I have read numerous reviews of the Ill-gifted burrito wrappers before, however it usually sends people's blood pressure to almost stroke like levels. Not for me, keep making mine messy. Why you ask? Well it didn't take long after a few WTF's to realize they put copius amounts of meat, rice and, beans. They put too much of the good stuff in there that's why my burrito is never wrapped right. Brilliant! Who cares that it is neatly wrapped and my foil is clean, I just want the food. I believe in the past I have stressed In keep my burrito in one nicely neat chunk. Not anymore, give it to me dirty. What do you guys think neatly wrapped or more meat and dirty?If I am going to eat at this corporate burrito place giving me extra everything is a good way to make it tolerable. In the meantime I'm going to check out my internal wiring and graduate to better burritos. I gotta go I have tobasco sauce in my eye.

18.description: This Chipotle location in particular is top notch -- there are always polite staff and helpful managers on hand to deal with the lunch rush. The staff cleans as they go so there's rarely a mess on the food prep counter. This location is really a tight ship as far as Chipotles go.

13.description: Top worst Chipotle ever.I worked at the busiest one on Broadway in Chicago and never have I seen such an awful crew.Woman on tortilla station didn't say "hi", she just said "what do u want". Woman at salsa station looked to be more interested in the conversation with the cashier instead of the long line they had out the door. I had to interrupt them to ask for what I wanted on my veggie bowl. Finally when I arrived at the cashier, he rung me up incorrectly because he assumed the guac was for chips, not on the side, from my veggie bowl.. When I sat down to eat, not only to mention how dirty the tables were (had to wipe down my own), my rice was undercooked, corn salsa was hot!, and the chips were plain. No salt, no lime, just corn chips.Walked out unhappy & extremely Disappointed.

4.description: First time coming to Chipotle from brickyard, I usually get the steak burrito to go when I was eating my burrito the steak wasn't cook it was raw the guac was black it was so disgusting so gross!!!! The service was horrible they had to wrap my burrito with double tortilla they messed up my burrito!!!! Won't go back here!!!!!! Horrible Staff what can I expect from some teens working here should of of know better!!!!!!!

24.description: Went a couple times to this Chipotle at the brickyard and havent had any problems. Staff was friendly and patient, I never feel rushed, food was great and hot, place was clean yet small. Its fast food... I mean if you want candles on your table and someone to check on you so you can personally complain then go down the street in any direction, to the nearest mexican restaurant.Ps- the guacamole and chips are awesome, don't skip them when going to Chipotle!

6.description: Honestly worse chipotle ever! Man, im so bummed because I was really craving chipotle. We only eat out fridays, but my hubby spoiled me. If only I would  have known the shit I was about to eat. It was disgusting..  the rice was not properly cooked, steak was rubbery, and my food was cold. Never again will I come to this location.

22.description: Typically, I love Chipotle. They have good tasting food, aren't super expensive, and is relatively healthy. While at this location I didn't have any issues with the staff (they were helpful, attentive, and had me out the door quickly), but I did have issues with the food. I ordered dinner from them around 5 today, and by 9:30 tonight, I was throwing up. As much as I have good things to say about Chipotle in general, I think I'll avoid this one in the future.

15.description: This is one of the better locations I've been to! Unfortunately, they were out of salad dressing, but offered me free guac to makeup for the inconvenience. The staff is friendly, and the dining area is kept clean. There was a note posted that the steak was conventionally raised and not organic due to a limited supply. It's nice that they inform the customers, and there are plenty of meat choices, we opted for the chicken and barbacoa.

7.description: We placed a large order on line, I gave them 35 minutes to prepare 12 bowls and burritos.  The order was not ready when I got there to pick it up even though I was five minutes past the pick-up time.  To be honest I do not think they started it until I got there, which makes no sense as it was already paid for.  While the staff was very nice and friendly that is about all I can say for it.  The food was cold when we opened it even though it was a short 10 minute ride to our office.  At least one order of the 12 was wrong.  We usually order from the store on Elston and Logan, order is always ready when I arrive even though that one appears to be a much busier than this location.

8.description: This chipotle is up to all the standards of their other locations. One day they didn't have organic beef, so they put up a sign apologizing and said they were serving regular beef. Much appreciated!They are indeed always busy at this location, but you can't complain about this - they are just popular.

3.description: I love ANY chipotle always fresh, always hot very nice worker very friendly faces. BUT today was just horrible the young lady making the bowl was just not in the mood, when asked for extras she seemed upset& just slabbed the rest that was on the spoon. My chicken bowl was BURNED chicken it was cold. The chips were cold & tasted gross. I called and spoke to Michael who did not seemed bothered that I called to let him know of my experience right away he asked "what do you want a refund a new bowl. " I said no...seeing as it was take out and I lived 25 minutes away. (I ate and drove btw and the food was cold!) Just never AGAIN...i'll take my business to other chipotle.....

14.description: COMPLETLY RUDE- PACKED AND DIRTY- bathrooms filthy- cashiers and front servers very rude! And kitchen music so loud it didn't allow them to hear out our orders. My burrito looked like a mountain of food and not like a yummy burrito. Server did not know to how to wrap it and continued to try wrapping and couldn't had to ask for help and the helper couldn't get it! Then you ask for meat and only give a small amount and a bunch of rice and beans when I said easy on beans. Not happy at eating my food. Also beverage station was dirty and hard to obtain lids. Very little ice on machine. Not happy at all for Saturday lunch.

3.description: I've been here a couple of times but I just decided that I need to post a review.I was introduced to wild wild wingz by my sister's boyfriend and I'm happy he did because this place is awesome.The wings are a good size, very flavorful, and a very good portion.I haven't had the hottest flavor yet (which is Nuclear) but the rest have been very spicy and delicious.Wild Wild Wingz recently added breaded shrimp (probably because my sister kept asking for them) and they are out of this world.They deliver from North Ave to Irving Park, and from Cumberland to Cicero. So The have a way to get it to you or Carry out, but If you decide to dine in, they also have plenty of space and they have a big screen TV for sports or movies.So come and enjoy these delicious wings from Wild Wild Wingz!

1.description: Well I found this place thru yelp and I'm new to the neighborhood. First I ordered carryout was told to come by to pick up in 20 minutes, got there in 30 minutes, food wasn't ready and waited about 7 minutes even though the place was empty on a Saturday night. Ordered wings (3 different flavors) and fries. The wings were way overcooked so they were very tough. The sauces are pretty good, the guy who answered the phone was helpful, fries were meh. Place is decorated nice to eat in.

2.description: Ill start by saying I ordered from here about a month ago, let's start with the loong wait for delivery, despite being told it would take 45 min we waited over an hour despite living literally 4 minutes away, the buffalo wings & breaded shrimp were ok, the honey bbq wings were very tasty and the breaded mushrooms were ok.. all in all I prob wouldn't order from here again sad cuz I really wanted to like this local spot.If you want big & really good wings I would take a drive to Sneakers Bar & grill in Franklin park their Holly Cow wings are delicious and they are huge, I know they deliver but unfortunately I'm outside of their delivery area

5.description: They got our order wrong 3 of 4 times.    Food is okay, but not worth the idiots they have filling the orders.  The food is cheap and the chips are very good.They need to work on the delivery side of things in a big way.  If they get that down, then I might try them again.

6.description: My bf loves wings (I don't) so we tried this place and he loves them. He orders at least once every week and I get the fish sandwhich which is delicious. It's nice and crunchy not all soft and microwaved. Or I get the hot dogs which are also good. The fries are so yummmmmyyy I love them. Our orders are always done quickly, love it. The smell of the wings smells really good, so I might just try them some day. :)

7.description: I will say do not order from here if you expect to get your food quickly,they take forever!! The food is so-so not great I rather just drive to b-dubs or go to Wing stop very average I can do better myself.

8.description: We were tired of Toppers and wanted to try something else. This was the only other delivery menu I had the  mild wings. They were ok. My roommate liked his (bonless nuclear) better than Toppers but I would prefer Toppers. They were delivered on time. The sauce on my mild wings was thin.  The meat was tender and fell off the bone. Not sure if I would order them again or not. If the roomie wants them I guess I will!

0.description: I did 3stars due to the long wait Walked in and placed an order to go. It was Sunday so the games were being played on their TV. Felt like a man cave but nothings wrong with that. They need to work on their menu and pricing. A 5pc of wings is 4.99 a 10pc is 9.99 15pc 14.99 20pc 19.99. If you do the math it makes more sense to get four orders of the 5pcs than the 20pc to save yourself .04cents.. That's just an example of how they should work on their menu. We placed an order for a 35pc combo that comes with 2 fries and 3 pops...  Why just 3 pops?  Idk..   It took well over 30mins for us to get our food. Brought it home and pretty upset for how long it took but once we had a wing it almost made up for the wait.  Hot and spicy garlic was good the regular buffalo was good and the lemon pepper was also pretty good. My tip to you is... place an order for pick up and take your time getting there.

4.description: Good wings. The fries are awsome. Their chipotle barbecue sauce was delicious! Will definitely come back.

3.description: A true Chicago Neighborhood Shot and a beer working man's Tavern. The crowd is mostly 30 and up, good ole Americans, which in this neighborhood is hard to find. Good place to start the night.

1.description: This place is just a average dive bar from the neighborhood. Nothing fancy but that's exactly what you want. Patrons are are really friendly unlike other bars in the general area. A real gem

2.description: Why am I not surprised I am the first one reviewing this dump hole in a wall. I usually like places like this but this was was pretty bad. It is on a busy street on Belmont Avenue. There is hardly anything on tap and the bartender was like 60 years old and moved like he was eighty. Took his sweet time getting a drink. There are two arcades in the bar that are not working. The amount of dust on them looks like it was last cleaned in the eighties. A very old and depressing bar.

0.description: This place is a lovable, local dive bar. If you're expecting anything more than go some place else. I live down the street and have been here a few times. It's a great laid back place to watch a game or just enjoy a beer. Although there doesn't seem to be any beers on tap, the bottle selection is pretty decent. They also have good daily specials, and $1.25 PBR daily. The lady bartender was nice and engaging. If you go on a Sunday for the game, you might get some of her delicious brats. Go in there with realistic expectations and you won't be disappointed. I found my local watering hole.

3.description: I walked in here looking to apply for a bartender position... Let's just say I IMMEDIATELY walked out without even dropping off my resume.This is a perfect place for you if you like to wear sleeveless Nascar shirts and have 4 teeth.  The bartender looked like she was having a horrible time.The bar is attached to a liquor store, when I say attached I mean if you want to leave the bar and pick up a Magnum 40 oz before you leave, you don't have to worry about walking outside.  Just go through the opening between the two spaces.Might be one of the worst bars I have ever set foot in.Nothin on the walls but whatever TV they could find sitting out on the curb on garbage day and scattered around to whereever the closest outlet was.I would suggest this place to NO ONE ever!!!I am a fan of dive bars, it is what I prefer.  But this is not a dive bar.  It is a room with a bar in it.

1.description: This is a typical neighborhood dive that a buddy and I wandered into, being in the neighborhood. It's not much to look at but no sooner had he and I sat down at the bar when a guy who I assume is a regular bought us a round without ever having seen us before! Also the bartender was beautiful and very attentive  - I'd consider going back if only for her! The down side, though, was that the door in the bathroom was too close to the toilet for the stall to open! What's with that? Over all a pleasant experience- seems like a decent place to watch a game. We didn't order any food.

2.description: I got what I was looking for since it was a couple of doubles before a wedding down the street, however its good that I didn't wind up in a fight when one of the regulars(who I thought was just a drunk at the time) started trashing my family and I before suggesting we should throw down.  It was good that I keep a very level head because everyone else here was buddy up to him.Beer selection is your general ball park affair (old style, bud, etc), and the TVs were small with scan problems when I was there... barely watchable.Friendly bartender, and a couple of the other patrons were nice... but if you aren't already in this crowd and you are younger this probably isn't what you were looking for.

5.description: Now this is what a real sports bar is about! Has 15 or 20 TVs playing just about every sport. Don't see what you want, the mixologists will put your sport on the tube in front of you! Good prices on the booze. Very blue collar down to earth people. Check out Anya, Mirka & Anita!!! Sexxxxy! The owners Eva & Saul are quick to welcome you and buy a round! Cash station inside!

6.description: Still the same old place, although some of the regulars have gone, for one reason or the other. Still everyone treats me like I was just there yesterday. Free drinks are still offered for those who show up.

0.description: Flat screen TVs everywhere, a Bears and Cubs bar. On Sundays, the owners serve complimentary food and raffle off a Bears jersey! Definitely enjoy this chill bar. Oh and they have a pool table now!

4.description: This is a fun place, they have drink specials most days, good professional bar tenders and a diverse crowd.Most people are very down to earth and friendly.I enjoy it when there are a few customers or a crowd. They often have summer parties with great food.The ownership cares for their customers and are fun !

3.description: I 'm still at odds with myself over Aldi Foods.  I am not sure if I hate it or love it..but to save on money, I think that I will return for some of their items.Today was the first time in my life that I have ever set foot in one.  I've had some friends rave about this store, others totally creeped out.  I have no idea why I avoided it for as many years that I have..other than the weird hours that I kept pre and post baby. I think that the majority of their stores close before 8pm. For those who have never been in an Aldi, I will share my experience from the moment that I set foot in the store.1.Carts.  In order to use a cart, you have to deposit a quarter into as slot that releases the chain that attaches it to another.  You get your quarter back...but I guess it is to ensure that people return the carts where they belong and so that carts don't get stolen or damage cars in the parking lot.2.This location is fairly new compared to most, so it is relatively clean.3. Organization of products doesn't really exist here.  Aisles are limited..so you will find cleaning supplies next to cake mixes, random specials such as storage containers next to the produce, chips next to oils, etc.  It kind of threw me for a loop.4.They do sell meat here...I just wouldn't buy it here unless it's cryovaced, a frozen product or prepackaged lunch meat.5.They don't sell organic milk or flavored creamer.  :(6. They sell alot of processed food and junk food for such a small place.7. You have to bag your own groceries.  This is no biggie to me since I am used to that at Costco...but jimimny I would immediately be fired if I were ever a bagger.  I couldn't keep up.  They just kept piling the stuff in my cart and I ended up having to bag the stuff at my car.  8.  You have to bring your own bags or buy them.  I ended up buying 1 of their frozen bag keepers and 2 of their reusuable bags because the shape and size were perfect..much better than the ones that I have seen at other stores.  What I hate about buying reusable bags is that every store that has them uses it as marketing ploy.  Great..on the retail side I understand this, but as a consumer, it irritates me that I am advertising for them and paying them instead of vice versa.  I hate brand logos on anything!9.  Despite what is listed on the reivews, they only accept cash or atm cards, so if you didn't know this before you started shopping, you are SOL.I spent a total of $99 there.  My cart was filled to the top, and I purchased about 2 weeks of groceries for a family of 3.  $5 of that purchase was spent on grocery bags.  :(  The best bets here are their 2.5lb flash frozen stir fry veggie mix for $2.99.  It comes with a sauce packet and with a bit of pasta or rice, it's a really filling meal.  I also recommend their 1lb of lunch meat for $2.99.  I was shocked that the lunch meat was actually pretty good.  Produce is hit or miss...it's shrink wrapped so you can't inspect it fully.  I was ticked to find that the side of one of the green peppers that I bought had a serious crack on one side.  Stuff that I bought that I thought was gross?  Their coffee.  Even Folgers is better.  The pot that I made tasted like it was sitting out for 5 hours.  Hot dogs...another pass...not as bad as Whole foods hot dogs..but more like Oscar Mayer type.  Absolutely no snap to them.  By far my worst purchase?  The frozen General Tso's chicken.  I have no idea why I bought that, and I should turn in my Asian card. Absolutely disgusting and reeked.

1.description: Once you "get" Aldi and get used to shopping here it is hard to shop elsewhere. I just hate to pay more for the same things elsewhere. I love their specialty foods and inexpensive holiday party supplies (plates, appetizers, etc).

2.description: I guess if you want a couple of snacks for a pretty low price then I suggest going here...great if you're serving snacks to a ton of people for a party but I would stay away from meat and produce just because the selection is lacking and the produce is almost non-existent.I like the southwest egg rolls they have that you have to heat in the oven. Take your own bag because they cost 5 cents and 10 cents for each of the different bags and you have to bag your own stuff.Oh...some of the knock off cereal is pretty good but stay away from the fake frosted flakes...NO DEAL!

0.description: I love this location!All of the employees are extremely friendly especially Maryola - she always finds time to help me and answers all my questions. The store is the perfect size and very clean.You can easily find what you need in an efficient amount of time here. Great prices

29.description: I have been to Lowe's several times, and found that generally,  they are usually better and more knowledgeable than folks at home depot, and they seem like they are actually interested in helping you, which is nice.However, I just went to the Brickyard Lowe's and asked about a new water saving device you can install in your existing toilet (just saw one at a relatives house) and did they have them in stock.  They proceeded to try and sell me a new toilet, and told me not only did they not have them,  they "never ever heard of" one that could fit in an existing toilet. The very next day we found one of these "extremely rare and unheard" of items at Costco.    Employee product knowledge FAIL.

42.description: I've been to pretty much every Home Depot, Mendard's, and Lowe's in Chicagoland (that includes the suburbs).  This location is without question the worst home improvement store I've ever been to.I started my poor experience off when I called and wanted to talk to the paint department to see if they had a specific brand/type of stain in stock.  It took about an hour of phone calls.  They transferred me, put me on hold, hung up. Called back, same thing.  Called back, put on hold for 20 minutes until someone at the service desk transferred me and it hung up.  I called back again and she connected me with the store's general manager, who right away said "no we don't have that" as if he knew every stain in the store.  I also asked if it could be special ordered, he told me no. This particularly struck me as odd since Olympic's own site listed this Lowe's as a store that carried what I was seeking.Fast forward six hours.  I needed some lumber, and after calling the Menards and Home Depot closer to me, I found I'd save about $100 by getting it from this location of Lowe's.    I also needed screws, but had a question about which specific screws could be used with the wood I was using it with.  The packages had contradicting, vague information.  I waited at the hardware desk for about 15 minutes, not seeing an employee in site.  Eventually I went to the service desk and asked them to page someone.  About 20 minutes later still nobody had come, so I asked her to page them again.  Still nobody.  Meanwhile people were at the service desk screaming at the lady because they weren't being helped, she seemed to be the only employee in the store.  After a good 50 minutes of waiting for a person to help me in the hardware aisle, someone came. It wasn't his department and he said he wasn't completely sure, so what does he do? he reads the box.  Well duh.  He didn't reallllly know despite the fact that he gave an answer saying "yes" they would work.  Internet research later contradicted this information, had I bought the screws he just guessed would work, the screws would have failed, causing an entire deck to fail.This location could disappear from the face of the planet tomorrow and the world would be a better place.   I usually love Lowe's, but seriously, I can't believe how terrible this location is.  If you're in Chicago and must go to Lowe's, go to the one on Touhy instead... That one is probably convenient anyway, it's much, much closer to a highway.

23.description: Me love me some Brickyard Lowes!  The plants in spring/summer time, the unique potteries, etc.  I just merembered, I purchased some of my outdoor furniture here TOO!love LoVe lOvE LOWES!  Please don't ever ever go away!

8.description: My boyfriend and I are remodeling my parents house and went in looking for some help with painting . We couldn't be happier with the help we received from Rafal from the paint department. Not only was he super personable, he went above and beyond to help us find exactly the type of primer and finish we were looking for! (I'm so indecisive when it comes to paint colors.. thank you for your patience Rafal!) The room has come out exactly the way we want it too! Can't recommend him enough!

31.description: If I could rate them on their ability to screw up my bank account, I'd give them five stars. We purchased our kitchen appliances from this store. One of the items was not in stock at the time, and a week or so later when the item came in, without warning they credited our account and then charged us again. Because credits don't come through instantaneously, and the amount they did this with was quite large, it completely screwed up our bank account and caused an overdraft. Like an idiot, a month later I went to the same store to buy a washer. The washer was 10% off and the state was offering an additional instant 15% rebate. The cashier didn't know that she needed to do anything to process the instant rebate. Once I pointed out that she didn't do it correctly, we needed to cancel the transaction. Instead of canceling the transaction, she put it through, refunded it, and charged me again. So now there is - again -  a bunch of money missing from my bank account that will take several days to get back. She also said she'd checked out several customers who thought they had gotten the rebate, but apparently they had not. These employees need to be more careful with customers accounts, and learn what how to do their jobs. The service in general here is generally awful. I've been told over the phone that they have items, and 15 minutes later when I get there I find that this item was not in stock. I've asked employees where simple basic hardware items are, and they have no idea what I'm talking about. The employees are busy screwing around, yelling across several lanes at each other, and complaining about customers instead of paying attention to customers. On my trip today the first cashier I attempted to go to didn't know what he was doing and just kept sending customers to other lanes (there was only one other open aside from customer service - where there was no cashier at the register).

34.description: My fiance and I just bought a house and have been doing quite a few repairs and even some remodeling in the house within the past few months. Lowe's is relatively close to my house, which has been nice since we have been making several trips a week to get materials. Unfortunately, many of these trips have been very displeasing. On one of our first trips to Lowes, we make an attempt to rent a hardwood floor sander. We ask an employee walking buy how we are to go about doing that and this particular employee is unsure. No big deal, we'll ask someone else. So... the mext person we ask is unsure too, but he is going to go to get a fellow employee to help, which turns out to be a person whom also doesn't know. Finally, we track down a fourth person, someone who can help us. He says he thinks he heard that one of them is broken, but he isn't sure which one that is. Apparently, he just picked the newer looking one for us and assumed it would work. We pay and take it out to our car. We can't find anyone to lift it up into our car, but grab a kid in the parking lot who agrees to help us. When we get home, we realize that this sander was the broken sander. UGH. So we pack up the sander and drive back to Lowes to retrieve the other sander that they have displayed on the floor. Again, we cannot find anyone to help us. So we just wheel it right out of the store--and no one even stopped to ask us any questions! Just let us wheel out thousands of dollars worth of equipment right out of the store without any receipts. We get out to the car and we find two Lowe's employees and ask them to help us load the sander into our car. They take the old sander out and put the new sander in. When they finish, they leave the old sander sitting in the parking lot and walk away. REALLY now?! Who does that? It was hysterical. They obviously really care about their jobs... So anyway... We get the sander home only to find that this sander is also broken. Believe it.... we gave them a mouthful. But it didn't matter because they didn't hear one word of it. On another trip back to Lowes that following afternoon, we noticed that both the broken sanders were still sitting out on the floor waiting to be rented. Just sitting there waiting to tick off the next Lowes customer...

16.description: That's the Power of Doing! Wait- is that the Lowe's slogan, or Home Depot? Came to this Lowe's to do some garden shopping. They have a nice big garden area with a great variety of plants, veggies, and flowers. Much better than the HDepot. Good selection of pots, too, you gots to have good pots.Went inside and browsed around, didn't get welcomed by a greeter or anything- just seemed like a normal big box store. Get it Done- at Lowe's! (There's your new slogan!)

13.description: see gina k (polish lady) in appliances as she cares and will take good care of you at the right price!  went in a few times to purchase a stainless steel suite for a rental in the downtown area.  she got the pricing right, took care of the details and made sure that all was delivered on time.  had one minor issue with the dishwasher but she handled it directly and the situation was resolved to my tenant's satisfaction.  i looked at hd, menards, grants and abt (ugh don't get me started on them!) and by far lowe's came in with the right pricing and service.  also hint, hint, hint.  go to your local post office and get a moving kit.  in there you will find a legitimate 10% discount coupon for lowe's!  enter that information online and then you will be emailed a coupon that you can use on your purchases!  with a big appliance purchase you will save big money!  opps...wrong store, but still i am a menard's shopper from way back and still am, but for this big appliance purchase i used lowe's and gina!  very satisfied.

11.description: Do not buy anything that requires installation from this store! They are great at selling things like countertops, but no one takes ownership of the job once they contract it out! Many promises, no follow through. The amazing contract artisans who do the installation are great, but Lowes and Stone-Systems, the countertop contractor that subs out all of the work, are totally incompetent...So far, with me, Home Depot has screwed themselves out of thousands, now Lowes.  Menards is up to bat...

39.description: I recently learned that Lowes has a free "Build & Grow" workshop to encourage children the love and appreciation of woodworking.  I enrolled my husband and my 3 year old for their "Build a skeleton" workshop. The sign up online was easy and painless.They put together a really cool movable skeleton complete with glow in the dark appliques.  My son received a certificate of completion as well a patch to sew on of his accomplishment.  He was super excited and happy that he was able to not only take the class but was able to use real tools.  I think that the concept is fantastic and a great opportunity for parents to bond with their children.On the store itself, I love it.  I much prefer it to other home repair centers.  The customer service here is exceptional, and I love the fact that I can preorder an item for pickup or check the status of an item's availability online. I have also found that many of their prices are better than their competitors.Lowes is the best place to buy organizational tools.  I am a sucker for those things.

37.description: I am torn on this place.  First, I like it because it is less scary than going to Home Depot for me and Lowe's carries a really nice selection of plants for the "garden-challenged" like me.  Second, I had a good experience when buying a new dishwasher from the place - got a great deal on a last year's model, installation as promised and no problems with the machine.  But, we went back two weeks ago to buy a new high efficiency washer and steam dryer and that is when things got dicey.  We buy our models, over $2600 worth and are told we wil get a call during the week about installation the next weekend.  Fine - my old machines run, so there is no hurry and I don't want to take off of work and wait around all day if I can schedule a Saturday.Then, we don't get a call until the next Friday and are now told they shipped two driers. We proceed to get calls every day about the trouble they are having locating our washer and blah blah blah.  Just call me when they come in.  Plus, we start getting automated calls every night at 9 (that will keep calling until you pick up) telling us installation is the following day.  When we get a call from a live driver telling us the machines are coming, I figure he must have them on his truck and get my mother to take off and come stay at the house during the day.  She waits 4 1/2 hours for nothing - the driver was wrong - and she is PISSED!  The store manager offers us a $200 credit - which is super nice,  but we still have no answer on exactly when the machines will be here (this Saturday is the new promise) and the automated calls have started again.  And, with the promise of the machines coming, I had a new window installed with the dryer vent, so now the old drier is unhooked  - I need to do laundry this weekend, so I am hoping they make good on their promises.  If so, all will be forgiven and we will take the credit and put it towards a new garage door installation!

0.description: Quick update...I filed a complaint with the BBB and corporate got involved. I was very pleased that Lowes resolved my situation with great satisfaction. The resolution was swift and polite on behalf of Lowes and I will give credit where credit is due...they made up for their mistake. In honor of my renewed faith in Lowes, I recently purchased a Troy Built snow blower and couldn't be happier. 4 stars for the renewal!

38.description: Three cheers for the greeter at the door advising and helping me to bundle my new little friends up in plastic bags before exposing them to the elements!Two cheers for the plant selection in the dead of winter!and... hip hip hooray! for getting 2 new plants for $17.(They also stock the light bulbs for my under cabinet lights in my kitchen... which I hunted around for awhile.)

27.description: I went to this Lowes because it was the closest to the house. Unfortunately I will NEVER shop here again.All I wanted was a car key made. I waited 10 minutes for someone to acknowledge that I was standing there. Mind you this was at 7pm on a Wednesday. The guy who was helping was reeling in bliss to do so. He took my original key and crammed it into as many places he could to size it. And I observed him forcing it into the "correct" size and thus, making my key from that selection.I get home and try out my new keys and guess what they didn't even fit in the lock or ignition. I return Friday and customer service didn't care to hear my story of the wonderful happy employee I experienced nor did they seem to care that I was returning product. I ended up going back to the key desk in  hopes that the next guy would know what he was doing. I was wrong again. I ended up asking where a locksmith was as he was cutting my new key....he didn't even stop and process the question. I took my original key and left.So Dear Lowes Hiring Department,Please train your employees to do their jobs,Thanks.

32.description: I'm not sure about the negative reviews here because I've been remodeling my house and they have been fantastic.  Over the last month I've been here probably 20 times, and they've been very helpful, polite, and attentive.  I went to the Home Depot down the street and their service was awful, not to mention their prices were higher.  I did about 80% of my shopping with Lowes.  They even installed our carpeting at a great price too.  This Lowes has a great selection, their prices are the lowest we found (plus 12 months same as cash financing).  Thanks for making my remodel a little easier!!

44.description: We had a horrible experience with Lowe's. I never had any strong feelings for Lowe's before, though for some reason I leaned toward it a bit more than Home Depot (for some reason, it seems a little cleaner in a Lowe's than an HD, and less warehouse-y).We went to this Lowe's, instead of the one in Lincolnwood that is 10 minutes away, because they had an A/C installer available. We purchased two A/C units and signed a contract for installation with them, with the promise by the clerk that we would receive a call within 48 hours to set up a time for installation.I called the following Saturday - after almost a week had gone by (we purchased on a Sunday) to find out why we hadn't been called, and to set up an installation. The girl who answered informed me that the people who work in that department were not there past 4 pm on Saturday. The next time I called I did get an employee in the installation sales department, and she informed me that the reason our purchase hadn't been installed was because we had been charged for installation of only one of the A/C units, not two. Of course I was a bit annoyed by this, and she went on to say that she could charge the second installation to the same credit card and set up a time for installation. I told her that since it wasn't my card, it wasn't my place to allow them to charge additional funds, and that I would have to find out when would be a good time for installation (both of us work during the week, and since it had been a week already we didn't want to have to wait until the following weekend for installation).We called again to find out what the total charge would be and what installation dates & times were available, and learned that she had in fact charged the additional fee (over $100) to the credit card. At that point, we refused to allow the service and demanded a refund of the installation charges. I haven't been to Lowe's since, and don't plan on returning anytime soon; I also make sure to let people know to be careful when dealing with them.The whole experience bothered me on several levels. For one thing, the woman in installation sales made several assumptions; one, that I was the wife of the credit card holder; the second being that if I was the wife, I would automatically be an authorized user of the credit card. On top of that, we paid for an installation of at least one of the units, even if the employee who rang up our purchase forgot to charge a second one. Since we didn't get any break on more than one installation (it was the same charge per installation for 1 or 10 installations), they should have come out to install the first unit, then come out a second time if they had to. The fact that the installation sales department didn't even feel the need to contact us about the installation OR the mistake in charge destroyed any faith I have in the reliability and professionalism of Lowe's.

24.description: That's the Power of Doing! Wait- is that the Lowe's slogan, or Home Depot? Came to this Lowe's to do some garden shopping. They have a nice big garden area with a great variety of plants, veggies, and flowers. Much better than the HDepot. Good selection of pots, too, you gots to have good pots.Went inside and browsed around, didn't get welcomed by a greeter or anything- just seemed like a normal big box store. Get it Done- at Lowe's! (There's your new slogan!)

7.description: Very disappointed on a purchase that I made online I purchased a product that showed one price and didn't respect the online price when I went to pick it up. They have false advertisement !!!!!!!! I recommend other stores that customers are priority and have serious pricing like Menards or Home Depot.

40.description: This place has it all over Home Depot.  There are plenty of customer service folks on the floor to help you unlike Home Depot.  Plus, they are friendly.  A guy spent 5 minutes with me helping me find the right size nails and washers.  And the checkout guy was funny.  This store it a lot less crowded than the Home Depot on Elston.  It's pretty far west (6000W) but to me it's worth it to make the drive to enjoy a cleaner, more organized store with helpful, friendly employees.

30.description: On the hunt for a large mirror for above our fireplace, Lowe's ranked pretty low on my list of places to buy such an item. Thanks to my mom's suggestion, we went there to check out their home decor section. Honestly, I wasn't expecting much because Home Depot just has basic mirrors, nothing decorative and worthy of our fireplace hearth. To my surprise, they have a wide selection and sizes of mirrors. With our measurements in hand, we found a silver mirror suiting our tastes (a mix of contemporary, traditional, nothing gaudy).
