For $80, we got a mirror perfect for our hearth instead of paying a lot more at a home furnishing store. In less than a half hour, we had a mirror and a small trash can for our second bathroom in hand. I also lusted after a great outdoor patio set, but we just dropped a small fortune on a dining room table set, so no patio set yet! Overall, we had a great experience there.

1.description: First I want to say the the customer service at Lowes is awesome when you buy a product at the store. Everyone there is great. Way better then the Home Depot that is also by the brickyard. The problem I had at Lowes was when I order items like security doors or blinds for my home. They use outside vendors there are horrible.I had security doors installed and the people that installed them looked like they just came out of prison. They smoked all day long and left cigarette butts all over the floor. The doors they installed had scratches and chips all over the door. When I asked to replace it they used this white out type paint that didn't match. They dripped all over my floor forcing me to have to pressure wash it. I was very disappointed. All this to say if you go to Lowes ONLY buy the products at the store. DO NOT USE THEIR OUTSIDE VENDORS!!

9.description: went to Lowes when they advertised 2/$10 hanging flower pots.  I thought it was too good to be true.  It was!  The hanging flower pots all over the front of the store are beautiful! Of course these are NOT the ones advertised.  I asked where the advertised items where.Even the clerk had a difficult time finding them. They were  inside the store and not in any particular area.  The worst part was the flowers were not in good shape or fresh.  Wrote to customer service and Lowes Brickyard did not bother to answer why they were selling such poor quality. Neither did the corporate office.

26.description: Nice looking  home improvement store.but extremely expensive.  They are at  least 20% more expensive than Menards.  I went there because I had to. I'm trying to avoid Lowe's.

25.description: Avoid at all costs they rather talk themselves than help out and when youso do pull them away from each other they know very little about the stuff they carry they are no help once so ever and very incompetent and unprofessional

12.description: I gave this a rating because I have to, it should be ZERO!  Started the process of buying a door in October it was barely installed today 12/4 and they did a TERRIBLE JOB!  It looks worse then the aluminum 1980s door I had on there.  I am beyond pissed!  The entire process has been an absolute nightmare and not to mention the installer tried to cancel this appointment.  The associate that has been calling me from the store has zero phone etiquette.  I can't even believe this experience. Will NOT spend another dollar in this store.  If you need an amazing installation and amazing service call Feldco!  You will pay top dollar but it is worth EVERY SINGLE PENNY!

21.description: Ok, coming from a guys perspective and the fact that this should be our Mecca, I just haven't been impressed with Loews in over a decade now. Since I used to do construction; this place used to cater to the needs and wants of the consumer all the way up to the contractor. I remember ordering a truck load of materials  at 7/8AM and having them on the job site around noon. Now it seems like they can't do anything! I can't get a red bull or a soda at the door, the bathrooms are filty. (Ladies, when you are a contractor, you may only get to go at these places) just one disappointment after another. Prices aren't all that competitive and you can't ask a trade question to kid working a weekend job.I know why I frequent Menards & Home Depot... Do yourself and your wallet a favor and just go somewhere else.

17.description: The customer service organization has the unfortunate task of talking to people who aren't happy with an install.  Rich did a great job of re-iterating the install issue to me, making sure that the issue was appropriately documented, and scheduling the follow-up.  He set expectations and counseled on contingencies if I did not get a call for the service visit window.  He demonstrated great professionalism. This would be five stars, but the phone system was having issues and I had to call 3 times. You can't blame front-line people for infrastructure and tools they didn't choose.

10.description: I called to ask if they had a product in stock and I gave the woman who answered building materials department the item sku number. She checked the computer and said they have 13 of them in stock. When I got there they had none and the guy helping me said they might have sent the product back to the vendor but didn't even say as much as sorry. This is a terrible store and I will not go back.

5.description: I have to mirror the previous comments regarding the paint department I went in to get some "touch up" paint for the apartment.  Rafal was very cool and helpful with all my questions and actually helped me in the getting the right paint for my place (an eggshell instead of a flat). I went to another store and they were rude and condescending when i had questions.

3.description: NEXT DAY SERVICE! This rating is based on my in-store experience, not the delivery.  Refrigerator went out some time Tuesday night but we didn't discover til Wed am....by then most of the food was too warm for who knows how long...company coming for the weekend, starting with my in-laws Wed. night....so I set to work on the Web all day long (in between caring for my family and trying to save what food I could) looking for something that would fit our needs and hopefully desires, as well as be in the right price range...found a lot of those, but delivery was at the earliest Monday! or mid March!  Was getting quite frustrated, then I spotted on Lowe's page that they would deliver next day if you buy something they have in stock and before 4pm...talked to a nice guy, Paul in the appliance area.  He was willing to check in the system if they had ones that I liked, but it really made more sense for me to come see what they had.  So off I went to the store.  He was very polite and patient and looked up a few items and specs for me in the system.  He gave good recommendations and saw that I liked the black Frigidaire but the ones on the floor were to small or too big, he knew of another one and they had it in stock, and it fit perfectly....the shelves aren't my favorite cause they bow a little in the middle if you get too much on them, but overall is a quality product, is new, and the price was right...also Lowe's was offering a free ice maker on top of a $200 off sale price.  And even though it was after 4, they delivered next day bright and early!  It was a happy ending to a very frustrating day on Wed.  Now the delivery guys, that's a topic for another day, wasn't too happy with them, but the important thing is I got a fridge that works, looks great, meets our needs, and I got it THE NEXT DAY!  They even took away the old one for free!   Even companies that say they do next day delivery, when on their web site, everything in our range of space and price, was not available for next day delivery.  And many stores keep all the stock at a warehouse, and it is not available for pick up or next day.  No matter how great other products or stores may be, when one has an appliance emergency, especially a refrigerator, there has to be a store that can get you a new one fast.  I assumed I'd have to pay extra for next day, but not so!  Lowe's is the store!

35.description: Spring is here and Summer is quickly approaching. We thought it would be nice to add a little pizazz to our balcony: flower boxes should do the trick. My husband and I are not very savvy in the botanical department, so we decided to seek out a little help from the local Lowe's, because "Lowe's Knows". Or at least that is what we had been led to believe, not the case at this particular location. There are massive amounts of flowers to choose from and it's slightly overwhelming. We approached one of the employee's to get a little advice. She notified us that she was filling in, in the gardening department and didn't know anything about flowers. I said, "Should we ask another employee?" she then stated that everyone working in that department was just filling in. On a Saturday? You don't have anyone that is knowledgeable about the products you are selling. Obviously, the "Lowe's Knows" slogan doesn't always apply!

19.description: Screw this place. Homeboy that sold us the washer and dryer that looks like he over threaded his eye brows is incompetent. Do not waste your time here and go somewhere else. Also, location sucks too!

28.description: The customer service at this store was really great and the managers on staff were extremely helpful in trying to accommodate our needs.  Lowe's has a specific product that only they carry and the management made sure that we got a speedy delivery.  We paid for our special order on Wednesday evening and Lowes had it delivered to our place by Saturday morning.  There was no extra charge for the rush delivery and everyone who helped us along the way was great. Getting to the location for those unfamiliar was confusing.

45.description: This is a great store to shop. For a hardware store it is very well kept and clean, very clean actually. You wont find the clutter or roughness found at other stores. Prices are very cheap too. Too bad they do not have self-check out.

33.description: I've been hear several times and upon entering i always get greeted A++ for that. I look around for the product i am looking for and i always get the "Can i help you look for something" another A++.But, sometimes your employee aren't so bright and have no idea what i am talking and or explaining about. Hiring teenagers who have no idea about the hardware business should get more expanded training or at lest have some kind of interest or knowledge of the business.

43.description: Huge thumbs down for Lowe's delivery/installation service.  Plumber called to schedule the install of our water heater, said he'd arrive between 12-2.  Plumber calls at 12:30, can't find our house, so I give him directions, he says he'll be there in 20 minutes.  Two HOURS later he arrives, and promptly declares he can't get bring in the water heater b/c our stairs are too narrow (we had described the stairway & width to both Lowe's & the plumber over the phone) and that the installation was going to cost extra because of something to do with the hookup to the existing heater.  If my husband will sign off on all liability, carry the thing downstairs himself, AND THEN pay the extra $$ (on top of the $100 premium we had already paid for same-day installation), he could possibly install it.  It's been an hour - he is still crashing around my basement...will update with installation outcomes one day, but will never ever use Lowe's install services again.

2.description: First time came here to get some paint.  The young girl at the painting station was very nice, friendly and helpful. the girl at the register was very nice too. What got me a bit upset was the manager. She was a young Hispanic girl with a bad attitude and no personality or customer service at all.She was called because the price was wrong in one of the items and she was just needed to put the right price in the register. She did not help one bit. She charge with the wrong price. So it was a mess again. I will probably not come here again.It's like going to a walmart in the wrong neighborhood.

18.description: Ok, coming from a guys perspective and the fact that this should be our Mecca, I just haven't been impressed with Loews in over a decade now. Since I used to do construction; this place used to cater to the needs and wants of the consumer all the way up to the contractor. I remember ordering a truck load of materials  at 7/8AM and having them on the job site around noon. Now it seems like they can't do anything! I can't get a red bull or a soda at the door, the bathrooms are filty. (Ladies, when you are a contractor, you may only get to go at these places) just one disappointment after another. Prices aren't all that competitive and you can't ask a trade question to kid working a weekend job.I know why I frequent Menards & Home Depot... Do yourself and your wallet a favor and just go somewhere else.

41.description: This store has been a bright spot for me in my home improvement binges (I have a problem with tools, like my wife has a problem with shoes, but dont tell her that lol) I made a pretty big purchase from there last summer. A shed, it was the only one I could find that was 8x10, without a floor, for around $900. I also purchased the lumber to build the floor myself,  16 inch centers for heavy stuff. Got the shed home and some of the parts were missing.This would usually "p" me off pretty bad, but when I called them they asked me what I was missing and told me to come and get the parts.On my way there, I went by Menards to look at the same shed and it was $749.00.  This Lowe's refunded the 100 dollars I paid them over Menard's cost plus ten percent. A young kid let me pull my truck in the service bay and load my truck when I made the original purchase. Can't believe I haven't  been back to this Lowe's.

4.description: My family ordered a new washing machine several weeks ago. They were supposed to bring it the following Saturday, but never showed up. When we called, they said they couldn't find our machine and weren't sure when it would be coming. So, two weeks later they finally come and guess what... They REFUSED to install it, even though we paid for installation!!!! So then after going to the store they were basically like, oh sorry I guess, here's your installation money back. You can buy a hose for a dollar and try to do it yourself. Whaaaaatttt?!?!?!?! Terrible service, which is unfortunate, because we could have gone to the Home Depot next door to get this machine instead.

6.description: If you're thinking of remodeling your kitchen or bathroom please go elsewhere. It's been a nightmare. Lowe's takes all your money upfront, leaving you with no leverage. They make design decisions without consulting you. Take longer than promised. Speak to you disrespectfully. If you don't email everyday they'll forget about your project. And when they make mistakes, which they will, it's like pulling teeth to have Lowe's fix the problems. I entirely regret using Lowe's for installation and I wouldn't wish anyone else to go through the same headaches. Look elsewhere.

22.description: I have been to this store at least three times and everything time I have had very Horrible customer service! Today I was literally following an associate just to get there attention, I was unsuccessful and had to go to customer service to get some assistance, I wish there was another optional store to go to in this neighborhood. This particular store is unsurpassable in CUSTORMER SERVICE.

15.description: Kenny C. in Pro Services in beyond helpful! Always taking care of his customers, and making sure that service is top notch! Professional, knowledgeable, honest and always very helpful! Deliveries always arrive as promised, and discounts are always applied when possible! Thanks Kenny C. for all your help! -PPA

20.description: Been here many many times.  I'll sum it up for you:1. Assistance is horrible. 2. Prices are usually higher than Home Depot and Menards. 3. They don't have everything in stock when I have needed it. Over-all ok but shop around first.

36.description: There comes a moment in spring when the landscape is a-wash with sun, the temperatures climb above sixty and you think "OMG, I have to get the garden started!"So you haven't started your own seeds over the winter?  Never mind that, Lowes can fix you up with some of the prettiest plants and flowers you could want.  I can't say that their prices are unbeatable, but they're sure not at the level of some of the specialty places like Gethsemane Gardens.  And I wouldn't look for really unusual items there because they stock what they know most people want, which is a lot of bang (color, scent, ease of cultivation) for the buck.  And I have to say that they have a better selection, over all, than the nearby Home Depot.  I was most impressed by their larger, better-established plants such as the enormous pot of Spanish lavender for about $36.  And that may seem like a lot of money, but had you seen the lush growth or smelled the clean scent that hung over the area where they were shown, I think you might have been seduced to the lavender side, too.There were very beautiful specimens of grape and berry plants, again, not cheap but well-established and in the case of the strawberries, already setting fruit with real vigor.  The blueberry has a mass of blooms ready to open and while our grape and blackberry plants are not yet committing to anything but upward mobility, I have no fear that they will disappoint.  These  are happy, healthy plants and I suspect they'll be bearing fruit all summer.  I really was quite impressed with the selection, there, and when we come to fill our window boxes and containers next weekend, I know I'll be going back to Lowes to find just the right plants.

14.description: Been here many many times.  I'll sum it up for you:1. Assistance is horrible. 2. Prices are usually higher than Home Depot and Menards. 3. They don't have everything in stock when I have needed it. Over-all ok but shop around first.
